Entries.Mon4: I'm getting an urge to visit the lake by Sebastian's house...#$b#...but it's only at its best when it's raining.
Entries.Mon6: As I've gotten older, I've figured out a way to give my parents a pretty awesome death glare.#$e#I think they're legitimately afraid of it, on some level.$h
Entries.Mon8: ...Oh, @! Hi.$h#$e#Want to hang out for a while? Here! Let me read your palm. *giggle* $h
Entries.Tue4: Sometimes I wonder... are everyone's parents as out-of-touch as mine are?$s#$e#Seems like their idea of a girl being adventurous is to try on a new dress or something.$u
Entries.Tue6: Hi, I'm glad to see you.$h#$e#I want to take my mind off things for a while... how is your day going?
Entries.Tue8: One of my online friends seems to get along so great with her parents.$s#$e#Is it normal for a girl my age to feel like I'm perpetually stuck in those early teenage years?$s
Entries.Wed2: Oh, hi @. Taking a break from your work?#$e#Me too. Oh! Nothing physical... the classes I take are all online.
Entries.Wed4: My favorite classes? Probably anthropology... media arts...#$b#Don't know what I'd do with those for a career, though.
Entries.Wed6: Which do you think is cooler: broadswords or katanas?#$e#I'm partial to both. I guess it just depends on the situation.
Entries.Wed10: If I ever have kids, I'm making sure they get to be who they want to be.#$e#Even if their lives are completely different from what I expect, that'd be okay, right?
Entries.Thu: Ugh... I'm not in a good mood right now.$s#$e#I said I'm not in a good mood... what do you want?$a
Entries.Thu2: Sebastian's basically my best friend. I don't know what I'd do without him.#$e#We pretty much grew up together.
Entries.Thu4: #$1 Abigail1#Oh no, I think my Dad's going to cook dinner tonight...$s#$e#I don't feel like doing anything today...$u
Entries.Thu6: I picked up how to play the drums pretty easily as a kid. My own set is in storage, though.#$e#Good thing Sam has some.
Entries.Thu8: I wonder if I would have turned out differently if I hadn't been born and raised in this little town.$u#$e#Do you ever think about other versions of yourself in alternate timelines?
Entries.Thu10: Hi.$l#$e#Do you feel like everything seems unreal lately?$l#$b#Not in a bad way, though.$h
Entries.Fri2: We're all going to hang out in the saloon this evening. It's kind of like a Friday tradition, I guess.
Entries.Fri4: It's saloon night. Wanna join us this evening?#$e#I just like having all my friends in one place.
Entries.Fri6: The birds were happily chirping today. They're too simple to understand the future.#$e#It's better to be like them, isn't it?
Entries.Fri8: I've often wondered if one day, I'll wake up and realize that the reality I knew was just a dream.#$e#But these days, I don't really hope that's the case.$l
Entries.Sat2: Ugh, so much homework to do this weekend.$s#$e#I've still got a few hours before the procrastination becomes risky, though.
Entries.Sat4: $d joja#Dad's really stressed about the store lately. He's been all passive aggressive, taking it out on me and Mom.$s|With JojaMart gone, it's actually really nice to see Dad in a positive mood more often.$h
Entries.Sat6: You came all this way to visit me? That's nice.$h#$e#So have you been exploring the mountain caves at all?#$e#Interesting. I'd like to go there myself one of these days.$l
Entries.Sat8: How can non-existence be so bad if we're not around to experience it?#$e#It's not like I miss my 'life' from before I was born. It's probably the same after.
Entries.Sat10: Dying one day and ceasing to exist didn't sound so bad before. But these days, the stakes seem too high.$l#$b#I don't want to lose what I have now.$l
Entries.summer_6: I went to the beach last night, after dark... Sometimes you can see strange lights bobbing over the sea.#$e#Or maybe that was just a dream I had... It doesn't feel real anymore.
Entries.summer_Mon2: $d joja#I try to help out in the shop on most days. Business has been pretty bad since the Joja Mart opened, though.|Ever since JojaMart shut down we've been doing great at the shop!$h
Entries.summer_Mon4: 'Legend of the Prairie King' is still driving me crazy.#$e#I tend to stick more to RPGs. Maybe that's why I'm not the best at shooters.
Entries.summer_Mon6: My pet guinea pig, David, just hates this hot weather. He's fussy.
Entries.summer_Mon8: I used to think Pelican Town was kinda drab, but lately I'm starting to love some things about it.$h
Entries.summer_Tue2: I can play the flute, but I only play when the mood strikes me right.#$e#The lake up north is a good spot for it.
Entries.summer_Tue4: I do what I can to help with the store. It's not my favorite, but I figure I have to do at least a little something.
Entries.summer_Tue6: You're an interesting guy, @. I'm glad you moved here.$h^You're an interesting lady, @. I'm glad you moved here.$h
Entries.summer_Tue10: Dad sometimes calls you his 'business partner.'$u#$b#He is going to freak when he finds out about the two of us hanging out.$h
Entries.summer_Wed2: Online classes are fine. I much prefer it to having to drive all the way to campus.#$e#Plus, I'm not a big fan of packing myself into a classroom with a bunch of weird people.
Entries.summer_Wed4: I would love to live in an old farmhouse like you.#$b#The creak of a floorboard, the slow plumes of dust whispering through the rafters... There's something special about an old building, isn't there?
Entries.summer_Wed10: Your farmhouse is really beautiful.#$e#Walking by it, I just get a sense of its history, its soul, like I'm nostalgic for an experience I haven't had yet.
Entries.summer_Thu8: I read that there's a section of the mines that's frozen over. Doesn't that sound nice, right about now?#$e#It'd be like stepping into a big freezer.
Entries.summer_Thu10: Wow, you look nice today.#$e#I mean, that summer air is really good for the complexion, isn't it?... heh...$l
Entries.summer_Fri2: Sebastian's a few years older than I am, but he's one of the few people who actually gets me.
Entries.summer_Fri4: I kind of wish I had a cat. Unfortunately, my Dad is allergic to pretty much everything.
Entries.summer_Fri6: If I ever get reincarnated, I'd want to be a cat in my next life. They've really got it figured out.
Entries.summer_Fri8: If I had a cat, I'd spoil the heck out of him.#$e#House cats should be appropriately chunky, don't you think?
Entries.summer_Fri10: Do you ever get lonely on your farm?
Entries.summer_Sat4: What's your favorite part about fall?#$e#For me, it's just everything that's not... all of this. What we have right now.
Entries.summer_Sat6: I'm actually enjoying myself this summer.$h#$e#It's funny how quickly one's outlook can change.
Entries.summer_Sat10: This might be the best summer of my life.$l#$e#But getting to spend time with you in the fall sounds even better.$l
Entries.summer_Sun6: My parents aren't terrible people. I just feel like they're keeping me stuck in the life of a child.$u#$e#I mean, you've got your farm. You can do whatever you want.#$e#I just feel like I'm meant for more than what I have.
Entries.fall_Mon4: I need to get some good use out of this season while it lasts. It's a good day to be outside.
Entries.fall_Mon6: Haha, see? I don't hate the outdoors. It just has to be the way I like it.$h
Entries.fall_Mon8: You know, I could actually see myself becoming a farmer some day...#$e#But how would that ever happen? *chuckle*$l
Entries.fall_Tue: $d joja#I try to help out in the shop on most days. Business has been pretty bad since the Joja Mart opened, though.|Ever since JojaMart shut down we've been doing great at the shop!$h
Entries.fall_Tue2: Sebastian's basically my best friend. I don't know what I'd do without him.#$e#We pretty much grew up together.
Entries.fall_Tue4: $d joja#Dad's really stressed about the store lately. He's been all passive aggressive, taking it out on me and Mom.$s|With JojaMart gone, it's actually really nice to see Dad in a positive mood more often.$h
Entries.fall_Tue8: $d joja#Why the heck did my parents decide to move to a small town if it was just going to be more stressful for them?$a|I heard my dad put on quite a show at the Community Center, right when it was restored. I wish I could've seen it.$h
Entries.fall_Wed4: Are you growing pumpkins on your farm this year?#$e#Save one for me!$h
Entries.fall_Wed8: I wonder if they'll let me design some of the features in the Spirit's Eve maze someday.#$e#I've got some ideas I've sketched. I just don't know who even to show them to.
Entries.fall_Wed10: Dad sometimes calls you his 'business partner.'$u#$b#He is going to freak when he finds out about the two of us hanging out.$h
Entries.fall_Thu4: Sebastian's a few years older than I am, but he's one of the few people who actually gets me.#$e#Well, and you and Sam sort of do, too.$h
Entries.fall_Thu6: #$1 AbigailHAND#Last night I dreamt that my left hand had turned into a gigantic %noun. Does that mean anything?#$e#%Abigail doesn't seem to be interested in talking right now.
Entries.fall_Thu8: I've often wondered if one day, I'll wake up and realize that the reality I knew was just a dream.#$e#But these days, I don't really hope that's the case.$l
Entries.fall_Thu10: I had an interesting dream last night, with you in it.#$e#It was a good dream.$h
Entries.fall_Fri6: I wish the season lasted a little longer.$8#$e#When the wind really picks up, I almost feel like a kid again.
Entries.fall_Fri10: I usually feel lonely this time of year, but not anymore.$l#$e#@, what are your plans for the future?
Entries.fall_Sat6: Hi.$h#$e#Your hair looks cool today... did you do something different?
Entries.fall_Sat8: Oh! Did I tell you? I finally beat 'Prairie King.' Took long enough, huh?$h#$e#Then it starts over in hard mode. Getting past the first level of that is my new project.$u
Entries.fall_Sun6: If it's an especially windy day, I like facing the wind directly and letting it blow back my hair.#$b#It's like facing some kind of immortal godbeast, or something. Just like, "Rah! Bring it!"$h
Entries.fall_Sun8: Hmm... what should I do tonight?#$q 27/28 fall_Sun_old#I was thinking about dyeing my hair again... what do you think?#$r 27 10 Sun_27#Dye it black.#$r 27 10 Sun_27#Why not blonde?#$r 27 20 Sun_WildColor#How about bubblegum pink?#$r 28 0 Sun_28#I like your hair just the way it is!
Entries.winter_Mon4: Maybe I should build a snow squidmonster. That'd be a nice change of pace.
Entries.winter_Mon6: It's just too cold to go outside much.#$e#But I do enjoy building a snowgoon.$h
Entries.winter_Mon8: When I was a kid, I built a pretty epic snow fort. I threw snowballs at just about everyone who passed by.#$e#For obvious reasons, my campaign didn't last long. Good times, though.
Entries.winter_Tue4: It's so cold, I wish we had a hot cup of cocoa to share.$h
Entries.winter_Tue6: Oh! Did I tell you? I finally beat 'Prairie King.' Took long enough, huh?$h#$e#Then it starts over in hard mode. Getting past the first level of that is my new project.$u
Entries.winter_Tue8: It's so cold, I wish we had a hot cup of cocoa to share.$h
Entries.winter_Tue10: *hug* Hey you!$h#$e#Um... just tryin' to get warm!$l
Entries.winter_Wed2: Hi. If you're ever bored, you can always hang out in my room.#$e#As long as I'm not changing, of course!
Entries.winter_Wed6: It must be nice not having crops to worry about this time of year.#$e#And that means you can hang out with me more often!$h
Entries.winter_Wed10: Do you ever get lonely on your farm?
Entries.winter_Thu4: So, how deep have you gone in those mines, anyway?
Entries.winter_Thu6: When I was a kid, I always thought life was too long, because it's the longest thing you'll ever experience.#$b#...And all the old people who said otherwise were wrong. Now that I'm an adult, I sort of see what they mean.
Entries.winter_Thu10: Another year is almost over...#$b#But this was a really good year, don't you think?$h
Entries.winter_Fri4: 'Legend of the Prairie King' is still driving me crazy.#$e#I tend to stick more to RPGs. Maybe that's why I'm not the best at shooters.
Entries.winter_Fri8: Do you ever worry that maybe all your hard work and effort might all be for nothing?$s#$e#Oh! I mean...! Not YOUR hard work. I just meant 'you' as in the general 'you.' No, don't worry. You're perfect.$l#$b#I mean...!$7#$b#Yeah, hope your day's going well!$h
Entries.winter_Fri10: @, there's something I want to tell you...#$e#It's just... um... well... your boots! They, uh...look really clean... *gulp*#$e#That's all... *sigh*$s
Entries.winter_Sat6: My favorite classes? Probably anthropology... media arts...$u#$b#Don't know what I'd do with those for a career, though.
Entries.winter_Sat8: I've been daydreaming a lot lately...#$e#Oh! You want to know what it's about? Well...$u#$b#...It's a secret.$h
Entries.winter_Sat10: Thanks for not getting weirded out after the bit with the spirit board.$l#$e#I was seriously worried that you'd never talk to me again.$l
Entries.winter_Sun10: Hey, if you ever want to come into my room, you can just walk right in.#$e#...You don't have to knock.$l
Entries.spring_1_2: Staying up until midnight used to be more fun when I was a kid.#$b#Seems like I do that all the time these days.#$e#Oh yeah, happy new year!
Entries.spring_12: I'm definitely going to enter the egg hunt tomorrow. Are you?
Entries.summer_10: Everyone's excited for the luau tomorrow. Maybe a little nervous, too, considering the Governor will be here.
Entries.summer_27: You can't miss tomorrow's festival. It's one of the most beautiful wonders of the valley.
Entries.fall_26: Will I see you tomorrow at the Spirit's Eve festival? Look for me in the haunted maze.$h
Entries.winter_7: I'm looking forward to making a snow man tomorrow.
Entries.winter_24: I'm going to eat so much cranberry sauce tomorrow.$h
Entries.winter_28: Hey! Are you going to stay up until midnight?#$e#Oh, that's right, you have to get up early tomorrow just like any day...
Entries.spring_12_2: I'm definitely going to enter the egg hunt tomorrow. Are you?
Entries.summer_10_2: Everyone's excited for the luau tomorrow. Maybe a little nervous, too, considering the Governor will be here.
Entries.fall_26_2: I'll give the haunted maze another shot this year. There just better not be any spiders.
Entries.winter_24_2: Tomorrow'll be a good day. What's not to love about the food?#$e#It actually makes me want to spend some time with my parents. It's just a good time for it, you know?
Entries.winter_28_2: Hey! Are you going to stay up until midnight?#$e#Oh, that's right, you have to get up early tomorrow just like any day...

Entries.Rainy_Day_0: #$c .5#I think I'll bust out my good ol' sketchbook today. I've got some ideas for mythical beasts that could be fun.#The dark... the rain... it gets me excited.$l
Entries.Rainy_Day_1: Hey, remember when we played that duet by the lake? This weather reminds me of that day.#$e#$c .5#Do you still carry around that mini harp? That one kind of surprised me. Where'd you learn to play, anyway?#You really surprised me with that mini-harp... I never expected that. I guess that's why I like you so much.$l
Entries.Rainy_Day_2: Hey! I woke up early and did some exploring on my own. I found this and it reminded me of you. [768 767 769 66 82]#$e#$c .5#Where'd I find it at this ungodly early hour? Ooh, wouldn't YOU like to know?$h#Think you can find something better than that? I'm not so sure!$h
Entries.Rainy_Day_3: #$c .5#Hehe, I did some sword training in the rainy darkness. You've gotta admit, your wife is pretty epic.$h#It might be a good day to visit the caves, huh? Just be careful out there, and if you go, bring a Life Elixir or two.
Entries.Rainy_Day_4: #$c .5#Is it getting kind of dusty in here? Don't worry, I'll take care of it.#Maybe I'll boot up Journey Of The Prairie King today... one of these days I swear I'll beat it fully.$h
Entries.Rainy_Night_0: #$c .5#The countryside looks more interesting on a day like this, don't you think?#I was just gazing out into the rainswept woods... I swear I saw something darker than black shifting around the trees.$6
Entries.Rainy_Night_1: #$c .5#It's a good night to see a ghost...#Hey! You look like you've been hard at work. Can I help you relax?^Have you been working hard? You look cute when you're a little exhausted.$h
Entries.Rainy_Night_2: #$c .5#Can you feel it? There's a stillness in the rain...#It's kind of funny how people pray for the rain to go away. I'm like, "Dude, do you wanna live in a desert, then?"
Entries.Rainy_Night_3: #$c .5#The sound of rain should put us right to sleep tonight.#On nights like this, I like to turn the light down low and just listen...$8
Entries.Rainy_Night_4: #$c .5#Aaaaand... soup surprise for you, my love! Enjoy! [199 218 219 727 730]$h#I felt like making some soup for dinner. I hope it's not too disgusting. [199 218 219 727 730]$h
Entries.Indoor_Day_0: #$c .5#You're always so active. It's motivating just to watch you, because you always seem to care about whatever you're doing.#I always loved this place, long before you moved in. Now I can explore the farm whenever I want!$h
Entries.Indoor_Day_1: #$c .5#You'll never believe how I got my hands on this! But I figured you'd like it. [286 287 205 732 441]$h#Hey. Heading out into the wild? I got you something...[286 287 205 732 441]#$e#Use that if you get into a tough spot. It should help keep you safe.
Entries.Indoor_Day_2: #$c .5#Today might be a good day for me to slip away to the mines. Nothing too serious. Just for a little change of pace.#Heading to the mines? Hey... if you find something tasty, remember to bring me a piece!$h
Entries.Indoor_Day_3: #$c .5#There's always something new happening on our farm... I love it.#Hey! I'm just debating what I should do today. I'm not used to having this much freedom!
Entries.Indoor_Day_4: #$c .5#Sure, I can do some cleaning today, no problem. It's actually kind of fun to clean up when I'm thinking about you.#You don't mind if I do some re-decorating now and then, do you? I'm still excited to have a place of my own to work on.
Entries.Indoor_Night_0: #$c .5#Heyyy, what'd you do? Enchant me with a love spell, or something? You look really good tonight.$l#I had a good day, today. There's always something interesting going on around here, if you look close enough.
Entries.Indoor_Night_1: #$c .5#Are you ready for bed soon? I turned on the electric blanket for us...$l#Hey! Tell me about your day. Did anything exciting happen?$h
Entries.Indoor_Night_2: #$c .5#No more screen time for me tonight. I don't want it to screw with my circadian rhythm.#I used to be a night owl, but I'm starting to enjoy the rhythm of life on the farm. It feels natural.
Entries.Indoor_Night_3: #$c .5#Mmm, it's a good night for a cup of tea.#*yawn*... I'm ready to call it a night pretty soon.$h
Entries.Indoor_Night_4: #$c .5#David Jr.'s been running spastic laps around his cage. I hope he doesn't keep it up after we go to bed.#The sounds of the night are louder out here. I'll never stop enjoying that.
Entries.Outdoor_0: #$c .5#What an awesome morning! I can't believe how many of these I missed before we got married.$h#The soft breeze is blowing mountain air throughout the valley today. It smells like fresh pine and sage.
Entries.Outdoor_1: #$c .5#I'm just going to hang out here, okay?#$e#There's a lot of interesting bugs and things out here. *chuckle*$h#Hmm... I think we've got plenty of space for outdoor slime ranching!
Entries.Outdoor_2: #$c .5#I've just got this strange feeling like a fairy, or a witch, or something has been here before.#Make sure to keep things tidy around your Grandpa's shrine. There's something special about it, I can feel it.
Entries.Outdoor_3: #$c .5#I'm scanning the outer reaches of the farm. Do you see anything unusual out there today?#It's pretty cool that we have a cave on our property. It's something I always dreamed about.$h
Entries.Outdoor_4: #$c .5#We should hang out on the porch sometime and snack on some blackberry cobbler. That would be the best.$h#I always forget to put some snacks in my pocket. *rumble*$h
Entries.funLeave_Abigail: #$c .5#I'm visiting my parents today. Someone's gotta check in with them, right?#I'm going in to town today, just so you know. I need to stretch these legs a bit.
Entries.funReturn_Abigail: #$c .5#My day was pretty good. How 'bout yours? Oh, and my parents say hi.#Hey! Did you have a good day? Mine went well. It was refreshing to take a walk.$h
Entries.OneKid_3: #$c .5#I can relate to my parents a little better now. Hoo, I must have been a little terror as a kid.$h#I can't believe I'm a "mom"... life is weird.$h
Entries.TwoKids_0: #$c .5#Haha, Mom and Dad thought I was hard to raise? Try raising two!$h#I already gave %kid1 and %kid2 their chocolate cereal. They were screaming!
Entries.TwoKids_2: #$c .5#I'd do anything for our kids. I'd fight every last monster around if it meant keeping them safe!#I had a dream that %kid2 will grow up to be a famous monster hunter. I've already been thinking about a little armor set.
Entries.TwoKids_3: #$c .5#We had kids young, but look on the bright side! At least we won't be super old when they're all grown up.#A cool old house, a couple kids, and an amazing farm. I never thought I'd come this far... but, hey! Our lives are just getting started.$h
Entries.spring_6: Do we have anything on the farm that's good for sharpening a katana? Or would I have to go to Clint's for that?
Entries.spring_16: Will you get mad at me if I go for an all-day video game binge today?#$b#Sorry, it just... sounds really nice.$l
Entries.summer_19: I'm feeling kind of explodey today.#$e#I made some cherry bombs. [286]Here's one for you if you need to let off some steam.$h
Entries.summer_22: Ugh... Didn't sleep well, and my back is killing me. I can't adult today...$s#$e#...But, yeah, I'll try. Sorry.#$e#I know it hasn't been that much time since we first met, but in some respects, I feel like I was still just a little kid then.$s#$b#I feel like I've grown up a lot since then. But I also feel such a long way off from... my parents' level of maturity, for example.$u#$e#Heh. Who knew entering adulthood would be just as scary as entering the mines?#$b#I'm glad you're with me.$l
Entries.summer_23: Some of my old online classmates squeed when they found out I was getting married. It's good to keep in touch with them.
Entries.fall_12: So uh, dumb question: What's the... "final boss" of the farming year? Is it the fall harvest? Like, right now?#$b#Or is there no final boss?
Entries.fall_24: Is it the 24th already? Yes!!$h#$b#That means I need to make time for my yearly playthrough of 'Time Ignition.'#$e#It's the anniversary for the game's release. I can probably get through it all in just a few days. Sorry if I seem preoccupied.
Entries.fall_28: Not a bad wrap-up to fall! I just finished 'Time Ignition' yesterday, and the Spirit's Eve festival was awesome once again...#$b#...except for those freaking spiders. *shudder*$s#$e#Still, though!$h
Entries.winter_1: It's kinda funny how people pray for the weather to go their way.#$b#Sure, one guy might do his snow dance, and he gets his wish. But then some other dude's out there freezing his butt off and dying.#$e#If I were Yoba, I'd have a tough time trying to decide whose prayers I answer, and whose I ignore.#$b#I'll pass on taking that job.$h
Entries.winter_8: I know we're all grown up, but you've gotta let me get out some of my inner child today. I'm going to make a snowman that's extra uncanny.$h
Entries.winter_19: Tonight's supposed to be a Saloon night again. Think you can make it?#$e#It's my due diligence as a friend. I'm happy I have you to myself on all the other evenings.$h
Entries.winter_24: I think I enjoy the Feast of the Winter Star more when I pause and realize how much I have to be thankful for.#$e#It hasn't been a bad life so far, you know?$h
Entries.winter_28: I know I'm not much of a drinker, but hey, here are some adult beverages for the evening. Tonight's as good a night as any! [346][346]

Entries.Mon4: All I need to do is show up for junior league gridball tryouts. Should be challenging, but not too hard.#$e#After a season or two of junior league, it's pro all the way, baby.
Entries.Mon6: There are some junior league gridball tryouts at the end of the month. I could give it a shot, but I uh... I dunno.#$e#Maybe another year of training would be what's best for me so I can make a good first impression.
Entries.Mon8: You know, I used to want fame and fortune, but lately I've been starting to sing a different tune. In the end it's the humble little things that satisfy, don't you think?#$e#I still want to go pro, but it's not the most important thing in the world.
Entries.Tue2: I spend a lot of time at the beach during the summer.#$e#Hey, if you're up for a game of catch, you should meet me there next month.
Entries.Tue4: It's important to have goals. Ever since I finished high school, I've really relied on my workout routines to give a sense of structure to my days.
Entries.Tue6: Nothing's better than an energetic day at the beach with your friends... right?
Entries.Tue8: *sigh*... I wish I had more friends in this town who wanted to play sports with me.$s#$e#I mean, it's the perfect place for it! Such a shame for it to go to waste.
Entries.Tue10: Heyyy.#$e#You're lookin' good today!$h#$e#So what's new?
Entries.Wed4: Do you ever watch Sports Report?#$b#I've been glued to it in the evenings. The gridball draft is going on right now.$h
Entries.Wed6: Gridball's more than just a game to me. It's really the one thing that I've always been good at.#$e#I don't know what I'd do without it.
Entries.Wed8: Everyone around me has always told me I'm the best player they have. Gridball is my life.#$e#Then one day, high school ends, and it's like all those promises everyone implied about you just vanish.$s#$e#Gotta figure out something else with my life, I guess. Right?
Entries.Wed10: I feel like I learn so much from you, @. I appreciate that you're honest with me.#$e#We'll see where my sports career goes. I appreciate that you're there for me whether I make it or not.
Entries.Thu2: I feel bad for people who have allergies. It's like, how do you even get your heart rate up if you're sneezing all the time?
Entries.Thu4: I was going to try out for junior-league gridball last year, but my knee was kind of messed up.#$e#Hey, you can't rush this kind of stuff.
Entries.Thu6: The air's starting to warm up... I'm feeling pumped.
Entries.Thu8: Everybody's got to have dreams. I think it's really cool how you just got up one day and came here to take over the farm.#$e#Hats off to you.
Entries.Fri2: In school, my teachers always complained about how gridball players make too much money. That's so ridiculous.#$e#If anything, they're underpaid. How many people do you know who can do what a pro does?
Entries.Fri4: Hey, @. I'm glad you stopped by.#$e#I'm not ashamed to say that I love my Grandma!#$e#Now Grandpa, on the other hand...#$e#Just kidding.$h
Entries.Fri6: It might sound weird, but I kind of miss having a coach yelling at me and telling me what to do.$s#$e#I can motivate myself, but when you're giving it your all for someone else, it's just different, you know?
Entries.Fri8: Hi @. You look sporty today.$h^Hey @. Did you do something different with your hair? Something keeps grabbing my attention.$h
Entries.Fri10: Hey um...$l#$b#Let me know if you ever want some help with your farmwork.$l#$e#I've gotta do something that's more than just exercise for its own sake, right?$h
Entries.Sat2: Hey, Haley's pretty great, don't you think?#$e#No, we're not dating right now. She's uh... going through some stuff.#$e#But it's probably headed there again soon.
Entries.Sat4: Grandma keeps complaining I take up too much space in the freezer with all of my ice cube trays.#$b#But I mean, how else am I supposed to have enough ice to take ice baths?
Entries.Sat6: My arms are really sore, but that's the sign of progress for a guy like me.#$e#I must've done a thousand push-ups yesterday.
Entries.Sat8: ...Where do you think I'll be in 10 years?$s
Entries.Sat10: I've been having a hard time staying focused lately.$l
Entries.Sun_inlaw_Haley: Oh, hey. How's the married life coming along?$9
Entries.Sun6_inlaw_Haley: I'll admit... I was a little jealous when you and Haley got married. But, hey... It's a chance for me to learn something new about myself.$9
Entries.Sun6: Hey, come by my room any afternoon you want and we can work out together.#$e#It's really a lot more fun to work out with friends.$h
Entries.Sun8: Hey, come by my room any afternoon you want and we can work out together.#$e#It's a lot more fun that way.$h
Entries.Sun10: Haley and I always thought we could be the town's 'power couple,' but it was always complicated.#$e#We just weren't meant for each other, beyond being friends.#$e#I mean, clearly, right?$l
Entries.summer_Mon2: So do you work out?#$e#I guess working on the farm sort of counts, but it's not really the same as pumping iron.
Entries.summer_Mon6: Hey @. Having a nice summer?#$e#What's new with you?
Entries.summer_Mon8: Hey, come by my room any afternoon you want and we can work out together.#$e#It's a lot more fun that way.$h
Entries.summer_Mon10: It's weird. I never really talked about my feelings with many people before I met you.$l#$e#I feel like I can just be myself.$l
Entries.summer_Tue4: Back when I played for school, it was such a long bus ride just to get there. I became known as the out-of-town kid.#$e#But after they saw how good I was, nobody ever looked down on me again.
Entries.summer_Tue6: If my hair wasn't so popular with the ladies, I swear I'd shave it all off in a second.#$e#*sigh*... Life can be tough.
Entries.summer_Tue8: Hey, @.$s#$e#You know, I was just thinking how I really miss playing on a team. But what am I supposed to do?#$b#It's not like I have enough money to move out of town...
Entries.summer_Wed6: I've lost touch with a lot of my gridball buddies. Last I heard, Zane was making straight A's in college. And Brody apparently already has a kid.$s#$e#So weird.$s
Entries.summer_Wed8: You know, I actually wouldn't mind being a farmer... it seems a lot like playing sports, in a way.#$e#I like being outdoors and doing things with my hands.
Entries.summer_Thu6: Sometimes I feel really tempted to eat some of the ice cream from the stand when no one's looking.$h#$e#My rule is that for every scoop of ice cream, I have to do a hundred extra pushups. So I pace myself.
Entries.summer_Thu8: You know what? I'm going to start reading a new book!
Entries.summer_Thu10: @! Hey! Look what I saved for you. [233]$h#$e#Shhh, don't tell anyone.$h
Entries.summer_Fri: What do you want?#$e#I've got more important things to do right now.
Entries.summer_Fri2: I'm working the ice cream stand this summer. Heh, be sure to support local businesses!$h
Entries.summer_Fri4: My ice cream job is just something I'm doing so I can put money toward turning pro.#$e#In a little while, I'll be able to move to Zuzu City and play for a junior league.#$b#But for right now, there's the matter of professional-grade equipment.
Entries.summer_Fri10: @, if I ever have kids, I'm going to make sure they have the best dad ever.#$e#That'd be my greatest victory. And it's a possibility to look forward to, you know?
Entries.summer_Sat: Mmmm... I smell a barbeque.#$e#Damn I could go for a burger.
Entries.summer_Sat2: Mmmm... Whatever Gus is cookin' up at the saloon, it smells like heaven.
Entries.summer_Sat4: Mmmm... I smell a barbeque.#$e#Damn I could go for a burger.
Entries.summer_Sat6: What if they made ice cream out of protein instead of cream?#$e#No no! Hear me out! It would just be like a protein shake, but iced! I think I might be onto something!
Entries.summer_Sun: Haley's pretty hot, don't you think?#$e#It really sucks that there aren't more hot girls in Pelican Town.^Maybe you oughta hang out with her.
Entries.summer_Sun2: I got these new shoes yesterday 'cuz my old pair had a brown smudge.#$b#I just threw them into the garbage. I would've donated them but I don't like the idea of some weirdo wearing my shoes, ya know?#$e#...What?$a
Entries.summer_Sun_inlaw_Haley: Oh, hey. How's the married life coming along?$9
Entries.summer_Sun6_inlaw_Haley: I'll admit... I was a little jealous when you and Haley got married. But, hey... It's a chance for me to learn something new about myself.$9
Entries.summer_Sun4: Oh wow...your shoes are a little dirty... but that's fine, too!#$e#Different people have different tastes I guess.
Entries.summer_Sun6: It might sound weird, but I kind of miss having a coach yelling at me and telling me what to do.$s#$e#I can motivate myself, but when you're giving it your all for someone else, it's just different, you know?
Entries.summer_Sun10: @, I wonder sometimes whether my mom would be proud of me.$s#$e#I managed to find you. And I know we can make things work between the two of us. I guess that's something.$l#$e#See you around.$l
Entries.fall_Mon2: Did you see Cheroky make that play last night? That was insane!$h#$e#Reminds me of what I used to do on the field.
Entries.fall_Mon4: My Grandma told me I should spend more time studying.#$e#Maybe she's right...$s
Entries.fall_Mon6: I've got all these old books that my mom used to have. It's interesting to see what she was into.#$e#It's kind of like looking at a photo of her, only with words, if that makes sense.$h
Entries.fall_Mon10: Tunnelers won again last night! They're having an amazing season this year!$h#$e#Sorry, I am really happy right now.$l
Entries.fall_Tue: Isn't it sad how some people just don't ever reach their full potential?#$e#The important thing is just to keep fighting, no matter what.
Entries.fall_Tue4: When the going gets tough, I imagine that some people just give up and settle for mediocrity.#$e#Anybody who's like that must not have a lot of self-respect.
Entries.fall_Tue6: I didn't make much money this year from the ice cream stand.$s#$e#@, what am I even doing?$s
Entries.fall_Tue8: I was thinking, maybe it's important to appreciate the little things around you.#$e#I always heard people say that, but it only recently started making sense.
Entries.fall_Wed8: I finally took the plunge... I've decided to stop putting gel in my hair.#$e#I wouldn't want to be friends with someone who only liked me because I have gel in my hair.
Entries.fall_Thu4: Dude, you are the bomb.^@, you are one awesome girl, you know that?#$e#Just the way you walked right into town one day, and said, "Yup! I'm gonna fix up this farm!" and you straight up did it!#$b#I think people like you and me are on another level.
Entries.fall_Thu6: I remember the final play of the regional championship game. The score was tied, and we were just ten seconds away from the end.#$b#I saw the leaves go flying around in a gust of wind, and I threw the ball, knowing the wind would knock it to the side a bit.#$b#Zane caught it perfectly and we scored. No overtime.#$e#It was a good feeling, y'know?$l
Entries.fall_Thu10: @! Um... Hi.$l#$e#Sorry! I mean, uh...$l#$b#Is it cool if we hang out soon?
Entries.fall_Fri2: That guy Clint? I don't know a whole lot about him.#$b#Apparently he used to play gridball, but he's kind of old now.
Entries.fall_Fri6: I'm going to do a ton of sit-ups tonight.#$e#You have to work really hard if you want to achieve your maximum potential.
Entries.fall_Fri8: You know, I used to want fame and fortune, but lately I've been starting to sing a different tune. In the end it's the humble little things that satisfy, don't you think?#$e#I still want to go pro, but it's not the most important thing in the world.
Entries.fall_Fri10: Haley's good as a friend, I think. It's just that she never listened to me the way you do.#$e#I felt like I always had to act like a big shot when I was around her. And if I told her how I really felt, she'd just lose interest in me.$s#$e#But having those memories make me appreciate who I have now, that much more.$l
Entries.fall_Sat2: Hey, Haley's pretty great, don't you think?#$e#No, we're not dating right now. She's uh... going through some stuff.#$e#But it's probably headed there again soon.
Entries.fall_Sat4: Salmon is definitely my favorite kind of fish. Especially when it's in season.#$e#It just has to be cooked the right way.
Entries.fall_Sat6: I was reading up on how salmon has a lot of... what do you call it? 'Omega-3 fatty acids.'#$b#So at first, I was like, "Whoa, I don't need extra fat in my diet," but it turns out it's the kind that's really good for you.
Entries.fall_Sat8: I have no idea where my dad is. I've spent a lot of time thinking what I'd say if I ever saw him.#$e#It wouldn't be pretty. Maybe some wounds are better left unopened.$a
Entries.fall_Sun4: Gridball's on today! I've waited all week for this.$u
Entries.fall_Sun6: Hey, @, if my grandpa won't get off the freakin' TV, is it alright if I just sprint over to your house to watch the game?#$e#What kind of TV do you have, anyway?
Entries.fall_Sun8: Hey, the gridball game is on today!#$e#Sundays are pretty awesome in the fall.$u
Entries.fall_Sun10: I was always worried that I might turn out like my dad. Still am.$a#$e#But with you around, I don't feel so worried anymore.
Entries.winter_Mon2: What's something good from the saloon that could warm me up?
Entries.winter_Mon4: You like the snow? Me... I'm just looking forward to spring.
Entries.winter_Mon6: Hey, we should work out sometime. The air in the hot spring isn't so dry like it is everywhere else.^Hey, we should work out at the hot spring sometime... er, I mean, I guess you can't get in on my side? Ah, oh well.
Entries.winter_Mon8: @, you know how people say high school is the best years of your life?$s#$b#What if that's true? Is it all downhill from here?$s
Entries.winter_Mon10: I think I disagree that high school is the best years of your life.#$b#This year, for one, has been better.$l
Entries.winter_Tue4_inlaw_Haley: I'll admit... I was a little jealous when you and Haley got married. But, hey... It's a chance for me to learn something new about myself.$9
Entries.winter_Tue4: Hey, @. Could you do me a favor?$l#$b#If you see Haley, tell her I'm busy.$l#$e#Thanks.
Entries.winter_Tue6: You're a cool person to hang out with, @. I feel like I learn something new every time I see you.
Entries.winter_Tue10: Hey! What's up?$h#$e#Are you bored, too? What a coincidence.$l#$e#Hey, we can hang out anytime.
Entries.winter_Wed4: I don't really play video games. Why would I want to push buttons and watch a guy throw a ball on the screen...#$b#...when I could do the same thing in real life?
Entries.winter_Wed6: So not much grows on your farm during the winter? You must be a little bored then.#$e#Hey, you and me, buddy! Welcome to the club.$h^Hey, you and me, @! Welcome to the club.$h
Entries.winter_Wed8: You know what? I'm going to start reading a new book!
Entries.winter_Wed10: I finished reading this book that my grandma said was my mom's favorite.#$b#It was about these two teenagers who travel through time and change history.#$b#So weird. I had no idea my mom was into that stuff.
Entries.winter_Thu4: Nobody really knows who owns Dusty. I feed him sometimes, but so do a few other people.#$e#This pen's been here for as long as I can remember. I think it's even been here longer than Dusty.
Entries.winter_Thu6: I wish I could control the weather.
Entries.winter_Thu8: I had a dream the other night where my mom was there. Then I woke up.$s#$e#Reality bites sometimes.$a
Entries.winter_Thu10: If I ever make a lot of money, I'll make sure all my friends and family are taken care of.#$e#That means you, too.$h
Entries.winter_Fri6: Do you think I'll wind up like Clint if I don't make pro soon?$s
Entries.winter_Fri10: @, are your parents proud of you?#$e#Well, here's one guy who's pretty proud of you.$l
Entries.winter_Sat: There's some weird people living in this town.#$e#...like that guy Sebastian. Why does he wear black all the time?#$e#I don't get it.
Entries.winter_Sat2: I bet if I tried to play catch with that guy Sebastian, he'd just duck and cover when I threw the ball at him.$h#$b#...#$b#Sorry, yeah, I guess that was kind a jerk thing to say.$s
Entries.winter_Sat4: There's some weird people living in this town.#$e#...like that guy Sebastian. Why does he wear black all the time?#$e#I don't get it.
Entries.winter_Sat10: @, you're totally different from me, but I feel like you've shown me a whole different side of life.#$e#Maybe I shouldn't be so judgmental of people who are different from me.
Entries.winter_Sun: Hey, the gridball game is on today!#$e#This might be my favorite day of the week.
Entries.winter_Sun2: At least the gridball season keeps going through winter. But it just gets too snowy where we live to do anything.
Entries.winter_Sun4: Hey, the gridball game is on today!#$e#This might be my favorite day of the week.
Entries.winter_Sun6: At least the gridball season keeps going through winter. But it just gets too snowy where we live to do anything.
Entries.winter_Sun8: Hey @. Do you want to hang out?#$e#It's okay if I miss the start of the game. I'm happy to spend a little time with you.
Entries.spring_1_2: Happy new year!#$e#I'm going to try to upgrade my workout again this year.
Entries.spring_23: Nervous? No way, I'm not nervous about finding a partner at the dance tomorrow.#$e#Why would I be?
Entries.summer_10: Tomorrow should be a good day at the beach. Good food, too!$h
Entries.fall_15: I'm not gonna lie, it rocks pretty hard to step outside of your house and have a full-fledged carnival waiting for you.$h
Entries.fall_26: Hmm... if I go into the haunted maze tomorrow, I wonder if I should bring my bat.
Entries.winter_24: There's gonna be so much good food tomorrow! I just need to watch and make sure I don't overdo it.
Entries.winter_28: Good weather's coming back! I can't wait.
Entries.summer_10_2: Tomorrow should be a good day at the beach. Good food, too!$h
Entries.fall_15_2: I'm not gonna lie, it rocks pretty hard to step outside of your house and have a full-fledged carnival waiting for you.$h
Entries.fall_26_2: Hmm... if I go into the haunted maze tomorrow, I wonder if I should bring my bat.
Entries.winter_24_2: There's gonna be so much good food tomorrow! I just need to watch and make sure I don't overdo it.
Entries.winter_28_2: Good weather's coming back! I can't wait.

Entries.Rainy_Day_0: #$c .5#With all this space, I can really achieve a full body workout.#I know you're not the type of farmer who'd raise beef cattle. That's okay; I can just get some steak at the store.
Entries.Rainy_Day_1: #$c .5#I never had many friends in town... I sometimes wonder how I'd end up if you never moved here.$9#I wonder what my old high school buddies are up to? Today might be a good day to call.
Entries.Rainy_Day_2: #$c .5#Aw... I was gonna do some jogging outside. But I can't really do it in this weather.#You know what? I'm gonna make the best of it today. Life's too short to mope around whenever it rains. Now... what can I do inside...?
Entries.Rainy_Day_3: #$c .5#*grumble*... I just woke up and I'm hungry for some protein.$9#Mmm... do we have any eggs? I'm craving eggs.$9
Entries.Rainy_Day_4: #$c .5#It's a good day to read. I don't want to become stagnant now that I'm a married guy!#I'm trying to catch up on all the books I was supposed to read in high school. Sometimes they start out boring, but they're actually really good!
Entries.patio_Alex: #$c .5#Unghh... one... Unghhh... two... It feels great to lift weights outdoors!$6#*huff*... Alright! *puff*... Feelin' alive! *huff*...$6
Entries.Rainy_Night_0: #$c .5#Hey, did you have a good day? I'm sure tomorrow will be even better.$h#Have you been going into the mine? 'Cause if so, just uh... stay safe?$s
Entries.Rainy_Night_1: #$c .5#How's it going? I've been carrying the old gridball around with me all day. A guy can pretend...$u#I called up my old buddy, Zane. It was great! We just picked up right where we left off.$h
Entries.Rainy_Night_2: #$c .5#Oh... the smell? I've been eating garlic all day. I'm trying to stay manly... Sorry.$l#I wonder what it'd be like to stand under a waterfall...?
Entries.Rainy_Night_3: #$c .5#I've been setting aside a few scraps for Dusty. He deserves a treat now and then.#I stopped by to visit Dusty today. Old boy just keeps on truckin'!$h
Entries.Rainy_Night_4: #$c .5#I was hungry so I made some dinner. Here, I saved you a plate. [241 242 225 214 198]$h#I don't really eat too many energy bars. I like real food better, like this! Here, bon appetit! [241 242 225 214 198]$h
Entries.Indoor_Day_0: #$c .5#Feels good to stay in good health! We only get one body. Gotta make use of it!$h#Ahh... there's nothing like a good night's sleep next to my husband!$h^Ahh... there's nothing like a good night's sleep next to my wife!$h
Entries.Indoor_Day_1: Hey, honey! I made you a hot breakfast.[195 210 211]#$e#$c .5#If you want to get strong, you have to eat like you mean it!#Good food, straight from the source! I'm so glad we've got this farm.$h
Entries.Indoor_Day_2: #$c .5#Come here. *squeeze*... Mmhmm. You're firming up from all that farm work.#Today's a good day to read something. ...Yeah, I've been keeping that going.$h
Entries.Indoor_Day_3: #$c .5#I'm still getting used to cooking and doing laundry... It's not exactly my favorite, but I knew what I was getting into when I married you.$h#I got some books from the library that I need to finish before they're due. I want to keep my mind as fit as my body.
Entries.Indoor_Day_4: #$c .5#There's a couple things around the house that I'm going to try and fix today. Don't worry about me, I'm not bored.#Leave the cleaning to me today! It's fun to have you picture me as a sexy cleaning brand mascot.$h
Entries.Indoor_Night_0: #$c .5#It feels good to push yourself to the limit, doesn't it? You'll really feel like you earned your place in the soft bed tonight.#Let me know if you're sore. I know some physical therapy techniques that can help you if you need 'em.
Entries.Indoor_Night_1: #$c .5#Did you get a haircut or something? You're looking pretty good today. Maybe it's all that fresh air...$l#Another busy day? I like how you keep as active as you do.$l
Entries.Indoor_Night_2: #$c .5#Tell me all about your day. It's good to get everything off your chest now and then.#Dinner's ready! I bet you're famished. [241 242 225 214 198]$h
Entries.Indoor_Night_3: #$c .5#Hey... I got some new shorts. I thought you might be interested to know...$l#I feel like my mom can rest at peace, knowing how things have worked out for me. I'm lucky to have you.
Entries.Indoor_Night_4: #$c .5#If you need some quiet time to yourself, that's okay with me.#Hey. Got some energy left in you?$l
Entries.Outdoor_0: #$c .5#Hey. When I stand here and look out over our land... I'm really proud. You've done great work.#If we ever moved, I'd really miss these sunrises. This is a good spot to stay put for a while, don't you think?
Entries.Outdoor_1: #$c .5#This is a great place to raise children. I would've loved growing up in a place like this. So much room to run around!#A fresh start for a fresh new day! Each day is like opening a new present.$h
Entries.Outdoor_2: #$c .5#I like to spend as much time outside as possible. It just feels better to be out here.#I guess I'm a fresh air snob. It was getting a bit stuffy for me inside the house, so I came out here.
Entries.Outdoor_3: #$c .5#Glad I got up in time to see the early morning. It's always the best part of the day, but it's so easy to miss if you sleep in.$h#Look at us, with our little farm. We make a cute couple.$h^Hey. Maybe it's the golden light, but you look beautiful today.$l
Entries.Outdoor_4: #$c .5#Ahh... It feels great to be outside. Stardew Valley really is the most beautiful place...#I wonder how old Dusty's doing? I oughta pay him a visit.
Entries.OneKid_0: #$c .5#I'm still getting used to my new life as a stay-at-home dad.$h#I could run a marathon if I really needed to, but looking after a kid all day is a completely different kind of exhaustion.$s
Entries.OneKid_1: #$c .5#Our little one's going to grow up strong, just like Daddy.#I've had to cut back on my workout routine a bit so I can take care of %kid1, but it's more than worth it.$h
Entries.OneKid_3: #$c .5#I wonder what it's like to be pregnant...?$h#Ahh, little %kid1... you've got a lot of life in front of you, don't ya?$h
Entries.TwoKids_2: #$c .5#When the kids get bigger, I don't suppose you could spare some of the farm space to make a little gridball field...?$l#Maybe %kid2 will be the first professional gridball played from Pelican Town?$h
Entries.TwoKids_3: #$c .5#I finally have the family life that I missed out on as a kid... thank you.$l#That'd be great if the kids are into sports. I want to make sure they stay healthy. But I'll support them in any kind of life they choose.
Entries.funLeave_Alex: #$c .5#I'm going into town today. I'll see you tonight.#It's about time I owe a visit to Grandma and Grandpa. That's where I'll be, so drop in if you get a chance!
Entries.funReturn_Alex: #$c .5#I had a good day. I like to see my grandparents often; they're getting pretty old.#It was nice visiting town today. Grandma had some cookies out, of course!
Entries.spring_3: These past couple of days have been pretty busy for you, haven't they?
Entries.spring_15: When I visit my grandpa today, I wonder if I can get him to watch something good with me.#$b#Like... Sports Report! I don't wanna miss a minute of the gridball draft.$h
Entries.spring_27: I should update my workout mix. Summer's gonna be here soon!
Entries.summer_3: I gotta say, I don't really miss working at the ice cream stand.#$e#What, do you miss the ice cream? Well, we could always make our own.#$b#I think uh... Sam's mom has a recipe. Or did she already share it with you?
Entries.summer_12: My stomach's all stretched after yesterday and I'm hungry again. I'd better take it easy today.
Entries.summer_15: Oof, I think I messed up my knee yesterday. Better take it easy with the leg days for a little while.#$e#Don't worry, I value my body too much to abuse it. I'll make sure I don't make it worse.
Entries.summer_20: Oh yeah! My knee's doing much better now. Thanks for asking.$h
Entries.fall_3: I almost forgot, it's salmon season! You know what sounds good?$h#$e#Pan roasted salmon with a lemon butter sauce. And a side of kale and... whatever that grain is. The one that isn't rice.$l
Entries.fall_7: It's the Tunnelers' first game of the season today! Oh, man, I'm so psyched!$h
Entries.fall_11: Whoa... I may have overdone it with the protein and carbo-loading this morning. Getting... diminishing returns.$s
Entries.fall_22: Oh yeah, yesterday's game was awesome! The Tunnelers were down, but they came back and crushed it in the last couple minutes.$h
Entries.winter_10: When I was younger, I didn't think I really needed friends. Just respect.$9#$e#But now, I can see I was missing out. It's strange to think I went through so much of my life with so little genuine human connection...$9
Entries.winter_15: These cold days are pretty rough on my grandparents. I'd better go visit 'em today.
Entries.winter_22: *sigh*... Just one more gridball game of the season, but at least it'll be a good one. The championship game is coming up on new year's eve.

Entries.Mon2: Was Abby polite the last time you saw her?#$e#Usually, she's polite to others, but she does have the occasional outburst. I hope she's been good to you.
Entries.Mon4: Abby's actually pretty musically talented, but she's never stuck with one instrument for too long.#$b#Have you ever heard her play anything?
Entries.Mon6: Abby and I keep fighting. I really wish she'd understand that I know more than she thinks.$3#$e$Sorry, I hope your day is going well.
Entries.Tue: On Wednesdays the shop is closed.#$e#Keep that in mind if you're going to need anything.
Entries.Tue2: If you need fast cash, Pierre will be happy to buy whatever produce you have.#$e#Even if it's foraged, we'll still take it. Those kinds of items give our stock a bit of local character.$h
Entries.Tue4: Jodi and I have been friends for a number of years now. I'm so glad that she and her family moved into town.#$e#Sometimes I wonder if I could even get by without her.
Entries.Tue6: I'm still amazed with how Jodi went back for round two, raising another boy. I remember Sam was quite a handful.$h#$e#It was "one and done" for Pierre and me. That was our plan from the get-go.
Entries.Tue8: Pierre's a hard worker. Sometimes I feel guilty about how much he's sacrificed to keep this store running.
Entries.Tue10: Jodi and I were just talking about some of the things you've done for the community.$h#$e#Personally, I'm glad that you're a positive influence on Abby.$h
Entries.Wed2: Oh hello! I hope you're feeling a little more at home now, in Pelican Town.
Entries.Wed4: Hey, have you tried making parsnip soup yet?$h#$e#It'd probably be easier if you saved some parsnips from the spring, huh?
Entries.Wed6: Stardew Valley is nice, but I wish I knew more people.#$e#I'm glad that we've become friends.
Entries.Wed8: I do what I can to stay social. Truth be told, though, it takes a lot of effort for me.#$b#That's the life of a recovering introvert, I guess.
Entries.Thu: I've seen wild horseradish in the forest.#$e#Foraging can be a fun way to earn some cash. Or you can use what you find as gifts or food.
Entries.Thu2: It's nice that we never have to worry about being short on ingredients when it comes time to make dinner.
Entries.Thu4: #$1 Caroline1#Hmmm... I wonder if I can get Pierre to cook dinner tonight.#$e#Hmmm... what am I going to make for dinner tonight?#$e#Maybe I'll just get take-out from the Saloon.
Entries.Thu6: $d Joja#I'm worried about Pierre. Each time we lose business to JojaMart, he can barely sleep for days.|I'm never going to forget the day Pierre stood up to Morris like that. It reminds me of when we were both younger.$h
Entries.Fri4: Abby goes to the saloon with a couple of her friends on Friday nights. Maybe you could join them?
Entries.Fri6: Pierre is multi-talented. Have you ever heard him sing?$h#$e#He's also quite athletic. Or he was, anyway...
Entries.Fri8: $d Joja#Jodi's my best friend, but does she have to shop at JojaMart? I don't know how to address the topic appropriately with her.$s|One of the best things about JojaMart closing down is that I don't have to worry about Jodi shopping there anymore.$h
Entries.Fri10: Be sure to show some support for Jodi when you see her next. It's very difficult for her, the way her husband is away.
Entries.Fri10_2: I thought I'd see a new side to Jodi after Kent returned from the war, but things still seem to be difficult for her.#$e#Maybe we could make her family some dinners?
Entries.Sat: I host an aerobics class on Tuesdays in our living room. You can come if you'd like.
Entries.Sat2: Is it just me, or does Abigail have an unhealthy interest in doom and gloom?#$e#Maybe I'm just too old to understand.
Entries.Sat4: It's funny, I can't remember whether the aerobics club was my idea or someone else's.#$b#I think it just happened organically. Exercise has always been my thing, and our living room seemed perfect for it, so...
Entries.Sat6: I thought I'd set a good example for Abigail with the aerobics classes I host, but if anything, it just seems like it pushed her away from wanting to exercise.#$e#I guess I shouldn't be surprised.
Entries.Sat8: #$1 Caroline12#When we first moved here, I took a while to settle down... I wasn't ready for the domestic life.#$e#Pierre's a bit traditional... but he's a good man. He's ambitious, but he always puts his family first.
Entries.Sun2: Feel free to pray at the Shrine of Yoba if you'd like.#$e#No, it's not really my thing. I do respect those who practice, though.
Entries.Sun4: Between the Shrine of Yoba, the aerobics classes, and the store, we've had to get used to  people just walking through our home on a regular basis.#$e#Communal living isn't so bad as long as people are respectful.
Entries.Sun6: Everyone wants their own child to make fewer mistakes than they themselves made.$s#$e#Is it too much to ask, that Abby stays safe and happy?
Entries.Sun8: I worry too much as it is, and life is short. It's not worth it to let life get you down all the time.#$e#We have to make peace with what we have.
Entries.summer_Mon: Do you grow any flowers on your farm this time of year?
Entries.summer_Mon6: Time seems to go by faster and faster the older you get...$s
Entries.summer_Thu: I've been seeing wild fruits in the forest lately.#$e#Foraging can be a fun way to earn some cash. Or you can use what you find as gifts or food.
Entries.summer_Thu6: The wild grapes that grow here are great for making wine. Are you making any wine right now?
Entries.summer_Thu8: Be sure to save some tomatoes at the end of the season so you can make vegetable stew.#$e#Once it's fall, all you need is a beet. It's a dream recipe for how good it is with so few ingredients.
Entries.summer_Sat6: Sorry if Abby's ever said anything that made you feel awkward.#$b#I wonder if she could have learned better social skills if she'd gotten outside a bit more.
Entries.summer_Sun4: It's perfect weather for an iced tea, don't you think?
Entries.summer_Sun8: Everyone needs to put in the appropriate time for self-care. I think you know my little rituals by now.$h#$e#Have you been putting in the appropriate time? You deserve it, you know.
Entries.fall_Mon10: I hope Abby doesn't make the same mistakes I made when I was her age...$s#$e#Uhm, I mean, looks like we've got another exercise class tomorrow! I'll see you around?
Entries.fall_Thu: Are you doing any foraging this season? I've seen edible mushrooms in the forest.#$e#I should probably mention that I'm not a big fan of them, though.
Entries.fall_Thu6: There are some good recipes that you can make year round with wild mushrooms, so it's not a bad idea to stock up.#$e#Or if you're not much of a cook, you can always sell them to us.
Entries.fall_Thu8: $d Joja#I'm worried about Pierre. Each time we lose business to JojaMart, he can barely sleep for days.|I'm never going to forget the day Pierre stood up to Morris like that. It reminds me of when we were both younger.$h
Entries.fall_Sat6: Abby's always had a strange interest in the occult. I'm not sure where she gets it from...
Entries.fall_Sat8: Is it just me, or does Abigail play too many video games?#$e#Maybe I'm a little old-fashioned.
Entries.winter_Thu: Winter is harsh, but you can dig up some roots if you're lucky.#$e#Foraging can be a fun way to earn some cash. Or you can use what you find as gifts or food.
Entries.winter_Thu6: #$1 Caroline1#Hmmm... I wonder if I can get Pierre to cook dinner tonight.#$e#Hmmm... what am I going to make for dinner tonight?#$e#Maybe I'll just get take-out from the Saloon.
Entries.winter_Thu8: $d Joja#I'm worried about Pierre. Each time we lose business to JojaMart, he can barely sleep for days.|I'm never going to forget the day Pierre stood up to Morris like that. It reminds me of when we were both younger.$h
Entries.winter_Fri6: Don't you think Abby would look better with her natural hair color?#$e#She used to have light chestnut-colored hair.
Entries.winter_Sun4: Ahh, with a hot cup of green tea, it's like the cold doesn't even matter anymore.
Entries.spring_12: Pierre has some really great things to sell tomorrow. Has he told you about it yet?$h
Entries.summer_27: The moonlight jellies are really a sight to behold. They bring back some great memories I've shared with Pierre.$h
Entries.fall_15: I wish Pierre wouldn't get so obsessed with his grange display. He has enough on his mind as it is...
Entries.winter_28: Well, here we are at the end of the year! Any resolutions you're starting tomorrow?
Entries.spring_1_2: Happy new year! Pierre's been waiting for you.$h
Entries.spring_12_2: We'll see you at the egg festival tomorrow, yes?
Entries.summer_27_2: *whew* What a summer. I think we've all earned a bit of a break.
Entries.fall_15_2: I wish Pierre wouldn't get so obsessed with his grange display. He has enough on his mind as it is...
Entries.winter_28_2: Well, here we are at the end of the year! Any resolutions you're starting tomorrow?

Entries.Mon2: Another day, another dollar.
Entries.Mon6: I listen to a lot of music to help pass the time. How 'bout you?#$e#Sometimes I'll sing along.#$e#What? No. You don't wanna hear me sing. Believe me.$h
Entries.Mon8: Maybe I was born in the wrong era. A few hundred years ago, and my skillset would've been much more respected.
Entries.Tue2: Business has been slow lately.#$e#You should upgrade your tools. I could use the cash.
Entries.Tue4: I've got some holes in my schedule today and tomorrow. If you want me to upgrade a tool, now's a good time for it...
Entries.Tue6: Y'know, I'm pretty good at what I do. It's just that blacksmithing isn't the type of talent most people care about.#$e#Pff, maybe in my next life I could be a rock star.
Entries.Tue8: I guess I don't mind what I do for a living. It's just pretty isolating.#$e#I don't feel like I ever have anything interesting to share with the other townsfolk.
Entries.Tue10: Hey, @. Thanks for droppin' by.$h
Entries.Wed2: Hey. Got any work for me?
Entries.Wed4: I like making weapons, too.#$b#If you're interested, you'll have to ask Marlon up north. He's my retailer.
Entries.Wed10: I heard there's one day a week when a shop in the desert sells omni geodes by the truckload. D'you know if that's true?
Entries.Thu: You inherited a pretty basic toolset, huh? Yeah, let me know how I can help with that.
Entries.Thu4: How did those furnace blueprints work out for you? Did you craft a furnace?#$e#Hey, I just figured it was something you could use.
Entries.Thu6: My little shop is a relic left over from Pelican Town's glory days as a mining town.#$e#The only reason I could afford the place was because the mining operation was in a downward spiral.
Entries.Thu10: Willy's a pretty good guy. You ever talk to him?#$e#He's got things figured out pretty well. I just couldn't ever do what he does.
Entries.Fri4: What kind of beer do you drink? Porter? Stout?#$e#I'm a lager man, myself.
Entries.Fri8: It's strange how I've been drinking Gus's beer and eating his food for years, but I barely know a thing about him.
Entries.Sat2: Most people would take a weekend on a day like this, wouldn't they?#$e#Me? Nope.
Entries.Sat4: I gotta get outta this town. Just for a day.#$e#Grampleton's sort of my go-to place. I can't afford a fancy vacation.
Entries.Sat10: Did I ever show you my hands? Tough as old leather from all the calluses.#$e#When I first started working, I was worried about my hands, but now I'd say I'm proud of 'em.#$b#If a guy has messed up hands, at least he can say he's done somethin'... instead of nothin'.$h
Entries.Sun2: Hey, if you've got geodes, make sure you don't sell 'em. Bring 'em to me and I'll help you crack 'em open.
Entries.Sun6: Iridium is exceedingly rare, not to mention difficult to work with.#$e#If you happen to find any, though, I'd be excited to see what I can do with it.
Entries.Sun10: So how are your tools holding up?
Entries.summer_Tue4: I went fishing with Willy a long time ago.#$e#Let's just say fishing's not for me.
Entries.summer_Thu10: Hey, c'mon, you've got to admit that it was pretty fortunate for you to land in a town with its own blacksmith.$h#$e#Would you be able to get as much done on the farm otherwise?#$e#Well, I'm just glad I could find some purpose for my work. So thank you for that.
Entries.summer_Fri6: I remember summer vacations, back when I was in school.#$b#Heck, that was probably my favorite thing about school to begin with.$h#$e#Oh, we didn't do too much. Just hung out with my buddies. Saw movies, drove around, got into trouble.$h#$e#I think it was the freedom more than anything. You're never that free again.
Entries.summer_Sun6: I couldn't tell you too much about the molecular properties of metal. You'd have to ask Demetrius or his daughter about that one.#$e#I just know how to make it into the shape I want.
Entries.fall_Mon: Looks like the Tunnelers had a good game last night.#$e#Cheroky's speed is really what drives the team.
Entries.fall_Mon8: Sometimes I wonder if there's anyone in this town lower on the social ladder than I am.$s#$e#Even Shane seems down pretty low, but at least he knows how to socialize if he feels like it.$s
Entries.fall_Tue2: I played a little Gridball back in school. Wasn't the worst at it, either.#$e#It was fun while it lasted.
Entries.fall_Tue8: My old gridball teammates... I've no idea where any of them are these days.#$e#Some of them probably wouldn't even remember me.
Entries.fall_Thu: Got anything good growing on your farm right now?
Entries.fall_Thu6: Dr. Harvey says I should lose some weight. Hah.#$e#I'm swinging a hammer and lifting metal in here every day. I count that as my exercise.
Entries.winter_Mon4: There's something special about holding a rare gem in your hands, knowing the earth took a helluva long time to create it.$h#$e#If a gem were a living thing, your whole life would seem like the blink of an eye to it.
Entries.winter_Wed8: What's the purpose of life? Ahh, damn it. Don't ask me questions like that.#$e#Tried anything good at the saloon lately?
Entries.winter_Fri8: No skills besides blacksmithing, no family, and no marriage prospects.$s#$b#@, you realize I'm going to do the same exact thing until I die?$s
Entries.winter_Sat4: I mostly do minor jobs for contractors who outsource their work here.#$e#It's more enjoyable if I get to work on one of your tools, though.
Entries.winter_Sun8: I've heard about dwarves in the mines. Not sure what I'd do if I ever saw one.#$e#Probably piss myself.$h
Entries.winter_28: *sigh* Well, did you at least have a good year?
Entries.spring_1_2: Any resolutions this year?#$e#Nah, not me. I don't really see the point.#$e#Still, though, at least it's nice outside.
Entries.Mon_inlaw_Emily: So uh... how's uh... how's Emily?$s
Entries.summer_Thu_inlaw_Emily: ...$s#$e#...What? Oh...#$e#...I think you know what.$s#$e#What do you need?
Entries.fall_Mon_inlaw_Emily: How are you and Emily?#$e#Oh, that's great!#$e#I'm glad for you two. Really, I am.
Entries.winter_Sun_inlaw_Emily: I'm not in the mood to chat today.$s#$e#Just get the hell out of here!$3#$e#Sorry I... that was...$4#$b#I'm sorry. What do you need?$s
Entries.winter_28_2: Hey, I hope your year was good.#$e#Me? Oh, I'll manage. I'm glad winter's just about finished.

Entries.Mon2: Maru worked hard to get through school early. Now she's studying a variety of sciences independently.#$e#I'm glad that I can provide her the equipment she needs to pursue her future.$h
Entries.Mon4: I'm happy Maru got her job at the clinic. Medicine is a very respectable profession, but I'll be happy with whatever kind of science she ultimately decides upon.
Entries.Mon6: I know that Maru will have to leave the valley eventually. If she got stuck here for too long, it could hinder her potential.$s#$e#For the moment, though, I think her living here works out well.
Entries.Mon8: I can already see Maru's scientific achievements surpassing mine in her future.#$e#I'm very lucky that she's turning out the way she is.$h
Entries.Tue2: Stardew Valley continues to impress me with the diversity of its flora and fauna.#$e#I'm surprised there weren't any other scientists observing the area before I arrived.
Entries.Tue4: Exploring the mines could be interesting, but my fields are ecology and biochemistry, rather than geology.#$e#If we found evidence indicating a significant causal link between the mines and the vegetation up here, well then that would be another story.
Entries.Tue6: The drastic changes between the seasons are crucial for keeping the wildlife migrating...#$b$...which in turn is crucial for preventing one single population from becoming too dominant.#$e#I keep pretty good tabs on the various local species, so I'll let you know if I see anything unusual.
Entries.Tue8: Have you ever visited Calico Desert?#$e#I was more interested in studying the valley's ecosystem, but the fact that we have a desert just a day trip's drive away has remained quite a mystery.
Entries.Wed4: Hi @! How are you doing today?#$e#I wish I could make your farming job easier somehow.
Entries.Wed6: I've been collecting some useful data from that cave on your farm.#$b#It's unique in that it produces flora that are often unavailable in the direct surrounding environment.#$e#We're still years away from determining how to utilize this, though.
Entries.Wed8: Whenever my field research becomes a bit stagnating, I'll admit that I enjoy a little off-the-wall chemistry.#$e#I got my hands on a little cesium a few years ago. Robin said "never again."$h
Entries.Wed10: Sorry, I must talk your ear off from time to time, don't I?
Entries.Thu2: Growing any green beans? One of my favorite comfort foods uses them in a recipe.
Entries.Thu4: There are a variety of sponsors who support my work. It took several years of publication and networking to be able to set up my lab out here.#$e#I did have my sights on Stardew Valley for quite a while.$h
Entries.Thu6: It's no wonder that humans have been farming in this region for countless generations. It takes an environment like this for early man to thrive.
Entries.Fri4: Robin has a hot temper. It's better to stay on her good side.#$e#...now if I could only quantify her mood levels, perhaps I could model the fluctuations using a sinusoidal curve...$u
Entries.Fri6: When I met Robin in college, a lot of my friends were pretty awestruck at my willingness to date someone who's already a mom.#$e#What can I say? We were just a good match.$h
Entries.Fri8: I can't help but analyze the 'why' of everything. The way plants grow, the way food tastes, the reason good art looks beautiful.#$e#But every once in a while, I recognize the need to detach, stop questioning, and simply dance with my wife.
Entries.Sat4: One aim of my research is to figure out the exact environmental conditions that we see here in the valley, that make it so uniquely fertile for such a wide variety of species.#$e#In terms of application, we could use it to bolster the abundance of crop turnouts in less fertile regions.
Entries.Sat6: Greetings, @. How is your work progressing?#$e#If you grow any pristine crops, it would be a privilege to examine them.#$e#And possibly taste them!$h
Entries.Sat10: Have you heard of giant crops? Apparently, if certain crops become so dominant in a wide enough plot of land, there's a small chance for the giant variant to manifest.#$e#Nature almost bred them out of existence, since their size makes them impractical for natural selection.
Entries.Sun4: My work basically is my hobby. Occasionally, though, I'll cook a meal, too.
Entries.Sun6: For Sebastian, I left most of the parenting to Robin.#$e#Even today, it's usually best to stay out of his way and let Robin handle things with him.
Entries.Sun8: Sebastian always seems bored by just about every aspect of my work.$s#$e#Computer science is a science, though. I've always tried to bond with him over that, but there's still a bit of a divide between us.#$e#The books I've read say that's to be expected.
Entries.Sun10: Between you and me, I really thought that Sebastian would have moved out by now.$s#$e#He's even older than I was when I first met Robin...$s#$e#As long as he works and pays his rent, though...
Entries.Sun_inlaw_Sebastian: It's such a relief that Sebastian's finally moved out. I did always think you were a good match for him.$h
Entries.summer_Mon6: Why is it that ice cream tastes so good? Science may never provide an answer.#$e#Ha ha, just kidding. It's the fat and sugar.$h
Entries.summer_Tue4: Fertilizer is best for producing quality crops, but if you need to rush a crop to maturity, use Speed Gro.#$b#In theory, you could get three melon harvests that way, instead of two.
Entries.summer_Tue8: You can use sap and fish to make quality fertilizer.#$e#If it's too time consuming to get the fish, maybe you could catch some snails or periwinkles in some crab pots instead.
Entries.summer_Thu4: Hmm... If strigolactone levels could be increased, would it have a proportional effect on mycorhizal growth?$u#$b#Oh! Sorry. I was pondering some data and I didn't notice you there.#$e#Do you need anything?
Entries.summer_Thu8: I became a scientist because I wanted to contribute to the progression of our species.#$e#Of course, none of this would be possible without farmers such as yourself.$h
Entries.summer_Fri: Do you have any animals on your farm?
Entries.summer_Fri2: $p 40#So I heard Maru had you look through that telescope out back.|If you and Maru become friends, I'm sure she'll show you how to use that telescope out back.#$e#Pretty exciting, huh?
Entries.fall_Wed: Let's see... perhaps the nitrogen fixation level is affected by nematode secretions...$u#$b#Oh! Sorry. I was pondering some data and I didn't notice you there.#$e#Do you need anything?
Entries.fall_Thu: How's the farming business going? It's corn season, isn't it?#$e#I can imagine it being pretty peaceful, working outdoors with plants all day.
Entries.fall_Thu6: Maru sure spends a lot of time working on those gadgets of hers.#$e#I'm glad she's so dedicated.
Entries.fall_Thu_inlaw_Maru: I'm still flabbergasted about Maru's secret robot... was it all a dream?
Entries.fall_Sun: During this time of year I divert my attentions to fungi.
Entries.fall_Sun6: We know a lot about nature thanks to science.#$e#But there's always a lot more to learn.
Entries.winter_Wed: Talk to my wife if you want to increase the size of your house.
Entries.winter_Wed4: Do you have a kitchen in your house yet?#$e#Cooking is kind of like doing lab work.
Entries.winter_Sat4: Let's see... if seasonal nitrogen levels could be modeled by a piecewise function...$u#$b#Oh! Sorry. I was analyzing data and I didn't notice you there.#$e#Do you need anything?
Entries.winter_Sat8: Feel free to harvest as much lumber and stone from this area as you please.
Entries.Event_tomato1: Really? I figured a farmer would know the correct answer...$s
Entries.Event_Lab_Silence: Well, we'd better titrate this solution before it crystallizes on us.
Entries.spring_1_2: Happy new year! Lots of work ahead of both of us.
Entries.summer_28: You got my letter, right? Don't be late! You won't want to wait a whole 'nother year for it.$h
Entries.winter_28: We've completed another rotation around the sun!#$e#That deserves a celebration, it seems.
Entries.summer_28_2: You got my letter, right? Don't be late! You won't want to wait a whole 'nother year for it.
Entries.winter_28_2: We've completed another rotation around the sun!#$e#That deserves a celebration, it seems.

Entries.Mon2: My name? My people have never used names.#$e#No, it isn't confusing. Frankly, I would have a harder time trying to remember a different name for every person I've met.
Entries.Mon4: I got some of this stuff from the surface. I just take it from your people during the night.#$e#Hmm? What is this concept you call "private property"?
Entries.Mon6: When you humans had your mining operation below, I had to be very crafty to evade detection.#$e#Obviously, I don't care much about that anymore. I humbly welcome you here.
Entries.Mon8: You keep coming back here. Do you... like bombs?
Entries.Tue: I know that you are new to my language. Please, ask me to repeat anything you hear me say.
Entries.Tue2: When was I born? Well, some time ago. It was...#$b#...wait, when would that be on your calendar?#$b#Some time in late "summer," I think. Summer 22?
Entries.Tue4: Ah... cave carrot stew, cave carrot roast, cave carrot soup and cave carrots au gratin.#$e#...And a ramekin of cave carrot brulee to sweeten the night.#$e#What?
Entries.Tue6: Occasionally, I see a gray-haired human come through here.
Entries.Tue8: You thought Dwarves had long beards? But... I do have a long beard. Can't you see it?#$e#What, a beard like the gray-haired human has? Well his isn't just long, it's excessive.
Entries.Tue10: I don't think I survived the Elemental Wars because of my bravery. On the contrary, the only thing I was ever good at was hiding.#$e#I'm not proud of that fact.
Entries.Wed2: You're only how many years old?#$b#Ah, yes, I apologize. In a dwarven lifespan, you would still be a child.#$e#I hope you take no offense.
Entries.Wed4: Long ago, my people knew the secrets of advanced technology. The archaeological evidence proves that.#$e#But I wonder where it came from? And where did it all go? I guess some questions will never be answered...
Entries.Wed6: I'm impressed by how much your species has advanced in the past 100 years alone.#$b#Are humans always in a rush like that?
Entries.Wed8: A few times, I have seen a strange, blue human climbing down through the mines.#$e#At least, I think he's one of you humans.#$e#I don't trust him.
Entries.Wed10: Of course I need money. Why would I sell my products for free?
Entries.Thu: You're not a spy sent by the Shadow People, are you?#$e#I'm keeping my eye on you.
Entries.Thu2: Yes, I live alone. I have no family. You can thank the shadow brutes for that.
Entries.Thu4: I feel most comfortable underground.#$e#The deeper underground the better.
Entries.Thu6: Most floors in the mines have become unlivable. Too many monsters.#$e#Living up here will have to do, though.
Entries.Thu10: I humbly thank you for your continued visits. You have made me consider humans differently since you showed up.
Entries.Fri2: Most humans fear the unknown... that's why I've hidden my shop here.#$e#Your mining skills prove you're trustworthy.
Entries.Fri4: Please inform me if you find any precious stones in the mine.
Entries.Fri6: My language is so much easier than what humans speak. You learned enough to have this conversation with me fairly quickly, did you not?#$e#Nonetheless, your skills are praiseworthy for a newcomer.
Entries.Fri8: Zzzzzz... Oh?#$e#My apologies. I usually delve into the mines during your night and I sleep at some point during your day. What do you need?
Entries.Sat2: So you're a farmer, then? Do you raise any slimes?
Entries.Sat4: I am happy to receive any dwarven artifacts that you find. But seeing them does fill me with a bit of sadness, too.#$e#I can't offer you any reward for them, but... just so you know.
Entries.Sat6: The mines can be a treacherous place. Be careful, friend.
Entries.Sat8: Explosives are only dangerous if you are a fool. I have used things like these since my earliest days.
Entries.Sun2: I am willing to try human cuisine, yes. Why don't you bring some by?
Entries.Sun4: One day you'll have to tell me about this beverage you call "milk".
Entries.Sun6: The old way of my life is gone. I must connect with humans, but I also do not think your species would receive me well if I walked through the town.#$e#The light outside would drive me crazy in a matter of minutes, too.
Entries.Sun8: You are without a doubt the one human I have spoken to more than any other.#$e#I was always taught to stay away from humans, but I am glad that I decided to shun that rule.
Entries.winter_Sun: Ah, yes. It's true that there's a shrine of death near here. Some humans must have tunneled straight into it some time ago.#$e#I can't say exactly where it came from. Certainly not my people. And the shadow people have also denied it.#$e#Have you been there?
Entries.winter_Sun10: The hostile spirits in the shrine of death must be quite ancient.#$b#I'm sure they would be no match for you, though.

Entries.Mon2: Pelican Town is a uniquely peaceful place. I could tell that from the moment I thought of settling in.#$e#I hope you feel the same.$h
Entries.Mon4: I hope you've come to think of this place as 'home.'
