Entries.Mon6: I am a firm believer that beauty is in the eye of the beholder.#$b#If that's true, then I'd consider writing to be the most direct pathway to where our minds create the beauty we experience.
Entries.Mon10: When you're around, @, the feelings in my heart can only be called poetry without words.$l#$e#I hope all is well with you.$h
Entries.Tue2: So many people go their whole lives without ever truly learning how to pay attention... to our surroundings, to ourselves...#$b#How much life is wasted in that manner?$s
Entries.Tue8: A day can never be boring when you follow the whims of your imagination.$u#$e#Sorry, am I babbling on about nonsense?
Entries.Tue10: In my life, I've spent so much time alone, but I think I may be ready for a change to that.$l
Entries.Wed2: Be sure to drop by my cabin whenever you visit the beach.$h#$e#I often crave solitude, but too much can deter one's well being.
Entries.Wed4: Please excuse the sorry state of my cabin.
Entries.Thu10: I've tried my hand at some sonnets lately.$l#$e#Oh! I've written nothing worth another's attention.#$e#Perhaps another time.
Entries.Fri2: You must have met Leah by now, yes? She has been a good friend since I arrived in town.#$e#I do enjoy a good debate with her about aesthetics.
Entries.Fri8: Farmwork with excellence must require a muse. What inspires you, @?
Entries.Fri10: Maybe one of my next pieces will be about you, @. I hope you don't mind.$h
Entries.Sat2: I don't believe in holding onto many material possessions. I keep only what I need.
Entries.Sat4: 'Awake, my visage of the looming sun#$b#As nature's chorus lifts its voice as one.'#$b#Oh, @, I was mulling over some of my poetry just now. Lately, the springtime has awakened my creativity.
Entries.Sat6: I have no TV, no computer, and no radio. Sometimes I wonder if I would have a difficult time rejoining 'mainstream' society.
Entries.Sat8: Some people are shy. Keep showing interest in them and they'll get comfortable around you.#$e#Everyone likes to have friends, even that grumpy blacksmith.
Entries.Sun2: Oh, so you came here to escape your old life, too?#$e#It appears we have some commonalities.
Entries.Sun4: I respect Leah's pursuit of beauty in material art.#$b#For me, though, beauty only exists in the mind. Words, thoughts, and music are enough for me.$h
Entries.Sun8: 'Awake, my visage of the looming sun#$b#As nature's chorus lifts its voice as one.'#$b#Oh, @, I was mulling over some of my poetry just now. Lately, the springtime has awakened my creativity.
Entries.summer_Mon10: Is it any coincidence that I can't help but picture you whenever I sit down to write?$l
Entries.summer_Tue2: @? You look puzzled.#$b#I guess the hot summer air can make us a little dizzy.
Entries.summer_Tue4: Visit my cabin whenever you like. I could use the company.$h
Entries.summer_Tue10: I write these days, hoping that whatever I compose will be pleasing to you.#$e#It's a whole different experience, writing for someone else instead of myself, but I am already quite fond of it!
Entries.summer_Wed4: The life of a single plant is a story within itself.#$b#Its struggle, its endurance, all for the sake of achieving its purpose of bearing fruit.#$e#The journey of a literary hero is quite similar.$h
Entries.summer_Wed6: If it weren't for the ocean, I fear that my cabin would practically become a sweat lodge during this month.
Entries.summer_Wed10: We ought to share a bottle of wine sometime... to celebrate the progress we've shared in this life!
Entries.summer_Thu2: I took to writing stories from an early age. I played imaginative games endlessly.#$b#But something certainly clicked the day I decided to start writing down the stories that had come so naturally to me.
Entries.summer_Thu4: Some of my best ideas jump into my head when I sit and play my piano.#$e#Of course, some of my worst hours of procrastination happen there, too...$s
Entries.summer_Thu6: It's true that I didn't always have an easy time in school.$s#$b#I spent so much time being different from my peers, that eventually, 'different' became the only identity I knew.#$e#At least I've come to know myself pretty well because of that.
Entries.summer_Thu10: I think of how much I was bullied and outcast as a child. To find someone like you, I feel luckier than I ever thought I'd be.$l
Entries.summer_Fri2: Leah has been telling me about her latest art projects. They sound fascinating.#$e#Some of them she likes to keep secret until they are finished, though. I quite understand.
Entries.summer_Fri4: Writing with a pen is actually quite a bit easier than writing at a computer.#$b#With a pen, you have to commit to the words you write, so it makes me much less indecisive.$h
Entries.summer_Fri6: It was quite an ordeal bringing that piano into my home. Moving it across the beach was no easy feat.#$e#I'm just glad that Mayor Lewis had one for sale from a previous resident who had moved out.
Entries.summer_Sat4: 'And darkness, conquered like a drunken bawd#$b#Submits a fallen face to summer's laud.'#$b#Ah, @, I was just coming up with a little bit of poetry to cheer me up. I hope your day is well.$h
Entries.summer_Sat6: When the sound of the ocean is ever present, it almost seems to become a part of my very being. Walking into the silence of the woods is suddenly the exotic experience.
Entries.summer_Sat8: I'd like to think of your work on the farm as a great romance. To conquer death and breathe life back into what was lost...#$b#Thematically speaking, that is where we as people find our hope.
Entries.summer_Sun4: All of the characters I create are in some way a reflection of me.#$b#In that sense, I consider myself to have explored many of the far reaches of my personality.$h
Entries.summer_Sun6: Writing is quite a bit like acting. Sometimes, I find myself lost in the mind of a character. It's always quite exciting.$h#$e#I prefer to keep my audience away until the story is complete, though.
Entries.summer_Sun10: I can often see pieces of myself in the characters I create. But lately, I've written some vignettes that resemble you more than me.$l
Entries.fall_Mon6: It's been said that a pirate's ship, full of plundered gold, shipwrecked here a long time ago.
Entries.fall_Mon10: Hello, @. I must admit I've felt rather amorous lately.$l#$e#Have you?$l
Entries.fall_Tue4: I've read most of the classics, but I find myself returning to them again and again.#$e#I wonder if anything I write will ever last for more than a generation?
Entries.fall_Wed2: One thing I adore about this beach is that I can enjoy a luxurious steamed lobster dinner on the cheap.$h#$e#The finest things in life require very little money if you know where to look.
Entries.fall_Wed4: I admire the classics, but right now I have my nose buried in a few popular novels, too.#$e#I can always learn more from published authors if I hope to become their peer one day.$h
Entries.fall_Wed6: One thing I adore about this beach is that I can enjoy a luxurious steamed lobster dinner on the cheap.$h#$e#The finest things in life require very little money if you know where to look.
Entries.fall_Thu2: It takes a lot of sweeping to keep the sand from forming a layer in my cabin.$s#$e#Just as long as it doesn't get in my bed.
Entries.fall_Thu4: Oh dear! A tiny crab appears to have made his home in my shirt pocket.$l#$e#That's the trouble with living on the beach.
Entries.fall_Thu6: I cannot deny how the seasons affect my mood. No doubt, then, they must affect my writing?$s#$e#But what if, then, I miss my chance to write the scene that I need so badly, and I have to wait for a whole year?$s
Entries.fall_Thu10: It's wonderful to see you, @! Shall we go for a walk along the beach sometime?$h
Entries.fall_Fri4: My legs are stiff from sitting at my writing desk all night.$s#$e#Sometimes I envy you, @.
Entries.fall_Fri6: I have a terrible headache today from too much eyestrain. Maybe I need an appropriate lamp for when I stay up late to write.$s
Entries.fall_Fri8: The plants in my home have been doing quite well. How about the ones on your farm?$h
Entries.fall_Sat4: 'A breath of leaves that sprightly-stirs the day$s#$b#And beckons mortals all unto decay...'$s#$b#Ah, @, it's just some lines of verse I'm working on. A little poetry offers some reprieve from my main project.$h
Entries.fall_Sat6: Every time I go to write a scene, it ends up taking so much longer than I expect.$s#$e#The more complex a story becomes, the more I have to analyze whether the symbols and motifs are consistent, among other things.
Entries.fall_Sat8: I'm relieved to have finished my book, but I can't stop writing now. Creativity can vanish if it goes unused.
Entries.fall_Sat10: I've already started brainstorming some ideas for another book.#$e#Yes, this is something I intend to keep doing.$h
Entries.fall_Sun4: I've been trying to catch up on some contemporary fiction. I must make sure that I haven't haphazardly duplicated another author's ideas.
Entries.fall_Sun6: Everyone always thinks of summer when they think of beaches. But an autumn beach has its own glassy beauty that should not go overlooked.
Entries.fall_Sun8: There's something poetic about the thriving nature of a farm in autumn, as nature as a whole begins its steady decline toward winter.#$e#Life... death... rebirth, all three have their separate phases, but all exist simultaneously, too.
Entries.winter_Mon4: These dark winter days do affect my disposition.$s#$q 060/061/062/063 winter_Mon_old#Does the winter season affect your mood, too? #$r 060 0 Mon_060#It takes the wind out of my sails.#$r 061 0 Mon_061#It perks me right up!#$r 062 0 Mon_062#It's a mix of joy and melancholy.#$r 063 0 Mon_063#No affect on me.
Entries.winter_Mon_old: $p 060#Are you taking good care of yourself?|I must not allow myself to succumb to a state of ennui.
Entries.Mon_060: Oh dear! It must be difficult to be a farmer when every living thing is asleep. Please come talk with me whenever you like.
Entries.Mon_061: Is that so? Yes, I suppose there is something quite uplifting about the holiday spirit.
Entries.Mon_062: That's exactly how it is for me, too. Some of my best writing has come from wintertime, but it does tend to be darker in tone.
Entries.Mon_063: Is that so? Well, I admire your impervious nature, then!
Entries.winter_Tue4: $d Joja#JojaMarts have always filled me with a deep sense of loathing. I haven't been in one in years.|It warms my heart whenever I see others shopping at Pierre's. I'm reminded of how the soul of this town won me over.
Entries.winter_Tue6: I've written countless stories before, but if I'm going to submit something for publication, it has to be perfect!$a#$e#Writing can exacerbate my perfectionist tendencies quite a lot.$s
Entries.winter_Tue8: 'A sheen of silky snow across the knoll#$b#Invites the lonely one to find his soul...'#$b#Ah, @, I'm just working on a little poetry to invigorate my inspiration.$h
Entries.winter_Wed: A day can never be boring when you follow the whims of your imagination.$u#$e#Sorry, am I babbling on about nonsense?
Entries.winter_Wed4: @, you've trudged through the snow to visit me?#$e#I'm honored!$h
Entries.winter_Wed6: I've been so involved in my own work that I've neglected to ask how your work is going. How is the farm?#$e#Do you have plans for building anything new for the coming year?
Entries.winter_Wed8: I am a firm believer that beauty is in the eye of the beholder.#$b#If that's true, then I'd consider writing to be the most direct pathway to where our minds create the beauty we experience.
Entries.winter_Thu6: It was a fantastic night last night! I must have written another two full pages every hour!$h#$e#I try to relish those personal victories.
Entries.winter_Thu8: Breathe deeply. Do you notice it? That's the smell of the sea.#$e#Whenever I smell the sea, it reminds me of my youth. The ocean really impressed me as a child.
Entries.winter_Thu10: My parents were among those who thought I was crazy to move here.#$b#When I read their most recent letter, though, they seemed more accepting.
Entries.winter_Fri4: Some of my best ideas jump into my head when I sit and play my piano.#$e#Of course, some of my worst hours of procrastination happen there, too...$s
Entries.winter_Fri6: I only got through writing three sentences all day yesterday. Three sentences!$s#$e#My brain simply must be exhausted.
Entries.winter_Fri8: Some of my best ideas jump into my head when I sit and play my piano.#$e#Of course, some of my worst hours of procrastination happen there, too...$s
Entries.winter_Fri10: I can often see pieces of myself in the characters I create. But lately, I've written some vignettes that resemble you more than me.$l
Entries.winter_Sat4: 'A sheen of silky snow across the knoll#$b#Invites the lonely one to find his soul...'#$b#Ah, @, I'm just working on a little poetry to invigorate my inspiration.$h
Entries.winter_Sun6: The cold does make my cabin feel lonelier.$s#$e#Perhaps if I could just use this loneliness as a source of inspiration...$s
Entries.winter_Sun8: I think I'll make enough to get by for another few months!$h#$e#It's easier for me as I have so few expenses, but for a while, I was worried I would go broke.
Entries.spring_1_2: Such a beautiful morning today! Happy new year!$h
Entries.summer_27: The moonlight jellies' visit made for a wonderful experience last year. I hope this year proves no different.#$e#And you can't beat the location of my home!$h
Entries.winter_15: These boats made quite the entrance when they arrived this morning!
Entries.winter_28: Here's to another chapter of our lives! [459]$h#$e#Cheers.
Entries.summer_27_2: The moonlight jellies' visit made for a wonderful experience last year. I hope this year proves no different.#$e#And you can't beat the location of my home!$h
Entries.winter_15_2: The night market is back. I never imagined I'd have that kind of wonderful spectacle right outside my front door.$h
Entries.winter_28_2: Here's to another chapter of our lives! [459]$h#$e#Cheers.

Entries.Rainy_Day_0: #$c .5#I feel inspired today... I think I'll do some writing.#I love waking up to the gentleness of that sound. Don't you?$h
Entries.Rainy_Day_1: The sound of rain, in some tiny way, reminds me of my cabin by the beach.#$e#$c .5#I may be due for another walk down there, soon.#The farm is wonderful, but I do miss the sound of the ocean.
Entries.Rainy_Day_2: I got up early and made coffee.[395]#$e#$c .5#This is a surpassingly delicious blend. I've become quite familiar with how coffee should taste, if I may say so.$h#I find that a cup of this exquisite brew makes the early morning a lot more pleasant.
Entries.Rainy_Day_3: #$c .5#I think I'll remain indoors today, my dear. The rain causes my hair to go limp.#Goodness! I'm in constant admiration at how you boldly venture outside on these days, yet it never dampens your spirit.
Entries.Rainy_Day_4: My inspiration for writing is like the weather... it comes and goes at random. Today I feel entirely dull.$s#$e#Perhaps I'll read one of the classics to get my creative juices flowing.
Entries.patio_Elliott: #$c .5#Ah, what a lovely day to read a book... don't you think, my dear?#Feel free to join me if you're taking a break, my dear.$h
Entries.Rainy_Night_0: #$c .5#Good evening. Did you have a productive day, @?#Our triumphant hero returns! How was your day?$h^Our triumphant heroine returns! How was your day?$h
Entries.Rainy_Night_1: #$c .5#You're ice cold! Let me keep you warm.$l#Dear, what are you doing, burying your wet face in my hair like that? I'm not a towel!$l
Entries.Rainy_Night_2: #$c .5#Ah, my dear, I was just thinking about you. Welcome home.$h#My skill with words is unmatched, yet I can't find the way to properly describe your allure.$l^My skill with words is unmatched, yet I can't find the way to properly describe your beauty.$l
Entries.Rainy_Night_3: #$c .5#What did I do today? I'll just say this... it takes a lot of work to maintain this rugged physique!#Isolating? No, it's never isolating here, compared to the beach. Simply the promise of your return each evening keeps my mind quite copacetic.$h
Entries.Rainy_Night_4: My love... I wouldn't trade you for 100 iridium bars.#$e#Nor 1000...#$e#Not even 10,000 bars, no.$7#$e#...$7#$e#No, not even 100,000 bars!$a#$e#...$s#$e#Wa... one million bars of pure iridium...? Don't make me do this...$8
Entries.Indoor_Day_0: #$c .5#I've been taking much better care of myself now that we're together. The bachelor life wasn't particularly healthy for me.#How on earth did I manage to rough it out in that old shack? Even now, it already feels like a memory out of someone else's life.
Entries.Indoor_Day_1: Good morning! I made us a pot of coffee.[395]#$e#$c .5#I find myself craving this robust flavor nearly every morning.#I know how to brew it just right, if I may say so. I'm a bit of connoisseur.$h
Entries.Indoor_Day_2: #$c .5#If you find a spider in the house, don't squash it! Just let me know and I'll take the poor thing outside.#I woke up with some thoughts swimming in my head for a little vignette. I'll have to write those thoughts down before they vanish.
Entries.Indoor_Day_3: #$c .5#Today is going to be a fantastic day... I can feel it! I get this special feeling in my nose...$h#A sheen of silky sun across your hair... reminds me how I know I've found my home, wherein your gleaming gaze invites to share... a moment in the sun to call our own.
Entries.Indoor_Day_4: #$c .5#Dear, what do you think we should do for dinner tonight? It's your pick.#I've had this recurring nightmare that you gave me a buzz cut... You wouldn't ever do that to me, would you?$s#$e#I trust you.
Entries.Indoor_Night_0: #$c .5#Mmm, good evening, my dear. Come closer.$l#From the brightest winter star, to the shimmer of an iridium vein... nothing can compare to my wonderful man.$l^From the brightest winter star, to the fragrant fairy rose... nothing can compare with your captivating beauty.$l
Entries.Indoor_Night_1: #$c .5#A crackling fire adds wonderful ambiance to the house... every piece of wood burns in a unique way.#There's no sand on the floor, but I still have a lingering habit of brushing off the bottoms of my feet before I climb in bed.
Entries.Indoor_Night_2: #$c .5#Every time I look out at the fields, I'm eager to learn more about your work. Why don't you teach me something new?#I never had much success growing plants in my old beach house. Hopefully I can pick up a thing or two by watching you.##$e#In this respect, you are the master and I only a humble apprentice.
Entries.Indoor_Night_3: #$c .5#When I behold thy wondrous face, a precious jewel of form and grace, my heart... torn by the dread of night, is purified with golden light.#A darkened, starry sky will blanket us, and I will wrap you up within my arms. Locked in that shroud we'll find our peace and thus, we'll lull into repose with gentle charms.#$e#Poetry is the only way I can begin to describe my feelings for you.$l
Entries.Indoor_Night_4: #$c .5#I came to know gourmet seafood quite well while I lived on the beach. [198 202 727 728]Bon appetit!$h#I spent the afternoon daydreaming about the ocean. So I decided to cook some seafood. [198 202 727 728]$h
Entries.Outdoor_0: #$c .5#My wildest dreams have come true... just look at this incredible landscape!#It's the strangest thing, but I get fewer tangles in my hair when I dry it outside. I try to do that on occasion.
Entries.Outdoor_1: #$c .5#The best authors manage to master a variety of voices and styles. That's an ongoing goal of my own.#Fertile soil beneath my feet, fresh air to fill my lungs, and the sun's warmth to delight my skin... Life is going well.
Entries.Outdoor_2: #$c .5#I might stay here and write some poetry. I'm feeling a sudden surge of creativity! You go on ahead and take care of business.#Triumphant wheel that spins the sky, illuminate us with a sigh. For now the dawn-air's chorus croons, to summon nature's youthful tunes.$h
Entries.Outdoor_3: #$c .5#If I stay perfectly still, perhaps a resplendent butterfly will bless my nose with a landing.#Scarecrows seem to work well here. I can't imagine the birds are short on food in the nearby forests.
Entries.Outdoor_4: #$c .5#Good morning. May I steal a soft kiss from my love?$l#I drank too much coffee... my mouth feels about as dry as the Calico Desert.$s#$e#Oh... sorry about the coffee breath.$7
Entries.OneKid_0: #$c .5#How strange... I no longer feel like the protagonist of my own life. And yet, it doesn't bother me at all.#Have you had any time to entertain little %kid1 today? Maybe a second child will make things easier for both of us.
Entries.OneKid_1: #$c .5#I feel like raising our child is the start of a brand new story! It will always be our greatest.#Little %kid1 is going to have the perfect childhood here. There's so much to explore.
Entries.OneKid_3: #$c .5#What are some good toys that we can get? I want our child to be learning something new as often as possible.#Caring for babies isn't exactly my strong suit... but I'll do my best to be a good father.
Entries.TwoKids_0: #$c .5#I wonder how long it'll be before our children can appreciate gourmet seafood?#I already gave %kid1 and %kid2 their food. They eat a lot for such small creatures!
Entries.TwoKids_1: #$c .5#I told the children a little story last night as they were drifting off. You can color me smitten.$l#I was carrying %kid1 earlier, and I could've sworn I heard a "Da...da".$h
Entries.TwoKids_2: #$c .5#Is raising children an art? If it is, I must say that it is quite the competition for my favorite art.$h#I'm going to teach %kid1 to read as soon as possible! That's a great way for children to learn about the world.
Entries.TwoKids_3: #$c .5#Goodness! I'm still able to write a little, but I have to do it in short bursts when our children require such attention.#We've done well, @. The farm is doing excellent and our healthy children are a great joy. I couldn't be happier.
Entries.funLeave_Elliott: #$c .5#I think I'll walk down to the beach today. It's always nice to see the ocean again.#If I walk to the beach today, I wonder who I'll see? There's only one way to find out.$h
Entries.funReturn_Elliott: #$c .5#I had a nice time at the beach by myself. I watched the waves come and go, just like old times.#The beach was quiet today, and yet so full of life. I quite enjoyed myself. And how was your day?
Entries.spring_3: I wonder what new stories we'll have to tell this year? This new chapter of our lives is still just beginning.
Entries.spring_15: I wonder how Leah is faring this spring. Have you seen her much?
Entries.spring_18: I have a new book from the library that's an absolute joy.#$b#The author's command of our language is masterful. The rhythmic sentence structures, the diction... I wonder if I could emulate the style a bit?
Entries.spring_28: The fledgling days of the year are at a close. There's no reason to grieve, though! Summer, fall, and winter all have a precious beauty to them, too.
Entries.summer_6: I have to make sure I write something today. Even if it's just a sentence, it makes all the difference in the world.#$e#I fear I would lose my momentum if I gave into any excuses for laziness.
Entries.summer_15: My soul is alive today!$h#$b#And I know that will not be the case forever. I don't want to miss a second of what this day has to offer.
Entries.summer_18: The halcyon days of summers are not gone! No, they're here in front of us, right now!$h#$e#Blissful as our childhood memories may be, we must not allow nostalgia to blind us. Today is just as precious as any day from years ago.
Entries.summer_22: I wonder what little treasures of the sea are washing up on the beach these days?#$e#I've always enjoyed examining those tide pools. The edge of the pool is the edge of the world for some of those creatures!$h
Entries.fall_5: None of the stories I've written are beautiful, so to speak. Beauty is an experience of the mind.#$b#I think of my written work as a gateway into that experience. Whether the reader successfully enters into beauty is largely up to them.#$b#But I like to think I make it easier for them.$h#$e#Sorry, is it too early to be speaking of such things?
Entries.fall_8: That old piano is still sitting in my old shack. I wonder if today is a good day to pay it a visit?
Entries.fall_20: Dear me. I should have flossed more carefully last night. I'm afraid one of my gums is rather sore.$s
Entries.fall_23: I wrote a short little vignette yesterday. I just need to polish it up today.#$b#Would you like me to read it to you after we go to bed tonight?$h
Entries.winter_4: Having a fresh field of unfettered snow... it's like having a blank sheet of paper and a pen.#$b#Such potential to explore!$h
Entries.winter_12: I must say, it is delightfully cozy in here! My old cabin got so cold.$h#$b#Just as I might have started missing it, I remember how rudimentary it truly was.
Entries.winter_16: My fingers used to get so stiff as I wrote in that cold, old cabin.#$b#I never have to worry about that here.$h
Entries.winter_21: I've always thought, as long as speaking is one of the most fundamentally human things we do, I might as well take some pride in it.$h#$e#I say I should speak mellifluously, even if others may find it strange.#$b#Yet, you know me well, dear: It would be strange if I didn't speak in my most authentic voice, would it not?

Entries.cc_Bus: The bus is finally back in service, and we can go to the desert! Have you met my friend Sandy yet?$h#$e#I'm also glad that Pam got her old job back.$h
Entries.Tue2: Leah comes into the saloon sometimes. You should go ahead and talk to her.#$e#She's a real sweetheart.
Entries.Tue10: Hey, @.$l#$b#%*kiss*#$b#You don't mind if I do that, do you? Physical touch is really important to me.$l
Entries.Wed2: I like sleeping in when I can. I stay out pretty late on nights that I work, so it's just a routine I've fallen into.
Entries.Thu2: I'm sorry, you must miss your grandfather so much.$u#$b#But once a soul comes into existence, there's no reason why it has to go away completely. I'm sure you'll see him again soon.
Entries.Thu8: Dancing is important to me, but I have no plans to dance for a big audience.#$e#It helps me to connect with the physical energy of the world around me.#$b#And if I share that connection with a handful of close friends, that makes it really special for me.
Entries.Fri2: Friday nights at the saloon are a lot of fun. It's good to get into a sense of flow when the speed picks up.
Entries.Fri4: The flowers are really alive out there! I look out at the grassy fields and I see a sea of souls, shifting and mingling.#$e#It's beautiful to be a part of it all.
Entries.Fri6: We have to remember that everyone is connected to everyone and everything else.#$b#The happiness you share today will make ripples across time for hundreds of years.
Entries.Fri8: It's always important to spread goodness, but we also have to remember that everyone is on a different journey.#$b#In my view, there's never any room for judging someone else for their situation.#$e#Just love others, right? That's what it's all about.
Entries.Fri10: I don't think anyone will be suspicious if they see me kissing you. Everyone knows I'm the touchy-feely type.#$e#Oh?#$b#%*kiss*#$b#Heehee...$h
Entries.Sat2: Clothing is the gateway between your body and the world that surrounds you.#$b#I like to make clothing that connects me harmoniously with the day's experiences.
Entries.Sat4: I've experimented with making my own dyes from materials that come from around here.#$e#Synthetic dyes just don't work on your skin the same way natural ones do.
Entries.Sat8: In a way, Yoba plays an important role in my life, but I believe her presence goes beyond anything we can comprehend.#$b#Who knows? Maybe she isn't even a 'she.'
Entries.Sun6: I think it's neat how my parents learned to do what makes them happy.#$e#I do miss them, but it isn't really that different from anyone who moves out when they reach adulthood.#$b#For Haley and me, it's just the reverse.
Entries.Sun8: I can't shirk my responsibilities to this town, to the house, to Haley...$u#$b#My parents are abroad, where they need to be, but I'm also here, where I need to be, so...
Entries.Sun10: @, you're very special to me. You know that, right?$u#$e#Everyone and everything around me is also special, but you... I can't seem to stop thinking about you...$u#$e#...Come what may, I felt compelled to tell you that.$u
Entries.summer_Mon6: I don't completely buy into the idea of the 'self.'#$b#It makes much more sense to me that all of existence is one divine presence, and we are merely ripples upon it.
Entries.summer_Mon10: @, hold on a sec.$l#$b#%*kiss*#$b#...$l#$b#Have a wonderful day!$l
Entries.summer_Tue2: It's another workout day today. I love waking up all those dormant muscles in my body!
Entries.summer_Tue4: There are some great spots to go camping around here. Is that your thing, very much?
Entries.summer_Wed4: I gave my friend Sandy a call earlier today. Sounds like it's pretty lonely out in the desert.$u#$e#I believe everyone is always where they need to be, but we'll see if the universe provides another path for her.$u
Entries.summer_Wed8: Have you talked to the birds lately?#$b#...It's important to remember that we have so much more in common than you think.
Entries.summer_Wed10: @... do you think we're... destined for more than just our day-to-day conversations?$l
Entries.summer_Thu4: I feel guided to take more risks, lately.#$q 040/041/042 summer_Thu_old#So, @, do you believe in fate?#$r 040 0 Thu_040#No, we control our lives.#$r 041 0 Thu_041#Yes, there's no such thing as choice.#$r 042 10 Thu_042#I'm not sure.
Entries.summer_Thu_old: $p 042#I still have to listen carefully to the conscience that the universe gifts to us, though.|I still have to listen carefully to the conscience that the universe communicates to us, though.
Entries.Thu_040: I've thought that, too, but what if I'd been born with a different brain? Would I have made the same choices?#$b#And could I still call those choices my own, if it was pure luck that I got that brain?
Entries.Thu_041: Right? I can't deny that we only make our 'choices' because of preexisting influences.#$b#That's why I can't ever judge someone for the situation they're in.
Entries.Thu_042: Hey, maybe that's the best way to be! There's so much to wonder at in the universe.
Entries.summer_Thu8: We're just standing here, but the universe has brought us to this exact moment!$h#$b#It's absolutely amazing if you stop and think about it.
Entries.summer_Sat4: We should always treat one another with not just respect, but love, too.#$e#I try to treat everyone the same. Sandy, Clint, Shane, you... everyone.#$e#Because you're all wonderful in your own ways!$h
Entries.summer_Sat8: My sewing machine's been getting a good workout this summer. I just have so many projects.#$e#I'll maybe get around to making something for Haley, but I also have to accept there's a good chance she'll never wear it.$u#$b#Oh well. *shrug*
Entries.summer_Sat10: I want to love everyone equally, @, but I can't deny that what I feel for you is... a little deeper.$u#$e#Do you think you'll live here a long time?$u
Entries.summer_Sun6: Hi, @! We've become decent friends, haven't we?$h#$e#That's fine with me. You're a cool guy.^I'm glad.$h
Entries.summer_Sun8: Hi, @! We've become decent friends, haven't we?$h#$e#This may sound weird, but I've always been certain this would happen.
Entries.summer_Sun10: Souls swirl together like clouds forming and reshaping in the sky. I'm glad we've crossed paths as we have, @.$l
Entries.fall_Mon4: I've been working on some sweaters for when the days get colder.#$e#My goal is for the fabric to create a warm, nostalgic feeling for whoever wears it.
Entries.fall_Tue8: Everyone has something to contribute to this world. Whether it's big or small makes no difference.
Entries.fall_Tue10: In a way, Yoba plays an important role in my life, but I believe her presence goes beyond anything we can comprehend.#$b#Who knows? Maybe she isn't even a 'she.'
Entries.fall_Wed2: One place where I put my foot down is with salmon. No other creature labors like they do to fulfill their purpose.$s#$e#If you catch one, I hope you'll toss it back.$s
Entries.fall_Wed8: I wish Gus wouldn't make his salmon dinner recipe. If we aren't careful, we'll run the world clean out of salmon.$s
Entries.fall_Thu2: I saw a little family of mushrooms living under one of the trees in town.$l#$e#Cutest thing ever!$h
Entries.fall_Thu4: I practice transcendental meditation. It's very important, I think, to get in touch with the part of the world we cannot see.
Entries.fall_Thu8: I hope I get a chance to visit the desert again soon. I've got to see Sandy, of course, but...#$b#...there's also a trader whose wares are just amazing.#$e#Be sure to bring some gems with you for trading, if you go.
Entries.fall_Fri4: Smell that clean air? It's lovely, isn't it?#$b#I just fear that the Joja Co.'s of the world will take this away from us.$u
Entries.fall_Fri8: Life can't last for all time, so we have to make sure we embrace every day!#$b#But also, what IS 'time,' anyway?
Entries.fall_Fri10: It's okay for me if people see us kiss. Everyone in town knows I'm the touchy-feely type.#$e#Oh?#$b#%*kiss*#$b#Heehee...$h
Entries.fall_Sat4: I don't have any huge plans for life. I prefer not to stress about the future.
Entries.fall_Sat8: There's good people in this town who just can't seem to find happiness. It makes me sad.$u#$e#Working in the saloon, I hear first-hand about everyone's problems.$u
Entries.fall_Sat10: Hi @.$l#$e#My heart rate picked up as soon as I saw you. Here, put your hand on my chest.$l#$e#I'm so glad you came by!
Entries.fall_Sun4: There are so many invisible barriers holding us back. Why can't people learn to let go and celebrate freedom?#$e#Me? Well, you know what they say... 'You can't cage a wild Junimo'.
Entries.fall_Sun8: You're such a nice person, @! Thanks for being my friend.$h
Entries.fall_Sun10: You're such a nice person, @! Thanks for being good to me.$h
Entries.winter_Mon2: Every now and then, I get a craving for a good vegan burger.#$e#I'm not actually vegan, or vegetarian. I just eat whatever feels most nourishing for my body and spirit.
Entries.winter_Mon4: With the weather as cold as it is, I've been working on a sweater for Shane.#$e#I think he'll like it. It's not too heavy, so it should fit nicely under his favorite hoodie.
Entries.winter_Mon8: Be careful an icicle doesn't fall on your head! I wouldn't want you to get hurt!
Entries.winter_Mon10: @, hold on a sec.$l#$b#%*kiss*#$b#...$h#$b#Have a wonderful day!$h
Entries.winter_Tue6: We can all use a little more dancing in our lives, don't you think?#$e#In a way, all of life is a dance. It's just a matter of how well aware your physicality recognizes that.
Entries.winter_Tue8: I hope we all can learn to age as well as the changing of the seasons into winter.
Entries.winter_Wed: I wish Haley would get a job or at least contribute to cooking and cleaning.$s#$e#I think she's hoping to marry someone rich.$u
Entries.winter_Wed2: I really wish Haley would pitch in more with keeping the house clean.#$e#Ah well. I just wish we all could learn to accept the responsibilities that are laid before us.
Entries.winter_Wed4: The last time I visited Calico Desert, I came across a merchant with a camel. She had so many beautiful things for sale, it almost took my breath away.#$e#Next time I go, I'll have to bring some of my gem collection for trading. She doesn't accept G.
Entries.winter_Wed6: Haley and I aren't made for such a big house. It's a hassle to keep it clean.#$e#Ah well. I really shouldn't be complaining.#$e#Your farmhouse seems nice and cozy.$h
Entries.winter_Wed8: I do wonder sometimes where Haley will end up.$u#$e#I'm sure she'll wind up exactly where she needs to be.
Entries.winter_Wed10: Sometimes it feels like I have to be a parent to Haley. But that's not a role I can really fill...$u
Entries.winter_Wed_inlaw_Haley: I'm so happy that Haley found you. The universe had a plan for her after all!$h
Entries.winter_Thu4: It's free hug day today!$h#$b#%*hug*#$b#I hope your day goes wonderfully!$h
Entries.winter_Thu10: You look like you could use a little human connection.$h#$b#%*kiss*#$b#Touch is important. I wish more people were open about it.$h
Entries.winter_Fri2: Crystals hold various potent properties. Some of them can serve as a nexus for spiritual connections with others.#$e#Clint's big into crystals, too. That's probably why we're such good friends.$h
Entries.winter_Fri6: If I wasn't so busy I'd help you dig around in that cave by the lake.#$e#I bet there are some powerful crystals inside there.
Entries.winter_Fri8: It isn't always easy trying to show love and compassion for everyone.#$e#What if the love I show for one person hurts someone else?$s
Entries.winter_Sat6: The world around us is sleeping, but the spirits are still very much alive.#$e#You can hear the spirits if you know how to listen with more than just your ears...
Entries.winter_Sat8: Life can't last for all time, so we have to make sure we embrace every day!#$b#But also, what IS 'time,' anyway?
Entries.winter_Sun2: My homemade sweaters have been really cozy in this cold weather.
Entries.winter_Sun6: There were some huge snowflakes outside the other night!#$e#Sometimes, I really enjoy walking home late at night.
Entries.winter_Sun8: My sister and I might fight sometimes, but I would really miss her if she left.#$e#I think she'll become a very nice young lady some day... Don't tell her I said that.$h#$e#So, is there anything you want to talk about?
Entries.winter_Sun8_inlaw_Haley: Say hi to my sister for me! And remind her to visit me tomorrow.
Entries.winter_Sun10: The spiritual connection that I feel to you... do you feel it too?$l#$b#It's like a million invisible threads connecting the two of us.$l#$e#...No?#$b#%*kiss*#$b#How about now?
Entries.spring_1_2: Where will fate lead us this year? I'm eager to find out.$h
Entries.spring_23: Who will I dance with tomorrow at the festival? Wherever my presence is needed the most, that's where I'll end up!
Entries.summer_10: Hey, look for me tomorrow at the luau. I'll greet you, but probably not in the way you're used to.
Entries.summer_27: The moonlight jellies will be here soon. As people, we have so much we can learn from them.$l
Entries.fall_15: I'm looking forward to the crowds at the fair tomorrow. There will be so many interesting people to meet!
Entries.fall_26: Gus has some pretty tasty treats that he's been prepping for Spirit's Eve. Be sure to say hi!
Entries.winter_9: Those poor fish! I hope Mayor Lewis was responsible with them after yesterday's competition.$s
Entries.winter_24: It's been a whirlwind at work lately.#$b#Gus has been in high gear with all the food he's been cooking for the feast!
Entries.spring_23_2: Who will I dance with tomorrow at the festival? Wherever my presence is needed the most, that's where I'll end up!
Entries.summer_10_2: Hey, look for me tomorrow at the luau. I'll greet you, but probably not in the way you're used to.
Entries.summer_27_2: The moonlight jellies will be here soon. As people, we have so much we can learn from them.$l
Entries.fall_15_2: Tomorrow will be a good day for people watching. What are your plans for the fair?
Entries.fall_26_2: Gus has some pretty tasty treats that he's been prepping for Spirit's Eve. Be sure to say hi!
Entries.winter_9_2: Those poor fish! I hope Mayor Lewis was responsible with them after yesterday's competition.$s
Entries.winter_24_2: It's been a whirlwind at work lately.#$b#Gus has been in high gear with all the food he's been cooking for the feast!

Entries.Rainy_Day_0: #$c .5#I wonder where the flying insects go when it rains? Don't they get hit by the raindrops?#I hope all the animals out there are taking shelter. Maybe they're all sleeping in.
Entries.Rainy_Day_1: #$c .5#A day like this is a blessing from mother nature.#When one raindrop falls on your head, how many times do you think its water molecules have been in the sky before?
Entries.Rainy_Day_2: #$c .5#Good morning... I got this gift for you. Don't worry, I already purified it with sage incense. [428 440 444 338 207]#It's pretty wet out there, isn't it? Here, this item will keep you well. [428 440 444 338 207]
Entries.Rainy_Day_3: #$c .5#I meant to let the parrot go free, but his wing never fully healed. He seems content, though. I give him lots of attention.#The parrot seems to enjoy living inside, especially on days like these. He told me that he's happy here.
Entries.Rainy_Day_4: #$c .5#I never told you this... but when you first moved here I had a dream about you. I knew right then that our life-paths would intertwine.$4#I've already forgotten last night's dreams. How strange. They were crystal clear when I first awoke.$u
Entries.Rainy_Night_0: #$c .5#Every moment has a unique and precious beauty... do you notice? It can be easy to forget, sometimes.#It's important to find something to love about each day. For me today, it was watching the fields dance to the rain in the afternoon.
Entries.patio_Emily: #$c .5#This is my favorite spot for a morning meditation. I visualize the energy from this crystal garden flowing through my body.#%Emily is in a deep meditative state.
Entries.Rainy_Night_1: #$c .5#I can hear the plants talking to each other... they're so happy after today's rain!#Does the weather have you feeling down? I wonder if a little clothing therapy would help?
Entries.Rainy_Night_2: #$c .5#How was your day? You look a little soggy.#Did you get everything done that you'd hoped? Don't worry if you didn't. Each day is special, even if it isn't what we planned.
Entries.Rainy_Night_3: #$c .5#My day was very peaceful. How was yours?#I wonder if the animals enjoy cuddling up together on a night like this.
Entries.Rainy_Night_4: #$c .5#Want some dessert? It's my special raw, gluten-free version, sweetened only with cactus syrup.[232 234 223 220]$h#I made you a treat! Sandy sent me the agave nectar that I used in it. [232 234 223 220]$h
Entries.Rainy_Night_5: #$c .5#Does the sound of rain ever put you in a trance?#I feel like our souls are especially in step tonight. Maybe we can head to bed a little early?$l
Entries.Indoor_Day_0: #$c .5#What physical objects do you feel especially connected to today? Be sure not to overlook them.#Another beautiful day on %farm farm... I have faith that something good will happen today!$h
Entries.Indoor_Day_1: #$c .5#Here, take this. It's for you. [428 440 444 338 207 395 749]#I've been saving this for a special occasion. Today seems like the right day. [428 440 444 338 207 395 749]
Entries.Indoor_Day_2: #$c .5#Hey, someone must've gotten a good night of sleep... you look fresh this morning.$h#One day, we'll all wake up from this life, as if from a pleasant sleep. But for now and many years, I just want to enjoy this dream.
Entries.Indoor_Day_3: #$c .5#My horoscope for the day isn't too good... but I'm going to make the best of it, as always. Let's get to work!#I wonder what Haley's doing today? I hope she has something planned.
Entries.Indoor_Day_4: #$c .5#Ughh... *gurgle*... I ate too many bran muffins for breakfast.$s#Good morning! Give me a kiss before you go.$l
Entries.Indoor_Night_0: #$c .5#Is that a new hole I see in your shirt? I can sew that up for you, no problem.#I danced a little while you were out. It always helps bring me back in touch with reality.
Entries.Indoor_Night_1: #$c .5#Welcome home. I hope you had a wonderful day.#Welcome home. I love the way you look at me like that.$l
Entries.Indoor_Night_2: #$c .5#Is it bed time already? My, the day just floated away from me again.$u#I just got off the phone with Sandy. Sounds like she had a great time visiting Zuzu City not too long ago.
Entries.Indoor_Night_3: #$c .5#Ah, that aroma! It can only be you. It's a good smell.$h#I feel so comforted, the split-second I hear your footsteps land on the deck.$l
Entries.Indoor_Night_4: #$c .5#I swept the whole house, washed the windows, dusted, and cleaned the fridge. It was a very productive day!#Maybe someday when we retire, we can travel the world, like my parents. At least just for a little bit.$u
Entries.Outdoor_0: #$c .5#I love getting up early. There's a certain freshness to the air and the wildlife is much more active.#Shh, if you pause and listen very carefully, you can hear the ocean.
Entries.Outdoor_1: #$c .5#What's on the agenda today, dear?#If you need a break later today, you can meditate over at the crystal garden. There's no wrong way how to do it.
Entries.Outdoor_3: #$c .5#A little sunlight is good for you. Just don't get crispy, okay?#There's so much to do today! Not in the stressful sense, but just in the 'appreciation' way.
Entries.Outdoor_4: Good morning! I was wondering when you'd finally roll out of bed!$h#$e#$c .5#I was hoping you wouldn't miss this beautiful morning.#It's okay... you deserve a good night of rest.
Entries.OneKid_0: #$c .5#I hope we can raise our child to be kind and considerate. That's more important than getting A's in school.#Little %kid1 will probably grow up to like vegetables if we set a good example. What do you think?
Entries.OneKid_1: #$c .5#Is one child enough, or should we raise another? I guess we'll just see where fate leads us.#To think... if you'd never felt upset at your old job, you never would've moved here, we'd have never met, and %kid1 wouldn't even exist.$l
Entries.OneKid_3: #$c .5#I lit a pale green candle and shook a sprig of baby-mint over our little one. That should ward off any dangerous spirits.#I love %kid1's cute little baby noises.$h
Entries.TwoKids_1: #$c .5#A big house, two kids and a parrot... I have my hands full!#Yoba has blessed our home so much! We have that much more responsibility to show love and support to others.
Entries.TwoKids_2: #$c .5#I hope the parrot doesn't feel neglected, but I have to admit that these kids keep my hands more than full.$s#Well, %kid2 certainly has your hair...$u
Entries.TwoKids_3: #$c .5#Oh, I already fed the kids their organic quinoa puffs with goat milk. You just focus on the farm!#I forgot to tell you, the kids loved seeing their Aunt Haley yesterday. She stopped by.
Entries.funLeave_Emily: #$c .5#I'm going to visit town today, and later on I'm going to help out at the saloon. Have a nice day.#Gus rang. Said he had some work for me, so that's where I'll be later today if you need me.
Entries.funReturn_Emily: #$c .5#My day went well... it's good to get out of the house now and then.#What a wonderful day today! It was nice to take a stroll through Pelican Town.$h
Entries.spring_14: The farm must seem like an endless expanse to the bugs and worms. It's an entire world, really.#$e#When I think about people standing all over the planet, we're just like the bugs who only know the farm. What lies beyond?#$e#Everything is relative. It's just a matter of perspective.
Entries.spring_19: It's Friday! Are you going to have a night out, or are you going to stay in?
Entries.spring_27: The parrot sang me a little song right before you got up. Did you hear it, or were you still out?
Entries.summer_7: I'll never forget that bear that showed up on our camping trip.#$b#Nor the part that came after that.$l
Entries.summer_12: I hope I didn't go overboard with the dancing yesterday. I'm thirstier today than I expected.$u#$e#Oh, of course I noticed you. My eyes were closed, but I heard your footsteps and felt your presence.
Entries.summer_18: Do we have any structures that could be temporarily repurposed as a sweat-lodge? It's just a thought I had.
Entries.summer_22: I know some people might be a little put-off by the things I believe and the way I act. But it's just the way I am.$u#$e#I don't know how to be myself any other way.
Entries.summer_26: Today is 'Do Something Nice for a Random Person' Day. Maybe I'll pay for Clint's burger tonight at the Saloon.#$e#Anyone in mind whose day you'd like to brighten?
Entries.fall_4: *sigh*... Salmon season.$s#$e#I hope as many as possible complete their long upstream journey.$s
Entries.fall_7: Mmm, maybe we can make it survival burger night, tonight?#$e#I've just got a craving.
Entries.fall_10: Are you going down into the mines any time soon? I know that Yoba will protect you, but it doesn't hurt to be vigilant on your end, too.$u
Entries.fall_14: When my feelings for you first developed, I secretly feared I'd lose my passion for loving the world around me...$u#$b#...that all my love was diverted into you.$u#$b#But now, I can see it's not a problem at all. The bond I share with you just spurs me on, to love everyone and everything even more!#$e#...$l
Entries.fall_20: The spirits are really active this time of year. Stand by the trees in the forest, and you can hear more than just the wind whispering through.
Entries.winter_10: You know, I noticed that Haley's keeping the house in pretty good shape!#$e#Who knew that all I had to do was move out, and she'd suddenly step it up?$h
Entries.winter_22: @, I just wanted to say, as long as we've known each other, you've never tried to change me from the person I am.$u#$b#I know... a lot of people don't really understand me, and possibly sometimes I do things that even confuse you a little, too...$u#$b#...But you've always accepted me.$u#$e#So... thank you.$u
Entries.winter_16: I hope Shane and Clint are doing okay. I don't see them as much as I used to.$u

Entries.Introduction: Why, hello and welcome to our little community, dear!#$b#You can call me 'Granny' if you like.$h
Entries.Mon4: There used to be so many children in this town. My, how they've grown up!
Entries.Mon6: I have good days and bad days with my energy. Today is a good day.#$e#Even if it's a bad day, there's no use moping about it.
Entries.Tue2: How's life on that farm going for you?#$e#George mentioned to me how glad he was to see someone working on it again. I don't know if he'll tell you that, though.
Entries.Tue6: It's nice of you to take the time to visit George and me.#$e#Without young people around, we'd age much faster.$h
Entries.Wed8: So what are young folks into these days?#$e#I suppose I'd have to visit Zuzu City to find out for sure. Pelican Town must not be like a lot of other places.
Entries.Thu4: I'll be baking cookies today. I like to make flower shapes in the spring.$h#$e#Have you tried a little baking yet, dear?
Entries.Thu6: I think if I cut them right, I can make my cookies look like tulips today.#$e#Even if no one eats the cookies, it helps me to do something creative.
Entries.Thu8: It's cookie baking day again. If we wind up with leftovers, I'll be sure to send you some in the mail.
Entries.Fri2: George watches the news a lot. I worry it'll give him a skewed perspective of the world.#$e#If you want a better perspective, look no further than your own neighbors. That's what I say.
Entries.Fri4: You'll see George heading to the Shrine of Yoba on Sundays.#$b#His own little traditions are the only things that can get him to do anything good for him.
Entries.Fri6: I hate to ask, dear, but could you talk to George a bit for me? The longer he stays locked up in the house, the crankier he becomes.#$e#I'm terribly sorry.
Entries.Fri8: One of George's favorite TV programs is so violent. And he always keeps the volume up so loud.#$e#I worry it can't be good for his health. Why bring more stress into the house when we don't need it?
Entries.Fri10: George agreed to turn the volume down on the TV. Turns out his ears are actually better than mine.#$e#That's no little victory. I've been asking him for years.
Entries.Sat4: Springtime always gives me a fresh sense of hope. I figure these old bones still have a number of good years left!
Entries.Sun6: I keep a diary, but I always write down what I did two days ago. It's an exercise that helps me with my memory.
Entries.summer_Wed6: I would go to Caroline's aerobics class if I could keep up half the speed of those other ladies.#$e#It's fine, though. I just do some basic stretches in the morning, and I walk a lot. Can't do much else beyond that.
Entries.summer_Thu4: I'm going to bake cookies today. They're coconut wonders shaped like little palm trees! Heehee.$h#$e#Have you tried a little baking yet, dear?
Entries.summer_Thu6: It seems like we always have more visitors when I start baking cookies.#$e#My mother taught me the recipe.
Entries.summer_Thu8: Maybe today's a good day to make homemade bread, instead.#$e#I can't make bread every day. It's a little rough on the joints. Today is a good day, though.
Entries.summer_Sun10: *sniff* ...Hello, dear.$s#$e#I'm sorry for you to see me like this. It was around this time of year that we lost our daughter, Alex's mother.$s#$e#I'll be alright by tomorrow, dear. Thank you for asking.$s
Entries.fall_Tue6: So what are young folks into these days?#$e#I suppose I'd have to visit Zuzu City to find out for sure. Pelican Town must not be like a lot of other places.
Entries.fall_Wed8: What's the secret to a lifelong marriage? Well that's quite a question!#$b#Of course, there are countless answers, but the one thing all those answers have in common...#$b#...is that you must love, simply and unceasingly.
Entries.fall_Thu4: Today I'm baking cookies. They're shaped like little pumpkins.$h#$e#Have you tried a little baking yet, dear?
Entries.fall_Thu6: I think I'll try something different today. Leaf-shaped cookies! $h#$e#It helps me to make something that reflects what I see outside.
Entries.fall_Thu8: Hey there, dearie. I was just thinking I might have to make a treat to send you in the mail sometime.$h#$e#It'll just have to be a surprise, though.$h
Entries.fall_Sat: Are you friends with Alex?#$e#Sometimes he worries me sick.
Entries.fall_Sat4: Does Alex still spend time with that girl Haley? She's a good girl, but I wonder whether she gives him the kind of support he needs.
Entries.fall_Sat8: Have you been spending much time with Alex lately?#$e#I just wonder sometimes where his life is headed.
Entries.winter_Mon6: I've walked the same roads of Pelican Town a hundred thousand times.#$e#But today is the first day I've ever walked them THIS time.$h
Entries.winter_Mon10: Perhaps George will outlive me in the long run. If that happens, you tell him not to burden Alex for too long!$s#$e#No young man needs that kind of responsibility.$s
Entries.winter_Tue8: Every day is so hard with George, but we can't move into assisted living.#$b#This community is really what keeps us going. If we didn't have Pelican Town, we wouldn't have anything.
Entries.winter_Thu: It's another great day for baking cookies. They're in the shape of little snowmen this time.#$e#Maybe I'll tell you my recipe one of these days.
Entries.winter_Thu4: It's another great day for baking cookies. They're in the shape of little snowmen this time.$h#$e#Have you tried a little baking yet, dear?
Entries.Winter_Thu6: I've got some snowflake-shaped cookie cutters to use today. This should be fun!$h
Entries.winter_Thu10: I bake cookies because they never fail to make George open up to me.#$e#He had a bite of cookie in his mouth when he looked right at me and said "I love you" for the first time.#$e#He's kept that going ever since.
Entries.spring_1_2: Well, a very fine day to you too, dearie! I hope your year is off to a nice start.$h
Entries.spring_21: Looks like I need to get started on the flower arrangements for the dance next week.#$e#I hope you'll be there, dearie!$h
Entries.spring_23: The flower arrangements for tomorrow's dance are all but finished. I hope Mayor Lewis will be pleased.#$e#And I hope you'll be pleased, too!$h
Entries.summer_10: Mayor Lewis always gets so nervous for the luau. Be sure to show him some support.#$e#The best way to do that is simply to bring something delicious for the soup.
Entries.winter_7: I'll gladly brave the cold for tomorrow's Ice Festival. That's an important one for me.#$e#I'll even drag George along with me, no matter what he says.$h
Entries.winter_1: I had Alex hang up the old winter decorations this morning. I'd say he did a great job!
Entries.winter_28: Best wishes in the new year, dearie. It's such a blessing to have you here in town.
Entries.spring_21_2: Looks like I need to get started on the flower arrangements for the dance next week.#$e#I hope you'll be there, dearie!$h
Entries.spring_23_2: The flower arrangements for tomorrow's dance are all but finished. I hope Mayor Lewis will be pleased.#$e#And I hope you'll be pleased, too!$h
Entries.summer_10_2: Mayor Lewis always gets so nervous for the luau. Be sure to show him some support.#$e#The best way to do that is simply to bring something delicious for the soup.
Entries.winter_7_2: I'll gladly brave the cold for tomorrow's Ice Festival. That's an important one for me.#$e#I'll even drag George along with me, no matter what he says.$h
Entries.winter_28_2: Best wishes in the new year, dearie. It's such a blessing to have you here in town.

Entries.Mon2: All right. What is it you want from me, anyway?
Entries.Mon4: Still haven't given up yet, huh?#$e#The farm, I mean. Still goin'?
Entries.Mon6: I'm surprised you want to be friends with an old-timer like me.
Entries.Mon8: Is there really a place for me in this world, anymore?#$e#Maybe that's just the way it has to be.
Entries.Mon10: You may or may not have heard already, but our daughter passed away some years ago.$s#$e#I don't know how Evelyn manages each day. I know that she's just as broken up about it as I am.$s
Entries.Tue: Hmmph... Looks like another gloomy day.
Entries.Tue2: Yeah, look at you, runnin' around like that. Just rub it in, why don't ya?
Entries.Tue4: What're you doing, wasting your time talking to an old man like me?#$e#Don't young people even stay busy anymore?
Entries.Tue6: I don't understand what you young people are planning to do with this world.#$e#All I can say is that it ain't the world I once knew.
Entries.Tue10: You know, I shouldn't get too depressed about my legs.#$e#I should just be happy that I'm alive.$h
Entries.Wed2: Are you trying to get me to buy something? I'm not interested.
Entries.Wed4: You be thankful for what you have on that farm, d'you hear?#$e#Before you know it, life'll pull the rug out from under you.#$e#It's only a matter of time.
Entries.Wed8: I wish my legs worked so I could play catch with Alex.$s#$e#That'll never happen.$s
Entries.Wed10: @! Let me turn off this darned television and we can have a little chat.$h#$e#So what are the young people doing these days?
Entries.Thu2: What do you want? Now's not a good time.#$e#Why? 'Cause it ain't.
Entries.Thu4: Looks like another rerun today.#$e#Shouldn't you be out and about?
Entries.Thu8: You ever watch this show "36"? Now that's some good entertainment.$h#$e#Nobody ever stops this guy from fighting the terrorists. He just does whatever he wants and it's hilarious.$h
Entries.Thu10: When you get as old as me it's a lot harder to adjust to new things.#$e#One day you'll know what I mean.#$e#Go on, enjoy yourself while you're still young.
Entries.Fri: That farm's been in miserable shape for years.#$e#And you want to restore it? Hmph. Good luck.
Entries.Fri2: So you're a farmer, huh? At least it's honest work.
Entries.Fri6: You be thankful now, that Stardew Valley is one of the few places where you can still work the land how you want.#$e#These politicians just want to regulate, regulate, regulate like they own this country. Hmph.
Entries.Sat: The weekend is no different than any other time, for me.#$e#That's how it is when you're retired.
Entries.Sat2: Hi there.#$e#What's going on out there, anyway?
Entries.Sat4: My prescription just keeps getting more and more expensive.#$e#This wouldn't have been a problem a generation or two ago. But these drug companies keep hiking the cost!
Entries.Sat6: Is it the weekend already? I guess I'll have to get out of the house soon, then.
Entries.Sat8: Evelyn's always been the best cook I know. And she just keeps getting better.#$e#Wish I could say the same about something I can do.$s
Entries.Sun: What's it take for a little peace and quiet around here?
Entries.Sun2: Aren't you cold? They don't make sweaters like they used to.#$e#*Sigh*
Entries.Sun4: Is it the end of the week already? I lose track of what day it is.
Entries.Sun6: It'll be good to be out of the house for a while.#$e#What are you up to today, young man?^What are you up to today, young miss?
Entries.Sun10: I didn't spend much time praying till recently.#$b#For a while, I was furious with Yoba, what with me losing everything I had.#$e#I have a kernel of faith that there's something better for me after this old body's ticker runs out.#$b#It's not much, but what's an old man like me to do?$s
Entries.summer_Tue10: From time to time, I can still see Clara in Alex's eyes.#$e#Alex is a good kid. You make sure you look out for him.
Entries.summer_Sun10: Whoa there! You'd better make way for me when I'm on the move, you rascal, or I might just run you down with this juggernaut!$h
Entries.fall_Mon10: Recently, I've been trying my best to stay positive each day.#$e#It isn't always easy. I apologize if I seem a little up and down.
Entries.fall_Sun10: Yep, I can do jumps, wheelies, spins... all kinds of tricks.$h#$e#Look over there!#$b#Oop, ya just missed me doing a somersault. Too bad.$h
Entries.winter_Sat10: Sometimes I wonder if everybody is just waiting for me to die.#$b#Heh. I'll show them. I have plenty of years left in this old body.
Entries.winter_Sun10: I don't know how Evelyn even puts up with me anymore.$s#$e#Sometimes I feel more like a patient than her husband.$s
Entries.summer_10: What? There's another festival tomorrow? Didn't we just have one?
Entries.winter_15: Night Market? No thank you. Nothing would make me want to go to that aberrant sideshow.#$e#Why's it have to be so late, anyway?
Entries.winter_24: Now why wouldn't I be excited about tomorrow? Take a wild guess.#$e#Oh, do you enjoy sitting in the freezing cold for hours?
Entries.winter_28: Another year gone. My life feels like a flip-book.
Entries.spring_1_2: Everyone in the news is just talking new year's this, new year's that. Isn't anything happening in the world?#$e#Hah, the news people must assume the whole world just stops when they stop talking about it.$h
Entries.summer_10_2: What? There's another festival tomorrow? Didn't we just have one?
Entries.winter_15_2: Night Market? No thank you. Nothing would make me want to go to that aberrant sideshow.#$e#Why's it have to be so late, anyway?
Entries.winter_24_2: Now why wouldn't I be excited about tomorrow? Take a wild guess.#$e#Oh, do you enjoy sitting in the freezing cold for hours?
Entries.winter_28_2: Another year gone. My life feels like a flip-book.

Entries.Mon: Yeah, I know a lot about the people living here.#$e#That's one of the benefits of being a bartender.$h#$e#Sometimes I hear too much...
Entries.Mon2: Hey there, @.#$e#So how's work treatin' you lately?#$b#I know things can be hard sometimes. We all get there eventually, though, as long as we don't give up!
Entries.Mon4: Have you tried the games in the arcade yet?#$e#I don't play 'em myself. I just figured that every good saloon needs some games as part of the atmosphere.
Entries.Mon6: Emily's a great girl. Have you two been hanging out much?
Entries.Mon8: *whisper* Hey, @. Y'know, I've been thinking...$s#$q 010/011 Mon_old#If I help someone make bad choices with their drinking habits, is that on me?#$r 010 -20 Mon_010#Honestly? Yes.#$r 011 0 Mon_011#No. Everyone's responsible for themselves.
Entries.Mon_old: $p 010#We're just gonna have to politely disagree on what we talked about the other week. I respect your opinion, though.|I appreciate hearing your opinion the other week. You're a good friend.
Entries.Mon_010: Hmm. Thank you for your opinion. I'll have to think about it.$s
Entries.Mon_011: That's always been my philosophy. It's just that after years of seeing customers' struggles up close and personal, it starts to wear on you.$s
Entries.Mon10: I know I can't solve every customer's problems, but behind the counter, I can still be there and treat them as a person.
Entries.Tue2: I've got some self-published cookbooks for sale, too. Have you checked them out?
Entries.Tue4: You should see what's on the menu tonight! I've got something really special.
Entries.Tue6: It was always my dream to open a little restaurant of my own.#$e#Things worked out well! I don't think an old-fashioned saloon like this would be possible in a bigger town.$h
Entries.Tue8: Be sure to give that jukebox a spin sometime. What are you in the mood for?
Entries.Wed: Glad to see you, buddy.$h^Glad to see you, young lady.$h#$q 012/013/014/015 Wed_old#I've got a cold beer here on the house.[346] What's today's battle? Lay it on me.#$r 012 10 Wed_012#It's kind of lonely here.#$r 013 10 Wed_013#I know nothing about farming.#$r 014 10 Wed_014#I have no money.#$r 015 0 Wed_015#Everything's peachy!
Entries.Wed_old: $p 015#I hope things are still going well! Let me know if you need a pick-me-up, though.|Remember you've got lots of friends here at the saloon. Especially on Fridays!
Entries.Wed_012: I feel ya. That's the reality for any newcomer.#$b#But relatively speaking, there are quite a few singles your age in Pelican Town. You're bound to hit it off with someone.$h
Entries.Wed_013: Well, I once knew nothing about cooking and brewing! But here I am.$h#$b#Truth is, we all start somewhere. Be sure to forgive yourself when things go wrong, and I'm sure you'll make it.
Entries.Wed_014: Oh yes, we've all been there, if we're not there now.$h#$b#But you know, your future looks bright. You're a landowner! I'm sure things will work out.
Entries.Wed_015: Is that so? Well, I'm glad to hear it. Pelican Town truly is a special place.$h#$b#Just let me know if something comes up. I'm always ready to lend an ear.
Entries.Wed2: Not to boast or anything, but the Saloon is the best place to be on a Friday night!$h#$e#Hope you can make it this week.
Entries.Wed4: Emily's been working here for a while now. I don't know what I'd do without her!#$e#I would hate to have to clean all those pots by myself.$s
Entries.Wed6: I try to source as many fresh, local ingredients as possible.#$b#Otherwise, what would really make my spaghetti or my salad any different from other restaurants'?
Entries.Wed8: Yes, I was married once, a long time ago. Did I ever tell you that?$s#$e#She's no longer with us. But I think about her every day.$s#$e#I like to think that what I do here at the saloon is to fulfill the dream we had together. First and foremost, just spread joy. I don't think she'd want anything less.
Entries.Wed10: After my wife passed, marrying again isn't for me. For some of us, we only meet the love of our life once.#$e#Despite life's hardships, we must never forget to spread joy to those around us.
Entries.Thu2: I'm no hedonist, but I truly think that good food and drink are some of the greatest things a person can live for.$h
Entries.Thu4: I feel like I've got even more of a reason to love Pelican Town when I'm able to source locally from your farm!$h#$e#So, if you're growing something good, I'd be honored if you brought some by!
Entries.Thu10: *whisper* I've been limiting the number of drinks I give Pam, more than I used to.#$e#I swear she's got a flask in her pocket, though, because sometimes she still winds up pretty sloshy.$s
Entries.Fri2: Hi there, @. How's that farming life working out for you? Be sure to treat yourself right every once in a while.
Entries.Fri4: Sam tries so hard at billiards, but he loses to Sebastian each time.#$e#Sam must be a really good sport about it, because they've been at it week after week!$h
Entries.Fri6: I don't actually drink very much myself. I'm mainly doing this to make a living.#$e#Although I do enjoy a taste of the Stardew Valley vintage from time to time.
Entries.Fri8: Whew! What a week it's been!#$e#I meant everyone else's week. I don't consider things done until the last mug is washed tonight!$h
Entries.Sat: Business was great last night. I'm pleased.#$e#Be sure to drop by again soon!$h
Entries.Sat2: Are you much of a chef, @?#$e#If you have a kitchen and some recipes, you can cook some useful dishes.#$e#Home-cooked meals make great gifts, as well.
Entries.Sat4: I play a little violin when I find the opportunity. As much as I love cooking, sometimes it's good to have a hobby that isn't also your job.
Entries.Sat6: Look, I know I serve a lot of drinks to a few of my customers. But I'm a strong believer in personal freedom. That's all.$3#$e#Sorry... what's new with you?
Entries.Sat8: I think I've earned a little glass of Stardew Red tonight.#$e#Are you going to be enjoying anything, @?
Entries.Sun2: I think I found the right place for myself here in Stardew Valley. This is the exact kind of place I looked for my whole life.
Entries.Sun4: How are you doing, @?#$e#Me? Just livin' the dream.$h
Entries.Sun6: I know I can't fix everyone's problems, but if I can make a fellow something delicious, I feel I've done my part.
Entries.Sun8: The Stardrop Saloon is definitely one of the older buildings in town.#$e#I restored it when I first bought it, but I'm far from the original owner.
Entries.Sun10: You're a good friend, @. Here's one on the house.[346]#$e#Cheers! To another good week!
Entries.summer_Sun2: This might be my favorite season. I bet you can grow a lot of great produce right now.
Entries.summer_Sun6: What a hot day! I could really go for some fresh-squeezed orange juice right now.#$e#It's an old favorite of mine.$h
Entries.fall_Fri4: Hey, @! Did you ever try making the 'salmon dinner' recipe I sent you? Now's the time to get the ingredients!$h#$e#You'll also need some kale, though.
Entries.fall_Fri8: Made any cranberry sauce lately? The ingredients are pretty easy to get this time of year.#$e#It'll get you into the mood of the season, for sure.
Entries.winter_Sat: Sure is chilly out there! Think you could do with a hot cup of coffee?
Entries.winter_Sat6: Now's the perfect time of year to huddle up next to the fire with some good comfort food.#$e#Maybe a little pizza? Or... what ideas do you have?
Entries.spring_1_2: I hope you were able to get up on time today! How's the start of the new year for you so far?$h
Entries.spring_12: Boy howdy! I've been staying up late the past few nights, getting ready for the egg festival!#$e#Just wait till you see what I've prepared.
Entries.summer_10: I've got some good dishes prepped for the luau tomorrow, but I try to steer clear of the communal soup.#$e#It's really a hit-and-miss tradition, and I'd rather play it safe when it comes to my reputation.$s
Entries.fall_15: Gonna be at the fair tomorrow? Look for me up north. I'll be making burgers all day.
Entries.fall_26: There's some pretty spooky stuff at the Spirit's Eve festival. Me? I'll just stick with hosting the buffet.
Entries.winter_24: What's a good festival without some good food? *chuckle* I've saved all my best recipes for this feast, so don't go missin' it!$h
Entries.winter_28: Happy new year, @! I'm breaking out the good stuff tonight! [348]$h#$e#Cheers to a great year in Stardew Valley. May the next year be even better!
Entries.spring_12_2: Boy howdy! I've been staying up late the past few nights, getting ready for the egg festival!#$e#Just wait till you see what I've prepared.
Entries.summer_10_2: I've got some good dishes prepped for the luau tomorrow, but I try to steer clear of the communal soup.#$e#It's really a hit-and-miss tradition, and I'd rather play it safe when it comes to my reputation.$s
Entries.fall_15_2: Gonna be at the fair tomorrow? Look for me up north. I'll be making burgers all day.
Entries.fall_26_2: There's some pretty spooky stuff at the Spirit's Eve festival. Me? I'll just stick with hosting the buffet. Same as usual.
Entries.winter_24_2: What's a good festival without some good food? *chuckle* I've saved all my best recipes for this feast, so don't go missin' it!$h
Entries.winter_28_2: Happy new year, @! I'm breaking out the good stuff tonight! [348]$h#$e#Cheers to a great year in Stardew Valley. May the next year be even better!

Entries.Mon4: I spent 3 hours practicing my signature today.#$e#I guess that's pretty silly, huh?
Entries.Mon6: I used to complain about this town being so small, but I've grown to like it.#$e#If it was much bigger it wouldn't feel like a community.
Entries.Tue2: I wonder if any nice shells washed up on the beach this morning?#$e#This isn't the best time of year for shells, though.
Entries.Tue6: Hey, we should hang out at the beach this summer.$h#$e#Oh, I guess you'll be pretty busy, though, huh?#$e#Well, if you've got time, then.
Entries.Tue10: Oof. I stayed up late reading cookbooks and trying out a couple of new recipes.$s#$e#Why? Oh, well, I just thought you might like it if I got good at that.#$e#Sorry, I'll share some with you sometime.$l
Entries.Wed2: Hmm... I wish it were summer.$u
Entries.Wed4: I'm glad that the flowers are starting to bloom.#$e#Those pink ones smell so good.$h
Entries.Wed8: There are only two things I like about this town.#$b#One of them is the beach.#$e#The other one is a secret! *giggle*$h
Entries.Thu2: *sigh* I could really go for a cupcake right now.#$e#Do you need something?
Entries.Thu4: Guys should have to read fashion magazines... just so you understand how much work girls have to put in each day.^You can borrow my fashion magazines if you want, after I'm done with them.#$e#What a girl shows on the outside is what people will think of her. Some girls think otherwise, but that's just the truth of the world.#$e#I don't make up the rules.
Entries.Thu6: I cooked dinner last night. It actually turned out okay!#$e#But I did make a huge mess in the kitchen...
Entries.Thu10: I was thinking I could try to move away someday, whenever it became clear that Alex's career wouldn't ever get off the ground.$s#$b#But now, I don't think I would move away, even if I could. I have too much to lose here.$l
Entries.Sat: I'm feeling an urge to go shopping. Ugh! I wish there was a mall here.
Entries.Sat2: Oh. Hi farmer boy.^Oh. Hi farmer girl.#$q 070/072/074 Sat_old#No offense, but why would you choose to work on the weekends, anyway?#$r 070 0 Sat_070#It's just for now until the farm's in good shape.#$r 070 0 Sat_070#I just enjoy it.#$r 072 0 Sat_072#There are living things that need my attention.#$r 073 0 Sat_073#I'm not working today, actually.
Entries.Sat_old: $p 073#Enjoying 'not working' again today?|Enjoying your gross job still?
Entries.Sat_072: Really? Won't they be okay for just one day?
Entries.Sat_073: Yeah right. Then how come you look all dirty?$h#$e#Oh. Or do you just always look like that?
Entries.Sat4: *sigh* I need a mall. Online shopping just isn't cutting it for me.#$e#I want to try things on! That isn't too much to ask for, right?
Entries.Sat6: Is your farm doing okay? Maybe I should come by and take some pictures of it.#$b#Or... sorry, is that okay?
Entries.Sat8: #$1 haleySeagull#Yesterday I found a seagull with her wing caught in a net. I set her free, of course. She looked so helpless, the poor thing.$k$s#$e#You know, I should probably start exercising more... this youthful metabolism won't last forever.
Entries.Sun: My sister is so weird. Sometimes I wonder if we're actually related.$u
Entries.Sun2: Hey.#$b#Have you seen Alex?
Entries.Sun4: Sometimes I wish Emily would just treat me like she treats everyone else.#$e#She doesn't care what other people do with their lives, but if it's something I do, she gets all up in my business.$u#$e#I don't know...
Entries.Sun6: I'm thinking about donating a bunch of clothes... I must have a hundred pairs of shoes.
Entries.Sun4_inlaw_Emily: The house is so empty and quiet without Emily around.
Entries.Sun8_inlaw_Emily: The house is so empty and quiet without Emily around. I never thought I'd miss her this much.$s#$b#But are you guys doing well?
Entries.Sun10_inlaw_Emily: The house is so empty and quiet without Emily around. I get so lonely.$s#$e#Why don't you come by?$l
Entries.summer_Mon2: Pretty much everyone who talks to Emily says she's weird.#$e#Some of the clothes she makes are nice, but why would you wear them when there are a ton of perfectly good brands out there?
Entries.summer_Mon4: I'm going to get such a nice tan this summer.
Entries.summer_Mon6: I should start reading some books instead of magazines.#$e#It's good to learn things, isn't it?#$e#I only ever look at the pictures.
Entries.summer_Tue2: Do you wear those clothes every day?
Entries.summer_Tue4: $p 47#Hey I found this new tool to open jars with. So you won't need to help me anymore.$h|There's not a cloud in the sky today.$h
Entries.summer_Tue8: I guess living in the country isn't so bad.#$e#If I lived in the city I might start to miss all the trees.#$e#@, I think I've been hanging out with you too much.$h
Entries.summer_Wed4: It's so hot today!#$e#I wish I had some ice cream.$s
Entries.summer_Wed6: Hey, I'm sorry if I was rude to you when we first met.$s#$e#You're actually really nice. I just didn't understand why anyone would choose to move here.$s
Entries.summer_Wed10: Oh, I was just about to reapply my sunscreen. Can you help?$h#$e#I just need some right between my shoulder blades. Go ahead. Don't be shy.
Entries.summer_Thu2: Alex could teach you a thing or two about staying in shape, just FYI.^Oh, hey. This might seem blunt? But Alex told me to let you know... that he's not interested. Just in case you were wondering.
Entries.summer_Thu4: If you stay in the sun a lot it'll make your hair lighter.#$e#It's a good thing to know!
Entries.summer_Thu6: If you stay in the sun a lot it will make your hair lighter... But you don't want to get sunburnt, either.#$e#I just want a healthy amount of sunlight. Everything in moderation, right?
Entries.summer_Fri4: For girls, shopping actually releases healthy chemicals into the brain. Did you know about that?#$e#A lot of guys just don't get that.^You should try it sometime.
Entries.summer_Fri8: I heard back from one of my friends who moved to Zuzu City a few years back. It doesn't sound as glamorous as I'd thought.#$e#She's working like crazy and can barely afford the rent. It's sad, but it actually makes me grateful to live in Pelican Town.
Entries.summer_Sat: Farming sounds so boring...#$q 142/143 summer_Sat_old#What do you even do all day?#$r 142 10 summer_Sat_12#Care for plants#$r 142 10 summer_Sat_12#Explore the caves#$r 143 -10 summer_Sat_13#Snoop around in your room#$r 142 10 summer_Sat_12#Dig for treasure
Entries.summer_Sat6: It seems like a good day to go swimming.
Entries.summer_Sat10: Rowr. Well I thought this day couldn't get any hotter.$l#$e#What have you been thinking about today?$l
Entries.summer_Sun2: So you're still not bored with that farm?#$e#Sure, okay. You do you.
Entries.summer_Sun4: Emily usually cooks dinner... But she makes weird stuff like quinoa.
Entries.summer_Sun4_inlaw_Emily: Has Emily been cooking for you? I kind of miss her cooking. It was actually really good.$s
Entries.summer_Sun6_inlaw_Emily: First my parents leave, and now Emily, too. I just...$s#$e#It's a lot, you know?$s#$e#I'm sorry. I know it's selfish of me.$s
Entries.summer_Sun8_inlaw_Emily: Hey. How's my sister?#$e#I've been getting along okay. It's been an adjustment.
Entries.summer_Sun10_inlaw_Emily: The house is so empty and quiet without Emily around. I get so lonely.$s#$e#Why don't you come by?$l
Entries.fall_Mon2: If I lived in the city, I wouldn't have to worry about slimy leaves and mud everywhere you go.
Entries.fall_Mon4: It's gross when all these fallen leaves get slimy.
