Entries.fall_Sat: If you hear any banging from inside my hut, it's probably just me working on one of my sculptures.
Entries.fall_Sat2: Decorations accentuate the feeling of the season. I think it's a worthwhile tradition.
Entries.fall_Sat4: Heyyy! So what do you think of my fall decorations?$h#$e#You should have some Spirit's Eve decorations for your farm. Nothing too creepy, though.
Entries.fall_Sat6: It's nice just to make something fun and whimsical every now and then, like the decorations on my house.#$e#Gotta get in touch with that inner child, right?$h
Entries.fall_Sat10: Hey. You should come by my place tomorrow morning. Bring a couple of omelets and we'll call it brunch.$h#$e#Sorry, if you're looking to get creative, there aren't a whole lot of other breakfast-y things I like.
Entries.fall_Sun4: Hello, @. Is there something you wanted to talk about?
Entries.fall_Sun6: Humans were born to be creative, don't you think? It's what makes us who we are.#$e#Of course, there are many ways to be creative. Painting and sculpting just happen to be a couple of my favorites.
Entries.fall_Sun8: I never felt truly safe in the city. Here, though, I don't even have to worry about locking my door.
Entries.fall_Sun10: Hey you.$l#$e#I've been thinking about you all day.$l#$e#So, tell me about your week.$h
Entries.winter_Mon4: I keep up a pretty strict pescatarian diet. It's not that I'm morally opposed to eating meat, but...#$b#...as long as everyone has their own way of showing respect for nature, I'm fine with 'em. This is just my way, for me.
Entries.winter_Mon6: I love the way everything looks when it's covered with fresh snow.
Entries.winter_Mon8: One of my earlier memories is from a time I went sledding. I sped down the slope and crashed into a pile of snow.#$e#I remember lying there, hearing to the silence and watching the sky, with the snow falling down on my face. I just wanted to stay there forever.
Entries.winter_Tue: Don't you think the saloon has just the right atmosphere for winter time? It's so cozy.
Entries.winter_Tue4: It gets pretty cold in my little cabin.$s#$e#I just snuggle up under a huge blanket, and I'm okay.$h
Entries.winter_Tue6: I guess nature can be pretty harsh in the winter. It still provides enough for us to get by, though.
Entries.winter_Tue8: Farming sounds so fun. I want to try it, someday.$l
Entries.winter_Tue10: Hey. C'mere. Warm me up.#$e#Mmm, you're cozy.$l
Entries.winter_Wed2: We wouldn't be able to survive without nature. It's good to remember that.
Entries.winter_Wed4: I saw a snow rabbit early this morning! They're rare, aren't they?
Entries.winter_Wed6: I never felt truly safe in the city. Here, though, I don't even have to worry about locking my door.
Entries.winter_Wed8: Seen any snow rabbits out there? I think they're one of my favorite things in the woods this time of year.
Entries.winter_Thu: I love to decorate for the different seasons.
Entries.winter_Thu2: I'm having a hard time finding fresh food to eat.#$e#I've been eating a lot of bread.$s
Entries.winter_Thu4: I hope Elliott's doing okay in his little house. I like to think I have it hard sometimes, but that guy really knows how to rough it out.
Entries.winter_Thu10: Snow on the ground outside, someone who loves me in my arms... Yeah, this is pretty nice.$l
Entries.winter_Fri2: So, what do you enjoy most about living on a farm?#$e#You must have a lot more time on your hands lately.
Entries.winter_Fri4: Time seems to move slower here.#$e#When I lived in the city, the year went by so fast.
Entries.winter_Fri8: I never felt truly safe in the city. Here, though, I don't even have to worry about locking my door.
Entries.winter_Fri10: Hey. Whaddaya say we get a little tipsy together this evening?$h#$e#It's alright. I trust you.$l#$e#I just want to be asleep by around midnight, though.
Entries.winter_Sat4: Hello, @. Is there something you wanted to talk about?
Entries.winter_Sat6: Do you like the winter decorations on my house?#$e#I'm always excited to put them up, but I've got to wait until the weather's right.
Entries.winter_Sat8: Do you ever get cold in that farmhouse of yours?#$e#Stop by my cabin if you want to huddle under one of my quilts and drink cider.$h
Entries.winter_Sun2: I hate to be blunt, but if we don't treat nature with respect, our grandchildren will be doomed.#$e#Don't you think so?
Entries.winter_Sun4: Apparently, there was an old woman who lived in my hut before I did.#$e#After she died, Mayor Lewis held the property until I was able to come through and sign for it.
Entries.winter_Sun6: I can be frugal with my lifestyle, but sometimes I feel like my art career is a ticking time bomb.$s#$e#Do you know of anyone who's made it by on the starving artist lifestyle?$s
Entries.winter_Sun8: Thank you for always believing in my work, @. I wasn't ever sure things would work out, but now I'm finally gaining a sense of momentum with my life.
Entries.spring_1_2: I thought I'd miss the snow, but I take it back. This is so much better. Happy new year!
Entries.spring_23: I figure I'll dance at the festival tomorrow. I mean, why not?
Entries.summer_27: I was awestruck the first time I saw the moonlight jellies. I'll never forget that year.
Entries.fall_15: The Stardew Valley Fair makes me feel like a kid again. I'm glad our town hosts it.
Entries.winter_24: Hey! Feeling in the holiday spirit yet?#$e#I'm more than ready, myself. Bring on the good eats!
Entries.winter_28: A wonderful happy new year to you!$h#$e#It was a good one for me. How about you?
Entries.spring_23_2: I wonder how that little clearing way off in the woods is doing?#$b#I haven't been back there since last year's flower dance.
Entries.summer_27_2: I was awestruck the first time I saw the moonlight jellies. I'll never forget that year.
Entries.fall_15_2: The Stardew Valley Fair makes me feel like a kid again. I'm glad our town hosts it.
Entries.winter_24_2: Hey! Feeling in the holiday spirit yet?#$e#I'm more than ready, myself. Bring on the good eats!
Entries.winter_28_2: A wonderful happy new year to you!$h#$e#It was a good one for me. How about you?

Entries.Rainy_Day_0: #$c .5#I sometimes find inspiration in the most unlikely of places.#Hmm, maybe I should put on some music. Something to wake me up.$s
Entries.Rainy_Day_1: #$c .5#I used to find rain depressing when I lived in the city. But here in Stardew Valley it's beautiful.#Not a bad day for staying in. I've got some new project ideas I was hoping to try.
Entries.Rainy_Day_2: Good morning! I got up early and did some mushroom hunting. Here, take one.[281 404 420 257]#$e#Searching for mushrooms is like going on a treasure hunt. It's a lot of fun.$h
Entries.Rainy_Day_3: #$c .5#It's days like this I'm really happy about my heavy-duty boots.$h#The clouds get so thick here. It's almost like it's still nighttime.
Entries.Rainy_Day_4: #$c .5#The trees have been begging for this rain... I'm happy for them.#You could go fishing today, if you want. Let me know if you find some driftwood.
Entries.Rainy_Night_0: #$c .5#How was your day? Did you see any animals out there?#Did the animals stay dry today?
Entries.patio_Leah: #$c .5#Don't look too close, it's a work in progress.#My wood sculptures sell relatively well, so I'm always working on a new one of these.
Entries.Rainy_Night_1: #$c .5#I usually go for salad... but a wet night like this gives me cravings for hot soup.$h#It wasn't a bad day. I just had to readjust my expectations and make the best of it.
Entries.Rainy_Night_2: #$c .5#It's going to be relaxing to fall asleep on a night like this...$l#Welcome home, love. Mmm, come here and kiss me.$l
Entries.Rainy_Night_3: I made a little wood sculpture today, but it was so ugly I threw it into the fire.$u#$e#I think to become a great artist, you have to be critical of your own work.
Entries.Rainy_Night_4: #$c .5#I'm glad you're home... It's a good night to get under the covers and stay warm.#I missed you today. We should... spend some time together tonight.$l
Entries.Rainy_Night_Leah: #$c .5#How was your day today, dear? Muddy?#An old friend from the city commissioned me to do a painting for her. I almost finished it today.
Entries.Indoor_Day_0: #$c .5#This house is a lot nicer than my old cabin! I don't miss it.#Hm, what am I in the mood for today? Painting or sculpting?
Entries.Indoor_Day_1: #$c .5#Rise and shine! Look what finished growing in a pot out back. [16 18 20 22 90 259 396 402]$h#Good morning, @. I've planted these in a little pot out back... [16 18 20 22 90 259 396 402]#$e#I grew that with great love and attention. Enjoy it.
Entries.Indoor_Day_2: #$c .5#Always remember to keep your eyes peeled for wild food! There's lots out there.#Good morning. What are you hoping to get done today?
Entries.Indoor_Day_3: #$c .5#I couldn't resist. These greens were at peak freshness, so...#I was thinking... life's too short to eat bad food. Luckily, we live in one of the best regions for fresh greens and vegetables!#$e#Here, I made you a healthy salad. [196]#$e#I'm surprised you aren't sick of my salad yet!
Entries.Indoor_Day_4: #$c .5#Good morning! I made us some coffee.[395]$h#My morning just wouldn't be complete without a hot cup of coffee.[395] How about you?$h
Entries.Indoor_Night_0: #$c .5#Something about this time of night makes me thirsty.#Got some time to spend with me tonight? I've been thinking about you...$l
Entries.Indoor_Night_1: #$c .5#The flow of time is so delicate... even the tiniest decision changes the future forever.#With the short lives we live, everyone leaves a mark on the world. I hope I'm doing my part to leave a good mark.
Entries.Indoor_Night_2: #$c .5#It's so much lovelier here at night than the garish glow of the city.#Everything worked out perfectly for me. I'm very lucky.
Entries.Indoor_Night_3: #$c .5#I never thought I'd receive a mermaid's pendant so soon after moving here! I'm happy about it, though.$l#Did you make any good memories today?
Entries.Indoor_Night_4: #$c .5#I saw a wild rabbit today. I just wish I could pet one someday. They look so soft...#I saw some red-crested bluebirds today. They must be tucked nice and snug in their nests by now.
Entries.Outdoor_0: #$c .5#The cool breeze feels nice. It reminds me of living by the river.#Heyyy, good morning. I was wondering when you'd find me out here.$h
Entries.Outdoor_1: #$c .5#Hmm... I'm going to do some maintenance over here. I just get the urge to do some hammering now and then.#I can tell which parts of the house were added by Robin. Let me just say, she really knew what she was doing.
Entries.Outdoor_2: #$c .5#It's going to be a special day, I can sense it.#Good morning! I'm feeling a little more awake now that I'm out here.
Entries.Outdoor_3: #$c .5#Ah... that smell of fresh dirt. There's nothing quite like it.$h#You can tell the air is clean here... it feels good in the lungs.
Entries.Outdoor_4: Don't overwork yourself, dear.#$e#$c .5#It's not as if we're starving, so there's no rush, right?#Make sure and take a break every now and then, or get something to eat.$h
Entries.funLeave_Leah: #$c .5#I'm going to take a nature walk today. I need to get out of the house.#I'm going for a long walk today, so hopefully I'll see some neat things. You'll see me in the evening.
Entries.funReturn_Leah: #$c .5#I had a nice, relaxing time today. How did your day go?#The woods were beautiful, as usual. I feel like I discover something new each time I visit it -- bugs, little flowers, you know.
Entries.OneKid_3: #$c .5#Stardew Valley is a great place for a child to learn an appreciation for nature, don't you think?#It's fun to be a parent. I want to make sure %kid1 grows up to have a love for the outdoors.
Entries.TwoKids_3: #$c .5#We've got a wonderful farm and a full family. Our new life has really turned out well, hasn't it?#I hope %kid1 and %kid2 find healthy outlets for their expression. It doesn't have to be painting or sculpting; just whatever makes them happy.
Entries.spring_4: Did you get all the crops in the ground yet? Or... is it better to stagger it out?#$e#I'm just curious. I trust your judgment.
Entries.spring_19: There's a coffee house in Grampleton that wants to hang a sampling of my work. Guess I've got my work cut out for me!#$e#I just hope some of it sells.
Entries.spring_25: Elliott says beauty is experienced in the mind, so he thinks words most resemble our thoughts and are best for creating beauty.#$e#But... don't we also think in images? And aren't image-based thoughts usually more potent?#$b#...I dunno. What do you think?$u
Entries.summer_8: Sorry if I'm wet to the touch... I was sweating all night in the heat.
Entries.summer_12: It was nice catching up with Elliott at yesterday's festival. Seems like he's in a pretty good place with his lifestyle.
Entries.summer_15: Ahhh, I'm so glad we still have a good chunk of summer left.$h#$e#I'm not ready for it to be over.
Entries.summer_20: It take a bit of guts to know my work sits on display in other people's homes.#$e#I pour myself into those pieces, so it's almost like they can spy on a piece of my soul. Does that make sense?#$e#Well, your work winds up on other people's dinner tables. So that's kind of the same thing.$h#$b#That's just the consequence of leaving a small impact on the world, I suppose.
Entries.summer_24: I wonder how my old neighbors are doing. Marnie, Jas...#$e#...Oh right. And Shane.#$e#I guess I'm still technically neighbors with them, huh?$h
Entries.fall_7: I wonder if I should check out Caroline's dance aerobics class again. I've only ever been... twice? ...I think?#$e#Oh yeah! Once, Dr. Harvey was there. It was cute.$h#$b#Hey, more power to him.
Entries.fall_10: Emily's still working at the Saloon, isn't she? Hm, I wonder if she'll ever move out of town?#$e#I've never gotten to know her super well, but I always got the sense she was meant for more than waiting tables.
Entries.fall_13: I basically get to live my dream. @, I hope you understand that I don't take that for granted, right?
Entries.fall_24: The coffee shop in Grampleton was displaying some of my paintings and they finished selling the last piece! Score!$h#$e#Maybe they'll ask me again.
Entries.winter_4: Hmm... I wonder how Elliott's doing with all this cold? Do you think maybe he'd appreciate a hot meal from us?
Entries.winter_11: Sorry, I let it get pretty cold in here last night, didn't I?#$e#I cracked the windows last night to let out the paint fumes. I just... let's just keep the fireplace running through the day.$s
Entries.winter_16: Sometimes, it's tough to sell a piece I feel really proud of.$s#$e#I mean, if we're good on money, maybe I'll just... keep some of them?$l
Entries.winter_20: Feast of the Winter Star-themed art is so fun and easy to do. I can just make it as unapologetically joyful as I want.$h
Entries.winter_27: The snow was melting and dripping repeatedly off this one spot on the roof. And then the sun started refracting through it.#$b#It sent these tiny little flashes through part of the room. So beautiful.#$e#Oh, this was just a few mornings ago.

Entries.cc_Bus: @, did you hear? It seems the old town bus started working again overnight!$h#$b#That old thing has been dormant for some time... This is truly a great mystery.
Entries.Mon: It's a good season to start thinking about gardening, even for us non-farmers.#$e#The valley is known for producing some of the finest spring flowers!$h
Entries.Mon2: Your grandfather and I used to chat a lot about gardening. I learned a good chunk of what I know from him.
Entries.Mon6: It must be difficult to be a child in Pelican Town. There aren't as many kids as there used to be...#$e#I commissioned to have that play structure built a few years back. I hope Jas and Vincent know they're well loved here.
Entries.Tue8: Our community sure has changed over the years. I remember there was an old, run-down house where the JojaMart stands today.#$e#I'm not sure if anyone even occupied that house since the time I was born. As a boy, though, I made sure to steer clear of it.
Entries.Wed2: Sometimes you can tell if there's something buried underground. Just keep your eyes open.
Entries.Wed6: One reason I love this town is for its rich history. People have inhabited the valley since well before Pelican Town was built.
Entries.Thu: Hi there, @! Nice to see you out and about.#$b#It's good to spend time socializing with the townsfolk every now and then.$h
Entries.Thu2: The saloon can get pretty lively at night. Sometimes we even put a coin in the jukebox *chuckle*$h#$e#I like to visit once a week or so to catch up on things, anyway.
Entries.Thu6: I don't suspect Emily's and Haley's parents will return to Pelican Town any time soon, if ever. It was always their dream to live freely around the world.#$e#Their girls reached adulthood, and then... poof! They were gone.#$e#Normally, you'd expect the kids to be the ones who do that.$h
Entries.Fri2: The museum's previous curator held private ownership over the exhibits. I wish we'd had the funding to hold onto them.
Entries.Fri4: In a little town like this, I get to be the hands-on event planner. I wouldn't have the same luxury if I were mayor of a big city.#$e#Sure, it's more stressful, but I can't argue with the kind of fulfillment I get out of it.$h
Entries.Sat2: I'm glad our town was able to get Dr. Harvey. The timing of his arrival was impeccable.#$e#When our previous doctor announced his retirement, we weren't sure if we'd all have to start commuting for medical care.
Entries.Sat8: I'll never have any children of my own, so I think of the spirit of Pelican Town as my child, in a way.#$e#If I leave my mark on the people who find a home in this town, that's all I can hope for.
Entries.Sun: Some of the townsfolk are wary of strangers. You'll have to win their trust before they open up to you.#$e#Just be persistent and you'll get through to them.$h
Entries.Sun2: Leah and Elliott each moved here about a year before you did. Have you talked to them much?#$e#They spend a decent amount of time together at the festivals, though they're not a couple. ...I don't think so, anyway.
Entries.Sun4: Growing flowers on your farm can really enhance the aesthetics.#$b#If I were you, I'd just grow 'em and leave 'em until the end of the season.$h
Entries.summer_Mon4: Cultivating a garden is both a literal and figurative pursuit. My flower beds are my garden, but in a way, so is Pelican Town as a whole. #$q 007/008 summer_Mon4_old#I'm sure you understand, @?#$r 007 5 summer_Mon_007#Yes, my farm is a reflection of my soul.#$r 007 5 summer_Mon_007#Yes, I want to cultivate my community, not just my farm.#$r 008 -15 summer_Mon_008#No, not really...#$r 008 -15 summer_Mon_008#Uh... what?
Entries.summer_Mon4_old: $p 007#For people like you and me, it's the way we'll win out in the long run.|I hope you come to understand that someday.
Entries.summer_Mon_007: That's fantastic! It looks like we're speaking the same language, then.$h
Entries.summer_Mon10: Hello, there, @!$h#$e#I hope your work has been rewarding. Just know that we all appreciate what you do.
Entries.summer_Tue4: Do you talk to Willy from time to time? He's lived in that shack for about as long as I can remember.#$e#He's a good man.
Entries.summer_Tue8: One of the things I like most about gardening is seeing people stop to admire your work.#$e#Do you ever feel that way about the aesthetics of your farm?
Entries.summer_Wed6: I learned a few gardening tips from Evelyn. It's always worthwhile to spend time with a good soul like her.
Entries.summer_Thu: Hmm... I wonder if it's anyone's birthday today? I'd better check the calendar by Pierre's shop.
Entries.summer_Thu4: The saloon gets pretty lively at night.#$e#I like to visit once a week or so to catch up on things. And to get a taste of Gus' authentic spaghetti.
Entries.summer_Fri: Hey there, @! It's good to spend an evening at the saloon when you can. Everyone needs a break now and then.$h#$b#Your grandfather always worked himself too hard... I'll have an extra beer in his honor tonight.
Entries.summer_Sun6: It's the perfect time to be cooking with some spicy peppers! Got any growing this summer?
Entries.fall_Mon: Robin and I like to give each other a hard time. I hope we weren't offputting when we first welcomed you off the bus way back when.$h#$e#She and Demetrius have brought great hope to our community.#$b#And please know that you do, too!$h
Entries.fall_Mon4: I've been Mayor of Pelican Town for over twenty years!#$e#No one ever runs against me when it's time for an election. I like to think that it means I'm doing my job well.#$e#I like being Mayor.
Entries.fall_Tue: Not many people tend to visit Clint, what with his shop being on the outskirts of town. Why not pay him a visit?#$e#I'm sure he could use the company. And the business.
Entries.fall_Tue6: It was around this time of year when I first became Mayor, over twenty years ago.#$e#That makes me feel really old.$s
Entries.fall_Wed4: Every Wednesday I have buckwheat waffles and coffee for breakfast. It's a little tradition I keep to keep the bachelor life interesting.$h
Entries.fall_Thu4: Do you have any bee houses on your farm?#$e#If you place them near flowers you can get different types of honey.
Entries.fall_Fri10: I feel like I've become as close with you, @, as I was with your Grandfather. It's strange yet heartwarming to see how times change.#$e#For every life that leaves this world, a new one comes to replace it. We must not forget that.
Entries.fall_Sun4: Ah... There's nothing like a strong cup of tea in the morning.
Entries.winter_Mon8: If my whole life is like a year, I suppose I've entered winter already, so to speak.#$e#I wonder what the world will look like in a few more decades, if I'm still around?
Entries.winter_Tue: I've got to balance the budget before the end of the year. I hope I don't have to cut any festivals just to keep the minimum for basic maintenance.#$e#I imagine I'll find a way. Always do. But there are no guarantees.
Entries.winter_Tue8: I've got to start coming up with a plan for improving our town next year!
Entries.winter_Wed10: I must say, @, I've seen you sell some rather... interesting things from that shipping bin.#$e#Got any interesting stories to tell?$h#$e#...No, seriously.
Entries.winter_Thu: Is everyone staying warm? Let me know if anyone's heating fails. Some of the houses around here are pretty old.
Entries.winter_Thu8: The stillness of winter always puts me into a somber mood.#$b#Rather, I wouldn't exactly say it makes me sad. It just feels like... my soul slows down to match the feel of the outdoors.#$b#It's tough to put into words, but do you know what I mean?
Entries.spring_1_2: Cheers to the new year! You've got a lot of work in these early days of the season, haven't you?
Entries.spring_3: Have you planted any spring crops yet? The season doesn't last forever, you know.
Entries.spring_12: Did you get my letter about the Egg festival? I sure hope you can make it!#$e#I've got some good ideas for hiding spots in the egg hunt. Just you wait.$h
Entries.spring_14: I think we've got all the hidden eggs from yesterday cleaned up.#$b#...Pretty sure, anyway.
Entries.spring_23: I sure hope the flower dance is a success again this year.#$e#Sometimes those old traditions die hard, though...$s
Entries.summer_10: I didn't sleep much last night. The luau is always the most stressful festival of the year for me.#$e#Don't let that get in the way of you having a good time, though!$h
Entries.summer_28: I think tonight's festival is my favorite because I don't have to worry about a thing. The moonlight jellies do all the work for me!$h#$e#It's a nice change of pace after the luau earlier this month.
Entries.fall_15: I take it you got my letter about the Stardew Valley Fair?#$b#This festival's my specialty. I'm sure it's going to go great.$h
Entries.fall_28: I'm not even sure how the town gets everything cleaned up after Spirit's Eve. Each year, I wake up expecting a mess, but it's like you'd never even know it happened.
Entries.winter_1: Well, winter is here! That means the townspeople will be spending most of their days indoors.#$e#At least you'll know where to find them!$h
Entries.winter_7: It looks like everything's in place for the Festival of Ice to be a success tomorrow.#$b#Remember, if I'm not too old to play in the snow, neither are you!$h
Entries.winter_15: The Night Market isn't something I plan myself. These traveling merchants just show up on their own each year, and frankly, I'm glad that they do.#$b#Not every small town gets that privilege.
Entries.winter_24: I'm thankful for the whole town! I can plan the Feast of the Winter Star on paper, sure, but the way everyone shows up in such a jolly mood...#$b#...it's simply magic!$h
Entries.winter_28: It's not just the end of another year, it's the anniversary of your arrival! I'll never forget when you stepped off that bus.$h#$e#The snow melted early that year, I remember.#$e#Thanks for a good year, @.
Entries.spring_14_2: I think we've got all the hidden eggs from yesterday cleaned up.#$b#...Pretty sure, anyway.
Entries.spring_23_2: Well, our flower dance just keeps truckin' along. I suppose it'll remain a tradition for a long time.
Entries.summer_10_2: I just got off the phone with the Governor. He confirmed he's already en route here. *gulp*
Entries.summer_28_2: I think tonight's festival is my favorite because I don't have to worry about a thing. The moonlight jellies do all the work for me!$h#$e#It's a nice change of pace after the luau earlier this month.
Entries.fall_15_2: I take it you got my letter about the Stardew Valley Fair?#$b#This festival's my specialty. I'm sure it's going to go great.$h
Entries.fall_28_2: I'm not even sure how the town gets everything cleaned up after Spirit's Eve. Each year, I wake up expecting a mess, but it's like you'd never even know it happened.
Entries.winter_7_2: It looks like everything's in place for the Festival of Ice to be a success tomorrow.#$b#Remember, if I'm not too old to play in the snow, neither are you!$h
Entries.winter_15_2: The Night Market isn't something I plan myself. These traveling merchants just show up on their own each year, and frankly, I'm glad that they do.#$b#Not every small town gets that privilege.
Entries.winter_24_2: I'm thankful for the whole town! I can plan the Feast of the Winter Star on paper, sure, but the way everyone shows up in such a jolly mood...#$b#...it's simply magic!$h
Entries.winter_28_2: It's not just the end of another year, it's the anniversary of your arrival! I'll never forget when you stepped off that bus.$h#$e#The snow melted early that year, I remember.#$e#Thanks for a good year, @.

Entries.Mon4: When berry season arrives, there's more than enough food to go around.#$e#You just have to know how to look for them, and they come in abundance.
Entries.Mon6: There's nothing like the feeling of making it through another winter with just the gifts of the mountain.$h
Entries.Mon8: Me? Married? Haha, no, I've never been married.$h#$e#I've never demanded that anyone else should conform to my lifestyle.
Entries.Tue2: Is there something that you want?
Entries.Tue6: A long time ago, yes, I grew up in a family. I haven't seen them for many years.#$e#I don't think I can even remember their faces anymore...$s
Entries.Tue10: Well, @, I suppose I could consider you a part of my new family, if that's alright.$h#$e#Oh, please don't be alarmed. The trees, the rocks, the lake, the sky... they are all my family, too.
Entries.Wed4: This land will continue to exist for many eons past our lifetimes.#$b#Please do treat it with respect.
Entries.Thu: ...Hmm? Do you want something from me?
Entries.Thu2: ...Maybe I need to pack up my tent and move again.$s
Entries.Thu6: Yes, you saw me taking food from the trash cans that one time...$s#$e#Usually, I just live on the food that nature provides, but the food that others throw out goes to complete waste if I don't take it.$s#$e#Is that any way to treat the world that provides for us?
Entries.Thu8: Sometimes, people don't understand me, but that doesn't make them bad.#$e#It just bothers me when they show hostility.
Entries.Thu10: There is a beauty in caring for others.#$b#So if I find something delicious and there's enough for two, I'll leave it in your mailbox.$h
Entries.Fri: Please don't destroy my tent.#$e#It's happened before.$s
Entries.Fri2: Why do you keep visiting me?
Entries.Fri8: Where do we go after we die? I suppose I'll go into the ground.#$e#Just back into the flow of nature, is all.#$e#It doesn't have to be so bad, if you think about it.#$e#I guess I'm not quite ready for that yet, though.$h
Entries.Sat: I'm happy by myself, you know.#$e#I don't need new friends.
Entries.Sat2: ...Hello, again.
Entries.Sat6: I don't imagine I'll stay here much longer.#$e#Don't be alarmed if you come up here and my tent is suddenly gone.#$e#That's how I've always done it.
Entries.Sat8: Perhaps I'll stay here another year.#$e#I don't normally stay put in one place for this long, but...$s
Entries.Sat10: At this rate, I may just stay here indefinitely.$h#$e#I can live in nature as much as I want, but I'm not too far away from at least one good neighbor. Thank you, @.
Entries.Sun2: You don't have to speak to me if you don't want to.
Entries.Sun8: When I first met you, @, I was sure I would be leaving the valley soon. Thank you for helping to change my mind.
Entries.summer_Tue8: Marlon and Gil? Yes, I see them every now and then.#$e#We mostly keep to ourselves.
Entries.summer_Sun6: I once caught a bass in the lake that was longer than my arm.$h#$e#That was a long time ago. I don't know that I'll ever break that record.
Entries.fall_Mon8: I'll admit, I've followed you into the mines before, from a distance.#$e#I'm sorry. I just want to make sure you stay safe...
Entries.fall_Tue10: Hi there, @!$h#$e#Find any good foraging spots today?
Entries.fall_Wed8: The mountain owes us nothing, yet it still gives. Anything we take is an undeserved gift. We must never forget to be thankful.
Entries.fall_Sun10: Have you tried fishing with wild bait yet?
Entries.winter_Mon6: I could hide indefinitely from the cold in the hot spring, but that isn't where I live.#$e#I'd rather not step on anyone's toes. The building belongs to the village.
Entries.winter_Tue8: If I play things right, I can go for a week or so without food.#$e#It isn't my first choice, but I can do it if it becomes necessary.
Entries.winter_Wed8: Rasmodius is a good friend. We only run into each other every now and then, but we always pick up where we left off.
Entries.winter_Thu8: The family in that house seemed annoyed by my presence when I first settled here. Lately, though, they seem fine with me.
Entries.winter_Sun8: It's important to know that we don't really matter. The world will carry on whether we humans exist or not.
Entries.spring_1_2: Breathe in that spring air!$h#$b#The valley is coming to life.$h
Entries.summer_10: I think I might take a risk tomorrow at the luau and share a little of my cooking.
Entries.winter_15: I caught a glimpse of the ships docking at the beach, from my view up on the mountain.#$e#Maybe I'll give them a look up close.
Entries.winter_28: We made it.$h#$e#*chuckle*$h
Entries.summer_10_2: I think I might take a risk tomorrow at the luau and share a little of my cooking.
Entries.winter_15_2: I caught a glimpse of the ships docking at the beach, from my view up on the mountain.#$e#Maybe I'll give them a look up close.
Entries.winter_28_2: We made it.$h#$e#*chuckle*$h

Entries.Mon2: I order all our supplies from a company I've done business with for almost two decades.#$e#I've got a special deal worked out, so it's cheaper for me to order the equipment.
Entries.Mon4: Leah's been a good neighbor. I can tell she has a deep appreciation for the natural world.#$b#And that includes animals, of course.$h
Entries.Mon6: Animals are so innocent, so sweet. And If I don't look after them, who will?$s#$e#I just hope my chickens aren't too upset when I take their eggs.$s
Entries.Mon8: What can I say? I guess it's in my blood to care for others.#$e#I'd say you have to be if you want to stick with this line of work.
Entries.Tue2: I'm sorry if Shane was a bit rude to you.$s#$e#It's just... I hope it's not too much to ask if you could be a friend to him.$s
Entries.Tue4: Shane is Jas's godfather. Has anyone mentioned that to you yet?
Entries.Tue6: Jas simply adores Shane.#$b#There's a strange distance between the two of them, though.$s#$e#She always calls me "Aunt Marnie," but she just calls him "Shane."$s
Entries.Tue8: Poor Jas. Did I ever tell you? Her parents died in a drunk driving accident several years ago.$s#$e#I just can't believe how strong she's been through it all.$s
Entries.Tue10: Shane was not in a good place when Jas's parents died, and in no shape to suddenly become an adoptive father.$s#$e#What else could I do? I had to take her in.$s
Entries.Wed: You can use a scythe to cut feed from grass.#$e#Just make sure you've got a silo to keep it in.#$e#Robin could help with that.
Entries.Wed2: You can use a scythe to cut feed from grass.#$e#Or you can buy it from me, of course!$h#$e#I could use the cash...$u#$e#Adios.
Entries.Wed4: I've lived on this ranch all my life. I was operating it singlehandedly by the time I was twenty.#$e#Times sure have changed.
Entries.Wed8: If your silo gets full, you can also store hay in a box.#$e#Just a little tip.$h
Entries.Fri2: This sure is a messy lifestyle, but nobody ever lived well without getting their hands a little dirty!$h
Entries.Fri10: It sure is a lot of messy, hard work to keep all those animals happy, but that doesn't stop me from being girly when I want.$h#$e#Jas and I can have a lot of fun playing dress-up. She's such a good girl.
Entries.Sat2: I'm glad you moved in, @. I'd almost given up hope that we'd ever see a neighbor up north of us again.
Entries.Sat4: Lily was my favorite cow back when I was a kid. I've never had one quite like her since.#$e#She was just a pure, loving soul, plain and simple.
Entries.Sat6: I always see Clint at the saloon but he won't talk to anyone. He just glances over his shoulder now and then.$s
Entries.Sat8: Sometimes I feel like I'm the only one who can keep this family going.$s#$e#Heck... That's not just how I feel. That's just how it is.$s
Entries.Sat8_inlaw_Shane: Sometimes I feel like I'm the only one who can keep this family going.$s#$e#Then again, that's not at all true. You're family, too! And you've done wonderful things for Shane.$h
Entries.Sun2: If you wanna hatch your own chickens, you'll need the Big Coop upgrade from Robin.#$e#Until that point, though, I'll sell you as many chickens as you'd like.
Entries.Sun4: Have you looked up how to craft a mayo maker?#$e#I never liked mayonnaise until I tried it homemade. That store-bought stuff just isn't the same.
Entries.Sun6: If I spend my life caring for the people and animals I love, then I'd say it's a life well lived.
Entries.summer_Mon2: Another one of our cows gave birth last night.$h#$e#I don't think I'll ever grow tired of watching how life continues on like that. It'll always find a way.
Entries.summer_Wed4: Shane's been distant since he moved in. He won't even sit with me at the saloon.$s#$e#I get that he needs his independence. He's an adult.$s#$e#And I'm not his mother, either.$u
Entries.summer_Wed6: *sigh*... I wasn't very productive this morning.$s
Entries.summer_Thu: How're you handling that heat?#$e#It rains enough in the summer that you shouldn't have to worry about your water sources running dry.
Entries.summer_Thu6: Hoo, it's hot, but it's not too hot. We shouldn't have to worry about sunstroke with any of the animals.
Entries.summer_Fri6: I spilled a whole bucket of milk on the floor today. It was horrible.$s#$e#And such a waste of my poor Belinda's hard work.$s
Entries.summer_Fri8: I wonder if Mr. Lewis gets lonely in that big house of his...$s#$e#It seems so empty in there, doesn't it?
Entries.fall_Wed: Are you stocking up on hay right now?#$b#Just take the number of animals you've got and multiply by 28. That's how much hay you'll need to make it through winter.
Entries.fall_Wed8: You and me! We'll make sure together that our animals last through the coming winter.$h#$e#Just swing by if you start to run low on hay.
Entries.fall_Thu: I sell heaters. Make sure you pop one of those down anywhere your livestock is housed.#$b#They'll be thanking you when the snow starts coming down.$h
Entries.fall_Thu6: Jas brought home another hundred-percent quiz from school. I sure am proud of that girl.$h#$e#She's come such a long way.$h
Entries.winter_Wed: Got enough feed for the winter?#$e#If you need me to sell you some, just make sure you don't wait until last minute.
Entries.winter_Thu: If I hadn't been a rancher, I wonder if I'd wound up as a cake baker.#$e#Hmm? Oh, no, I don't bake. I uh... I just really like fancy cakes.
Entries.winter_Thu8: Yes, Jas moved in first. Sometime later, I checked in on Shane, and it became clear that I'd need to take him in, too.
Entries.winter_Fri: Every now and then, I deliver a little cloth to Emily.#$e#It's exciting to see what she makes with it.
Entries.winter_Fri4: We make our own cheese and ice cream here.#$e#I never get tired of 'em if they're made the right way.
Entries.winter_Fri8: Yep. That tower near our ranch still gives me the creeps.#$e#I just try not to think about it.
Entries.spring_1_2: Happy new year!$h#$b#The animals are just dying to get outside.
Entries.spring_12: I've been delivering eggs to Gus and Lewis for the past week.#$e#I sure hope they have enough.
Entries.fall_15: I've been scrambling to get a good grange display for tomorrow's fair. I just need a few more eggs.#$e#Whoops. "Scrambling." That was a bad pun.
Entries.winter_24: Hey there! I hope to see you at the Feast tomorrow.$h
Entries.winter_28: We did it! Our animals made it through the winter.$h
Entries.Tue_inlaw_Shane: I'm so glad Shane met you. You take good care of him now, you hear?
Entries.Tue8_inlaw_Shane: I'm so glad Shane met you. When he first moved to town, I wasn't sure how things would work out, but here we are!$h
Entries.spring_12_2: I've been delivering eggs to Gus and Lewis for the past week.#$e#I sure hope they have enough.
Entries.fall_15_2: I've been scrambling to get a good grange display for tomorrow's fair. I just need a few more eggs.#$e#Whoops. "Scrambling." That was a bad pun.
Entries.winter_24_2: Hey there! I hope to see you at the Feast tomorrow.$h
Entries.winter_28_2: We did it! Our animals made it through the winter.$h

Entries.Mon2: Hi. Have you seen anything interesting on your walks around town yet?
Entries.Mon4: A lot of technical work must go into designing and running a farm. What do you do to clear your mind when you get a bit flustered?
Entries.Mon6: Sometimes my head gets so cluttered with nonsense I can hardly think. Does that ever happen to you?#$e#Getting some fresh air usually helps.
Entries.Mon8: Isn't it funny how the solution to a tough problem can just appear in your head as soon as you stop thinking about it?
Entries.Mon10: These days, I take walks just because I hope I'll run into you.$l#$e#Looks like today's my lucky day!$h#$e#How about tomorrow, too?
Entries.Tue2: Stop by our house when you need to upgrade your buildings.#$e#It's always nice to have visitors.
Entries.Tue4: Hmm... I wonder if there's anything I could craft that would make my mom's job easier...#$e#With the way she works, you'd think she was twenty years younger.$h
Entries.Tue6: I worry about my mom when she works in the rain. What if she got struck by lightning?$s#$e#Do you have some lightning rods on your farm?
Entries.Tue8: My mom's always been really supportive of me in my pursuits. So has my dad.#$e#I don't think I would've done as well if I'd had anyone else as parents.
Entries.Tue10: It's important to sit back and enjoy the finer things in life.#$e#Sometimes, my brain starts going a mile a minute and it gets overwhelming.#$b#But thankfully, I've managed to settle down now.
Entries.Tue6_inlaw_Penny: Penny used to talk about you all the time.#$b#Eventually, I was like, "Hey! You'd better ask that boy out if he doesn't ask you out first!"$h^Eventually, I was like, "Hey! You'd better ask that girl out if she doesn't ask you out first!"$h
Entries.Wed2: Days at the clinic are nice when I get to learn something new.#$e#If I don't learn something new every day, the day just ends up feeling incomplete.
Entries.Wed4: Dr. Harvey was about to throw out his defibrillator, but I opened it and fixed it up no problem.#$e#Unfortunately, he still had to replace it. Something about protocol and avoiding lawsuits...$s
Entries.Wed6: The heart monitor in the clinic's treatment room could really use a few improvements.#$b#It wouldn't be too hard to install a voice command system on it. That's just one thing.#$e#It's just wishful thinking, though. I know I can't tamper with standardized medical equipment.$s
Entries.Wed8: I work at Harvey's clinic on Tuesdays and Thursdays.#$e#He's nice, but not really my type...
Entries.Thu4: Looks like it'll be another slow day at the clinic.#$e#There's only so much I'm licensed to do, anyway.
Entries.Thu6: I plan on spending a lot of time with my telescope this summer.#$e#You should join me on an evening when the weather's clear.$h
Entries.Thu10: Oh, @! Is there anything you want to talk to me about?$h#$e#I was just thinking about you.
Entries.Fri: Hey, sorry if I seem cranky... I'm a little sore from work yesterday.#$c .5# I had to carry ten boxes of medical files to the attic!#$e#I had to sort patient records for four hours straight!
Entries.Fri2: Penny's a great friend. We've gotten along ever since my family moved here.#$e#Be sure to say hi, okay?
Entries.Fri4: My mother is a carpenter and my dad is a scientist. I guess it makes sense that I'm into building gadgets.
Entries.Fri6: Ooh, what a week. I didn't make as much progress on my projects as I'd hoped.$s#$e#Did your week go well, though?
Entries.Fri8: What do you think farming will look like, a hundred years from now?#$e#I guess there's no replacement for the human touch, is there?$l
Entries.Sat: Do you know my dad, Demetrius? He's a scientist. I have a lot of fun helping him out in the laboratory.
Entries.Sat2: My dad's studying the unique properties of the valley. You won't find a lot of ecosystems around the world like this one.
Entries.Sat4: I haven't quite decided what kind of science I want to pursue as a long-term career.#$e#Maybe I'll just keep doing a little bit of everything.$h#$e#Though, it would be nice to have some kind of contribution to the world.
Entries.Sat6: Rocket propulsion was an early interest of mine. I still dabble in it, from time to time.
Entries.Sat8: I want to save up so I can order some iridium from a hardware catalog. The stuff is crazy-expensive, though.$s#$e#But... oh, the things I could do with it!$l
Entries.Sat10: Everyone needs a happy place to retreat to and be alone. The bench by the community center is mine.#$e#There's the other bench by the saloon, but that's where I meet up with Penny.#$e#Though, I wouldn't mind it if you joined me at the happy bench.$l
Entries.Sun8: You must enjoy your work quite a bit if you've stuck around town this long.#$e#I'm really happy for you.$h
Entries.Sun10: You must enjoy your work quite a bit if you've stuck around town this long.#$e#I do, too. We make a good pair, don't we?$l
Entries.summer_Mon: Hmm... What sort of gadget should I tinker with this summer?
Entries.summer_Mon2: I've got a lot on my summer to-do list with my gadget projects. I hope I can get through it all!
Entries.summer_Mon6: When you're working on an experimental tech project, there are a dozen failures for every success.#$e#The way things don't work can be just as exciting as the way they do work.#$b#...As long as no one gets hurt.$s
Entries.summer_Mon10: Whenever I'm working on a project these days, I'm always keeping you in mind as I work.#$e#You're somewhat of a muse, I guess. I just want to see your reactions to things.$l
Entries.summer_Tue2: My brother only tends to come out of his room in the afternoon.#$e#Sometimes we go for a couple of days before our paths cross.$s
Entries.summer_Tue4_inlaw_Sebastian: Heyyy, brother-in-law!$h^Heyyy, sister-in-law!$h#$e#Sebastian seems so much happier now that he doesn't have to live here. I hope things are well!
Entries.summer_Wed2: Ick, it's incredibly hot. I bet Sebastian's room is really cool right now by comparison.#$e#I wouldn't know for sure, though. I rarely actually go down there.
Entries.summer_Wed4: Is it just me or did it suddenly get really hot?#$e#I guess it's just me.
Entries.summer_Wed6: Tonight's a good night to do some stargazing. You should stop by.
Entries.summer_Wed8: I wonder if I can find some celestial bodies I haven't seen before tonight?
Entries.summer_Wed10: It's strange. Looking at the cosmos through my telescope seems a little lonely these days.$s#$e#Just lonely... without you with me.
Entries.summer_Thu10: How do your hands stay so soft with all that farm work?
Entries.summer_Fri4: Dad and I sometimes go out for ice cream. Sebastian used to come too, but he doesn't anymore.
Entries.summer_Fri6: I'm glad I get to work at such a slow clinic. If we lived somewhere else, it'd take up so much more of my time.#$e#The hours I work each week are perfect for me.
Entries.summer_Fri10: Hey @. We should hang out sometime by the lake and share some ice cream.#$e#Do you like that idea?
Entries.summer_Sat: Hey, have any interesting farm stories to tell me?#$e#Guess not.
Entries.summer_Sat2: Trying to build something mechanical is a game of problem solving. I enjoy having to think outside the box.#$e#Is anything in your job like that, too?
Entries.summer_Sat4: Hmm... I wonder if robots will ever be popular enough to replace animals as pets?#$e#Well, probably not during our lifetimes.
Entries.summer_Sat6: My parents support my work, but they draw the line at bringing a nuclear reactor into the house.#$e#What? I could handle it.$h#$b#In theory, anyway. They're not that dangerous if you know what you're doing.
Entries.summer_Sat10: It's in the middle of summer like this when I see you, @, and my whole heart just feels warm.$l#$e#In the evenings, especially, I just get the sense that later in life, I'll be nostalgic for these days.
Entries.summer_Sun: I bet you're growing some interesting crops right now.#$b#Dad says a lot of exotic plants grow in the valley this time of year.
Entries.summer_Sun4: I can keep myself pretty disciplined. It helps to stick to a schedule.#$e#How about you?
Entries.summer_Sun8: I wonder if I should apply for a job as a researcher in a university.#$e#I'd miss the valley, though. And I can do pretty much everything I want to out here, though, so...
Entries.summer_Sun10: I wonder if I should apply for a job as a researcher in a university.#$e#I'd miss the valley, though. And I can do pretty much everything I want to out here, though, so...#$e#And there's you.$l
Entries.fall_Mon4: Remember how margarine used to be more popular than butter, because it was supposedly healthier?#$e#Then they found out margarine is actually even worse for you than butter. So now we're back to butter.#$e#Research is a funny journey, sometimes.$h
Entries.fall_Mon6: Hmm, the air smells nice. Today's a good day to be outside.
Entries.fall_Mon8: You should come visit me at the clinic tomorrow. I work from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.$h
Entries.fall_Mon_inlaw_Sebastian: Oh, hey @! How's my brother doing?
Entries.fall_Tue2: The colors of this season are what really make me love it so much.#$e#We all have a good excuse to go outside.
Entries.fall_Tue4: @, I just love how the trees look right now!#$e#I know you like them too.
Entries.fall_Tue8: Days like these remind me of when I first went to school as a little girl.#$e#Any nostalgic memories for you, @?
Entries.fall_Tue10: Rocket propulsion, arm robotics, artificial intelligence... the synthesis of these elements is something really special.#$e#There's still a long way to go in each science. Endless possibilities, really.
Entries.fall_Wed4: If you have any extra metal lying around, I could always use it for one of my projects.#$e#But only if you don't need it yourself.
Entries.fall_Wed6: You've probably crafted some pretty neat devices of your own. Have you made a mayonnaise machine?#$e#It's actually pretty easy. The properties of the earth crystal do most of the work for you.
Entries.fall_Wed8: Gold is for much more than just decorative purposes. It's also a really good conductor for electrical equipment.#$e#But it's not like anybody just has some of it just lying around, right?$h
Entries.fall_Wed10: Mmm, this is nice. Beautiful autumn day, light refreshing breeze...#$b#...boyfriend on my arm...$l^...girlfriend on my arm...$l
Entries.fall_Thu: In other parts of the world it's spring right now. Imagine that!
Entries.fall_Thu4: It sure would be interesting to see artificial intelligence interact with organic intelligence.#$e#It'd be even more interesting if we could meld the two in one lifeform. Got any cows who'd be up for a 'bionic cow' experiment?$h#$e#Ha, just kidding.
Entries.fall_Thu8: Ever heard of a crystalarium? They seem a bit tricky to make, but not impossible.#$e#I would make one if I had the materials.
Entries.fall_Fri4: Dr. Harvey seems to be in good spirits lately. It was a good week at the clinic this week.
Entries.fall_Fri6: I've been feeling especially optimistic lately...$h
Entries.fall_Fri8: Artificial intelligence is really fascinating. I'm not quite as good at programming as Sebastian is...#$b#...but there are some preset AI modules that I've tried altering myself.#$e#Even some basic emotion algorithms should be possible, but of course I keep it relatively rudimentary.
Entries.fall_Fri10: Mmm, this weather's making me crave sweets.#$e#...And you. *giggle*$l
Entries.fall_Sat4: The way all the organisms in the wild perish and survive to sustain one ecosystem...#$b#...there's a lot we can learn and apply to making any complex system stable.
Entries.fall_Sat6: My dad had a really cool experiment earlier this week.#$b#The microbes in the lake actually stabilize the lake's pH levels. But in order to do that, the microbes have to die in massive quantities.#$e#Am I bad if it was fun to replicate the process in the lab?$s#$e#Well, you know, nature's both cruel and beautiful.
Entries.fall_Sat10: Ugh, my thoughts are just spinning out of control right now. It's like my brain is in overdrive.$s#$e#Can you rub my back? I've got to breathe slowly. *sigh*#$b# ...One, two, three, four, five, six, seven...$s#$e#One more time...#$e#...$s#$e#Thanks. I'll be okay.$l
Entries.fall_Sun2: Any plans for next week? Or just taking it day by day?
Entries.fall_Sun4: Hey, here's to another good week! *toast*
Entries.fall_Sun6: Ugh, I can't stop my thoughts from spinning like a whirlwind.$s#$e#Sorry.$s
Entries.fall_Sun8: Hey, nice running into you. How was your week?
Entries.fall_Sun10: You have a leaf in your hair. Let me get it for you.#$e#...$h
Entries.winter_Mon2: My snowman looks a tiny bit different each year, but my inner kid pretends it's the same soul who always comes back to visit.
Entries.winter_Mon4: You're never too old to build a snowman.#$b#Anyone who's tired of snowmen is tired of life.$h
Entries.winter_Mon6: I think I'll do a little patch-up work on my snowman today. Maybe I can get him to last until the new year.$h
Entries.winter_Mon8: Hi @!$h#$e#Hey, don't you think my snowman looks kind of like you?
Entries.winter_Tue4: Hey, do you have any ideas for a new gadget I can make?#$e#Mhmm. I trust your opinion.
Entries.winter_Tue6: I wonder if I could make a device that could keep my hair from getting frizzy when the weather's dry...
Entries.winter_Tue8: One of my first ideas for an invention was an automatic snowball maker and thrower.#$e#I never actually finished the project, because I had the idea when I was seven.#$b#Still, though, shouldn't be too hard...
Entries.winter_Wed4: Hm. I'm a little bored today. How do you pass the time in the winter?#$e#My current projects just aren't doin' it for me, lately. I need a change of pace.
Entries.winter_Wed6: To tell the truth, I feel like I learn even more from Penny than she learns from me.#$e#The way she understands kids and literature, and art... We're a couple of nerds, but we balance each other out.
Entries.winter_Wed6_inlaw_Penny: I'm so happy you wound up with my best friend. I always had a feeling about you and Penny.$l
Entries.winter_Wed10: The world just looks perfect after a fresh-fallen snow.#$e#@, you're a really good person. I hope you recognize that about yourself.$l
Entries.winter_Thu4: I hope Sebastian's okay. I feel like he barely sees the sun during the winter. It's not healthy.$s
Entries.winter_Thu6: I tried asking Sebastian if I could join them the next time Sam comes over, but he looked really unenthusiastic.$s#$e#I mean, I'd understand if I did something wrong, but honestly, why does he single me out like that?$a
Entries.winter_Thu8: I let Sebastian do his own thing these days. I think he just wants to be left alone.#$e#It sucks. I've tried all these years to be a good sister, but I don't think he'll ever stop pushing me away.$s#$e#Well, not every sibling relationship winds up perfect.$s
Entries.winter_Thu10: @, come closer. I'm cold.#$e#My hands are so dry from the winter air. I'm sorry about that.
Entries.winter_Thu4_inlaw_Sebastian: I did a voicechat with Sebastian this morning. Now that he's moved out, it's a lot easier to get along with him.#$b#Isn't it funny how that works?$h
Entries.winter_Fri4: We treated a patient with the flu yesterday. Ugh. I really hope I don't get it, too.$s#$e#No, I can't tell you who it is. Patient confidentiality.#$b#Just be sure to wash your hands a lot.
Entries.winter_Fri6: You look fresh today. I guess it's that crisp winter air.
Entries.winter_Fri10: Your cheeks are all rosy. *giggle* So cute.$l#$e#Mmm, give me a hug.$l
Entries.winter_Sat4: Mmm, if only I could go into the caves and get some precious metals. The amount of things I could accomplish...!#$e#But... I don't want to make my parents worry themselves sick.
Entries.winter_Sat8: @! I'm glad to see you.#$e#It's been a bit of a rough week, but seeing you makes things a little better.#$e#You're just always a pleasant person to be around. It's nice.
Entries.winter_Sun: I get so sleepy when it's cold...
Entries.winter_Sun2: I want to wrap myself up in a blanket, but then I'd just fall asleep. Hmm.#$e#That'd really mess up my sleep cycle if I took a nap.
Entries.winter_Sun4: I get so sleepy when it's cold...
Entries.winter_Sun6: Time travel is theoretically possible. It would just take more energy than anyone can harness.#$e#We're talking... pretty much all the kinetic and potential energy in the world. In one place.
Entries.winter_Sun10: Time travel is theoretically possible.#$b#But even if I could travel through time, I wouldn't want to change anything.$l
Entries.spring_1_2: A good day to you, sir!^A good day to you, @!#$e#How's your year so far?
Entries.summer_1: This is going to be a great season for stargazing.
Entries.summer_27: You'll be at the beach tomorrow night, right? I hope so!
Entries.fall_15: The Stardew Valley Fair is so much fun. It's one of my favorite days of the year.#$e#You should try some of the games they have.
Entries.winter_7: I love my snowman, but I'm interested to see what other people build tomorrow.
Entries.winter_28: Have a good night tonight. Let's count our lucky stars!
Entries.summer_27_2: You'll be at the beach tomorrow night, right? I hope so!
Entries.fall_15_2: The Stardew Valley Fair is so much fun. It's one of my favorite days of the year.#$e#You should try some of the games they have.
Entries.winter_7_2: I love my snowman, but I'm interested to see what other people build tomorrow.
Entries.winter_28_2: Have a good night tonight. Let's count our lucky stars!

Entries.Rainy_Day_0: #$c .5#I bet my brother just went to bed an hour or two ago. What a goof.#I wonder how Penny is doing? Maybe I'll give her a call later today.
Entries.Rainy_Day_1: #$c .5#Have you seen my flathead screwdriver with the yellow handle? I'm always misplacing that thing...$s#I was just daydreaming... do you think MARILDA is okay? I hope she finds some place where she truly belongs...
Entries.Rainy_Day_2: Hey! I had trouble sleeping last night so I fiddled around in my workshop for a bit. Here, I made this for you. [688 369 338 325 287]#$e#$c .5#I'm happy to contribute where I can.$h#I hope you can find some use for it.
Entries.Rainy_Day_3: #$c .5#Phew, I thought I slept like a baby, but I'm still tired.#The only thing I dislike about rain is the fact that I can't do any stargazing!
Entries.Rainy_Day_4: #$c .5#Some of my electronics are getting a bit dusty. That's something I could work on today... or maybe some reading.#Do I hear a leak in the roof? I'll have to check it out. I know a thing or two about carpentry from watching my mother.
Entries.Rainy_Night_0: #$c .5#I stayed inside because of the weather. Not too exciting, but it was relaxing. I kicked back with the latest 'Schematics Weekly'.#Make sure you don't leave your tools out in the rain! You wouldn't want them to get all rusty.
Entries.patio_Maru: #$c .5#When this one's done, it should be useful for helping me cook food. Y'know, MY way, just for fun.#I'm not sure what this is, yet... but it's fun to turn the old wrench now and then.
Entries.Rainy_Night_1: Hi @. How was your day... soggy?#$e#$c .5#Why don't we do an indoor date night tonight? What're you craving?#This weather gives me gadget ideas... maybe if I funnel the rainwater it could power a mill?
Entries.Rainy_Night_2: Dad's been tracking the weather patterns for the last twenty years.#$e#$c .5#I really hope the climate doesn't change to the point where it negatively affects your farming.$s#It's a little too early to tell, but the results have revealed some abnormal trends.
Entries.Rainy_Night_3: #$c .5#Come here. *kiss* I need some human contact tonight.$l#Can we have spaghetti in bed tonight?
Entries.Rainy_Night_4: #$c .5#Look what I made. And I didn't even use an oven! Guess how? [232 234 223 220]$h#I made some dessert! Make sure to brush your teeth before bed, though. [232 234 223 220]$h
Entries.Indoor_Day_0: #$c .5#I have so many little projects I want to work on today... Maybe I should write down a list, before my brain gets too cluttered.#Hmm? Sorry, sometimes I get so lost in thought that I don't even realize what I'm doing.
Entries.Indoor_Day_1: #$c .5#Got any ideas for how we could put this to use? I just don't like wasting good equipment. [286 287 205 732]#I found this in my scrap pile. Think you could find a use for it? [286 287 205 732]
Entries.Indoor_Day_2: #$c .5#There's something about farm life that gets me up early. I don't know what it is. It just feels right.#Finally, you're up! I was getting so hungry... *rumble*$h
Entries.Indoor_Day_3: #$c .5#What can we do to make today a little more special? Anything fun you've been meaning to get to?#One of the best things about living on the farm is waking up to a chorus of songbirds.
Entries.Indoor_Day_4: #$c .5#I used to wonder where I'd end up after moving out. I never imagined it'd be right down the road. How funny.$h#How do you keep your hands so soft with all that farmwork?
Entries.Indoor_Night_0: #$c .5#One day, we'll look at the stars the same way early man looked at the horizon: distant but surmountable.#Did you see the moon tonight? It always looks spectacular on the horizon.
Entries.Indoor_Night_1: #$c .5#There are always little optimizations that can be made on the farm, but perhaps more important is whether the layout's pleasing to you.#I saw a shooting star earlier. I like to pretend it's MARILDA stopping by to check on us.$h
Entries.Indoor_Night_2: I can't decide if I'm craving chocolate cake or ripe strawberries. Or maybe both...?#$e#$c .5#Life's too short not to eat more goodies.$h#Be honest... am I gaining weight?$s
Entries.Indoor_Night_3: #$c .5#You did good work today! You deserve to relax the rest of the evening.#Oh, there you are! I was just hoping you'd come home.$l
Entries.Indoor_Night_4: #$c .5#I'm really starting to love this old house. It's so cozy at night. Mom's done a great job improving the place.#I'm really proud of the work you do. You know that, right?
Entries.Outdoor_0: #$c .5#Oh good! You found me. I was hoping to share a bit of the morning outside with you.#Ahh... the farm smells great, it reminds me of the mountains near my parents' house.
Entries.Outdoor_1: #$c .5#I'm sure if my mom were here, she could tell you a little story about every single piece of wood on this side of the house.#With a little planning, we could automate most of the farm work and just relax!
Entries.Outdoor_2: #$c .5#No matter how advanced technology gets, I hope this farm and these woods are here for a really, really long time.#It's going to be clear tonight... I wonder if the %noun constellation will be visible?
Entries.Outdoor_3: #$c .5#Good morning! Mind if I watch you from here?#Don't worry, I won't mind if you track mud into the house. It's fun to get a little dirty now and then.
Entries.Outdoor_4: #$c .5#So, what was it like when you first moved here? It's almost tough to remember when I was just your acquaintance.#I never realized the amount of care and planning necessary to run a farm! It's a lot like working in the laboratory.
Entries.OneKid_0: #$c .5#I'll ask Penny for some kid advice. I know she works with big kids, but she just has a way with the little ones.#Have you spent any time with %kid1 today? Kids need playtime in order reach their full potential.
Entries.OneKid_1: #$c .5#What? No, of course I'm not going to make a parenting robot. You can't find a substitute for the human touch.$h#What do you think... will %kid1 grow up to be a farmer? Or an engineer?
Entries.OneKid_3: #$c .5#My parents are thrilled; they just said they never expected to be grandparents at so young an age. Well, Mom and Dad, surprise!#I have high hopes for our child. I've been reading all the scientific data on the best ways to raise children.
Entries.TwoKids_3: #$c .5#Good thing we have good healthcare here. Dr. Harvey will see our kids in a heartbeat if we need to.#My own workshop, two wonderful kids, and a beautiful plot of land. Life is pretty good.
Entries.funLeave_Maru: #$c .5#My parents are probably missing me a bit. That's where I'm headed today.#I think I'll visit my parents today. I haven't seen them in a while.
Entries.funReturn_Maru: #$c .5#Well, it was good to go home today, but now it's even better to come 'home-home.' My heart's really here, now.$l#Mom and Dad are doing just fine. Their routine is still the same, even with me gone. How was your day?
Entries.spring_9: Working in a university would be interesting, but honestly, what would I do there that I don't already do?#$b#Invent? Learn? Experiment? I already do all that.$h
Entries.spring_15: I'll see if I can get one of my robots to do the cleaning for us today.#$b#It's more work to get the robot set up and calibrated than if I just did it myself, but it's also more fun.$h
Entries.spring_16: I wonder if my walk to work is shorter or longer now, compared to where I used to live...?
Entries.spring_26: MARILDA really was a one-off kind of invention for me. I'm not even sure I could reproduce another robot like her... And even if I could, hmm...$s#$b#A big part of me wants her to remain special, one of a kind.
Entries.summer_4: I remember one year, when I was a kid, the strawberries came really late in the season.#$b#We were still eating them fresh at around this point on the calendar.#$e#What? Of course I remember! They were just that good!$h
Entries.summer_9: Another day of work for me today.#$b#Hmm... I hope no one comes in with heatstroke.$s
Entries.summer_16: Eldra, one of the 'feuding brothers' constellations was at its highest point in the sky last night.#$b#Half a year from now, his brother will take his place. Our ancestors were really creative, the way they made so many detailed stories to explain the sky's phenomena.
Entries.summer_23: There's a beauty to human technology, but then there's also an even greater beauty to nature.#$b#I feel like the ultimate beauty would be a harmony between the two. What do you think?
Entries.summer_27: Just a couple more evenings until the moonlight jellies arrive. I'm really excited!#$e#To be honest, though, I'm probably nowhere near my dad's level of excitement.
Entries.fall_9: Have a good day today, honey. I'm just going to put the finishing touches on my plutonium destabilizer.#$e#Kidding.$h#$e#No, seriously, I keep the plutonium destabilizer in my secret lab. The one under the wood pile.#$e#Please tell me you didn't just fall for that!$h#$b#Er, well... oh. I guess I did have a secret lab at my old place.$s#$e#No, I didn't install a secret lab! This is your house, you goof!$h
Entries.fall_15: Yesterday was the last day to be able to plant pumpkins in time for Spirit's Eve.#$e#Actually, if you forgot, you could still do it. It'd just take a little Speed-Gro.
Entries.fall_18: Living within walking distance of my parents' house... in a house my mom remodeled...#$b#Well, I know my situation isn't exactly typical. Let me know if it ever gets weird for you, okay?#$e#You are my priority, you are my love. Now come here and kiss me.$l
Entries.fall_22: Penny lent me a book a few days ago. I think I'll get it started later today, maybe while I'm out.
Entries.winter_11: I learn best by doing things hands-on, and I try to learn something new every day.#$e#For me, knowledge is its own end. I don't have any plans to sell an invention for big money.#$b#I'm open to changing my mind on the subject if it ever becomes necessary, though.
Entries.winter_22: I love fireplaces... even more than I love central heating. Is that weird for a technophile like me?#$e#It's just that woodfire smell, and the feel of the natural heat. You can't beat it.
Entries.winter_23: I've almost finished the book that Penny lent me a while back.#$e#I don't know how she speeds through books the way she does. I only read through a few books per year.
Entries.winter_28: Happy new year, honey. Let's celebrate tonight! [232 234 223 220]$h#$b#Don't stay out too late.$l

Entries.Saloon_Mon: Hey kid, I'd buy you a drink if I could afford it!
Entries.Saloon_Thu: *gulp*... I've been looking forward to this beverage all afternoon. Heh heh.
Entries.Saloon_Entry: Ah... Finally./I need a drink./Gus! Gimme the usual./Hey, I'm back!/Ooh boy, am I thirsty!/I'm parched!
Entries.Trailer_Entry: Penny! Did you make dinner?/Penny! You done your chores?/Penny! You home?/Hey! I'm home!
Entries.Mon: #$1 PamDrank#urghh... my head...$k#$e#You know, I'd eat healthier food if I could afford it.#$e#Hey, you probably have a lot of tasty grub growin' on your farm, hm?
Entries.Mon2: I could sure go for some parsnips.#$e#What? Don't believe I eat healthy sometimes?
Entries.Mon4: Maybe if you do real well on your farm it'll boost the local economy.#$e#Then everyone will have a job and we'll all be happy, right?
Entries.Mon6: If my legs weren't so stiff I'd visit the mountains every now and then.
Entries.Mon8: $d bus#Don't you worry 'bout a thing. I know I'm at the saloon a lot, but I always drive sober.|I sure do miss my job.$s
Entries.Tue2: Oh, it's Mr. @.^Oh it's Miss @.#$e#Do you need my help or something?
Entries.Tue4: I was reading the newspaper this morning but then I got depressed. It's a rotten world, kid.#$e#Keep your head screwed on right and you'll make it through in one piece...#$b#That's what my Pappy always used to say. Heh heh heh.$h
Entries.Tue6: If I could start all this over again...? Nahh, I don't think about those kinds of things.#$e#It ain't gonna happen, so there's no point.#$e#Maybe I'd punch that husband o' mine in the mouth a couple extra times.
Entries.Tue8: I had hopes and dreams like you, once... But look at me now.$s#$e#Life doesn't always turn out like you expect.#$e#Ah well. There's no sense dwellin' on what you don't have.
Entries.Wed2: $d bus#You don't know how glad I am that the bus is up and running! I feel alive again.|Ever since I got laid off, I can't help but wonder if Mayor Lewis is gonna do something to get that bus fixed.
Entries.Wed4: $d bus#You don't know how glad I am that the bus is up and running! I feel alive again.|I talked to Lewis about fixin' the bus. He said he can't 'legally' fix it, 'cause the town don't own it. For cryin' out loud!
Entries.Wed6: $d bus#I don't need anything too complicated for work. Just give me somethin' to drive and I'm happy.$h|I called up the bus company again. Said they still ain't got the money to fix it. Budget cuts.$s
Entries.Wed8: $d bus#It's nice havin' a reason to get up in the morning again.|That damn bus company! Who do they think they are, givin' me a bus that just ups and breaks on ya?
Entries.Wed10: $d bus#I do enjoy my morning walks out to the bus stop. Nothing beats the smell of that fresh air.|Some of us just can't win in this world, kid.$s
Entries.Thu4: Hey, what do you think of that Sam fellow? Heard anything about him?
Entries.Thu6: Sam seems like a good guy, if a bit young.#$b#Penny says he's got some growing up to do.
Entries.Thu8: Penny says I spend too much time at the saloon...$s
Entries.Fri2: Each day's just the same as the last...$s#$b#If only I'd been born rich...$s
Entries.Fri4: You know, I've been thinking... I wish I had a hobby. Something to do other than hanging around at that saloon every night.#$e#You got any ideas?#$e#...Ehh. Maybe I'll play checkers against myself.
Entries.Sat2: Havin' a local farm is good for our town.
Entries.Sat4: Hey kid. What're you up to?#$e#I'm just passin' time, same as always.
Entries.Sat6: I wish a team of elves would come during the night and tidy up my house. Hahahaha.$h
Entries.Sun4: *Sigh*... I guess I'll be popping a frozen dinner into the microwave tonight.$s
Entries.Sun6: $d bus#Good thing I got my job back when I did. A few more weeks and I woulda been clean outta cash.|I don't know how much longer I can go before Gus kicks me outta the saloon for not payin' my tab...$s
Entries.summer_Mon8: $d bus#I'm a safe driver, kid. Ain't had a single ticket since I was younger than you.$h|Damn this weather, huh kid?
Entries.summer_Wed10: $d bus#Ain't no way I'm missin' my unemployment days, nuh uh.|Some of us just can't win in this world, kid.$s
Entries.summer_Thu2: Oh, hi there, farmer.#$e#Did I see you at the saloon the other night?
Entries.summer_Fri8: Well, the world can't be all bad if there are still some good ones like you left.#$e#How'd you turn out so nice, anyway?
Entries.summer_Sat2: Don't mind that ol' dog next to the house.#$b#He might look at you cross, but he'll never get up from that box in a hundred years.#$b#The old boy's name? It's Dusty.
Entries.fall_Mon10: It's around this time of year, I always remember...#$e#That idiot husband o' mine just stood up and walked on out.#$e#I don't really care where he is. Penny's grown up just fine, and she's too good for him, anyway.
Entries.fall_Wed10: $d bus#I ain't rich, but I'm glad I don't have to worry about money so much anymore.|Some of us just can't win in this world, kid.$s
Entries.winter_Mon: It's so dry in winter. My skin feels like old parchment.
Entries.winter_Mon6: You got any hogs on that farm?
Entries.winter_Tue4: I just hope Penny has a good life ahead of her. If you ever have kids you'll know how I feel.
Entries.winter_Wed10: $d bus#You don't know how glad I am that the bus is up and running! I feel alive again.|Some of us just can't win in this world, kid.$s
Entries.winter_Fri8: It's cute seein' how Penny works with those kids.#$e#Well, even if it's too late for me, at least Penny's doin' something good for the world.
Entries.winter_Sat8: Fishin' in the Ice Festival is pretty fun. I figure I should do it more often.$h#$e#Maybe I just need an audience to motivate me.#$e#Heh... like someone's got time for that.
Entries.winter_Sun8: Your farm sure is pretty in the snow. Makes for a nice view.#$e#Don't you let it go fallin' apart, y'hear?$h
Entries.spring_1_2: Any plans for the new year?#$e#Yep, we'll see.#$e#Gotta keep that head up, huh?
Entries.spring_23: I can't wait to see Penny dance tomorrow!$h#$e#I just hope she dances with someone good enough for her.
Entries.winter_7: Time for me to try my hand at fishing tomorrow. You gonna be there at the festival?
Entries.winter_28: Welp, time for another year to walk into the sunset!#$e#Make sure you don't let your life go whooshin' by, kid.
Entries.spring_23_2: I can't wait to see Penny dance tomorrow!$h#$e#I just hope she dances with someone good enough for her.
Entries.winter_7_2: Time for me to try my hand at fishing tomorrow. You gonna be there at the festival?
Entries.winter_28_2: Welp, time for another year to walk into the sunset!#$e#Make sure you don't let your life go whooshin' by, kid.

Entries.Mon2: So, I guess you're staying in Pelican Town for the long haul? That's good.
Entries.Mon4: *sigh*... My mother definitely has a problem with going to the saloon too much.$s#$q 237/238 Mon_old#But it's best not to dwell on bad things, right?#$r 237 50 Mon_237#Right. It's best to be positive!#$r 238 10 Mon_238#I think it's good to be realistic.
Entries.Mon_old: #$p 237#But if I keep trying I think I can get her to change.|I guess it makes sense. There's not much I can do to change it, anyway.
Entries.Mon6: If you're ever looking for something my mother will enjoy, you can't go wrong with parsnips.#$e#She uses it in a hangover remedy, but at least it's better than something that causes the hangover in the first place.$u
Entries.Mon_237: That's how I feel. I'm just going to focus on making the future better.
Entries.Mon_238: Maybe you're right. It's better to cope with reality.$u
Entries.Tue2: I tutor Vincent and Jas just three days a week: Tuesday, Wednesday, and Friday.#$e#It's not quite a full school week, but having only two students helps me give them a lot of individual attention.
Entries.Tue6: Teaching children involves so many more responsibilities than I originally thought.#$e#Has the same proven true for your farming?
Entries.Tue8: $d bus#I'm trying to save money from my tutoring job, but it's hard with my mother out of work.|Maybe now that my mother has her bus driving job back, I can start saving more money. Things are looking a little brighter.
Entries.Wed6: Ms. Eleanor was my teacher when I was growing up. A lot of the things I teach Vincent and Jas, I learned from her.#$e#I've also learned a lot just from the books in the library.
Entries.Wed8: It's tough trying to fill the shoes of the woman who had my job before me, but having only two students makes it a bit easier.#$e#Ms. Eleanor had nine of us one year. There were just more kids in town when I was growing up.
Entries.Thu2: It's nice just having two students. We get a little more flexibility with when we meet for class.
Entries.Thu4: Some book suggestions? Hm, well, the 'Marcie' series is really good. Everyone loves those.#$e#For my personal favorites, just about anything by Nora Sealy is hard to go wrong with.
Entries.Thu8: Hi @!$h#$e#It's been a great week so far. The kids did really well on their quizzes yesterday.#$e#How's your week coming along?
Entries.Thu10: When I was a little girl, I always thought I'd grow up and marry Sam. We barely even spend time together anymore, though.#$e#Heehee, no, you don't have to be jealous.$h
Entries.Fri2: Teaching is a lot of work. I can't even imagine how a 'real' classroom teacher does everything with a full-sized class.
Entries.Fri6: Becoming a teacher will mature you up quite a bit. I feel like I've grown up five years' worth in the last two years alone.
Entries.Fri10: Hi there, @!$h#$e#It's strange. I feel somehow older and younger at the same time around you.
Entries.Sat6: I want to do what I can to help the world, even if I'm just helping the people around me.#$e#You must feed a lot of people with the work you do, huh?
Entries.Sat8: Jas draws me the cutest pictures sometimes. My favorite so is one where she drew your farm next to hers.#$e#She drew every little fence post. It was adorable.$h
Entries.Sat10: The romance novels I read as a kid have been making a lot more sense to me, lately.$l#$e#What? ...Oh, sorry, nothing.$l
Entries.Sun2: I apologize if my mother is... well, a bit much.#$e#Everyone else is already aware of us, so...
Entries.Sun6: I've seen a decent number of people come and go in Pelican town. You won't be leaving anytime soon, will you?
Entries.Sun8: Hi @! It's always great to see you.
Entries.Sun10: It's so embarrassing. I keep spacing out in the middle of teaching lessons.$l#$e#You know why, right?$l
Entries.summer_Mon2: Maru's a good friend. I feel like I learn so much every time I have a conversation with her.#$e#She gives me good ideas that I can use for science lessons with the kids.
Entries.summer_Mon4: Maru tells me that every family's got issues of one kind or another.$u#$b#It just bothers me sometimes, when it feels like half the town's judging my mother and me.$s#$e#Uhm, sorry, how's your day going?
Entries.summer_Mon8: In my first year of tutoring, I'd go home crying at least once a week. I just thought, 'I can't do right by these kids.'$u#$e#But it did eventually get easier. I think I was overly critical of my own performance and how the kids would receive it.
Entries.summer_Tue: I have the kids on a summer reading schedule. It's nice to take it a little easier this time of year.
Entries.summer_Tue2: I do hope Vincent's doing his summer reading today...$u#$b#But I'm not supposed to be doting on him right now. The goal is to build independence.
Entries.summer_Tue4: I have the kids on a summer reading schedule. It's nice to take it a little easier this time of year.
Entries.summer_Tue10: Sam and I were like Vincent and Jas when we were younger. We've really grown up in different ways since then, though.#$e#Sam is just in a different place in his life. He's still growing up.
Entries.summer_Wed: We don't do a full summer vacation, because we have to make up for our short school weeks during the regular year.#$e#Jodi and Marnie requested we do it that way, instead of doing things the way a normal school would.
Entries.summer_Wed4: I look forward to getting outside just as much as the kids do. The world outside is our classroom, too!$h#$e#Though, Vincent sometimes just wants to run around, rather than do a science lesson.$u
Entries.summer_Wed8: Today we're learning about the water cycle. I had figured this would be a lesson best taught outside.
Entries.summer_Wed10: @! Oh, hi!$l#$e#Sorry, is it just unusually hot today?$l
Entries.summer_Sat2: Today's a playground day for the kids.#$e#It doesn't have anything to do with my tutoring job. I just do this for fun.
Entries.summer_Sat4: $d cc#Thanks for fixing the community center back up. I guess you're kind of a town hero.|Hello, @. It's nice to see you're doing well.
Entries.summer_Sat8: I think children's laughter is the nicest sound in the world.$h#$e#That pure, unadulterated joy... that's what it's all about, isn't it?
Entries.summer_Sat10: Do you like seeing the kids play, too?#$e#It reminds me of those perfect, bygone days, but in a way that recaptures that perfection and gives me hope.$h
Entries.summer_Sun: So... do you like to decorate your farm house?#$e#It must be nice having your own place to decorate.
Entries.summer_Sun2: I found a library book just lying in the dirt. How could someone be so irresponsible?$s#$e#If you find any others, please be sure to send them back where they belong.
