Entries.summer_Sun4: So... do you like to decorate your farm house?#$e#It must be nice having your own place to decorate.
Entries.summer_Sun6: What do you think I should do with the kids this coming week? I was thinking of trying a little drawing game for practicing vocab.
Entries.summer_Sun8: Sometimes, I look at myself, and I wonder if I'm a good enough role model for the kids.$s#$e#If I'm supposed to show them all the places where education can lead them in life, well, look at my life...$s#$e#...I just tell myself it'll be okay. As long as they find happiness one day in the future...$u
Entries.summer_Sun10: Lately, I've found myself with more confidence in what I do.#$e#Even more than ever, I'm reminded of the importance of showing care and support for the ones around me.
Entries.fall_Mon6: Maybe I could find a job as a full classroom teacher someday. But I don't know that it would be better for me.#$e#I just can't imagine having the same connections with twenty or thirty students like I have with Jas and Vincent.
Entries.fall_Mon8: Maru and I became fast friends when her family moved here. I'd miss her greatly if she ever had to leave.
Entries.fall_Mon10: If I met my dad again, I don't know what I'd do... and I don't really care to know.$a#$e#Everything I have right now is zero thanks to him. So, screw him, you know?$a
Entries.fall_Tue: I have Vincent come in a little early each day, for a little extra help.#$e#He's been making good progress, even if he has to be a trooper about it sometimes.$h
Entries.fall_Tue10: I walked by your farm the other evening as I dropped off Jas at her home. I saw you in the distance, and...#$b#...the landscape was beautiful, but you were my favorite part about it.$l
Entries.fall_Wed4: I've been an avid reader for as long as I can remember. Books are one thing that have always been there for me.
Entries.fall_Wed6: Books are good for a little escapism now and then. I think everybody needs some form of that.
Entries.fall_Thu10: Vincent asked yesterday if I was in love with you. That boy, I swear...$u#$e#...$l
Entries.fall_Thu8: It's always a struggle to care for my mom, but after Dad left, the two of us agreed to stick together no matter what.$u#$e#Everyone needs someone who watches their back, you know?$u
Entries.fall_Fri4: ...$s#$e#Oh, sorry @. I was just thinking. Fall is always a difficult time for me.$s#$e#I'll tell you about it sometime.
Entries.fall_Sun10: @! I was just thinking about the future...#$e#Where do you picture yourself in ten years?$l#$e#I have a few ideas for myself...$u
Entries.winter_Mon: On the 25th we'll be having the Feast of the Winter Star. It's one of my favorite events.#$e#It's supposed to be a time to show gratitude for all the good things in your life... but for most people it's just a time to relax and exchange gifts.
Entries.winter_Mon6: There's a lot of excitement for this year's Feast of the Winter Star. I wonder who I'll get this year?$h
Entries.winter_Mon10: I was reading before bed last night, but I only got through a couple pages.#$e#My mind kept wandering...$l
Entries.winter_Tue4: Elliott's a novelist, isn't he? I'd love to read some of his work, but I don't know him very well...
Entries.winter_Tue8: Elliott shared some of his writings with me. It wasn't the type of stuff I usually like to read, but I made sure I was polite.#$e#He's still very talented.
Entries.winter_Tue10: With the Feast of the Winter Star approaching, I was counting my blessings.#$b#I'm very thankful to have gotten to know you, @.$l
Entries.winter_Wed: I love that the library has a fireplace. It makes it so much nicer to just curl up with a good book.
Entries.winter_Wed4: I'm looking forward to seeing what your farm looks like in the spring.#$e#It's going to be so fresh and beautiful.$h
Entries.winter_Wed8: I have no idea whether Vincent will ever go to college. I never did.$u#$e#But if he grows up one day to be a fine and caring young man, I can't ask for anything more.
Entries.winter_Thu4: I have to make sure I do my best with my job. If the parents don't feel like their kids are learning enough...$u#$b#...they'll put them on a bus each day for the long commute to a public school.#$e#So far, so good, though.
Entries.winter_Thu6: Hey, @, I was wondering... you haven't given my mother any alcoholic beverages, have you?$u#$e#Sometimes I wish Gus would just ban her from the saloon.$s
Entries.winter_Thu10: Oh, hi @.$l#$e#Sorry, I didn't sleep much last night. I was up late...$s#$b#...uh, reading. It's a really good book I can't put down.$l
Entries.winter_Fri2: Are you friends with Linus? He lives in a tent up in the mountains.#$e#Everyone ignores him, the poor guy. He's actually really nice... Just a little odd.#$e#It must be so cold to live in a tent this time of year.
Entries.winter_Fri6: George doesn't go outside of his house as much as he used to. I hope everything's okay.$u
Entries.winter_Sun6: I have to hide most of the money I make from my job. Otherwise, my mom might drink it away.$s#$e#My mom still loves me. She doesn't do it all the time, but it has happened before.
Entries.winter_Sun10: Sometime soon, we should go back to my place in the evening and cozy up together with a book.$h#$e#If you can make it, just try to show up before 8. I don't want my mom to come home early and make things awkward.
Entries.spring_1_2: It's a bright new start to the year! I hope the morning was nice for you.$h
Entries.spring_12: We decorated a few eggs earlier this week in preparation for the egg festival.#$e#Are you going to be there, too?
Entries.spring_23: I have pleasant memories of the flower dance.#$e#I imagine the dance would seem a little old-fashioned for a newcomer, but the steps are really easy to learn.
Entries.summer_10: Mmm... I can already almost taste the food at tomorrow's luau.#$e#I just hope no one ruins the soup this year...$a#$e#That's one reason why I don't hang out with Sam as much as I used to.$a
Entries.fall_15: I love the Stardew Valley fair.#$b#Those carnival games can be a little tough for the kids, though.#$e#Maybe you can win a prize, @.
Entries.fall_26: Spirit's Eve used to scare me when I was little. These days, though, I enjoy it.#$e#Everyone's got to be a little adventurous from time to time, right?$h
Entries.winter_7: Snow really brings out the child in everyone. Tomorrow's festival should be a lot of fun.
Entries.winter_24: Tomorrow's the big day! It's the most magical day of the year.$h#$e#Watching the expressions on the kids' faces when they open their presents is really special.
Entries.winter_28: Happy new year...! ...tomorrow!$h#$e#I wonder what's in store for our little town this coming year.
Entries.spring_12_2: We decorated a few eggs earlier this week in preparation for the egg festival.#$e#Are you going to be there, too?
Entries.summer_10_2: Mmm... I can already almost taste the food at tomorrow's luau.#$e#I just hope no one ruins the soup this year...$a#$e#That's one reason why I don't hang out with Sam as much as I used to.$a
Entries.fall_15_2: I love the Stardew Valley Fair.#$b#Those carnival games can be a little tough for the kids, though.#$e#Maybe you can win a prize, @.
Entries.fall_26_2: Spirit's Eve used to scare me when I was little. These days, though, I enjoy it.#$e#Everyone's got to be a little adventurous from time to time, right?$h
Entries.winter_7_2: Snow really brings out the child in everyone. Tomorrow's festival should be a lot of fun.
Entries.winter_24_2: Tomorrow's the big day! It's the most magical day of the year.$h#$e#Watching the expressions on the kids' faces when they open their presents is really special.
Entries.winter_28_2: Happy new year...! ...tomorrow!$h#$e#I wonder what's in store for our little town this coming year.

Entries.Rainy_Day_0: #$c .5#On rainy days my thoughts always drift toward cinnamon and cookies.#It's quite a trek to get to the library in the rain, but it's worth the extra distance if I get to live here.
Entries.Rainy_Day_1: I wonder if Maru and Dr. Harvey will ever get together? I'm sure Harvey likes her...#$e#$c .5#...but I think their age gap makes both of them indecisive.#I think Maru will have to make the first move, though.$h
Entries.Rainy_Day_2: #$c .5#Hi, honey! I did some shopping this morning and got this for you.[186 180 770 535]#Oh right! I picked this up yesterday, but I forgot about it.[186 180 770 535] I thought you could use one of these.
Entries.Rainy_Day_3: Hmm... maybe I should experiment with a new recipe. You liked the last recipe I made, didn't you, honey?#$e#What was it called... 'Chili de @'?
Entries.Rainy_Day_4: #$c .5#On days like this, I love to curl up with a good book.#A good book and some tea. Mmm, that sounds wonderful right now.$h
Entries.Rainy_Night_0: #$c .5#How was your day, honey? I spent my afternoon reading a novel.#I know some people find fulfillment, reading between the lines of a book for a deeper meaning. Me, I just find joy in the story itself.
Entries.patio_Penny: #$c .5#This is a lot more peaceful than my old spot in town. I'm very happy here.#Care to join me for a bit? ...Or, I guess you must have a lot to do, right?
Entries.Rainy_Night_1: #$c .5#I'm sure Mom's at the saloon right now... But I don't feel so bad about it anymore. It's out of my hands.#Has my mother been nice to you lately? You know what they say, 'When you marry someone, you marry into the whole family.'
Entries.Rainy_Night_2: #$c .5#I was just thinking about that night we met in the bathhouse. I'll never forget that night...$l#Hm, I didn't finish all the grading I'd hoped. Maybe I can wing it first thing in the morning.$s
Entries.Rainy_Night_3: #$c .5#The sound of rain used to bother me, when I lived in that old metal trailer. But it's quite soothing here.#I hope Vincent and Jas are nice and snug in their beds, too.
Entries.Rainy_Night_4: #$c .5#I felt like making a nice dinner. I hope you like it. [212 214 225 209 200]$h#I think I've gotten a little better at cooking, if I say so myself. [212 214 225 209 200]Dig in!$h
Entries.Indoor_Day_0: #$c .5#It's so peaceful here. I used to have the most horrific nightmares, but now I sleep like a baby.#Growing up, I always wondered about this farm. Who knew I would actually live here someday?
Entries.Indoor_Day_1: #$c .5#Good morning! I made you a hot breakfast.[195 210 211] It's important to me that you leave here with a full belly.$h#Good morning! I woke up hungry, so I made enough for two. Enjoy![195 210 211]
Entries.Indoor_Day_2: #$c .5#You know, I think I'll read a book today. I picked up something new from the library last time I was there.#Gunther asked me to say hi. Do you know if we have anything to donate?
Entries.Indoor_Day_3: #$c .5#I love to hear about all the artifacts you've found. To think... there may have been farmers at this very spot 10,000 years ago.#I got a brand new book from the library. It's always exciting when there's a new shipment.$h
Entries.Indoor_Day_4: #$c .5#Was I shy when we first met? It's funny to think about, now that we've come so far.$h#Just wanted to say... I love the way you look this morning.$h
Entries.Indoor_Night_0: #$c .5#Good evening, honey. Did you accomplish everything you wanted to today? If not, that's okay. We've got all the time in the world!#When the light's dim, you have these little glowing stars in your eyes. You're so lovely.$l
Entries.Indoor_Night_1: #$c .5#Hmm... skirt or pants tomorrow? Oh, who am I kidding... I always go with the skirt.#So this is what happily ever after feels like.$l
Entries.Indoor_Night_2: #$c .5#We should always try and remember those less fortunate than us. I'm just very grateful for what we have.#Phew. Did I mention? Over the last week, Vincent wouldn't stop pummeling me with little kid questions about married life.
Entries.Indoor_Night_3: Mom's probably pretty lonely now that I'm gone. I just hope she doesn't visit the saloon more to make up for it.#$e#You shouldn't feel bad! Mom has to solve her own problems.
Entries.Indoor_Night_4: #$c .5#Ready to tuck in? I made the bed and everything...#Hee hee. I can, um, finish this chapter later if you wanted to head to bed.$l
Entries.Outdoor_0: I only ever dreamed of living in such a beautiful place, and now it's come true.#$e#$c .5#I realize how much I was missing before you moved into town.$l#I was so miserable back home.$s
Entries.Outdoor_1: #$c .5#Isn't this a perfect place to raise children? I would've been so happy growing up on a farm.#I understand that you have to get straight to work, honey. Will you be home early tonight, though?
Entries.Outdoor_2: #$c .5#Hey. Are you going to be shipping anything unusual today?#Hi, honey! If I knew more about farm work I'd help you out more. Sorry!#$e#I'll be thinking of you.$h
Entries.Outdoor_3: #$c .5#I just saw a songbird flying due west. In Stardew Valley that's a very good omen.$h#I think I'll do a little reading out here on the porch.$h
Entries.Outdoor_4: #$c .5#Ahh... It feels great to be outside. I could spend all day right here, observing every little thing.#Oh! I just had a good lesson idea for Jas and Vincent. I'm trying to mull over the details.
Entries.OneKid_0: #$c .5#Have you had any time to play with our little one today? Maybe a second child will make things better.#Oh right. My mom visited yesterday to spend some time with %kid1. It's kind of surreal, getting to see that nurturing side of her personality.
Entries.OneKid_1: #$c .5#The kids don't allow me quite as much time for reading as I used to have. Maybe I'll have to settle for audiobooks.#Little %kid1 is going to have such a great childhood here.
Entries.OneKid_3: I feel a lot older now that we have a child. Maybe it's just this new responsibility weighing on me.#$e#It's not bad! I've wanted this for a long time.
Entries.TwoKids_0: #$c .5#The kids keep me so busy, but I want to make sure I'm not neglecting you. ...How are you?#I already gave %kid1 and %kid2 their food. They're such hungry children!
Entries.TwoKids_1: #$c .5#The kids love it if you sing to them. They just pause and get so attentive. It's so precious.$h#We have to make sure and give %kid1 a lot of attention now that we have %kid2. We don't want any jealousy between them.
Entries.TwoKids_2: #$c .5#Kids don't stay in their cribs forever. I'm trying to enjoy every moment with them.#I've had this dream that %kid2 grew wings and flew into the night sky. What does it mean?
Entries.TwoKids_3: #$c .5#A nice house, two wonderful kids, and a beautiful plot of land. We're so very fortunate.#With the way I grew up, I never really thought I'd amount to much. But seeing our children like this makes me feel so lucky.$l
Entries.funLeave_Penny: #$c .5#Today's not a work day. I just need some time outside today.#I'm going to head into town today, just for fun. I'll be back in a while!
Entries.funReturn_Penny: #$c .5#I had a nice time... It's good to stay in contact with everyone. Tell me about your day.#A lot of people were out and about. I'm glad I was able to chat with a few of them.
Entries.spring_1: We've got a long, warm year to look forward to. Let's make it a productive one.
Entries.spring_4: Spring is probably my favorite season. There's a certain freshness in the air that fills me with hope.
Entries.spring_12: School's off today. I'll be heading into town for the egg festival. Are you coming, too?
Entries.spring_16: Ah, the 'spring cleaning'... I'm actually going to enjoy this.
Entries.spring_19: It's really nice seeing my mom proud of me. I wondered, briefly, if she'd be jealous of me.#$b#But that turned out not to be a problem!$h
Entries.spring_26: I've got an art project that Jas and Vincent are going to love, using some flowers left over from the festival.#$b#I'm really looking forward to it.$h
Entries.summer_9: Reading an actual printed book is so different from using an e-reader. It's about the texture of the pages...#$b#...the sounds they make as you turn them, and the way your memory associates each part of the story with how many pages are behind you.#$e#I know my books may take up an entire shelf, but it's worth it.$h
Entries.summer_10: Those full-classroom teachers must really be enjoying their summer break right now.#$e#Oh well. To be honest, every day feels like summer break here, even if I have to go to work.$h
Entries.summer_19: I've never really been drunk, to be honest. Maybe a little tipsy, once, but I can't say I even enjoyed the experience.$s#$e#Just... too many negative connotations.$s#$e#Not everyone needs to have every experience under their belt, you know?$u
Entries.summer_23: I'll be honest. I don't really have a clear lesson in mind for teaching today. I'll probably just wing it.#$e#It'll be fine. I've been doing this long enough.
Entries.fall_10: I wonder what Jas and Vincent will be when they're all grown up.#$e#They're the only students I've ever had. I know that's not normal for a teacher.
Entries.fall_12: Sometimes, I wonder if my mother will meet someone and fall in love again. I kind of doubt it, though.
Entries.fall_16: No school today, of course. Will I see you at the Stardew Valley Fair?
Entries.fall_19: I got to catch up with Maru yesterday. It's weird that we're in different phases of our lives now.#$b#But she's just as good a friend as ever.$h
Entries.winter_5: The falling snow reminds me of grandma, rocking by the fire. I mostly remember her shadow flickering against the orange wood. That was long ago.
Entries.winter_9: It's been so long since Nora Sealy released any new books. I wonder if she's ever even going to get around to it.$s#$e#Sorry, just thinking out loud. I'm sure I'll find something to read today.
Entries.winter_12: I wonder if Vincent will ever learn to enjoy reading...$s#$e#It's just not enough for me to teach him skills he'll never use. I want him to find joy in it.#$b#Plus, I don't want to let Jodi down.
Entries.winter_16: Brr... Such a long walk in the snow, to get to school this morning.$s#$e#Yep, out here in the country, I guess we still walk uphill both ways.#$e#...$h
Entries.winter_26: I think I've had enough of the snow for a while. I hope it melts soon.#$e#It's getting a bit slushy out there, anyway.
Entries.winter_28: I baked a cake for New Year's tonight. Be sure to be back home early so we can celebrate! [220 221]$h

Entries.Mon2: How is the farm?#$e#I think we could really have a nice business setup, you and me.#$b#So I hope you stick around!
Entries.Mon4: Hi, @. Need any seeds or fruit tree saplings?
Entries.Mon6: Caroline and I met in school. We never actually dated anyone besides each other.#$e#I know, it's a little unconventional. But it's worked so far!$h
Entries.Mon8: $d Joja#Well, at least some residents of our town believe in supporting local businesses. ...*sigh*$s|I'll admit, work's actually a little more fun without JojaMart around. ...It all seems like it matters again, knowing it won't end in ruin, y'know?
Entries.Tue2: Hey, glad to see you again!#$e#Thanks for supporting the local economy!
Entries.Tue4: If we look out for one another, that's how our community will make it in the long run.#$e#Anyway, would you like to buy anything?$h
Entries.Tue10: $d Joja#Apparently, the mom-and-pop grocer in Grampleton closed not too long ago. I wonder when it's gonna be my turn?$s|I did some research. Turns out JojaMart was selling at quite a loss. Their general strategy isn't even to turn a profit until after the local businesses are extinguished.
Entries.Wed6: #$1 pierre1#*sigh*... No matter how well the business does, it's never enough to satisfy my desire for success. What's wrong with me? Maybe I'm just bored with domestic life.$s#$e#Some day I'm going to open a new shop in the city and make a killing.#$e#Unfortunately, business is so slow I can hardly save any money...$s
Entries.Wed10: Hey, mind if you watch the counter for a few hours, while I go and work on your farm?#$e#Haha, just kidding.$h#$e#...*sigh*$s
Entries.Thu4: Hey, @. You're my number one customer!
Entries.Thu6: $d Joja#I support a free market as much as anyone, but who exactly is it 'free' for when Joja holds the kind of power it has?$s|Just another beautiful day in the neighborhood!
Entries.Thu8: It's easier to keep in a positive mood when there are more familiar faces dropping in.#$e#So... thanks for visiting!$h
Entries.Fri4: With her online classes, Abigail's already formally more educated than I've ever been. I'm proud of her.#$e#I started out as a courtesy clerk as a kid, and then I worked my way up until I could open this store.
Entries.Fri6: I've thought about writing stories to pass the time. Nothing really gets me inspired, though.#$e#I don't know how Elliott does what he does.#$e#Maybe I need a change of scenery.
Entries.Fri8: $d Joja#Everything that Morris does is technically legal, but it doesn't change the fact that he sees our town for its money and nothing else.$3|My stress nightmares about JojaMart have finally stopped. ...Did I tell you I'd been having nightmares? Yeah, that was a thing.
Entries.Sat2: I like it best if I can sell produce that's local.#$e#I just want to do what I can that's right by the environment.#$e#Plus, there are no shipping costs when it's local.
Entries.Sat4: Sometimes, operating a small business really takes it out of you.#$b#But I wonder, what would this community be like without my store?
Entries.Sat6: Sometimes it's tough making dinner conversation with my family. At the end of the day, all that's on my mind are order forms, profits, sales...$s#$e#I guess I can see how that'd be boring...$s#$b#But at any rate, a man has to do what's necessary for his family, regardless of whether they can appreciate it or not.
Entries.Sun2: Thanks for stopping in!$h#$e#I hope your day goes well.
Entries.Sun4: Providing basic necessities to the people of this community... That's worth a legacy, isn't it?
Entries.Sun6: I sometimes wonder... what percentage of my life will I spend behind this counter?$s
Entries.Sun8: $d Joja#Can a community have a soul? I want to believe in this place, but it's difficult when it seems like people's wallets are their number-one priority.$s|I feel very lucky. In the end, it looks like Pelican Town is a special place after all!
Entries.summer_1: I've got summer seeds available! You'd better stock up.
Entries.summer_Tue: JojaMart doesn't even have lower prices than we do, unless you count those 50% off coupons that they're always handing out.$3#$e#You've never gotten one, huh? Yeah, neither have I. Makes sense why.
Entries.summer_Tue6: Ugh... It's so hot in here.
Entries.summer_Thu6: Abigail will always be my little girl. It was love at first sight, when I saw her for the first time.
Entries.summer_Fri6: Summer is a good time to eat a refreshing salad, don't you think?
Entries.fall_1: Fall seeds are here! Crops don't grow in winter so this is your last shot until spring.#$b#Better go all out, huh?
Entries.fall_Mon4: I just can't really get into following gridball.#$e#Ha ha, go Tunnelers, I guess! Right?
Entries.fall_Mon8: I heard there was a big sportsball game last night.#$e#Joseph Sports ran all the yards and scored the goal.#$e#...$h
Entries.fall_Mon_inlaw_Abigail: Hello, er... my son?$s^Hello, er... daughter?$s
Entries.fall_Mon4_inlaw_Abigail: Hi, @. How's Abigail doing? Tell her that we've been missing her around here.
Entries.fall_Sun: Hi there. Is your farm still doing well?#$e#Maybe a few of my seeds will spruce things up.$h
Entries.fall_Sun2: I'm happy to buy whatever you produce on the farm.#$e#Yes, I do resell it for a profit... but that's the benefit of being an established shop owner.#$e#Don't get any ideas...
Entries.fall_Sun4: It's starting to get cold outside...#$b#That means more people come into the shop to warm up... hehe.
Entries.fall_Sun8: If I didn't have this shop to run I would be outside right now...#$e#The leaves look great and the mushrooms are sprouting.
Entries.winter_1: You can't grow any crops during winter... so I have no seeds to offer you.#$e#It's really going to cut into our profits.
Entries.winter_Mon4: I just can't really get into following gridball.#$e#Ha ha, go Tunnelers, I guess! Right?
Entries.winter_Mon8: The thing about gridball is that it's all about giving it 110%.#$e#The other team only gave it 108%, though, so that's why they didn't score more goal points.#$e#Hehehe... sorry.$h
Entries.winter_Mon_inlaw_Abigail: Hello, er... my son?$s^Hello, er... daughter?$s
Entries.winter_Mon4_inlaw_Abigail: I used to worry about Abigail's future, but I can see that she's wound up exactly where she needs to be.#$e#You be good to each other now, alright?$h
Entries.winter_Wed: #$1 pierreDin#I'm going to surprise Caroline tonight with dinner and a bottle of Stardew Red. Don't tell anyone! Finally, a day of relaxation.$k#$e#
Entries.winter_Thu2: I mainly deal in edibles, so if you've got any ores or wood you'd better try selling them somewhere else.
Entries.winter_Thu4: Is it just me or is there a cold draft in here?
Entries.winter_Thu6: Caroline really is wonderful. I don't think I could last through this cold season without her.
Entries.winter_Sat: If I didn't have this shop to run I would be outside right now.#$e#It would be fun to throw a snowball.
Entries.winter_Sat6: Is it just me or is there a cold draft in here?
Entries.winter_Sat8: #$1 pierre2#Does Abigail look anything like me? Don't tell my wife, but sometimes I wonder if I'm really the father.$k$s#$e#Don't tell my wife, but I hate to cook dinner.
Entries.spring_12: Tomorrow's the egg festival! I'll have some special seeds that are on sale only at the festival, so be sure to save some cash!
Entries.spring_23: I'm going to have a kiosk open at the flower dance tomorrow, with some exclusive items. Be sure to swing by!
Entries.fall_15: I'm feelin' pretty good about my grange display for tomorrow.$h#$b#Though I do welcome the competition.
Entries.fall_26: I'll be selling rare goods again at the Spirit's Eve festival. I hope you'll come and take a look!
Entries.winter_28: Happy new year, @. Thanks for stopping in.
Entries.spring_1_2: Aha! I figured you'd come by. Better get some seeds into the ground, huh?
Entries.spring_12_2: Tomorrow's the egg festival! I'll have some special seeds that are on sale only at the festival, so be sure to save some cash!
Entries.spring_23_2: I'm going to have a kiosk open at the flower dance tomorrow, with some exclusive items. Be sure to swing by!
Entries.fall_15_2: I'm feelin' pretty good about my grange display for tomorrow.$h#$b#Though I do welcome the competition.
Entries.fall_26_2: I'll be selling rare goods again at the Spirit's Eve festival. I hope you'll come and take a look!
Entries.winter_28_2: Happy new year, @. Thanks for stopping in.

Entries.Abigail: #$c .5#The valley looks more interesting in the rain... don't you think?#The lake's a beautiful place to visit when the weather's like this.
Entries.Robin: #$c .5#The rain doesn't stop me from getting a job done! ...Although soggy wood isn't a joy to work with.#Your roof isn't leaking, is it? Let me know if it that ever happens.
Entries.Demetrius: #$c .5#Greetings. Stay inside if you want to keep warm.#The low acidity of this rain should be good for your crops.
Entries.Maru: #$c .5#When it rains I have a good excuse to work on my gadgets all day. ...It must be kind of boring for you, though.#Ah, another rainy day, just like I predicted.
Entries.Sebastian: #$c .5#If you're lucky, you might see a frog in this weather.#Looks like a good day for some ocean gazing.
Entries.Linus: #$c .5#A warm rain is a pleasant way to get clean.$h#It looks like the rain doesn't bother you much, either.
Entries.Pierre: #$c .5#Most people stay indoors on days like this... It's not good for business.$s#I'm glad you made it here in the rain. The shop's been really quiet.
Entries.Caroline: #$c .5#My garden is happy today... And our water bill will be lower this month.#I hope the sun comes out soon. What did the weather report say today?
Entries.Alex: #$c .5#Hmmph. This is not good weather for sports, but... oh well, I can always lift weights inside.#Nothing like a hardcore game of mud gridball. As long as you've got buddies who are up for playing.
Entries.George: #$c .5#It's awful cold, isn't it? What a rotten day.#Why do I even bother getting out of bed when the day looks like this?
Entries.Evelyn: #$c .5#I think the roof might be leaking. In the old days, George would've scampered right up and fixed it... *sigh*$s#These days affect my energy a lot more than they used to...$s
Entries.Lewis: #$c .5#Hi there. Taking a break? Seems like a good time for one.#Goodness, I hope the river doesn't overflow...$s
Entries.Clint: #$c .5#Today would be a good day to explore the mines... Who knows, you might find some rare ores.#My shop feels even more isolated when it's raining.
Entries.Penny: #$c .5#The raindrops are really loud on the roof of our home. ...It's soothing, though.#Looks like a good day to curl up with one of my favorite books.$h
Entries.Pam: #$c .5#Howdy, kid. Stayin' dry?#Heh. Guess I'll warm up with a nice pint tonight.
Entries.Emily: #$c .5#It never rains in Calico Desert... That's where my friend Sandy lives. Wish I could've visited her today.#If you stand in the rain and listen carefully, the raindrops sound like little whispered conversations.
Entries.Haley: #$c .5#I spent all morning doing my hair... now the rain could mess it up. *sigh* ... Life is hard sometimes.$s#Yikes. No offense, but you are soaked.
Entries.Sam: #$c .5#Rain muffles sound, so I can play my guitar louder without my Mom getting mad. Hehe.$h#It feels kinda badass to walk through the rain without letting it faze you.
Entries.Leah: #$c .5#Maybe I should cook something new and exciting today. Something spicy.#I always look forward to how the forest looks all glisteny after the sun returns.
Entries.Shane: #$c .5#Hmm... this weather makes me thirsty.$u#Oh joy. Another rainy day.$s
Entries.Marnie: #$c .5#Hey there. You look like you're soaked...you poor thing!$h#Hey @. You don't have any critters stuck outside, right?
Entries.Elliott: Sometimes when I lie in bed I can hear a distant foghorn cut through the rain.#$b#But when I look out the window I see only a curtain of gray.
Entries.Gus: #$c .5#There's nothing like a glass of dry red wine on a day like this, huh? Hehehe, I love my job.#Need something to warm you up tonight? Don't be shy!
Entries.Dwarf: #$c .5#Rain... It's almost mythical to us. Some of us dwarves live our entire lives without ever experiencing it.#Humans seem to complain about rain, yet you choose to live on the surface. Why is that?
Entries.Wizard: #$c .5#Stormy days are the only time I can commune with certain elementals. I don't expect you to understand.#If you have extra time on days like these, why not enter the mines and slay a few monsters?
Entries.Harvey: #$c .5#Hi there. Er... Read anything interesting in the library lately?#Days like these make me hungry for a hot meal. How about you?
Entries.Krobus: #$c .5#Ah, the sewers are flowing quickly today. It'll get nice and humid in here... Just how I like it.#Rain is truly a lifegiving force. Give thanks to Yoba today.

Entries.cc_Begin: Oh, that old Community Center? Yeah, I would fix it up, but Lewis hasn't really been clear with me what he wants to do with it, exactly.
Entries.Mon: Hey there, @.#$e#I was just daydreaming about some new carpentry projects.#$e#Are you doing OK at your place? How's the woodwork in your cottage holding up?
Entries.Mon2: Have I told you that I built our house from the ground up?#$e#It's definitely been the highlight of my career so far.
Entries.Mon4: Nahh, I don't go into the mines all that much. Too dark and dangerous.#$e#Let me know if you find anything neat down there, though.
Entries.Mon6: Demetrius's work technically brought us out here. I'd say it's worked out pretty well, though.
Entries.Tue2: There used to be some great buildings on your farm, but they're all gone now.#$e#I'd love to help restore the farm anew. Just let me know what I can do.
Entries.Tue4: Leah's got a good handle on woodworking, too. I just prefer to make things with a little more practical use.
Entries.Tue6: Demetrius may be a bit stoic, with his scientific brain, but I learned pretty quickly how to get through to his romantic side.#$e#I did teach him how to dance with me, after all.$h
Entries.Tue8: I must say, you've certainly been quite a support for our business since you moved into town.$h
Entries.Wed: Hey, how are things going?#$q 604/605/606 Wed_old#Are you settling in okay?#$r 604 0 Wed_604#So far so good.#$r 605 0 Wed_605#I'm alright, just overwhelmed.#$r 604 0 Wed_604#This place is refreshing.#$r 606 -10 Wed_606#This place sucks. Why am I here?
Entries.Wed_old: $p 006#I hope things are starting to get better.|Be sure to drop in anytime.
Entries.Wed_604: I'm glad to hear it. Let me know if you need anything.$h
Entries.Wed_605: Hang in there. It'll get better.#$b#Remember, we didn't even have a house when we first moved out here. I'm sure you'll land on your feet soon, too.
Entries.Wed_606: Oh gosh, I didn't realize it was that bad.$s#$b#Thank you for being honest. Please know you're never alone here. We're all on your side.
Entries.Wed2: When we first moved here, we had to rough it out in a trailer until I could get the house finished.#$e#Demetrius had a separate trailer for his lab.
Entries.Wed4: Do you have some good furniture for your home yet?#$e#I just can't imagine coming home to a house that I don't love.#$e#Sorry, I mean, whatever works for you though, right?$h
Entries.Wed8: Sebastian's father? He was a good guy. Things just didn't work out.#$e#We were both very young.
Entries.Thu2: Have you tried reaching out to Sebastian yet?
Entries.Thu4: I hear strange electrical noises coming from Maru's room from time to time.#$e#I always wondered whether her interests would take after me or Demetrius. Guess it was a little of both.$h
Entries.Thu6: I met Demetrius in college while working an apprenticeship and raising Sebastian.#$e#My head still spins when I wonder how we managed to find time for it all!
Entries.Thu8: Sometimes, I wonder if Sebastian passively resents me for not having his father around.$s#$e#Maybe he feels like Maru's got it all, and he lives in her shadow...$s
Entries.Thu10: @, it's great to see you!$h#$e#Having you as a neighbor has been one of the best things that's happened to us since we moved here.
Entries.Fri2: Sam comes over occasionally to play games with Sebastian. Maybe they'll invite you join them sometime.
Entries.Fri_inlaw_Maru: I did think you and Maru would get along well. It really makes me happy to see the two of you together.
Entries.Fri8: It's strange. I don't feel old enough to be the mother of two adult-aged children.#$e#Life just gets faster and faster as you go, I guess.
Entries.Sat4: Ugh, I wish Sebastian wouldn't smoke.$s#$e#I don't even know where he picked that up from.$s
Entries.Sat6: Demetrius is usually laid back about everything, with the exception of anything Maru-related.#$e#That's the one area in which you really have to earn his trust.#$e#Sorry if he's ever said anything standoffish. It's not just you.
Entries.Sat8: Out here, I get a little more flexibility to do the projects that interest me.#$e#I don't think I'd get that kind of freedom working in the city.
Entries.summer_Tue6: Mmm, I'm craving a ripe peach. Do you have any on your farm?
Entries.summer_Tue10: Have you tried anything creative with note and drum blocks yet?#$e#Remember that you can change the tones on them.
Entries.summer_Wed: I'll work in the direct sun if I need to. Don't worry, I've got some of the heaviest-duty sunscreen you can find.
Entries.summer_Wed8: What? You're worried I work too late on my construction projects? No, I take plenty of breaks throughout the day.#$b#Just not when you're looking, I guess.$h#$e#Besides, it takes a lot of work to build as quickly as I do.
Entries.summer_Fri_inlaw_Sebastian: Has Sebastian been getting outside much lately?#$e#Make sure you two take good care of each other!$h
Entries.summer_Fri_inlaw_Maru: Has Maru been tinkering around with anything neat lately?#$e#Make sure you two take good care of each other!$h
Entries.fall_Mon4: Has Maru showed you any of her latest projects yet?
Entries.fall_Mon8: It was about when Maru became a teenager that I knew she was something else with machines.#$e#As a kid, she would always take apart our electronics, though she couldn't always put them back together.#$e#But eventually, she reached a point where she'd put them back together in her own way, with modifications.#$b#I'm really proud of how advanced she's become.
Entries.fall_Thu8: When things work out for us, it's our duty to help others in need.#$b#Don't you think so, too?
Entries.fall_Fri6: Hardwood is tough to come by, but there's nothing better to work with.#$e#I don't suppose you have any extra lying around, do you?$h
Entries.winter_Mon6: Do you like your fireplace? Let me know if you ever want to remodel it.#$e#The right fireplace makes the biggest difference in making a room's appearance come together.
Entries.winter_Mon8: I've always had a passion for building things, even when I was a kid.#$e#Sometimes I'd get a "look" from others about my hobbies. I just didn't let it bother me.
Entries.winter_Wed: I think I need a little me-time. A visit to the hot spring might be in order.#$e#Do you ever go?
Entries.winter_Wed6: Architecture styles and home fashions might come and go, but they all have one goal in mind: to make a better place to live.#$e#Humanity has always sought a better place to live. It's as old as history itself. So I enjoy the feel of that connection in my work.
Entries.winter_Fri_inlaw_Maru: Is Maru staying cozy over at your place?#$e#Be sure to tell her to visit soon!
Entries.winter_Sat8: As a girl, I remember looking up how to make a real igloo and then putting it together.#$e#It turned out pretty good! I acted as foreman and put a couple of my friends to work.$h
Entries.winter_15: I thought we might head down as a family to that Night Market on one of these nights.#$e#I don't know if I can get Sebastian to go, though...
Entries.summer_27: I don't think I'll ever get tired of seeing the moonlight jellies with Demetrius.#$e#I hope you can make it, too.
Entries.fall_15: The Stardew Valley Fair is really something else. I hope you'll put together a grange display for us to see!
Entries.winter_28: Another year down. Another couple decades of this and I'll be old.#$e#I'll keep doing what I'm doing for many years, though.$h
Entries.spring_1_2: Happy springtime! Hey, now's a good time to let me know of any projects you might have for me.
Entries.winter_15_2: I thought we might head down as a family to that Night Market on one of these nights.#$e#I don't know if I can get Sebastian to go, though...
Entries.summer_27_2: I don't think I'll ever get tired of seeing the moonlight jellies with Demetrius.#$e#I hope you can make it, too.
Entries.fall_15_2: The Stardew Valley Fair is really something else. I hope you'll put together a grange display for us to see!
Entries.winter_28_2: Another year down. Another couple decades of this and I'll be old.#$e#I'll keep doing what I'm doing for many years, though.$h

Entries.Mon2: Hey, how's it going?#$e#Last night I practiced guitar for 4 hours straight. My fingers hurt like crazy.$s#$e#Bye, I've got something to do...
Entries.Mon4: I got into skateboarding when I was a little kid.#$e#It's rewarding to do the same hobby as an adult, though. You really end up viewing it in a whole new light.
Entries.Tue2: Hey, @.#$e#So, do you play any video games?
Entries.Tue4_2: I tried fixing a bowl of cereal for my dad, but as soon as I poured milk on it, he flipped out. What was up with that?$s
Entries.Tue8: Sometimes I look at other people and notice how everyone changes. Some people I grew up with just aren't the same.#$e#It sucks to have to leave behind those parts of your childhood. Why does everyone settle for it?
Entries.Tue8_2: Sometimes I look at other people and notice how everyone changes. Some people I grew up with just aren't the same.#$e#It sucks to have to leave behind those parts of your childhood. Why does everyone settle for it?
Entries.Wed: I'm trying to come up with a new song for my band, but I'm blanking...#$q 319/320 Wed_old#Hey.. What do you think my new song should be about?#$r 320 30 Wed_320#Farming, mining, and chopping wood.#$r 8820 30 Wed_320#A city in the sea.#$r 8821 30 Wed_320#Trains.#$r 319 -50 Wed_319#Choose anything. It'll still be a horrible song.
Entries.Wed_old: $p 319#But I already know what you think about it.$a|Thanks to your help I'm already done with the lyrics!$h
Entries.Wed_319: Hey, man... what the heck is your problem? Sorry I asked.$a
Entries.Wed_320: Hey, you know what? That sounds perfect. Thanks!$h
Entries.Thu_2: Well, my Dad is back. You've met him, right?#$b#I'm just glad he's okay.
Entries.Thu2_2: Well, my Dad is back. You've met him, right?#$b#I'm just glad he's okay.
Entries.Thu4: I think my Dad might be coming back in a year or so.#$e#I guess you might be able to meet him, then. If you're still living here.#$e#You wouldn't abandon the farm after putting so much effort into it!
Entries.Thu4_2: ...I have mixed feelings about my father being back. He seems strange.$s#$b#But I guess I haven't seen him in 3 years... so that could explain it.
Entries.Thu8: I'm amazed we've made friends with each other as quickly as we have! You are seriously the best person ever, @!
Entries.Thu8_2: Hey, if you get to talking with my dad, just uh... show him some support, if it's not too much to ask.#$e#He doesn't really like talking about himself around me, so maybe it's easier if you're not as close?$s
Entries.Fri2: I miss the city sometimes, but if I moved there again, I'd end up working around the clock just to get by.#$e#I wonder which is more worth it?
Entries.Fri10: The older I get the more attached I feel to the valley.#$b#Although I could be biased... for a certain reason.$l#$e#So, how are you doing today?$h
Entries.Sat2: I picked up guitar just a few years ago. It came to me pretty naturally.#$e#I've still had to practice a lot, though. There's 'good,' but then there's 'actually good,' y'know?$h
Entries.Sat4: Oh! I just remembered I'm supposed to call my Grandma. Okay, I'm going to put this rubber band on my wrist so I don't forget.#$e#I have to make little reminders for myself or else I'll totally forget to do things.$h
Entries.Sat6: Abby came up with a cool drum solo. I just have to figure out how to incorporate it into one of our songs.#$e#I didn't think too much of Abby when I was younger, but it turns out she's really creative.
Entries.Sat8: Abby came up with a cool drum solo. I just have to figure out how to incorporate it into one of our songs.#$e#I didn't think too much of Abby when I was younger, but it turns out she's really creative.
Entries.Sat8_2: Having my dad back has been... even more different than I expected.$s#$e#I just don't know I'm supposed to act around him. Like, am I a kid again or am I a man?$s
Entries.Sun2: If I head outside, sometimes I start getting ideas for lyrics just popping into my head.#$e#You must like working outside a lot, huh?
Entries.Sun4: I've been experimenting with an effects pedal. It's a lot of fun, but we'll see if I can find a place for it in our band's music.#$e#If you create a sound that's just gimmicky, it ends up sounding cheesy. High risk, high reward, I guess.
Entries.Sun8: Sometimes I wonder if my mother is actually happy with her life...$s#$e#I asked her once and got the feeling she was hiding some inner pain.
Entries.summer_Mon: There's a little less pollen in the summer... my nose is really happy.
Entries.summer_Mon10: Getting to play in Zuzu City was a dream come true, but I feel like I've gotten that out of my system.#$e#My thoughts have been moving onto other things, lately.$l
Entries.summer_Tue6: Hmm, tomorrow morning should be a pancake day.#$e#I bet Vince would really like that.
Entries.summer_Tue10: Maybe I should learn how to cook#$b#You wouldn't mind being my taste tester, right?$h#$e#I dunno, I just thought it might be something you'd like.$l
Entries.summer_Wed6: $d Joja#Another shift at JojaMart today. Yay, another few hours of my life wasted.$s|If I work quickly, Gunther sometimes lets me off my shift early. Morris never would've let that slide.
Entries.summer_Thu: Dad was telling me one time about our national enemy, the Gotoro Empire... They sound like a ruthless bunch.
Entries.summer_Thu4: Sebastian has some pretty cool board games.#$b#A long time ago, I wasn't into board games, but he knows how to make them fun.$h
Entries.summer_Thu6: @, thanks for reaching out to me like you have. Things have been tough lately with my dad being gone.$s#$e#No news is good news, right? Gotta stay positive.
Entries.summer_Thu6_2: Sometimes I can hear my Dad pacing down the hallway at night.$s#$b#...But he won't tell us what's troubling him.
Entries.summer_Fri4: Oh man. I ate an entire large pizza at like... eleven last night.#$e#I just opened the fridge, and I was like, 'jackpot'!#$e#...Haha, nope, I feel fine.$h
Entries.summer_Fri6: I was homesick a lot when we first moved here, but that was ages ago.#$e#This is really the only home Vince has ever known. Seeing him fit in makes it easier for me, too.
Entries.summer_Fri10: I've been writing a song lately.#$e#It's uh... it's about you.#$e#Hey, c'mon, don't laugh!
Entries.summer_Sun2: Hey, having a good summer?#$e#Stop by my place if you're looking for somewhere to cool off.
Entries.summer_Sun4: Booyah! I got another set of lyrics cranked out last night!$h#$e#I'm on fire lately. Still lots of work to do, though, before we're ready to play live.
Entries.summer_Sun6: Hoo. I could go for some donuts right now.#$e#It doesn't matter what time of day it is. It's always donut time.
Entries.summer_Sun8: Ever notice how there are a ton of single old dudes in Pelican Town?$s#$e#It's just kinda weird, don't you think?$s
Entries.summer_Sun10: You know, I don't think I miss my old home anymore. It's fun to do a gig in Zuzu City, but I don't really have any urge to actually live there again.
Entries.fall_Mon2: I like taking walks in the forest this time of year. The temperature is so comfortable#$e#...$h
Entries.fall_Mon6: Band practice went awesome last week. Abby and Sebastian have been putting in a lot of hard work.
Entries.fall_Mon6_2: My dad? Yeah, I dunno. It's easier just to stay out of his way most of the time.
Entries.fall_Mon10: You're the best, @. I can't wait for my dad to meet you when he gets back.$l
Entries.fall_Mon10_2: I told my dad, "Look, Dad, you don't have to hide stuff from me. I'm not a kid anymore."$s#$b#For one second, he looked like he might actually open up, but then he just stood up, did this weird smirk, and walked away.$s#$e#I think he'll never give up wanting to protect me. If it hasn't happened now, it probably won't ever happen.$s
Entries.fall_Tue6: After Dad left for his tour, I made a conscious decision to give Vince the best childhood he can get.#$e#I realized, if I don't help make that happen for him, who else will?
Entries.fall_Tue8: I did a little cleaning up around the house to make things easier for my mom, but she doesn't actually seem any happier.#$e#She was thankful, but... I dunno. She's always saying that's her biggest source of stress. I'm not so sure, though.
Entries.fall_Wed4: My mom makes pretty awesome pizza, as long as she doesn't put any weird toppings on it.#$e#Don't tell her, but the pizza at the saloon is downright perfection. Gus knows his stuff.
Entries.fall_Wed6: I think I'm becoming a pizza purist. Toppings are nice, but if you get just the right blend of cheeses, that's all you really need.#$e#I wish I could cook.$s
Entries.fall_Wed8: Been cooking any pizza lately? Man, I could really go for a slice.
Entries.fall_Wed10: It's tough for me to focus on writing lyrics lately. I think some of my muse came from feeling isolated in this town.#$e#But that's... not really an issue anymore.$l
Entries.fall_Thu4: Hi @.#$e#Hmm... I wonder if I could grow a cactus in my room?
Entries.fall_Thu6: I think my Dad might be coming back next year.#$e#I guess that's kind of soon. Weird.
Entries.fall_Thu6_2: I guess I should start thinking about moving out soon...$s#$e#...But I would miss Mom's fish casserole, so I dunno...$s#$e#I hate making decisions.
Entries.fall_Fri6: ...I stayed up late playing games on my computer last night. I really wish I'd focused on writing some more lyrics.
Entries.fall_Fri8: I got my paycheck yesterday. Hmm... should I save it or should I spend it...
Entries.fall_Sat2: Hi @.#$e#Hmm.. I wonder if I could grow a cactus in my room?
Entries.fall_Sat4: I'm lucky to have the biggest room in the house to myself.#$e#I guess there's advantages to being the oldest child.
Entries.fall_Sat8: $d Joja#So glad I have the day off. Working at JojaMart's been really grating on me lately.|I was looking at the exhibit displays during my shift at the museum. We've got some pretty cool stuff in there.
Entries.fall_Sun2: Oh man, I scraped my knee so badly on my skateboard a couple days ago.#$e#Nahh, it doesn't hurt. Just a little battle damage.
Entries.fall_Sun6: It's hard to have fun on Sunday... I keep thinking about having to go to work tomorrow.$s
Entries.fall_Sun8: @, what gets you out of the Sunday-night blues? Y'know, when you have to go back to work the next day?#$e#Oh, right. You never take a day off.#$b#Well, you must really love what you do, then. I'm envious.$h
Entries.winter_Mon2: Everyone's indoors during the winter, so I can play guitar as loud as I want.$h
Entries.winter_Mon4: We had another good band practice this weekend! Things are coming along.$h#$e#Oh, don't worry, I'm definitely getting you tickets to our first show.
Entries.winter_Mon8: Vince is looking forward to the Feast of the Winter Star. I'm coming up with ideas for how to make it extra special for him this year.
Entries.winter_Mon10: Hey, if we lived together, would you get annoyed at me playing guitar too loud?#$e#There's no wrong answer. It'd be whatever worked for you.
Entries.winter_Tue8: Penny and I used to hang out a lot when we first moved here.#$e#We still hang out occasionally, and we've got this weird, almost... flirty? ...thing going, but we don't have a lot in common anymore.$s
Entries.winter_Tue8_inlaw_Penny: I'm glad things worked out for you and Penny! I always kinda wondered about her.$h
Entries.winter_Wed6: $d Joja#I know our jobs are kinda crap, but it'd be nice if Shane was a little friendlier at work to pass the time.|I wonder how Shane's doing? He always seemed like he hated his JojaMart job even more than I did.
Entries.winter_Wed10: Heyyy... you aren't... 'hiring' at your farm, or anything, are you?$l
Entries.winter_Thu4: I think my Dad is coming back this spring.#$e#It's been 3 years since I've seen him. This is going to be strange.
Entries.winter_Thu4_2: Dad's been back for a while now. I guess I'm finally getting used to it.
Entries.winter_Fri4: I'm hoping for some more dry, powdery snow before everything outside turns to slush.
Entries.winter_Fri6: Vince and I had an epic snowball fight yesterday. We're almost getting evenly matched.$h#$e#A couple more years, and I'll legitimately have to watch my back.
Entries.winter_Fri8: Snowboarding's a lot of fun, but I've only been a couple times. Too bad there aren't any good slopes nearby...
Entries.winter_Fri10: @! It's so good to see you!$h#$e#Give me a hug. ...Ooh! You're nice and warm!$l
Entries.winter_Sat6: After we moved here, Penny and I grew up together. Now she's my little brother's teacher. How does that even happen?#$e#Maybe it's high time I actually get a move on my life. Sebastian's got the right idea.#$e#You do, too, for that matter.
Entries.winter_Sun4: I caught Vince at the door with wet shoes. Glad I caught him before he went running into the kitchen.
Entries.winter_Sun6: Try not to make a mess in the house. My Mom's pretty OCD about keeping things clean.#$e#Hmm, I wonder if she actually has OCD for real...$s
Entries.winter_Sun10: Maybe if I moved out, my mom would finally be a little happier.#$e#I wonder if she's stressed just because she's worried about me?
Entries.spring_1_2: Hey @, pretty amazing start to the year, isn't it? I thought last year would never end.$h#$e#Thanks for stopping by.
Entries.spring_12: My little brother gets so excited for festivals. He's been talking about tomorrow's egg hunt all day.
Entries.spring_21: Sometimes those spring petals that float around make my nose drip.$s#$e#I like summer best, myself.
Entries.spring_23: Why couldn't the flower dance be today so I could get work off?$s
Entries.winter_7: One time, Gus fell in the river during the Ice Festival. We had to build a huge fire in the saloon to dry him out.#$e#We were all worried we'd never taste his famous spaghetti ever again.
Entries.fall_7: The first week of fall is already over. Man, that went by fast.$s#$e#Whatever. I'm just happy that you came to visit me!#$e#So do you have anything new to tell me?
Entries.fall_9: I ordered a new pair of shoes online. They're the same style so I know they'll fit right.
Entries.fall_16: I ordered some shoes online more than a week ago! Man, they're really taking a long time.#$e#I guess we must really live in the middle of nowhere.$s
Entries.fall_23: Ah, my feet feel great in these new shoes. They're a little crisp, but they'll break in. Especially after I run through the haunted maze this weekend.$h
Entries.fall_26: Tonight, after everyone is asleep, that weird old man who lives in the woods will set up the haunted maze. He always makes sure no one is around to see him working.
Entries.summer_10: I don't have to work tomorrow! I've never been so happy.$h
Entries.winter_24: The Feast of the Winter Star is supposed to be a time to show gratitude for all the good things in life.#$b#Me? I'm mostly interested in the food. Hehe.$h
Entries.winter_28: I've got a strange feeling about tonight. Something big is about to happen.#$e#I just hope it's a good something.
Entries.winter_28_2: Guess I'll stay up late with Vincent tonight. I figure there's only a limited number of times he'll want to do that.
Entries.spring_12_2: My little brother gets so excited for festivals. He's been talking about tomorrow's egg hunt all day.
Entries.spring_23_2: Why couldn't the flower dance be today so I could get work off?$s
Entries.winter_7_2: One time, Gus fell in the river during the Ice Festival. We had to build a huge fire in the saloon to dry him out.#$e#We were all worried we'd never taste his famous spaghetti ever again.
Entries.fall_7_2: The first week of fall is already over. Man, that went by fast.$s#$e#Whatever. I'm just happy that you came to visit me!#$e#So do you have anything new to tell me?
Entries.fall_26_2: Tonight, after everyone is asleep, that weird old man who lives in the woods will set up the haunted maze. He always makes sure no one is around to see him working.
Entries.summer_10_2: I don't have to work tomorrow! I've never been so happy.$h
Entries.winter_24_2: The Feast of the Winter Star is supposed to be a time to show gratitude for all the good things in life.#$b#Me? I'm mostly interested in the food. Hehe.$h

Entries.Rainy_Day_0: #$c .5#Might be a good day to sit back and jam on the guitar... Hey, you can relax too if you want.#Hey, sweet. Looks like good ol' nature's doing your work for you today. Take advantage of that!
Entries.Rainy_Day_1: #$c .5#Do you think Sebastian and Abigail will ever hook up? Heh... now that I'm married I'm trying to get everyone else married too.#Sebastian's a few years older than me. I never expected I'd beat him to the punch with tying the knot.
Entries.Rainy_Day_2: #$c .5#Hey, I found one of these rolling around in the back of a drawer. [90 88 86 535]I thought you might be able to use it.#Aw man, I was gonna go skateboarding today.$s
Entries.Rainy_Day_3: #$c .5#Aw, man. These cloudy days are kind of a drag...$7#Maybe today's a good day for me to give Punkman 2 another try. I never did beat that game.
Entries.Rainy_Day_4: #$c .5#How'd you sleep? The sound of rain really makes me zonk.#I hope my mom's mood is okay today. At least she won't have to worry about me tracking footprints in the house.
Entries.patio_Sam: #$c .5#*Sigh*... I'm never gonna land this trick...$s#Aw man! You just missed it! I landed a perfect kickflip just a little bit ago.$h
Entries.Rainy_Night_0: #$c .5#Hey, how was your day? I just laid around and read comics most of the day... it was great.$h#I love living here, with no neighbors! I cranked my amp up to eleven!$h
Entries.Rainy_Night_1: #$c .5#It was a pretty low-key day for me... colas, frozen pizza, a few hours noodling around on the guitar. I feel relaxed.#It'll be fun when Vince grows up a bit, into a teenager. Think he could crash here for movie nights?
Entries.Rainy_Night_2: Earlier, I listened to our live recording from that show we played. Remember that? Man, was that sloppy.#$b#It made me a little nervous that you were there, I didn't want to mess up and have you think I was a loser!$l
Entries.Rainy_Night_3: I hope Vincent's not too lonely now that I'm gone... I kinda felt responsible for the little guy.$s#$e#$c .5#You know, he's probably going to be fine. It's not like I moved across the country, or anything.#But, life's all about change... right? Kids need to learn that, eventually... Or else adulthood will destroy them.$7
Entries.Rainy_Night_4: #$c .5#Hey, I tossed a couple frozen pizzas into the oven. Here's yours. [206]$h#Here you go. The only frozen pizza we had was barbecue chicken. Sorry, I had the four-cheese. [206]
Entries.Indoor_Day_0: #$c .5#Phew... I'll tell you one thing I don't miss about my old life... working at JojaMart.#I'll get some cleaning done today. At least that's one good thing I learned from my old job.
Entries.Indoor_Day_1: Hey, I made you some instant pancakes. Enjoy. [211]$h#$e#$c .5#What? I never learned to cook... mom always did that.#I consider myself to be an instant pancake connoisseur. Just... you probably don't want me to try cooking much else.
Entries.Indoor_Day_2: #$c .5#Hey. I know I joke around a lot, but I want you to know that I seriously love you...$l#Oh! 'Morning. Does my hair look okay today?$l
Entries.Indoor_Day_3: Do you have big plans for the day?#$e#$c .5#Oh, not me... I usually decide what to do a few moments beforehand...#I might play some old favorites on my guitar.
Entries.Indoor_Day_4: #$c .5#Maybe Sebastian's going to be online later. I just kinda feel like playing video games today.#Um... Maybe I'll help out on the farm some other day. I feel lazy today.$s#$e#You're not mad?
Entries.Indoor_Night_0: #$c .5#Hey, you look tired. Let me help you relax tonight, okay? Maybe I'll give you a massage later.#Whoa, you're home! Guess that's my cue. OK, relax-o time for you! [184 346 206]
Entries.Indoor_Night_1: #$c .5#My day? Oh... I can hardly remember. I didn't really do anything of note. Just relaxed and had a good time.#I dusted and swept today. And I cleaned the kitchen. See? I do stuff sometimes, too.
Entries.Indoor_Night_2: #$c .5#Hey, sorry I didn't make the bed. You know I'm sloppy... that's why you like me, right?$h#Me? Oh, I got caught up on some shows today. I'm feelin' a bit stir crazy; they were kinda intense.
Entries.Indoor_Night_3: #$c .5#The only thing I miss about living at home is Mom's fish casserole.#Hey. I kinda missed you today. I went looking for you at one point, but I figured you were probably busy.
Entries.Indoor_Night_4: #$c .5#Ready to hit the hay? I actually made the bed for once...#Want me to play you a guitar lullaby? I'm in no rush to fall asleep, myself, but you're probably pretty tired.
Entries.Outdoor_0: #$c .5#Maybe I should get some off-road wheels for my skateboard. Mayor Lewis can't touch me out here.$h#Hah, if it weren't for all the trees in the way, you could probably see my old house from here. Kinda funny, isn't it?$h
Entries.Outdoor_1: #$c .5#I always keep an eye on the wide blue sky... you never know when a UFO might go by.#This quiet kind of morning... It's nice. It's probably healthier than being some kind of tweaked out rockstar.
Entries.Outdoor_2: #$c .5#Hey, got a good feeling about today? I don't wanna throw off your morning routine.#Hi, @! If I knew more about farm work I'd help you out more. Sorry!#$e#I'll try and help you with encouraging thoughts.$h
Entries.Outdoor_3: #$c .5#Something in the air makes me feel positive... maybe it's the faint whiff of pizza from Gus' ovens.#Do I ever miss living in the city? Ha, nope. Not a bit.$h
Entries.Outdoor_4: #$c .5#Wow... you look great today, and the specks of mud just add some extra charm.$l#Hoo... I was thinking I didn't sleep so well last night. But just stepping out here makes me feel awake all the sudden!
Entries.OneKid_0: #$c .5#Sorry. I'm realizing how much I slacked off when we first got married. Being a dad is definitely keeping me busy now, though.#I'll change %kid1's diaper... don't worry about it. You've got enough on your plate.
Entries.OneKid_1: #$c .5#It's weird, but I really like being a father!$h#*yawn* Man oh man, I'm definitely feeling a new appreciation for stay-at home parents.$s
Entries.OneKid_3: #$c .5#I think we should have another kid. Why stop now?#Sure, being a dad is way more exhausting than I imagined, but I'm up for a challenge!$h
Entries.TwoKids_0: I woke up early, fed the kids and changed their diapers! We're all set. You can just focus on raking in that sweet money.$h#$e#I'm just kidding... I didn't marry you for the money.
Entries.TwoKids_1: #$c .5#Two kids... Crazy. Well, if my mom can survive it, so can I!#We have to make sure and give %kid1 a lot of attention now that we have %kid2. We don't want any jealousy between them.
Entries.TwoKids_2: #$c .5#It's fun to see the babies playing with each other. I think they're going to be very close.#I think I'll do a private concert for the kids today. That's the only kind of audience I really need!$u
Entries.TwoKids_3: #$c .5#I never thought I'd become such a family man, but I'm really satisfied with what we've built here. Life is going great.$l#My parents are still pretty young. They could easily live to see great grandbabies. Or maybe even great-great grandbabies!$u
Entries.funLeave_Sam: #$c .5#I'm gonna visit the family today, okay? I'll be home in the evening.#I've gotta go see my family today, make sure everyone's okay. I'll see you tonight, though, okay?
Entries.funReturn_Sam: #$c .5#Seeing family is nice, but it's also kind of depressing in a weird way. Like... our lives are totally separate now, and everything feels more formal than it used to.$7#My family's doing alright, but they're all struggling with something or other. I hope it's cool with you if I see 'em again soon.$7
Entries.spring_3: I went and got some allergy meds. I don't like using 'em, though. I just feel really spacey.$s
Entries.spring_8: Sebastian lent me a big ol' stack of his comics. That pretty much carves out my reading for the next month.$h
Entries.spring_16: It's kind of weird, knowing I'll never be a kid again.#$b#But... knowing my old track record, maybe that's a really good thing.$h
Entries.spring_25: How many days until summer now? Heh, I can't wait.
Entries.summer_5: I hope tomorrow's a good day to hit up the halfpipe.#$e#You wanna come by and watch me for a bit?
Entries.summer_12: It was nice seeing Penny at the festival yesterday. We only hang out every once in a while these days.#$b#Plus, now that I'm married to you, there's less awkwardness hanging in the air between her and me.
Entries.summer_17: Today marks the anniversary of when my family moved to Pelican Town.#$b#Or... I think it was this day?$s#$e#Maybe I'll ask my mom.
Entries.fall_4: This is Abby's favorite season, right? I bet she's enjoying herself.#$e#I noticed, whenever she's in a good mood, Sebastian seems to be pretty happy, too.
Entries.fall_9: I keep getting the sense that some people think we got married too young.$7#$b#Look, I get how they could think that, but I just want to let you know that for me, this is real.$s#$b#We can do this, right? I'm on board... you're on board...#$e#We're gonna conquer the world together.
Entries.fall_13: I thought Pelican Town was a prime spot for doing things how you want, but... dang. On this farm, we really can do whatever we want, huh?$u
Entries.fall_23: One year, I went a bit overboard with Vincent on the Spirit's Eve candy.#$b#That was a mistake. Poor little guy couldn't keep it all down. So gross.$h#$e#Uh, yeah, Mom cleaned it up. I felt pretty bad.$s#$e#Not doing that again. Don't worry.
Entries.winter_3: So, does anything actually grow in winter...? Or...
Entries.winter_14: If you're not as busy this season, is there a day that we can just spend lounging around? I really kinda miss you.$l
Entries.winter_20: I hope Vincent gets everything he wants this year for the Feast. I love seeing that kid open presents.
Entries.winter_26: I wonder how my dad's doing...$7

Entries.Mon2: You made it out here again! I'm so glad.$h#$e#What's new in the valley?
Entries.Mon4: One time, a couple literally camped out here for their honeymoon. Whatever floats their boat, right?
Entries.Mon6: I got lunch with Emily not too long ago! It was so great to catch up with her.$h#$e#We talked for a bit about you, actually. All good things, I promise!$h
Entries.Mon8: Emily's got a real knack for reading people. It's like she's on a different wavelength, or something.#$e#She can't help but treat everyone with equal respect, though, no matter how the other person acts. I admire that.
Entries.Mon10: Hey honey! Made any of that tom kha soup lately? I don't think I'll ever get tired of the flavor.#$e#Grab a coconut before you go, if you see one.
Entries.Tue2: That skeleton out back is a 'sand dragon.' As a kid, did you love dinosaurs, too?#$e#Sometimes, tourists will stop to take pictures.
Entries.Tue4: My name's not really Sandy, you know. It's just good for business.#$e#But everyone calls me Sandy anyway, so I've just gotten used to it.
Entries.Tue6: I complain about the heat nonstop, but nothing can really beat the coolness of the desert when the sun goes down.#$e#The way a desert sunset looks is hard to beat, too.
Entries.Tue8: Hi!~ Stay as long as you like.#$e#The air conditioning sure feels nice, doesn't it?
Entries.Tue10: Well gosh! How many times have you ridden that bus out here now?#$e#Hey, I appreciate every visit.
Entries.Wed2: Hey there, sweetie!$h#$e#How's Emily doing? I hope Haley's not too much of a handful.
Entries.Wed6: I see all sorts of folks out here. Sometimes, they're on road trips or they work in shipping.#$e#But most regular customers just head for the back room.
Entries.Wed8: Isn't it expensive, coming to the desert so often like you do?#$e#You must really like to see me, huh? Hmmm... $h
Entries.Wed10: Hey, it's @! I'm glad to see you, kid. I was starting to think you'd never come back!#$e#If I didn't have this shop to run I'd come back to the valley with you for a day or two... just you and me on the old farm.$s#$e#You'll just have to visit me more often so I don't get depressed.$h
Entries.Thu4: Hey... I think I can trust you. You can keep a secret, right?#$b#*whisper* That guy in the back... it's some kind of exclusive club. I've never been inside myself, but they pay me a generous monthly rent so I don't ask any questions.#$e#SOOOOoo! How's that Stardew Valley weather right now?
Entries.Thu6: Those antenna-like structures northeast of here? No idea.#$e#Apparently, they were featured on an old episode of 'Mysteries of the Unknown.'#$e#They must have been built there for some reason, anyway!
Entries.Thu8: I know it doesn't look like it, but business has been decent lately.#$e#Part of it's thanks to you. Cost of living out here is dirt cheap, so just a simple seed purchase goes a long way!$h
Entries.Fri: That trader with the camel comes through here pretty often. I don't know how she expects to do any business, though.#$e#Hey, I speak from experience. It's tough out here.
Entries.Fri2: I think the thing I miss most about the valley is the wild flowers. Just a lotta good memories that go with them.#$e#Bring some by if you find any, okay, sweetie?
Entries.Fri4: Well look who's here! How you been?#$e#I just got done reading the best book. 'Marcie and the Underground Castle.' Definitely worth the read, if you've got time.
Entries.Fri6: I listen to the radio sometimes. After you hear the same pop song twice an hour for a month, though, it's tough to keep it going.$s
Entries.Fri8: Hey there! How's the farm, sweetie?#$e#I'm guessing things must be in good shape if you're able to spare the time to trek out here.#$e#It's always a treat to see you.$h
Entries.Sat: Hi! Welcome to Sandy's Oasis, the number one destination in Calico Desert!#$e#*whisper* Did I sound professional?$h#$e#Make sure to check out our seasonal seed selection.
Entries.Sat2: The cavern north of here is best worth avoiding.$s#$e#I peeked inside once. There's this door? ...and *shiver* Ugh, never again.#$b#Never. Again.$s
Entries.Sat4: You look really thirsty. Here, have a taste of this ice cold milk. [184]#$e#Tasty, huh?$h
Entries.Sat8: @! Come on in. I've got a treat for you. [233]#$e#I figured you'd love it.$h
Entries.Sat10: Hey @. It's free sample day! Enjoy. [218]
Entries.Sun2: Hi there, honey. Yep, it's just me, alone in this big old shop. Hmmm...#$e#Well, except for that creepy guy in the back. But he never moves a muscle, so I often forget about him.
Entries.Sun4: I floated around in the valley for a few years. Wish I could live there, but it's pretty hard to find reliable work.#$e#So that's how I wound up here!
Entries.Sun6: I guess I've seen at least one guy from the back room who occasionally heads up north.#$e#I wonder if he's headed for that freakish cavern?$s
Entries.Sun8: I took a trip to Zuzu City last month. Can't miss out on living it up at the clubs every once in a while!$h#$e#I don't waste a second. I stay out all night.#$e#There are college kids who can't even keep up with me! Heehee!$h
Entries.Sun10: The cavern? Look, if you've been in there, I don't wanna know.$s#$e#I trust you'd stay safe if you did, though, huh?
Entries.winter_Fri: I can't believe there's snow right now where you live.#$e#Oh well. Sand is kind of like snow. It'll have to do for me.
Entries.winter_Fri6: At least it's a little cooler here in the winter. That sun sure doesn't let up, though.
Entries.fall_Fri: You wouldn't have much luck farming out here, honey.#$e#Well, unless you were a cactus farmer.$h
Entries.fall_Fri4: Seems like that desert trader usually knows how to predict when you'll show up.#$b#Then she heads home just as soon as you leave. Can she predict the future or something?#$e#Wish I could do that...
Entries.summer_Fri6: The desert trader came in and looked around for a bit the other day. She didn't say much. Didn't buy anything, either.#$e#What a mysterious person. I wonder what her real life is like?

Entries.Mon2: Uh... what's up?
Entries.Mon6: I'm always confused why the idea of an afterlife is so appealing. Do people realize how long 'eternity' actually is?#$e#I understand the need for comfort, but...#$b#...to me, thinking about 'eternity' is more like staring into an endless abyss. I'd rather focus on what's temporary and in front of me.
Entries.Mon8: It seems pretty narcissistic to assume that we matter in the grand scheme of things.$s#$e#But I guess we're all floating downstream. Gotta enjoy the ride while it lasts.
Entries.Mon10: It seems pretty narcissistic to assume that we matter in the grand scheme of things.$s#$e#That said, though, you matter to me, no matter how indifferent the universe might be.$l
Entries.Tue4: When you throw a rock in the lake, it sends out ripples. But then the ripples eventually reach the edge and stop.#$b#Everything ends, so how can things with a lasting effect be any more important?
Entries.Wed4: I get bored by plain, ordinary life stuff. How do people get excited about the most mundane things?#$e#Like for example, Abby's parents got a new washing machine a few months ago, and they'll tell stories about that thing for hours...#$b#...like it's the most important thing that'll ever happen to them.#$e#In one sense, it's kind of funny, but in another, it's just depressing as hell.$s
Entries.Wed10: It's nice having a reason to stay here in Pelican Town.#$e#Um, you know what I'm talking about, right?$l
Entries.Thu4_inlaw_Maru: It's a little easier not having to live with Maru anymore. How are you holding up?
Entries.Fri2: *sigh*... If gas wasn't so expensive I'd ride my motorcycle to the city today.#$e#$q 415/416 Fri_old#So what do you do when you aren't working?#$r 415 0 Fri_bad#More Farming#$r 416 30 Fri_good#Comic books#$r 415 -30 Fri_bad#Shopping#$r 415 -30 Fri_bad#Sports
Entries.Fri_old: $p 416#Hey, if you're bored feel free to hang out in my room...$h|You probably prefer the small-town life, huh?
Entries.Fri8: What's new?$h#$e#I'll be at the saloon tonight destroying Sam at pool again.$h
Entries.Sat4: You don't smoke, do you?#$b#...Yeah, no problem, it's all good.
Entries.Sat6: Maybe I should do something creative this weekend.#$b#I wonder if my client would mind if I redesigned the logo for his program?
Entries.Sat8: Sam almost beat me in pool last night.#$e#Well, 'almost' is a relative term, but he has been getting better.$h
Entries.summer_Mon2: Everyone perking up when the sun's out... It's such a cliche.$a
Entries.summer_Mon4: Don't you ever get sick of the sun? When the heat's beating you silly, you're all sweaty, and dirty...#$b#...and you have to smear smelly goo on your skin just to keep it from burning... Why do people like summer, again?
Entries.summer_Mon10: I've gotta say, @, when I first met you, I didn't think I'd like you. You seemed so... peppy?$h#$e#But I'm glad I was wrong. It was probably just me projecting assumptions on someone who willingly moved to Pelican Town.$l
Entries.summer_Tue4: It's definitely better to be too cold than to be too hot.#$b#Too cold? Put on a sweatshirt. Problem solved.#$b#Too hot? You're screwed.
Entries.summer_Tue6: Summer evenings are decent, at least, if it cools down enough.#$e#When it's pitch dark outside and you still feel that wave of heat, stepping outside... that's messed up.
Entries.summer_Tue8: My biological dad? Yeah, I've met him a few times.#$e#He's staggeringly unremarkable.#$e#That's about it.
Entries.summer_Wed4: It's nice, getting that sense of accomplishment when you fix a bug that was eluding you for days.$h#$e#Oh, sorry, that's probably pretty boring for you to hear about.
Entries.summer_Wed6: Damn it. Today's not a good day.$a#$e#If you can give me some space, I'd appreciate it.#$e#Look, you understand how I work.
Entries.summer_Wed8: Why am I grinning? I guess I've been unusually happy lately...$h
Entries.summer_Thu: Getting out and making small talk with the locals, just for the fun of it. ...That's probably your kind of thing, isn't it?
Entries.summer_Thu2: I definitely don't want to go swimming, if that's what you're going to ask.$s#$e#Oh, you just stopped to say hi? Sorry.
Entries.summer_Thu6: I just feel so stuck, living here. My life doesn't change from one year to the next.$s
Entries.summer_Thu8: I feel stuck. How the heck did you do it, @, just quitting your life and moving away?#$e#I'd kill to be able to do that. But the cost of living keeps jumping in the city.$s
Entries.summer_Fri2: You've been up since how early? *yawn* ...Damn.
Entries.summer_Fri4: I have to stay up late. It's the only time the house isn't sweltering.#$e#I can't sleep when it's too hot to get under the covers.
Entries.summer_Sat2: I'm really in the mood for some coffee, but it's way too hot for it.#$e#And iced coffee just isn't as good.
Entries.summer_Sat4: Sam and I originally bonded over music, a while back.#$e#He's a good guy. Most people don't care about my hobbies, but he's pretty much always willing to try the things I like.
Entries.summer_Sat6: There are all sorts of creatures lurking underground, but people hardly ever talk about them. I mean... why not?#$e#It's like some people specifically choose to be boring.
Entries.summer_Sat10: Maybe it'd be fun to ride my bike out in a nighttime thunderstorm.#$e#I mean, uh, scratch that. Too dangerous, I know.$l#$e#I know you'd worry. I've got to think of that.
Entries.summer_Sun6: Some people look up at the night sky and start to feel insignificant.#$b#But I feel that way all the time. For me, it's actually a comfort for the sky to remind me of that simple truth.
Entries.summer_Sun8: The best thing with the lake is when there's a full moon right above it. It gives the whole area a nice, serene glow.
Entries.fall_Mon6: Why does Maru have to be instantly good at everything she does?$s#$e#I'm still better than she is at music... and programming...#$b#...but even with programming, she's crazy good at installing the AI scripts for her robots.$s
Entries.fall_Mon6_inlaw_Maru: Don't get me wrong, I'm happy you and Maru got together, but...#$b#...it's just another reminder about how she keeps upstaging me. Everything just has to work out perfectly for her.$s
Entries.fall_Mon8: Does it make sense if I say that the more crowded a place is, the lonelier it is?#$e#I was in a nightclub in Zuzu City a couple of years ago. It was too crowded to dance and too loud to talk.#$b#Kind of defeats the whole purpose, doesn't it?
Entries.fall_Tue2: Maybe I should pay Abby a visit soon.$u#$e#...I dunno.$u
Entries.fall_Tue4: Pumpkin spice this... pumpkin spice that... man, I do get sick of these seasonal fads.
Entries.fall_Tue8: I'm not really mad that Mom married Demetrius. She can live her own life.#$b#I just wish they'd let me live my own life, too.
Entries.fall_Wed4: I stayed up most of the night finishing a job for one of my clients. It was actually a lot of fun.#$e#I don't even feel tired, for one thing.$h
Entries.fall_Wed6: *sigh* If I lived in the city, I could join a 'Solarian Chronicles' group and do some of those epic 8-person raids.$s#$e#Oh well. I guess it's not really the same when you don't know anybody in the group.
Entries.fall_Thu4: My room might be a little less depressing if I had a window...$s
Entries.fall_Thu6: Hm, maybe I should move my synthesizer back here from Sam's place. It'd be a lot easier to practice.#$e#Or I can just practice on my computer keyboard. That's how I first learned, anyway.
Entries.fall_Thu8: I know I should try more to connect with Maru. It's just...#$b#...if I try to meet her on her level, getting all excited with her, it feels wrong. It's just not me.#$e#Does that make any sense?
Entries.fall_Fri: *yawn*... I was up until 3 reading this new book...#$q 462/463 fall_Fri_old#Do you read, @?#$r 462 -30 Fri_bad#Yep. The classics.#$r 463 30 Fri_good#Only Sci-fi and Fantasy#$r 462 0 Fri_bad#I like a good Romance#$r 463 -30 Fri_bad#No, I don't read books
Entries.fall_Fri_old: $p 462#You probably wouldn't like it.$s|I think you'd like it.
Entries.fall_Sat6: Eventually, I have to get up in the morning so my parents don't patronize me. I'd rather not be treated like a kid.
Entries.fall_Sat8: How the heck do you get up so early each day? I don't get it.#$e#That's officially your superpower. 'Early-Morning Man.'^That's officially your superpower. 'Early-Morning Girl.'
Entries.fall_Sat10: @, hey! I'm glad I ran into you.$h#$e#I'm just having a really good day. I wanted to see how you were doing.
Entries.fall_Sun4: A lot of people seem self-obsessed. Some can't get into a book or TV show if the characters don't remind them of themselves.#$b#The exact opposite of that is why I like reading fantasy.
