Entries.fall_Sun6: People act completely different in big groups. They all put on this mask, this persona...#$b#...and it's just so other people will accept them.#$b#Don't they get a little too comfortable losing touch with the real version of themselves?
Entries.fall_Sun10: Hey. Want to stay out late with me tonight?#$e#When there's a glow on the horizon, that's usually when I can tell it's time to head for bed.
Entries.winter_Mon6: People always say "just be yourself," but I think for most of them, it's just a saying.#$b#They don't actually mean it when they say it.
Entries.winter_Mon8: Feast of the Winter Star's coming up. I know I should try to think of things I'm grateful for, but...$s#$b#...it's tough when there are so many people my age moving on with their lives.$s
Entries.winter_Mon10: I was just thinking... I'm really thankful I have you in my life.$l#$e#Just something I was thinking about, with the Feast of the Winter Star coming up.
Entries.winter_Tue2: You want to talk? Uh... I'm kind of busy at the moment.#$e#Okay, not 'busy' busy, but...$s#$b#...Sorry, today's just not a good day. Maybe later.
Entries.winter_Wed6: Sam's being needy again. And we just gamed online last night.#$e#Oh well. He's still happy if I only say yes one in every four or five times he asks.
Entries.winter_Wed10: Abby's a great girl, don't get me wrong. She's cooler than most of the people in town.#$b#But she's a little young. And besides, I've got you.$l
Entries.winter_Thu4: I used to like my sushi dressed up as much as possible. But if the fish is good, everything else just gets in the way of the flavor.#$e#Maybe a little soy sauce.#$e#Plus, uh, one of my favorite characters from a series I read has a thing for sashimi, so...$s
Entries.winter_Thu10: Here, you wanna finish my coffee? I've had a few cups already. [395]#$e#Gotta get you warmed up!$h
Entries.winter_Fri4: Hmm... I wonder if I can brave the cold to go for a ride tonight...$s
Entries.winter_Fri6: I'm really excited. There's a new volume of 'Cave Saga X' coming out next month.$h#$e#I've already pre-ordered mine.$h
Entries.winter_Sat4: You must not spend very much time at home, with the way you're always running around.#$e#Sounds exhausting.
Entries.winter_Sat8: I'm always confused why the idea of an afterlife is so appealing. Do people realize how long 'eternity' actually is?#$e#I understand the need for comfort, but...#$b#...to me, thinking about 'eternity' is more like staring into an endless abyss. I'd rather focus on what's temporary and in front of me.
Entries.winter_Sat10: Man, I've got to move out of here, fast.#$e#Anything new on your farm, despite the snow?
Entries.winter_Sun4: I built a snowgoon but Demetrius made me get rid of it.#$b#You know your life's going in reverse when your stepdad treats you like a six-year-old.$u
Entries.winter_Sun6_inlaw_Maru: I can't believe Maru still comes out here to build her snowman.#$e#Are you sure it was a good idea to marry someone who lives within walking distance from your farm?#$e#Sorry. I mean, whatever works for you.$s
Entries.spring_1_2: I should browse the forums for some more clients. Anything to keep me busy indoors this spring.
Entries.spring_12: I'm not too big on festivals. Lots of commotion, too much social interaction... More stress than fun, if you ask me.
Entries.spring_23: Ugh... Tomorrow is the worst festival of the year by a mile. Just wait and see how stupid I look during the flower dance.
Entries.summer_10: Hehe... It might be funny to put something disgusting in the potluck soup tomorrow. Just don't poison anyone.#$e#Why ruin the potluck? Hmm... I guess some people feel liberated when the rigid structures of society break down a little. Maybe I'm weird.
Entries.summer_27: Tomorrow we'll all be gathering at the docks to see the migration of the moonlight jellies. I think it starts at ten o'clock.
Entries.fall_20: Are you looking forward to the Spirit's Eve festival? It's probably my favorite.$h
Entries.fall_26: The Spirit's Eve festival is tomorrow. I really hope they have those skeletons on display again this year.$h#$e#I almost feel like they're my friends at this point.
Entries.winter_24: It's the eve of the winter star today. Better make sure you've got an empty stomach for the feast tomorrow.
Entries.winter_28: It'd be nice if we could skip the first part of the year.#$b#Everybody makes empty resolutions they'll never keep. I wish more people could at least be genuine.
Entries.Mountain_47_23: I come here for the peace and quiet.
Entries.summer_Mountain_58_35: #$c .5#The temperature only starts to get comfortable at night.#$e#It always seems to stay a little cooler by the lake.
Entries.spring_12_2: I'm not too big on festivals. Lots of commotion, too much social interaction... More stress than fun, if you ask me.
Entries.spring_23_2: Ugh... Tomorrow is the worst festival of the year by a mile. Just wait and see how stupid I look during the flower dance.
Entries.summer_10_2: Hehe... It might be funny to put something disgusting in the potluck soup tomorrow. Just don't poison anyone.#$e#Why ruin the potluck? Hmm... I guess some people feel liberated when the rigid structures of society break down a little. Maybe I'm weird.
Entries.fall_20_2: Are you looking forward to the Spirit's Eve festival? It's probably my favorite.$h
Entries.fall_26_2: The Spirit's Eve festival is tomorrow. I really hope they have those skeletons on display again this year.$h#$e#I almost feel like they're my friends at this point.
Entries.winter_24_2: It's the eve of the winter star today. Better make sure you've got an empty stomach for the feast tomorrow.
Entries.winter_28_2: It'd be nice if we could skip the first part of the year.#$b#Everybody makes empty resolutions they'll never keep. I wish more people could at least be genuine.

Entries.Rainy_Day_0: #$c .5#Finally... some heavy rain. I get bored of sunny weather easily.#I think I'm going to have a good day today. And you enjoy yourself, too, okay?$h
Entries.Rainy_Day_1: #$c .5#Hey. I was just thinking about my old room in the basement. I felt comfortable there, but this is a lot more interesting. And I don't miss the smell...#I couldn't really hear the sound of the raindrops in my old basement room. It's nice being able to in this house.$7#$e#I felt kind of embarrassed living in my mom's house for so long.
Entries.Rainy_Day_2: Hey. I couldn't sleep last night so I took a walk to the caves. I found this... want it?[575 769 767 84 66 78]#$e#$c .5#I just have trouble sleeping sometimes, it has nothing to do with you. I love you.$7#I just kept walking, and I guess I got a bit carried away. Sorry, I don't mean anything by it.
Entries.Rainy_Day_3: #$c .5#Seems like a pretty good day to just lie around, maybe read a book or something... what do you think?#It's on the edge of my brain... I was stumped yesterday by this one coding problem, but today, I think I can make it work.$7
Entries.Rainy_Day_4: #$c .5#Hey, another rainy day... perfect.#$e#You look cold... here, come closer.$l#Remember that day we had at the beach? Under the umbrella?$l
Entries.Rainy_Night_0: I'm trying my best to quit smoking now that we're married... I don't wanna die on you. It's a bad habit.#$e#I want to have a future together.$l
Entries.patio_Sebastian: #$c .5#Need something? I'll just be over here working on my bike for a while.#I just want to make sure everything's in perfect shape. Next time I ride, I don't want any worries on my mind.
Entries.Rainy_Night_1: #$c .5#I was in a musical mood today, so I played around with a synth program. Wish I did it more often; it's really gratifying.$h#I did some work on the laptop today. I was actually brainstorming some ideas for a game I want to make.#$e#With your farming income, I can afford to do what I want with my life. It's pretty amazing. Thank you.$h
Entries.Rainy_Night_2: #$c .5#Oh, dang! I was supposed to take out the trash today, wasn't I? I'll... do it in the morning.$s#Sorry, I didn't make any dinner. We might have a frozen pizza in the fridge or something.#$e#I dunno, my mind was elsewhere. It's hard to remember to do chores...
Entries.Rainy_Night_3: How was your day? Did you slay any monsters?$h#$e#$c .5#It feels good to take out your aggression now and then, doesn't it?#In either case, I'm glad you know how to avoid being boring.$7
Entries.Rainy_Night_4: #$c .5#Maybe a witch will visit us tonight? Hah.. if only life were that interesting...#Hey, let me know when you're ready to turn in for the night...$l
Entries.Indoor_Day_0: The older I get, the less I'm drawn to the city. It had a certain mystique to it, once.#$e#$c .5#But it turns out that was just a romantic fantasy. The city's so busy, so full of people... I don't belong there. I'm a loner.#Living out here... it's just the right kind of loneliness for me. The kind that makes me look forward to seeing you again each day at home.$7
Entries.Indoor_Day_1: Hey... want some coffee?[395]$7#$e#$c .5#I needed some... woke up early from a nightmare and I just couldn't fall back asleep.#This is the good stuff. Not that Joja-brand garbage.
Entries.Indoor_Day_2: I couldn't sleep last night so I went for a night ride on the motorcycle.#$e#$c .5#I need to stay independent, even though we're married. That's just how I am. I still love you, though.$7#The moon was bright enough to cast shadows through the trees. It was just the perfect night.$7
Entries.Indoor_Day_3: Hey. How'd you sleep last night?#$e#$c .5#I heard you mumbling. You seemed scared, but I have to admit... it was kind of cute.$l#It wasn't too bad a night for me, but I'll admit I'm jealous how you can sleep like a log sometimes.$7
Entries.Indoor_Day_4: #$c .5#Living here with you is teaching me to come out of my shell a little bit. I think it's good for me.$7#The way you've put this farm together... I've got to say it's given me an appreciation for where our food comes from.$7
Entries.Indoor_Night_0: Hey. I just hung out around the house, today. Nothing interesting...#$e#...#$e#$c .5#Oh, I got all the dishes and laundry caught up. So there's that.#The view from our house is perfect. You can see the sun setting over Pelican Town from the front porch.
Entries.Indoor_Night_1: Maybe I drank too much coffee... I don't feel very tired.#$e#$c .5#I just didn't want it to go to waste. That, and it was a flavor I really like.#I'm still trying to adjust to the farm schedule. I used to stay up until 5am and sleep in until 2pm, sometimes.$h
Entries.Indoor_Night_2: #$c .5#I thought living down the road from my family wouldn't be quite far enough. But things feel a lot less tense just from not having to share a roof.#It's really cool to have our own place. I can do whatever I feel like and not have people nagging at me all the time.#$e#I'm sure Maru's happy that I'm gone.
Entries.Indoor_Night_3: #$c .5#I spotted a bat out the window earlier. It's kind of hard to see, but if you stay focused you can often catch them flittering about. They're out there.#Oh, hey. I made this, if you want it. It's not exactly restaurant quality, but I'm learning. [227 228]
Entries.Indoor_Night_4: #$c .5#I often felt unappreciated back home... but here I feel like I really belong. Thanks for making me feel welcome.$l#I don't feel tired, but I'll try to go to bed. I just want to have a chance to see you before you leave for the day.$7
Entries.Outdoor_0: #$c .5#I feel like I want to do something today... but I'm not sure what. Do you ever have that problem?#Hah, I stayed up almost the whole night out here, reading under the porchlight. I might need a nap later.$h
Entries.Outdoor_1: Hmm... sometimes I have to force myself to stay outside for health.#$e#$c .5#I dunno what it is, but I like being indoors. Maybe I'm just so used to my dark basement.#The sun's starting to get pretty bright. I'll probably head back in soon.
Entries.Outdoor_2: #$c .5#I'll just watch you from here. I enjoy watching you.$h#Standing here on the porch like this... I wonder if someday I'll grow to be a mysterious old mentor for some kid in town.$7
Entries.Outdoor_3: #$c .5#I don't want to get soft now that I'm a married guy. Maybe I should start eating more hot pepper and working out? Just an idea...$h#I went for a little walk just before you got up. Sounds like some animals are already up and alive.$7
Entries.Outdoor_4: We should raise more slimes... In big quantities they can be pretty profitable. And they're so easy to raise.#$e#Also, different colored slimes produce different items. I dunno, I think it'd be kind of a fun hobby for us.
Entries.OneKid_0: #$c .5#I'm still getting used to being a father. Don't worry, I'll take good care of our kid! It's just... something new.#Well, we've finally done it. We've discovered someone whose sleep schedule is even more erratic than mine. Thanks, %kid1.$s
Entries.OneKid_1: #$c .5#Being a dad is so much harder than I ever would've thought... but I know you're the one earning our keep, so I promise I'll do my best every day.#Maybe when %kid1 is a little older, I'll get a sidecar for the bike and we can all go for a ride.$h
Entries.OneKid_3: #$c .5#I didn't think I could love a tiny little human being so much. Seriously, I would do absolutely anything for this kid.$l#Have you smelled %kid1? Maybe it's time for a bath...
Entries.TwoKids_0: #$c .5#I'm trying to keep the kids on a schedule to preserve my sanity. My own schedule's still all over the place, though.#Don't worry, I already fed the kids... %kid2 spilled the chocolate milk all over my shirt again.
Entries.TwoKids_1: #$c .5#I can't say this is exactly the kind of life I imagined when I first met you. But it does feel more purposeful than I ever would've imagined.$l#I hope %kid1 and %kid2 are nice to each other. Maru and I always fought as kids. ...If I think back on it, it was mostly my fault...
Entries.TwoKids_2: #$c .5#Sometime soon when the kids are both sleeping, I think I'll need some alone time. The kids have been running me ragged.$s#I've had this recurring dream that %kid2 is wearing a shadow shaman costume and sitting on a glowing pumpkin. Weird, huh?
Entries.TwoKids_3: We've come a long way, @. Look at our family. To be honest, I never really thought I'd end up in this situation.#$e#Now that I'm here, I like it...$l
Entries.funLeave_Sebastian: #$c .5#I'm going to take a walk today. I need some time to myself. I'll see you in the evening.#Got a lot of stuff on my mind today. I'll let you know in the evening if it's still bothering me, but for now, I just need to go for a walk.
Entries.funReturn_Sebastian: #$c .5#My day was fine, nothing much to tell you about. Why don't you tell me about yours?#Hmm? Oh, I'm in a pretty good mood, actually. How about you?$7
Entries.spring_8: My right eyelid keeps twitching. It's been doing that for almost a month.#$e#It's funny. I don't feel that stressed.#$e#Maybe it's from looking at screens so much. But I'm not giving those up for a little thing like this.$u
Entries.spring_16: I got picked on a lot as a kid. Doesn't really bother me anymore, though.#$e#If anything, it just helps me appreciate the present more.$7
Entries.spring_26: The wait's finally over. There's a new Cave Saga X that should be delivered later today.$h
Entries.spring_28: Man... I completely binged my way through the new Cave Saga X. I can't believe it's back to the waiting game again.#$e#I'll have to look through it again. There's probably some foreshadowing or secrets I missed.
Entries.summer_5: Are you putting on sunscreen today? Ugh. I'm sorry.#$e#You... do a lot for us, don't you? I'll... do some cleaning around the house today.$u#$e#Look, and if you want buy yourself a treat or something, I'm not gonna complain. You earn the money.
Entries.summer_15: Seriously, how is it this hot already? It's never a good sign when it's 6 AM and I've already stuck my head in the freezer once...$u
Entries.summer_19: There's a video game charity drive that's livestreaming today. I think I know what I'll be doing to keep my mind off the heat today.$h
Entries.summer_22: Don't you ever get tired running around all the time? I swear, you must have energy drink syrup for blood.$7
Entries.fall_6: I took another freelance job yesterday with an old client. This should keep me busy for a few days.$7#$e#I'm actually kind of excited to work on this one.$h
Entries.fall_17: Okay, I admit, I was smoking yesterday at the fair. But it was a special occasion. I promise you, I'm not getting back into it.$s
Entries.fall_22: I try to keep things in perspective when I recognize that everything is temporary. Everyone fades away eventually.#$e#Yeah, sometimes I go a bit overboard with these thoughts, but... I need them.$u#$b#Maybe that seems weird, but I really do.
Entries.winter_3: This kind of season is perfect for late night rides.$7#$e#Don't worry, I won't go if the roads are iced over. I'm not an idiot.$h
Entries.winter_12: The air is so dry and crisp. Just the way I like it.$h
Entries.winter_19: Hm. I usually go for coffee, but maybe today's a hot chocolate kind of day.$u#$e#With marshmallows.$7
Entries.winter_24: We'll be sitting down with my whole family tomorrow. You know... I'm actually kind of looking forward to it.$h

Entries.Introduction: I don't know you. Why are you talking to me?
Entries.JojaMart: %Shane's hard at work. He doesn't seem interested in talking.
Entries.Mon: I don't know you. Why are you talking to me?
Entries.Mon6: I learned a while ago that it's easier to shut new people out before they get to know me.#$e#A lot of people just turn out to be jackasses.
Entries.Mon8: Emily's a pretty good girl. She gives me beer and she listens. Not much else I need.#$e#You're pretty cool, too.
Entries.Tue8: Clint's a bit awkward. I don't know how Emily puts up with the obvious hots he's got for her.#$e#Or maybe she's just oblivious...$u
Entries.Tue10: It never would've worked out for me and Emily... for obvious reasons. I'm glad I have you.$l^Emily and I were always just friends. I'm glad that we kept it that way.$l
Entries.Wed2: ...'Suuuuup.$s
Entries.Wed4: Have I ever gotten really weird and vulnerable with you while I was drunk? I have the tendency to do that.$u#$e#Whatever I said, don't read into it.$u
Entries.Wed6: $d Joja#*sigh* ...Every day is the same. Stocking those horrible shelves, going to the saloon, tossing and turning all night.$s|I hated my job at JojaMart, but now that I'm unemployed I feel even worse.$s
Entries.Wed10: My counselor's been helping me out a lot with my thoughts of suicide.#$b#Alcohol is still a tough one, though.#$e#A lot of people don't get it. I can't just 'stop going' to the saloon.$s
Entries.Thu10: I have my ups and downs still. But lately, things seem to be a bit better.#$e#Like, today's good, right? You stopped to talk, for one thing.$h
Entries.Fri2: You're just not gonna leave me alone, are you? $s
Entries.Fri10: @, I appreciate you being there for me. But you realize that you're not gonna fix me, right?#$e#I'm just saying, what you see is what you get.#$e#Give it some thought. I don't want to hurt you.$s
Entries.Sat10: Oh man, I got really drunk before I went to bed last night.$s#$q 530/531/532 Sat_old#You must be disappointed in me.#$r 530 -250 Sat_530#Yeah! I thought you wanted to get clean!#$r 531 0 Sat_531#Recovery has its ups and downs.#$r 531 0 Sat_531#Sorry, I know it's hard for you.#$r 532 -50 Sat_532#No prob. You do you.
Entries.Sat_old: $p 530#Look, I'm doing my best. I'm sorry if I let you down sometimes.$s|But I appreciate that you're always around, no matter what.
Entries.Sat_530: ...#$b#Well clearly I'm not good enough for you.#$b#It's cool. Go hang out with someone else.
Entries.Sat_531: ...#$b#How are you such a good person? Don't you ever get mad about anything?$s#$e#Thanks, though.
Entries.Sat_532: ...#$b#Seriously, what the hell. Do you even care about what I do?$a
Entries.Sun2: You again? How many times do I have to tell you to leave me alone?$s
Entries.Sun4: Hmm... it's %time. Should I throw a frozen pizza in the microwave, or should I wait?$u
Entries.summer_Mon6: $d Joja#I think I'll spend a little extra time in Joja's back room freezer when it's hot like this.$u|Hmm... what can I do to pass the time today?
Entries.summer_Mon8: I think Emily's nice just for the sake of being nice. I don't need her pity, but...#$b#...I don't -not- need her company, either.$u
Entries.summer_Mon10: Jas and I played a pretty fun game yesterday. We made a little obstacle course outside.$h#$e#I know I haven't been a great influence on Jas, but you have to admit I have my moments.
Entries.summer_Tue8: $d Joja#My walk to work in the morning is nice during the summer. It's just so calm and not too hot yet.|Those chickens sure do get me up early. But at least the air's nice in the summer when the sun first comes up.
Entries.summer_Tue10: Maybe I fell for Emily a little bit, at one point or another, but...$s#$b#...you're different in that you actually seem to be serious about wanting something from me, too.$l
Entries.summer_Wed6: $d Joja#*sigh* ...Every day is the same. Stocking those horrible shelves, going to the saloon, tossing and turning all night.$s|I hated my job at JojaMart, but now that I'm unemployed I feel even worse.$s
Entries.summer_Wed8: Marnie and Jas have put up with a lot of my crap. I actually feel motivated to do my best for them.#$e#That's not something I've felt in a long time.
Entries.summer_Thu6: Looking forward to gridball season?#$e#Sometimes it's fun to watch the junior league in the off-season, too. Tickets are cheaper.
Entries.summer_Thu8: Man, the chickens won't stay out of trouble lately. Breaking stuff... Getting stuck in stuff...#$b#Hah, at least they need me for something.$h
Entries.summer_Thu10: When your two best friends die on the same exact day, it really kind of messes you up.$s#$e#I had problems before they died, but that's really still the worst of it.
Entries.summer_Fri4: What a hot day. I could really use a cold one.#$e#You in?
Entries.summer_Fri6: I saw some old classmates' photos online.$s#$e#The most revolting ones are of the people who can't take a photo without their freakin' baby in the shot.
Entries.summer_Fri8: Seeing people who have it all... the money, the house, the honor-student kids...#$b#...it almost seems even more depressing than what I've got.#$e#Hey there, sport! Congrats on another straight-A report card! Let's get ice cream!$10#$b#Gross.$u
Entries.summer_Fri10: Out of a million people, I bet you're the only one who wouldn't have bailed on me by this point.#$e#Hey, I don't take these things for granted.
Entries.summer_Sun6: Looks like I'm gettin' a little gut. Oh boy. Soon I'll be the guy who has it all!$u
Entries.summer_Sun8: $d Joja#Back to work for another week tomorrow. Yayyy...$s|I kind of miss having actual weekends, like I used to. But I guess that's the tradeoff for being a full-time chicken man, now.
Entries.summer_Sun10: @, one thing you should probably know is that I'm technically Jas's godfather.$s#$e#Marnie's really the one who's been raising her, though. I really screwed that one up.$s
Entries.fall_Mon6: I saw some old classmates' photos online.$s#$e#The most revolting ones are of the people who can't take a photo without their freakin' baby in the shot.
Entries.fall_Mon8: I missed the gridball game last night. Whatevs. It's better live, anyway.
Entries.fall_Mon10: Do you ever feel like the whole world is scrutinizing you like some disgusting insect?
Entries.fall_Tue8: Well, at least Clint's life is crappier than mine. Guy lives alone.#$e#Sorry, yeah, that was a crappy thing to say.$s
Entries.fall_Tue10: It's strange how I don't ever seem to get bored with seeing you, @.#$e#That's never happened for me before.$l
Entries.fall_Wed6: $d Joja#*sigh* ...Every day is the same. Stocking those horrible shelves, going to the saloon, tossing and turning all night.$s|I hated my job at JojaMart, but now that I'm unemployed I feel even worse.$s
Entries.fall_Wed8: I guess I've grown attached to Marnie and Jas. We're a ragtag bunch but it kind of feels like a weird family.#$e#I never really had much of a family as a kid.$s
Entries.fall_Thu6: Hey @.#$e#So, are you drinking tonight? It's cool if you want to join me.
Entries.fall_Thu8: You like talking to me? I guess I believe you... maybe you're as weird as I am.$h
Entries.fall_Thu10: I have my ups and downs still. But lately, things seem to be a bit better.#$e#Like, today's good, right? You stopped to talk, for one thing.$h
Entries.fall_Fri4: $d Joja#That guy Sam? Yeah, I work with him. Don't really talk to him much, though.|That guy Sam? Yeah, we worked together. Never really talked to him much, though.
Entries.fall_Fri8: I'll definitely be going to the saloon tonight. What else is there to do?
Entries.fall_Fri10: @, I appreciate you being there for me. But you realize that you're not gonna fix me, right?#$e#I'm just saying, what you see is what you get.#$e#Give it some thought. I don't want to hurt you.$s
Entries.fall_Sun6: ...I think I might be gaining weight.$s
Entries.fall_Sun8: If I watch more TV maybe I can forget about life. That would be relaxing.$u
Entries.fall_Sun10: A new chick hatched on our farm last night. It's been a good day so far.$h
Entries.winter_Mon8: I don't get how someone like Emily is so content with her life.#$e#I couldn't put up with her job and her life if I were in her shoes.#$e#And I probably wouldn't hang out with guys like me, either.$s
Entries.winter_Mon10: When your two best friends die on the same exact day, it really kind of messes you up.$s#$e#I had problems before they died, but that's really still the worst of it.
Entries.winter_Tue4: Poor little mother cluckers are stuck inside all winter long. Gotta take good care of them.#$e#You got that I meant chickens, right?$u
Entries.winter_Tue8: Do chickens have it better or worse than humans? Hmm...$u#$e#Worse, I'd say.#$b#Unless they're free-range chickens. Then... I don't know.
Entries.winter_Tue10: My counselor's been helping me out a lot with my thoughts of suicide.#$b#Alcohol is still a tough one, though.#$e#A lot of people don't get it. I can't just 'stop going' to the saloon.$s
Entries.winter_Wed6: $d Joja#*sigh* ...Every day is the same. Stocking those horrible shelves, going to the saloon, tossing and turning all night.$s|I hated my job at JojaMart, but now that I'm unemployed I feel even worse.$s
Entries.winter_Wed8: I try to do my best for Jas. She says she has some good memories with me already.#$e#I don't remember some of the ones she mentions, though.$s
Entries.winter_Thu6: Kind of a crappy day today...$s#$e#So what's the drunkest you've ever been?
Entries.winter_Thu8: You like talking to me? I guess I believe you... maybe you're as weird as I am.$h
Entries.winter_Thu10: I'll say... I had you completely wrong.#$b#First time I saw you, I thought you'd be an absolute tool. I'm glad I was wrong.$h
Entries.winter_Fri6: I'll definitely be going to the saloon tonight. What else is there to do?
Entries.winter_Fri8: Seeing people who have it all... the money, the house, the honor-student kids...#$b#...it almost seems even more depressing than what I've got.#$e#Hey there, sport! Congrats on another straight-A report card! Let's get ice cream!$10#$b#Gross.$u
Entries.winter_Fri10: $d Joja#The thought of getting to see you is what gets me through the day. Are we hanging out tonight?|Hey, I hope you're staying warm. I've got an old coat you can borrow if you need it.
Entries.winter_Sun6: It's been an interesting gridball season.#$e#Or so I hear. I've missed a ton of the games.
Entries.winter_Sun8: What's it like for those functional alcoholic millionaires? Like, the CEOs who always have half a minibar behind their desk?#$b#Do they just stay plastered all day and get paid for it? 'Cause if so, sign me up.#$e#Looks like I missed my calling.
Entries.winter_Sun10: What you have to understand, @, is that when I do my best, it looks a lot worse than what other people do.$s#$e#I just thought you should know that.
Entries.winter_28: Another year gone? Man.$u#$e#Take a wild guess what I'm doing all evening.
Entries.spring_1_2: Buh, my head.$s#$e#Can I just sleep through this whole year?$s
Entries.winter_28_2: Another year gone? Man.$u#$e#Take a wild guess what I'm doing all evening.

Entries.Rainy_Day_0: I hope Jas and Marnie are doing alright without me.#$e#I'm not too worried... Jas is old enough now to take care of the animals on her own.
Entries.Rainy_Day_1: #$c .5#You know what? I think I've lost some weight since moving in with you.$6#My knees are kind of stiff today. Does that ever happen to you, or is that just me?$s
Entries.Rainy_Day_2: #$c .5#Here... take this.[346 174 303 305 215] I bought some of those a while ago and they're almost expired...#Here, take this for later. [346 346 303] Just a little reminder not to work too hard when you can afford to be lazy.
Entries.Rainy_Day_3: #$c .5#Buhh... I don't feel like being productive today.#...Alright. Screw it. I'm dipping my pizza in ranch dressing today.$u
Entries.Rainy_Day_4: #$c .5#Well, should I do something useful today?... or just nap forever?#I was so dedicated last night to doing some sit-ups today. But this rain is really killing my motivation.
Entries.Rainy_Night_0: Hmm... seems like a good night to microwave a few pizza rolls.#$e#Some people like to cook them in the oven, but it just takes too long for me. Plus I like that squishy texture.$h
Entries.patio_Shane: #$c .5#Charlie's doing well.$8#If Charlie's in a good mood, I'm in a good mood, too.$8
Entries.Rainy_Night_1: #$c .5#The tip-tappa-tip of the rain takes me to a different time... a different place.#I hope Charlie's not scared out there.$u
Entries.Rainy_Night_2: #$c .5#I guess... if I had some pants I might've gone outside today... but, nah.#What if we just let Charlie live inside? It's not like there'd be that big a mess...$u
Entries.Rainy_Night_3: #$c .5#I like gloomy weather, but I feel kinda bad for the hens.#I still can't believe how you spend all that time outside when it rains, just like it's no big deal.
Entries.Rainy_Night_4: #$c .5#Tip-tappa-tip-tappa-tip... I'm starting to feel thirsty.$6#Do we have any homemade brews? Guess I'm feelin'... fancy tonight.
Entries.Indoor_Day_0: #$c .5#Buh... sometimes life feels like a slow, gray blur... know what I mean?#Here's to the end of another pointless day. Hey, not that that has to be a horrible thing.
Entries.Indoor_Day_1: #$c .5#Hey. Take this... I put a bit too much in the microwave. [195 215 206]Sorry if it's squishy.#Open your mouth. And close your eyes. And you'll get... a big surpriiiise. [195 215 206]
Entries.Indoor_Day_2: #$c .5#Do me a favor... when I pass away, use my dust to fertilize some corn for the hens.#Does it ever annoy you, that I'm not as peppy as a stereotypical dream husband?
Entries.Indoor_Day_3: #$c .5#*smooch*... Mmm, it tastes like someone's been nibbling on pizza rolls.$6#Hey, don't brush your hair. You're looking hot this morning.
Entries.Indoor_Day_4: #$c .5#I may keep to myself a lot, and I may seem unhappy sometimes... but I do appreciate all the work you do. I'm a lucky guy.$6#Give me something positive to focus on. I know it should feel like a good morning; I just need some help getting there.
Entries.Indoor_Night_0: #$c .5#I'm just gonna have a couple more beers before closing my eyes for the night.#I took a nap while you were out. I hope that doesn't screw up my sleep cycle.
Entries.Indoor_Night_1: If... If only... ah, I was just thinking back on the glory days, when I played gridball on the varsity team.$6#$b#Now I'm old and weak, though...
Entries.Indoor_Night_2: #$c .5#Ughh... *gurgle*... I feel a little bloated... oof... too much Joja all-purpose dipping sauce.#Hey, I was good today. I wanted to finish the bag of Carbo Cones, but I held off.
Entries.Indoor_Night_3: #$c .5#Buh... I wish I was six inches taller and a whole lot smarter... But you like me for who I am? I still have a hard time understanding that...#Hey. Want to... go to bed when I do?$l
Entries.Indoor_Night_4: #$c .5#I spent all day watching TV and now my legs feel like soft dough. Guess I'll have to take it easy until tomorrow.#Maybe I should drink something to help me sleep. Not a good solution, but it'd beat staying up all night.
Entries.Outdoor_0: I didn't sleep well last night so I'm hoping this fresh air will get the juices flowing.#$e#What juices, you ask? Heh... you're weird.$h
Entries.Outdoor_1: Sometimes I stop and realize that I'm nothing more than a bag of juicy, squishy flesh.#$e#But hey... that's just fine... what's life, anyway?$h
Entries.Outdoor_2: #$c .5#When I stop and think about it... I'm in a good place. My life is pretty nice.$6#I can't really think of a better place to be right now, than here. Gotta keep things in perspective, right?$6
Entries.Outdoor_3: #$c .5#Ooohh... my tongue is swollen from eating too many pepper poppers.$s#Dang. I didn't realize how stagnant the air in my lungs was till I got out here.
Entries.Outdoor_4: #$c .5#Hey. You were sleeping like a baby so I slipped out of bed and went for a morning walk around the farm. Everything looks fine.#I don't know why, but I'm just feeling pretty good this morning. I must've slept well.$h
Entries.OneKid_0: #$c .5#It's weird, when I was younger I swore I'd never have a kid. I wonder what happened to me?$6#I want to make sure I don't screw things up for %kid1. Just... have some patience with me.
Entries.OneKid_1: #$c .5#Let's make sure to give this kid lots of eggs... Baby's gotta grow those legs!#I want to give %kid1 the best childhood ever. I've got to make up for at least some of my screw-ups of the past.
Entries.OneKid_3: Papa Shane reporting for duty...$6#$e#Buh... I've become corny in my old age.
Entries.TwoKids_0: #$c .5#Well, if the kids stop behaving themselves today, I can always bust out some tunes for a spontaneous dance party.#I already fed the kids two bowls of pizza puffs cereal. They'll be full for a while.
Entries.TwoKids_1: #$c .5#I'll be honest... two kids is enough for me.#Oh my god, how does anyone ever raise more than two kids? I'm so exhausted.$s
Entries.TwoKids_2: #$c .5#Whew... I hope the kids wind up with more of your traits than mine.#Ugh... %kid2 is being a little brat today. Must've gotten that from me...
Entries.TwoKids_3: *Sigh*... If only we could send the kids off to Joja work-camp for a season...#$e#I'm just kidding.$h
Entries.funLeave_Shane: #$c .5#I'm going to go out today, alright?#Time for me to get a change of scenery or the walls'll close in. I'll be back later today.
Entries.funReturn_Shane: #$c .5#Sorry if I'm sweaty... That was quite a walk... Buh, I'm out of shape.$6#Yeah, I had a good time going out. Don't worry, though. I was good.
Entries.spring_2: It was awesome yesterday, seeing the chickens get outside for the first time in a while.$h
Entries.spring_14: Buh, I think I'm on post egg festival withdrawal. Just not a lot to look forward to for a while.$s#$e#Don't worry, I'll be alright in the long run. This always happens to me.
Entries.spring_19: Eventually, everyone gets tired of everything.#$b#Ha, am I just ahead of my time, or something?$h
Entries.spring_27: I'll admit I did not... drink in moderation the other night.$s#$b#But still, I'm a helluva lot better off than I was before I met you. I just hope that makes sense from your perspective.#$e#I mean, you haven't discovered me passed out cold any time lately, right?
Entries.summer_2: We're growing hot peppers this summer, right?
Entries.summer_4: Man, I miss Jas. Today's her birthday, too.#$e#I knew there was something I was forgetting.
Entries.summer_12: Ha, it was awesome yesterday, seeing Emily do her thing on the dance floor. Glad she's as well as ever.$h
Entries.summer_16: ...Another year's gone by since I 'adopted' Jas. And then promptly screwed it all up.$s#$e#Things are turning out alright for her. No thanks to me.$s#$e#I guess things would've been different if it happened now. With you around, I'm a lot more stable than I used to be, believe it or not.
Entries.summer_17: How do people like you and Marnie just keep it together all the time? I don't even know where I'd be if Marnie hadn't taken in Jas... and me.$s#$e#Well, and then you came along.$l
Entries.fall_3: I suddenly felt like cooking, so I made omelets. Here you go. [195]#$e#Just don't ask me to do much real cooking besides this. Seriously. You'd regret it more than I would.$h
Entries.fall_7: Oh that's right. Gridball season just started. I'll have to check if there are any good games coming up.
Entries.fall_10: Today's a good day for a playthrough of Turbo 2. Or maybe Paths of Fury 2.#$b#Hm. ...Or maybe both.$u
Entries.fall_12: I was walking around yesterday, looking all over the farm. It's really something else, isn't it?#$e#YOU'RE really something else, I mean.$h
Entries.fall_23: We live for sleep. Everything we do is about it. We work, so we get tired, so we can sleep.#$b#We eat, so we're not hungry, so we can sleep. We do creative things so we feel fulfilled, and then we sleep.#$b#Are we all just unknowingly training to get more comfortable with our inevitable deaths?$u
Entries.winter_1: Any big plans this winter? I'll probably end up watching a lot of TV and just hanging out around the house.
Entries.winter_28: Well, another year gone by... I look a little older...$6#$b#...but you look good as ever.

Entries.Mon2: My brother's really good at video games. I like watching him play more than I like playing against him.
Entries.Mon4_2: Sam threw out some of his old computer games after Dad got back.$u#$e#I think they were the shooting ones.$u
Entries.Mon8: Mom gave me a haircut. She's the one who usually does it.#$e#A long time ago, Sam gave me a haircut. He got in big trouble!$h
Entries.Mon8_2: Mom made me stop playing just to show me Dad sleeping in.$u#$e#Then she started crying. It was really weird.$u
Entries.Mon10: @, maybe you can be my dad until my real dad comes back!^Even though you're a girl, maybe you can be my dad until my real dad comes back.
Entries.Mon10_2: @, was your dad ever like mine?$u
Entries.Tue2: Red flavored gummies are really good, but the purple kind in this new brand is really REALLY good.#$e#The only problem? The other colors that come with the purple kind aren't as good.#$b#Hmmmmmmmmm...
Entries.Tue4: I like to collect Foroguemon cards.#$e#My big brother only plays with me sometimes, though.
Entries.Tue8: Can you keep a secret, mister?^Can you keep a secret, miss?$u#$b#I wanna marry Miss Penny when I grow up.#$e#Just don't tell her, okay?$u
Entries.Tue8_inlaw_Penny: It's so cool how you're married to my teacher.#$e#I never thought that would have happened!
Entries.Wed4: There's spring onions out in the forest. Do you know how to find them?#$e#The taste of them is pretty bad, though. I just like hunting for 'em.
Entries.Wed6: I found a millipede outside yesterday.#$b#Is it really called a millipede because they have a million legs?
Entries.Wed8: I wanna look for bugs, but Mom gets mad when I'm all dirty.#$b#It's a tough choice.
Entries.Wed_inlaw_Sam: How's my brother doing?#$e#I can't believe we're related now!$h
Entries.Thu6: It's fun living so close to Marnie's Ranch.#$e#I saw a cow wink at me one time.
Entries.Thu8: If I had a farm like you, I'd want it to be a candy farm!$h#$e#I know, I know, I'm just being silly.
Entries.Fri: Oh no... Mom's making lentil soup tonight.$s
Entries.Fri2: Mom said she's making yellow curry tonight. Does that have curry powder in it?$u#$e#It does? Awwwww.$s
Entries.Fri4: Do you grow anything good on your farm?
Entries.Fri8: Sam used to be kind of mean to me when I was little. But these days, he's a lot nicer to me.
Entries.Sat: Dad's coming back soon!#$b#I hope he brings me some toys.$u
Entries.Sat_2: Dad seems weird since he came back. I wonder what happened to him?$s
Entries.Sat2: Do you know anyone in the army? That's where my dad works.
Entries.Sat4: My dad's gone, but Jas's mom and dad aren't around either.$u#$e#She never talks about them. And Ms. Penny says I shouldn't ask.$u
Entries.Sat4_2: I'm having fun today! Are you?
Entries.Sat6: *sigh*... When's Dad coming back?$s
Entries.Sat6_2: Dad seems weird since he came back. I wonder what happened to him?$s#$b#He doesn't play with me anymore.$s
Entries.Sat8: My dad's gone, but Jas's mom and dad aren't around either.$u#$b#She never talks about them. And Ms. Penny says I shouldn't ask.$u
Entries.Sat8_2: I had a bad dream last night.$s#$e#I dreamt that Dad was gone again. Forever.$s#$e#I know. It's not real. But it was still scary.$s
Entries.Sat10: @, was your dad around much when you were a kid?$u
Entries.Sat10_2: I wish Dad would play with me more...$u
Entries.Sun4: Ms. Penny makes me read a new book every week.$s#$b#At least she lets me pick them, sometimes!
Entries.Sun8: I tried some of Mom's yellow curry. It was actually really good.#$b#But ONLY because of the sauce. Vegetables are still icky.
Entries.summer_Tue: Hey Mister @.^Hey Miss @.#$e#Is there anyone in town who you like?#$e#Yeah, like... LIKE like.$h#$e#Aw, c'mon, tell me!
Entries.summer_Tue4: What's your favorite flavor of ice cream?#$e#Mine's mint chip.
Entries.summer_Wed6: The rock-climbing wall is pretty fun, but I've climbed it so many times.
Entries.summer_Sat6: Sam showed me this music video with a bunch of dancing crabs. It's so funny!#$e#If I saw dancing crabs in real life at the beach, I'd be like, 'Whaaaat?'$h
Entries.summer_Sat10_2: Sam showed me this music video with a bunch of dancing crabs. It's so funny!#$e#If I saw dancing crabs in real life at the beach, I'd be like, 'Whaaaat?'$h
Entries.fall_Wed: Did you know? My big brother is basically a rock star.$h
Entries.fall_Wed_inlaw_Sam: How's my brother doing?#$e#I guess he's a real grown-up now!
Entries.fall_Wed8: My big brother lets me try his guitar every once in a while.#$e#I can't play anything, though. I don't think I'll ever be as good as him.
Entries.fall_Tue: I've been collecting leaves. I found a bunch of really bright red ones!
Entries.fall_Sun4: There's so much mud outside!#$e#Mom's not a big fan.
Entries.fall_Thu4: I tried throwing a gridball back and forth once with that guy Alex, but I couldn't keep up with how far he'd throw.
Entries.fall_Thu8: Jas is pretty cool. And not just for a girl, either.#$e#She's really smart, too.
Entries.fall_Fri: Ew, it's boiled beet night again...$s
Entries.fall_Sat10_2: Sam got me to try some of mom's fish casserole. It's kind of gross, but it also has cheese and noodles in it.#$b#So that makes it kind of good.
Entries.winter_Mon: I can't wait for the Feast of the Winter Star!$h#$e#I hope I get some toys! Or maybe something yummy!
Entries.winter_Tue4: I built a block tower yesterday that was even taller than my brother!$h#$e#I had to stand on a stool to make it.
Entries.winter_Wed: Mom doesn't count hot chocolate as junk food when it's snowy.#$e#It's nice.
Entries.winter_Wed_inlaw_Sam: So are you and my brother like... really super in love?#$e#Hahaha!$h
Entries.winter_Fri: Ms. Penny's a pretty good teacher.#$b#I don't get a lot of questions right, but she's always really nice.
Entries.winter_Fri10: A long time ago, I hit Jas when we were playing.$u#$e#I always make sure I'm nice to her now.
Entries.winter_Sat10: Hey! Wanna play in the snow?#$e#The snow is perfect today for the best snowballs ever!
Entries.winter_Sat10_2: Hey! Wanna play in the snow?#$e#The snow is perfect today for the best snowballs ever!
Entries.spring_12: Finally! The egg festival is tomorrow!$h#$e#I always find the eggs that all the grown-ups are too tall to notice.$h
Entries.fall_26: It's Spirit's Eve tomorrow! I'm gonna get so scared!$h
Entries.winter_24: Feast of the Winter Star! I can't believe it's finally happening tomorrow!$h#$e#Are you excited, too?
Entries.winter_28: I get to stay up until midnight tonight!
Entries.spring_1_2: I am so happy today! Eeeeee!$h
Entries.spring_12_2: Finally! The egg festival is tomorrow!$h#$e#I always find the eggs that all the grown-ups are too tall to notice.$h
Entries.fall_26_2: It's Spirit's Eve tomorrow! I'm gonna get so scared!$h
Entries.winter_24_2: Feast of the Winter Star! I can't believe it's finally happening tomorrow!$h#$e#Are you excited, too?
Entries.winter_28_2: I get to stay up until midnight tonight!

Entries.Mon: Any progress with fishing yet? Stick with it. It'll get easier with time.
Entries.Mon2: Ahoy there, son.^Ahoy there, lass.#$b#Looks like decent weather for fishing, eh?
Entries.Mon6: If you sell me some fish, I'll be sure to tell whoever buys it that you're the one who caught it.$h
Entries.Mon8: I'll post some more fishing challenges on Pierre's bulletin board if the mood fancies me. I hope you'll keep an eye out for 'em.
Entries.Tue2: There are two worlds: the one we live in, and the much, much older one beneath the water.#$e#I think of what I do as a dialogue between those two worlds.
Entries.Tue4: To take the life of a fish, you have to respect it first. You certainly won't last long in this profession, otherwise.
Entries.Tue8: I'm happy that I entrusted you with my old rod, @, back when we first met. You've been a good friend.$h
Entries.Wed2: The waves are pretty calm at our beach. That's the only way I can manage to have my shop out on the dock itself.
Entries.Wed4: Have I ever been lost at sea? No. Never.#$b#I always take the appropriate precautions. If you know what you're doing, you never compromise your safety.
Entries.Wed6: Remember, anywhere there's water, there's likely to be fish.#$b#You get out a little more than I do, so I hope you find some exotic varieties.$h#$e#Just don't bring it to me if it's a bit TOO exotic, though.$s
Entries.Wed8: I've never been married, no.#$e#I loved someone once, long ago. She left me for another man.#$e#Sometimes, the one that gets away, stays away forever.$s
Entries.Thu2: It never ceases to amaze me how much trash winds up in the water.$s#$e#It's up to us to take care of it. Preferably, it should be recycled.
Entries.Thu4: Sometimes I can find someone who'll play checkers with me at the Saloon.#$e#It's important to have a little human contact every now and then, no matter how comfortable I can be by myself.
Entries.Thu6: There's rumors of some very rare fish in these parts... but only an experienced angler could stand a chance against them.#$e#You'll need the finest bait you can get if you want a rare fish to bite.
Entries.Thu8: My biggest catch ever was from when I was young, like you.#$b#Who knows, though? It's still possible that I could outdo myself.$h
Entries.Fri2: If you really want to get the fish biting, make sure you put some bait on your hook.
Entries.Fri4: If you ever catch a lobster in a crab pot, be sure to share some with Elliott. It's his favorite.
Entries.Fri6: Made any good chowder yet?$h#$e#It's an old classic.$h
Entries.Fri8: We can all agree that fishing'll teach you patience. I can't think of a better skill to practice.#$b#Life itself is a waiting game. And then it ends. I pity anyone who never learns how to wait properly.
Entries.Sat2: I've learned some good fish recipes over the years. Maybe I'll share some with you sometime.
Entries.Sat4: If you see me out fishing, you just come on up beside me and cast your line, too.#$b#You're always welcome to.$h
Entries.Sat6: When you're waiting for a bite, listening to a bit of music on the radio is a great way to pass the time.#$b#Our ancestors had no such luxuries, though. So sometimes I cut the music and listen to the sounds of nature, out of admiration for the old ways.
Entries.Sun4: Sometimes, I reel in a little sunken treasure. I've found some pretty amazing things over the years.#$e#I hope you find some interesting treasures, too!
Entries.Sun6: I'm sorry I don't ask enough about your farming. How is that going along?
Entries.Sun8: My old neighbor passed away some years ago and entrusted his home to me.#$b#I'm glad Elliott was able to purchase it and move in. He's been a good neighbor.
Entries.spring_Fri2: Catfish will only bite when it's raining. You can catch 'em in fresh water in the spring and fall.#$e#Just thought I'd mention it. Catfish is one o' my favorites.$h
Entries.spring_Fri8: If you catch a really common fish, it's actually more profitable to clean it and cut it yourself.#$e#That's if you're sellin' elsewhere. Me, I only buy whole fish.
Entries.summer_Thu2: It's rainbow trout season.#$b#And this is the only season when you can get 'em. Be sure to stock up if you like cooking with them.
Entries.summer_Thu6: If you're fishing for tilapia this summer, make sure you do it in the morning.#$e#Sometimes, they'll show up in the early afternoon, but it's not too often.
Entries.summer_Wed2: That carpenter Robin'll build you a fish pond, mmm? That could work. Just make sure you treat those fish extra well.#$e#Some of 'em just need the wild ocean, or the streams, y'know? Not all fish live in ponds for a reason.
Entries.summer_Wed10: Y'know, I'm comin' 'round to the idea of farm-raised fish. If anyone's gonna be listenin' to the fish and what they want, it'd be you, hmm?
Entries.fall_Mon2: The walleye is one of the rarest fish you'll find in these parts. Try casting a line in fresh water when it rains this season.
Entries.fall_Fri2: When it rains this month, be sure to catch some eels in the ocean. Otherwise, you'll have to wait until spring.
Entries.fall_Fri6: A lot of salmon have come swimming upstream. Be sure to catch 'em while they're here.#$e#You can only find salmon in the fall.
Entries.winter_Tue: Ye really can't beat wild-caught fish when it comes to taste. And nutrition.#$b#People who live too far inland don't really know what they're missin'.#$e#If they eat farm-raised fish, it's like a whole different food.
Entries.winter_Tue8: I guess I've gotta be thankful for farm-raised fish.#$b#If everyone ate nothin' but the good stuff I like to catch, we'd just about fish this whole ocean right up.
Entries.spring_1_2: Ahoy there! A happy new year to you, too!$h#$e#I'm surprised you found time to visit me. Today's such a busy day for your farm, right?$h
Entries.summer_4: Looks like tuna have shown up off the coast of our beach. Be sure to stock up on 'em. They'll be gone again until winter.
Entries.winter_7: Will you go ice fishing tomorrow at the festival? I don't even care whether I win these days. I just like to see more folks fishing.$h
Entries.winter_15: I think I'll be needin' some peace and quiet from the night market after these next few days.#$e#I'll just have to manage until then.
Entries.winter_28: Another year down. The passage of time is a beautiful thing if you can learn to appreciate it.
Entries.winter_7_2: Will you go ice fishing tomorrow at the festival? I don't even care whether I win these days. I just like to see more folks fishing.$h
Entries.winter_15_2: I think I'll be needin' some peace and quiet from the night market after these next few days.#$e#I'll just have to manage until then.
Entries.winter_28_2: Another year down. The passage of time is a beautiful thing if you can learn to appreciate it.

Entries.Introduction: Ah, yes. I predicted your arrival a long time ago, young @.#$e#However, your fate is ultimately in your own hands.
Entries.Mon2: If you are looking for some kind of supernatural assistance with your farmwork, I am afraid this is the wrong place to be.#$e#It isn't that there is nothing I can do. Rather, there is nothing I SHOULD do.
Entries.Mon4: I will post a message in town if I need help stabilizing the local elemental forces. The creatures in the mine sometimes throw it out of balance.#$e#If you can't get to it, Marlon usually can, but his leg slows him down.
Entries.Mon6: My potions typically help me communicate with a variety of spirits who require my attention. Such was the case with you.#$e#But they also put me in the right physical state, in order to cast certain spells.
Entries.Mon8: To wield arcane power, one must have the highest integrity. Personal problems must never cloud our judgment.#$e#My friend Welwick is like this. She keeps up a gambling habit, but she refuses to apply her gift of clairvoyance in a card game.#$b#Even at the risk of financial ruin.
Entries.Tue2: Ahh, @, welcome. Would you care for something to drink?$h#$e#Oh, but I have more than just what is in that cauldron.$h#$e#Actually, come to think of it, never mind.
Entries.Tue8: I tried living for my own selfish pursuits some time ago and it didn't end well.#$b#The truth is that there are greater things for me to worry about than myself.
Entries.Wed2: It takes tireless effort to keep the valley's natural environment in balance.#$e#For that reason, I must continue my work.
Entries.Wed4: I am most interested in objects that hold strong mystical properties.#$b#But a man also has to eat, so if you were to bring me a hot meal, I wouldn't say no.
Entries.Wed8: I am used to being treated with apprehension, but I appreciate your repeated visits, @.#$e#Normally, I have no interest in mundanes. But you remind me that I cannot neglect my human side.
Entries.Thu4: Stardew Valley is a special place. It is rich with bountiful, living things.#$e#You can thank the spirits for that.
Entries.Thu6: The art of reshaping the human soul is something I do not wish to pursue. You would have to ask a shadow being about that.
Entries.Thu8: The biologist who lives near the mines is actually quite bright. I respect his ability to understand the natural world.#$e#My practice is different, in that I focus on bending the natural world, through use of the world beyond.
Entries.Fri: Think of me as an ambassador between this world and the world of spirits.#$e#That is but one of my duties, anyway.
Entries.Fri2: I believe the townsfolk are afraid of me.#$e#It is unfortunate, but I suppose it is human to be afraid of the unknown.
Entries.Fri4: My ability to teleport took a lifetime to develop, but a similar technique is also possible through use of warp totems.#$e#Your connection with the forest spirits should allow you to craft warp totems, too.
Entries.Sat6: Rrrgh. My head is killing me. I was testing out a potion.#$e#No, this is perfectly normal. I'll be fine.
Entries.Sat8: I traveled for years before I found a place rich enough in magical energy to construct this tower.#$e#No, of course I did not lay the bricks by hand. I wield the power of summoning for a reason.$h
Entries.Sun4: Though I am looking for an apprentice, I can safely tell you that it will not be you.#$e#Do not be disappointed. This responsibility is not enviable.
Entries.Sun6: In the elemental wars, the dwarven race was almost completely wiped out by the shadow beings.#$b#But the war has finally ended. I hope that those who remain can move on.
Entries.Sun10: Ah, @. I am glad you are here.#$e#Yes, I am happy to take a break from my work. How are you?
Entries.summer_Tue10: I fear for the souls of those who abuse the dark arts, especially for selfish desires.#$e#To harm the innocent... truly, there is no greater crime in this world nor the next.
Entries.summer_Fri: The bears in this region are not... ordinary.#$b#With your connection to the forest spirits, you may even be able to communicate with them. Have you tried?
Entries.summer_Fri6: There is an accursed shrine in the eastern region of the mines. Have you ventured there?#$e#Ah, but of course, I already know the answer. I just wanted to see if your expression would be truly as unfazed as I thought it would be.#$e#You really are extraordinary for a mundane, @.
Entries.fall_Mon2: Ahh, the spirits are very active during this season.#$e#It is an exciting time for my craft, but let us hope there are no... incidents this year.
Entries.winter_Mon4: The affairs of mundane folk matter little to me, but the elementals like a chance to see you up close.#$e#It is for them that I created that silly maze at the Spirit's Eve festival.
Entries.winter_Tue10: I fear for the souls of those who abuse the dark arts, especially for selfish desires.#$e#To harm the innocent... truly, there is no greater crime in this world nor the next.
Entries.winter_Wed4: Yes, am quite well acquainted with Linus, though we typically only meet once per year.#$e#He understands the mountain better than most others. There is much you could learn from him.
Entries.fall_26: Will I see you tomorrow at the Spirit's Eve festival?#$e#No, I didn't look into my scrying orb for that one. I just figured it'd be easier to ask.#$e#What is it that you think I do here all day, anyway?
Entries.winter_28: Another year with no disasters. I've brewed up a special potion with my name on it.$h#$e#No, you may not have any. Your body is not properly adjusted to it.#$e#That potion when we first met? That was about a 2. This is a 9.
Entries.spring_1_2: You came out here when you should be getting your farm back in shape for the new year?
Entries.fall_26_2: Will I see you tomorrow at the Spirit's Eve festival?#$e#No, I didn't look into my scrying orb for that one. I just figured it'd be easier to ask.#$e#What is it that you think I do here all day, anyway?
Entries.winter_28_2: Another year with no disasters. I've brewed up a special potion with my name on it.$h#$e#No, you may not have any. Your body is not properly adjusted to it.#$e#That potion when we first met? That was about a 2. This is a 9.

Entries.jobLeave_Harvey: #$c .5#I've got some appointments today at work. I'll see you in the evening!#I have to go into the clinic today. Have a nice day, okay?
Entries.jobLeave_Penny: #$c .5#I have to go into town today. Don't work too hard, and eat something good for lunch!$h#Looks like I'm all prepared for work. Be sure to take good care of yourself today!$h
Entries.jobLeave_Maru: #$c .5#It's another work day for me. Shouldn't be too stressful! But we'll see.#I have to leave for work soon. I'll see you tonight. I'll be thinking of you!$h
Entries.jobReturn_Harvey: Hi, honey. How was your day?#$e#$c .6#My patients are still healthy, so it was a good day.#*Phew*... I'm exhausted...$s
Entries.jobReturn_Penny: #$c .7#Good evening. My day was fine, thanks! How was yours?$h#Jas and Vincent weren't behaving very well today. I'm still all wound up...
Entries.jobReturn_Maru: #$c .5#Well, it was just another boring day at the clinic.#Hey. Did you have a more exciting day than me? I hope so.#$e#Well, It's time to kick back and relax. Did you leave me any dinner?#$e#I'm just looking forward to bed-time.$h
Entries.OneKid_0: #$c .5#I've been reading this book on child development. Looks like our child is perfectly healthy.#Have you spent any time with %kid1 today?
Entries.OneKid_1: #$c .5#Phew, staying at home with a kid is teaching me how to stretch my energy further than I ever have.#I wonder if %kid1 will grow up to be a farmer like you?
Entries.OneKid_2: #$c .5#Leave the parenting to me today! I've got things under control, so be sure not to stress while you're out.#Don't worry, I'll feed %kid1 today. You can just focus on running the farm.
Entries.OneKid_3: #$c .5#I wonder what our child's favorite foods will be? Maybe something you grow yourself?#Life's a lot different now that we have a child.
Entries.TwoKids_0: #$c .5#I'm planning on having lots of little adventures with the kids today!$h#I already gave %kid1 and %kid2 their breakfast. They were hungry!
Entries.TwoKids_1: #$c .5#I'm trying to keep the kids on a schedule. It helps with everyone's sanity.#We have to make sure and give %kid1 a lot of attention now that we have %kid2. We don't want any jealousy between them.
Entries.TwoKids_2: #$c .5#With a marriage and kids, I feel like I can see further into the future of our life than ever before.#You know, I think %kid2 has your nose.
Entries.TwoKids_3: #$c .5#I'm actually glad that I've got my hands full with the children. You do so much work, so I'm glad I can contribute to our household.#A nice house, two wonderful kids, and a beautiful plot of land. What's left?
Entries.spouseRoom_Emily: #$c .5#I'm going to spend some time with the parrot today. It breaks my heart that he'll never fly again.$u#I've got some tailoring projects that need my attention today. The parrot will keep me company while you're out.

Entries.Abigail: Sam? Sebastian? Did you guys even try last year?
Entries.Robin: Hey, @. Good to see you here.#$e#You must be in full swing with your crops by now, huh?
Entries.Demetrius: Gus's buffet is pretty spectacular this year. Are any of the eggs in there from your farm?
Entries.Maru: I think I'll give the egg hunt another shot this year. Why not?$h
Entries.Sebastian: Egg hunts are just too simple for me. If I'm going to play a game, there needs to be some kind of depth to it. You know? Context. Narrative.
Entries.Linus: It's worth it to brave the looks people give me, if it means I get to eat something delicious.
Entries.Caroline: Did you visit Pierre's kiosk yet?$h
Entries.Alex: Maybe I overdid it a bit with the buffet this year... but it'll be easy to work it off.#$e#I could go for a run later tonight.
Entries.George: It was another rerun on TV. But this festival is like a rerun, too, so y'all should be thankful I'm here.
Entries.Evelyn: Oh George. You like the free food and you know it.
Entries.Clint: I made sure to get here extra early this year, before everyone else raided the buffet. I really had my fill.$h#$e#Wait... does that mean I hogged someone else's share?$s
Entries.Penny: We did an egg-decorating art project earlier in the week. If you see a purple one, it might be Jas's, and one of the yellow ones is Vincent's.
Entries.Pam: I've done this festival so many times, it's tough to remember 'em all.#$e#Why? Did anything interesting happen last year?
Entries.Emily: I glued some costume jewels to a few of the eggs that I decorated this year. I hope you like the patterns.$h#$e#Nope, they're not worth any extra points. They're just fancy.
Entries.Haley: Deviled eggs are so gross and slimy.#$b#What, do you like them, too, or something?$s
Entries.Jodi: Sounds like Emily really puts her heart and soul into this festival.$h#$e#Maybe I need a new hobby, too.
Entries.Marlon: I come to every festival, but I have to wonder whether some of these people even know who I am...
Entries.Sam: *sniff* ...Hey, it's hard to go crawling in the bushes for eggs when you've got a full-blown sneezing fit going on.$s
Entries.Leah: Where's that punch from last year? That stuff was to die for.#$e#Yeah, I know why it was good. I'm not dense.$h#$e#Okay, well, maybe it took a few glasses for me to figure it out.$u#$b#But it was worth it!
Entries.Shane: I always feel a little better at this festival. All the hard work I actually care about finally pays off.#$e#Hey, you enjoy.$h
Entries.Marnie: Shane was a big help this year. I'd say he just about put more work into making it happen this year than I did!$h
Entries.Elliott: Across cultures, eggs symbolize the promise of perpetual life through rebirth.#$b#For us here, the festivities breathe new life into the human spirit. We all relate to the beauty of it on a subconscious level.$h
Entries.Gus: That's right! Fried eggs, boiled eggs, poached eggs, deviled eggs, scrambled eggs, chocolate eggs... you name it!#$e#I hope I lived up to last year's feast.$h
Entries.Harvey: Mayor Lewis is letting me help hide a few eggs this year. I've been scouting some good locations.#$e#Oh, you're participating? Well... who knows? Maybe I won't hide them where you think I will!
Entries.Jas: Maybe I should just team up with Vincent and we can split the prize?#$e#Hmm... maybe not. That's probably not allowed.
Entries.Vincent: I heard the prize this year might be 1000G! That's SO much money!$h#$b#That's like... enough to buy 1000G worth of ice cream!$h
Entries.Willy: The children of this town don't care too much for what I spend most of my time doing. And that's fine.#$b#Helping out with this event helps me connect with them a little, even if indirectly.$h

Entries.Abigail: Can't we just have a flower dance without the dance? I don't mind the dress.$u
Entries.Robin: A flower feature can really make the aesthetics of your home come together. Have you seen the crafting recipe that Pierre has for sale?
Entries.Demetrius: It makes me so proud to see Maru in this festival. Kids sure do grow up fast.
Entries.Maru: I wonder if my dad's going to be videotaping this?#$b#I guess he can if he wants. He never really goes back and watches old videos, anyway.
Entries.Sebastian: After a while, these festivals get... routine.#$e#I think I'm just numb to this one, at this point.
Entries.Linus: I wondered if it would be a good idea for me to show up this year.#$b#Well, thank you for visiting with me.$h
Entries.Caroline: Abby needs to learn that a little dance once a year is far from anything that will kill her.#$e#I think she's more insecure than she realizes, and there's only one way to fix that!
Entries.Alex: Dancing's really fun if you've got the right partner!$h
Entries.George: My body'll be screamin' at me tomorrow for pushing myself all the way out here.#$e#It's the least I can do, though.
Entries.Evelyn: George won't let me push him out here to the clearing. Says he still wants to do it himself.
Entries.Clint: *sigh*$s#$e#...What? Oh, I wonder if I should see who's over by the river.
Entries.Penny: Okay. I just have to breathe. And not think about who's watching.
Entries.Pam: Heh heh. Mayor Lewis can't help but keep an open wine bar at this event. It's tradition, after all!$h
Entries.Emily: It's good to see Haley in a purely positive mood. I do my best to help make this day special for her.
Entries.Haley: One two three, one two three...#$b#...nailed it. Okay. I think I'm ready.
Entries.Jodi: I can't wait to see Sam dance again. He never does stuff like this at home.$h
Entries.Marlon: Gil told me he used to go to this festival, long ago.#$e#Apparently, it's been about thirty years. Maybe longer. He said he lost count.
Entries.Sam: You just can't be afraid to have some fun, you know?$h
Entries.Leah: Hey @. Don't mind us. Elliott and I were just debating aesthetics again.
Entries.Shane: Hmm... good thing I'm not too big into wine. It's tempting, though.$u
Entries.Marnie: Hey @. D'you think if I just went over and...$s#$b#...Er, never mind.$s
Entries.Elliott: The true beauty of flowers comes from their very temporary nature, not just their physical appearance.#$b#The shorter something lasts, the more precious it can potentially be.$h
Entries.Gus: Well, everybody seems to be having a good time. Looks like another success.
Entries.Harvey: I wonder how many of my old colleagues would be willing to dance at an event like this?$h
Entries.Jas: I wanna see Ms. Penny's flower dress!$h
Entries.Vincent: If you dance with someone, it doesn't mean you have to promise to marry them, right?$u
Entries.Willy: Hmm... what is there for someone like me to do at a festival like this?#$e#I think I'll stay until the dance wraps up. It's only polite.

Entries.Governor: Ah yes, the natural beauty here is lovely, Lewis, but campaigning for Stardew Valley as a tourist destination remains to be decided.#$e#Do tell me about the annual fall fair. Can we expect it to be filled with delicious cuisine?
Entries.Abigail: Hey, I think I saw a whale spouting on the horizon.#$e#Wait! There it is again!$h
Entries.Robin: Emily's fine. She does that all the time in aerobics class.
Entries.Demetrius: Are you sure Emily is okay, honey? She started dancing long before we did.
Entries.Maru: Mmm, I'm saving room for Linus's roast. Looks like it's just about done.
Entries.Sebastian: If the soup turns out terrible, I'm sure Sam's going to challenge me to a contest to see who can eat the most.#$e#He'll win.$h
Entries.Linus: Ah, good morning, @! Would you like a piece of breakfast?$h#$e#Oh, right. We're past breakfast time. I must have slept in later than I realized.
Entries.Pierre: I got done speaking with the Governor right before you arrived.$h#$e#It went... fine.#$e#He didn't actually respond to me.$s
Entries.Caroline: I worked everyone just a bit harder during aerobics this week. We've all earned a little feasting, I'd say.
Entries.Alex: Now this is what I'm talking about! Why don't we just do this kind of party every day?$h#$e#We could make Pelican Town into a beach paradise spot for tourists.$h#$e#Hey, maybe I should be mayor someday.
Entries.George: I liked the luau better, back when we didn't have those big electronic speakers ruining the atmosphere of the beach.#$e#This was... oh, twenty, twenty-five years ago.
Entries.Evelyn: This is just about the spot where I'd build sandcastles as a little girl, all these years ago. I can still picture it.
Entries.Lewis: *psst*... I'm on the verge of getting the Governor to promote the Stardew Valley Fair.#$b#Make sure you leave him impressed today!
Entries.Penny: I have to admit it's a bit fun to watch Mayor Lewis's different facial expressions throughout the day.$h#$e#I hope his conversation with the governor goes well.
Entries.Pam: Marnie better be watching that soup carefully. I'm countin' on taking home some leftovers for tomorrow's lunch.
Entries.Haley: *giggle* My sister is such a dork sometimes.
Entries.Jodi: It's nice having a day off from cooking on a day like today.
Entries.Marlon: This festival is especially uplifting, after spending so much time underground and in the dark.
Entries.Sam: Alright, Penny, alright. The anchovies thing was just one year. I promise I won't put anything gross in the soup.#$b#*psst* You, on the other hand, @...$h
Entries.Leah: Aren't the first local melons of the season about to come in? Ooh, that sounds so delicious right now.
Entries.Shane: I'll eat spicy food any time of year, but for some reason, the hotter it gets outside, the better it tastes.
Entries.Marnie: I just love seeing everyone together like this.
Entries.Elliott: I didn't forget about the luau this year!$h#$e#Well, Leah reminded me, anyway. That helped.
Entries.Gus: I could make a delicious soup, no problem, but the potluck soup is supposed to be more a reflection of the whole valley, not a reflection of me.#$e#I just have to step back and let it be what it'll be!
Entries.Wizard: Ever notice how it's always sunny on festival days?#$e#Yeah, you're welcome for that.
Entries.Harvey: Is Emily still dancing? Good grief. I told her, dehydration and dance meditation are not the same thing.$11
Entries.Jas: Nobody needs a squirt gun to dance, Vincent.
Entries.Vincent: You should get a squirt gun and shoot it at my feet, like a cowboy! Then I'll dance like, woo-woo-woo!
Entries.Willy: I hope everyone cleans up better than they did last year. This might as well be my backyard.

Entries.Abigail: Ahh, my favorite day of summer. And not just because it's over.
Entries.Robin: My first year in town, I saw the old candle-boat they were using, and I said, "Hey, I can build something like that."#$b#So I went ahead and made one, and Lewis liked it.
Entries.Demetrius: In my field of study, it helps now and again simply to pause and truly absorb the beauty of the natural world.#$b#It reminds me that we have so much more to learn about nature. In the grand scheme, we've only just started.
Entries.Maru: This evening is always important to me. I hope you enjoy it as much as I do.
Entries.Sebastian: Once, I saw some sort of green creature with a round head poke up above the water.#$e#It was raining, so it was kind of tough to tell what it was.
Entries.Pierre: The harvest season begins tomorrow. It's tough to believe it's already here. Are you all set?#$e#Erm, sorry. I'd love to chat about tomorrow, but it's date night tonight.
Entries.Caroline: Oh, Pierre, this is exactly what I needed right now.
Entries.Linus: It's nice to see everyone being so appreciative toward nature. She provides everything we need, especially beauty.#$e#I'll sneak up when the jellies arrive. Don't worry. I won't miss this for the world.
Entries.Alex: I made some really good memories this summer. My only complaint is that it's all over.$s
Entries.George: Can't see much of anything. I'm counting on those jellies letting me know where they are.#$e#They always do.$h
Entries.Evelyn: What a lovely way for the year's youthful days to end. I couldn't ask for more.#$e#I'm still making lots of plans for the fall, though.
Entries.Lewis: Good evening, @. I saved a spot for you here on the deck.#$b#Let me know when you've settled in for the jellies to visit.
Entries.Clint: Can you believe another year's already half gone?#$e#I can't say the first half turned out how I'd hoped, but it did turn out how I'd expected.#$e#You get used to things after a while.#$e#Anyway, thanks for dropping by.
Entries.Emily: *sigh* This evening is like a long goodbye kiss from the season. Sad but sweet.$u
Entries.Penny: The jellyfish have such a simple existence...#$e#And when I think about things in the grand scheme, so must we, by some relative standard.
Entries.Pam: Fall's coming up. It's a tough time for Penny, so you outghta do something nice for her.#$e#I reckon she'd appreciate that.
Entries.Haley: I actually remembered my camera this year. There should be some really good shots for me to take.
Entries.Jodi: Kent, honey, I'm so glad you're with me this year.
Entries.Sam: Hmm, I just got the best idea for an album cover.
Entries.Leah: Summer's an extra special time of year for me. I just need an evening by myself to give it proper closure.
Entries.Shane: I'm going to miss these longer days.
Entries.Marnie: I love animals because I can look directly into their faces. But these little guys don't have any faces.#$e#They're still absolutely breathtaking, though. It must be a different kind of beauty.
Entries.Elliott: 'The harbinger of hope sighs out his light#$b#While ancient moonlamps serenade the night.'#$b#Oh, @, that's the last two lines of a poem that's fluttering into my head.#$e#I don't keep a poem if I rhyme 'light' with 'night,' so this one's just for the moment.$h
Entries.Gus: It's nice to take the night off. I don't get many of 'em.
Entries.Wizard: The Lunaloos were going to make a modest showing this year. I managed to pull some strings with the sea's spirit guardians, to fix that.#$e#Please don't make a big fuss about it. I'm hiding back here for a reason.
Entries.Harvey: I just have to get a glimpse of everyone. I spend so much time making sure everyone's body's in working order...#$b#...that it's really a touching moment to see everyone so well and peaceful.
Entries.Jas: I hope I see the rare green jelly like Vincent saw last year.
Entries.Vincent: Jas said there were babies last year. I'm going to look for them this time.
Entries.Willy: This might be my favorite festival. Fishermen around the world would give an arm and a leg just to witness this once.

Entries.Abigail: I wish we had a 'Tent of Horrors' or something like that, as a place to spend star tokens.
Entries.Robin: It's been good catching up with Leah! We don't normally run into each other a lot, but we've got a lot in common.$h
Entries.Demetrius: I've thought about doing a grange display, but if it were truly a representation of my best work...#$b#...you'd have to look at it under a microscope.#$e#So... that's a bit of a problem.$h
Entries.Maru: I came back for the barbecue sandwiches, but maybe I'll have a burger this year.$h
Entries.Sebastian: Just serving my time here. If I'm after fun, I've got dozens of games at home that I'm more invested in.$u
Entries.Pierre: Oh, hey @. Uhh... did one of my pumpkins actually come from your farm?
Entries.Caroline: Pierre feels like the success of the store depends on his grange display. I tell him not to worry so much.#$e#We sell the products of everyone who's entered here, including you. So it doesn't make a big difference in the long run.
Entries.Linus: These animals have gentle souls. They deserve the best.$h
Entries.Alex: I'm saving up for that fedora, but it's taking a while with just the 'Strength' game alone.$s
Entries.George: I won't say no to a good-quality meal. At least with this festival, I don't have to travel far to reach the food.#$e#And at least there's something besides eggs.
Entries.Evelyn: George, we need to make sure we're watching your cholesterol.#$e#If you don't eat it, I won't either.
Entries.Lewis: @! Welcome! Can we expect a grange display from you this year?$h#$b#I called in mostly the same entertainers and vendors as last year. But if it ain't broke, don't fix it!$h
Entries.Clint: I know you're familiar with my work on your own tools, but if you want a little more reassurance, take a close look at these.$h#$e#Marlon sells my weapons at his guild, in case I haven't told you.
Entries.Emily: It's cute how Haley gets so invested in the fortune teller. I think I can claim credit for that one.#$e#Well, we can all use a little something to look forward to.
Entries.Penny: Last year, I made off like a bandit at the wheel of chance.#$b#I've been unable to recreate my success, so I'm trying to figure out if orange or green wins more often.
Entries.Pam: I'm taking a break before I go back in there and whup that fishing game again.$h#$e#It's definitely the best place to earn star tokens.
Entries.Haley: Everything the fortune teller told me last year came true. She's amazing.#$e#I hope my fortune comes true this year, too!$h
Entries.Jodi: Excuse me, uh... Mr. Clown? Do you tell a joke if we give you a tip? Is that how this works now?$s
Entries.Sam: I got a 4x multiplier at the slingshot game for having perfect accuracy! The star token payout was insane!$h
Entries.Leah: Hanging out at Robin's display is like getting a free woodworking class.$h#$e#Sometimes I miss being a student.
Entries.Shane: Marnie put me in charge of the petting zoo. Go ahead. Give 'em a pet.#$e#Hey, if you wanna take one home, you know the system: ask Marnie.
Entries.Marnie: If only the displays were based on taste, rather than looks. Then maybe I'd have a fighting chance in the competition.
Entries.Elliott: It's a marvelous view of the fairgrounds up here, isn't it?$h
Entries.Gus: Goodness! Some folks really like to slather on that barbecue sauce!$h#$e#I take pride in my secret sauce, but make sure you can still taste what's under it!$h
Entries.Wizard: I refrain from telling my acquaintances about their futures, for fear of the consequences. Welwick is different.#$b#She is uniquely gifted and will tell you exactly what you need to know.
Entries.Harvey: If human medicine had been too much for me, I suppose I could have easily wound up working as a veterinarian.#$b#The work's still quite rewarding, I'm sure.
Entries.Vincent: I wanna ride one.#$e#Will you lift me over the fence?#$e#Aw, c'mon!#$e#...Where's Sam?
Entries.Marlon: I wonder if I could get my investment back if I purchased one or two of these blades for the guild's stock?
Entries.Willy: I'm most proud of that Dorado. Have you caught one of 'em before?#$e#It's hard to put together a good grange display when a beautiful fish's shelf life is so short.

Entries.Abigail: Nnnngh... I was really hoping the spiders wouldn't be here again.$s
Entries.Robin: What are you planning to do in your upcoming off-season?
Entries.Demetrius: This festival is fun, but I feel like sometimes people can take their own ideas of fun a little too far.
Entries.Maru: What I need is some kind of device that can track my location and steps.$s
Entries.Sebastian: Nice. They've got the skeletons again.$h#$e#It's a pretty expensive special effect, so I wasn't sure if they'd have 'em.
Entries.Caroline: I'll just stick to the food. The maze really isn't for me.
Entries.Alex: I brought my bat just in case something jumps out at me.#$b#Remember, it's always the sports star who saves the day in the horror movies... right?
Entries.Lewis: This is a pretty hands-off festival for me. Somehow, it comes together each year, but I'm not entirely sure how.
