Entries.Clint: I'm reasonably aware... if it's Marlon who's brought these monsters, they're probably the real deal.
Entries.Emily: What an exciting night! The square is buzzing with activity from spirits we can't see.
Entries.Penny: Is someone playing tricks on me? How did I wind up here?$u#$e#This cauldron... It's... familiar.$s
Entries.Pam: Was it just me, or did I hear a scream come from the direction of the maze?
Entries.Haley: I got a little ways in, and then in the shadows I saw something moving out of the ground.$s#$b#...I think I'm done.$s
Entries.Jodi: I'm sure Vincent only wants to go into the maze because Sam makes it seem like no big deal.$4#$e#I don't think he realizes what he'd be getting into.
Entries.Sam: I swear this maze is the same as last year's.#$b#But my memory gets... unnaturally fuzzy when I try to remember where I went after the graveyard.$s
Entries.Leah: Who made this cobbler? It's delicious.
Entries.Marnie: I'm glad this event isn't held close to our farms. The animals would go into a panic.
Entries.Elliott: Soon, the world will fall inevitably into a deep, deathly sleep.#$b#But just as inevitable is the struggle to stay awake just a little longer, in nature and within ourselves.$h
Entries.Gus: Everyone needs a slice of pumpkin pie this year! I insist!$h
Entries.Harvey: An open-heart surgery never bothered me, but this... THIS is too much.$s
Entries.Shane: The animatronics on these skeletons are still pretty impressive.
Entries.Jas: Aunt Marnie, I know there's no such thing as monsters and ghosts. Why can't I go in?
Entries.Vincent: I bet Sam got to go into the maze all the time when he was my age.$s
Entries.Marlon: To slay a skeleton is one matter, but to capture one is a different feat altogether.

Entries.Abigail: I think next, I'll try to eviscerate this snow goon's belly with some kind of creature crawling out.#$b#Maybe I can use a few fish from the competition. Ew!$h
Entries.Robin: This should be ready in an hour or two. I hope there are some people who are still around to see it then.
Entries.Demetrius: Can you believe how borderline tropical it'll be around here, in just half a year?
Entries.Maru: Sebastian makes some pretty cool snowmen. I feel like I could learn a thing or two from him, if he'd let me.
Entries.Sebastian: Nah, this isn't too cold. Cold is when you go outside with wet hair and it freezes.
Entries.Pierre: Finally! I can spend some time outside and throw a snowball!$h#$e#Hmm... is there anyone I can hit? Or... they'll just be mad, won't they?$s
Entries.Shane: Two words: Pizza. Festival. Seriously, that needs to happen this year.#$e#It'd be so easy, too. We'd just order a crap-ton of pizzas from Gus and pass 'em around.
Entries.Caroline: I actually think Abby's snow goon is pretty funny.$h
Entries.Linus: I traveled all over the place when I was younger. Some places are like this year round.#$e#I don't think I could handle living on the tundra anymore. That was when I was younger.
Entries.Alex: Heyyy, I've got an idea. Maybe we could take some sports jerseys and have the snowmen wear them.#$e#Actually, would a jersey even fit on a snowman's body?#$b#Ohhh, they'd make my favorite athletes look all fat.$s
Entries.George: I brought my extra-heavy blanket for this.
Entries.Evelyn: My joints will be stiff from spending so much time in the cold, but the visit is worth it.#$e#This festival is very important to me, you know.
Entries.Lewis: Hi there, @! Glad you could make it. Be sure to say hi to everyone.$h
Entries.Clint: Well, look at this, Emily! It's like this snowman's our own little kid! You're the mom and I'm the dad! Heh heh.$h
Entries.Emily: Oh, yeah Clint. Um, I guess?$u#$e#Maybe I can be this snowman's aunt.
Entries.Penny: $y 'Hmm... What kind of snowman should we make?_How 'bout something with peppermint candies for eyes?_Ooh, fun! Do you know anyone who has some candies?_Look to Abigail for inspiration._Oh, yeah. Never mind.$s_Make a conventional one. It's the only true way to do it._When you only do it once or twice a year, the classic ones never get old, huh?'
Entries.Pam: I actually practiced a little bit in preparation for the competition.$h#$e#Er, well, what I mean by that is... I didn't practice. At all.$s#$e#Does the fishing tent from the fair last month count?
Entries.Haley: I should look through my wardrobe for some winter fashions. I've got some really cute fur coats that I've never even worn.
Entries.Jodi: I love the forest when it's silent. When the snow falls off the branches, it makes that soft thump.#$b#I just love that.$h
Entries.Sam: We live right across the street from a river. I'm amazed that I still don't know how to fish.#$e#Oh yeah, I guess I'd get bored pretty quickly, wouldn't I?
Entries.Leah: I got here extra early this morning so I could get started on my sculpture right away. What do you think?
Entries.Marnie: Mmm. Tonight'll be nice, sitting by a fire, with hot chocolate, snuggling up next to...#$b#...um, I mean, just feeling snuggly.$s#$e#So what's new?
Entries.Elliott: Willy taught me some fishing tricks a while back. I wonder if he'll be watching me to see if I remembered?#$e#Don't want to let him down.
Entries.Gus: ...What? Sorry. Just daydreaming. I'm already crafting my plans for the Feast of the Winter Star.
Entries.Wizard: Sneaking off to visit my weird tower? You're odd for a mundane.
Entries.Harvey: Well, no one had hypothermia last year, so I guess I can lighten up a bit.$h
Entries.Jas: Ms. Penny, do you have a hat we can use?
Entries.Vincent: Look! If you stomp really hard, little cracks appear in the ice.#$e#What? Why is that bad?$u#$e#Oh...$u

Entries.Robin: @, cheers to you, for two great years with you in Pelican Town!$h
Entries.Demetrius: What a great time to be alive!$h
Entries.Maru: Oh good. I told my mom, "Mom, we have to get a table that has the green stuff at it."$h
Entries.Shane: I was thinking maybe I'd start getting into better shape.#$b#Welp, that's out the window now.
Entries.Sebastian: I have half a dozen things on my mind that need doing.#$e#Well, it's just hobby stuff, but I was in the middle of it before we came down here.
Entries.Pierre: I spent so much time worrying about the store this year, but that all seems so far away right now.#$e#I'm really thankful when the year comes together like this.$h
Entries.Caroline: Pierre... you're two drinks behind me! Yoohoo, where are you?$h
Entries.Linus: Everyone looks quite joyful today, don't they? It's okay. I'll just stay back here.
Entries.Alex: I'm on plate number five. Feelin' alive!$h
Entries.George: Bah. It feels like we just did one of these Feasts last week.
Entries.Evelyn: I know there's lots to eat, dear, but I hope you save room for one of my cookies.
Entries.Lewis: Just when we think the long winter will never end, we all spontaneously break into a joyful celebration. Cheers!$h
Entries.Clint: I should probably call my mom.
Entries.Emily: $y '@! What are you hoping to find under the spirit tree?_A rare gemstone._Oh! I bet you must have the perfect place to display it at home, huh?_Something tasty._Oh yeah! Edible items are tough to go wrong with when you feel like you have everything you need.$h$h_A tea set._Hmm, oddly specific, but who knows? You might get it!'
Entries.Penny: It's so cold out, and yet I don't even feel cold at all.$h
Entries.Pam: Hey, kid. Here's to another year.
Entries.Haley: My parents used to get the most epic gifts for this.#$e#I hope they're doing well... wherever they are.$u
Entries.Jodi: Here, Kent. Why don't you eat the rest of what's on my plate?
Entries.Sam: I'm thankful for my dad being back this year.#$e#It's been... different than how I expected, but it's nice to have everyone together again.
Entries.Leah: Joining our table for a little while? Here. Have some nog. Gus is on about his candy canes again.#$e#I think it's literally the same spiel as last year.
Entries.Marnie: I hope you can walk home tonight after you're done eating!$h
Entries.Elliott: The beach was especially lonely this morning. I took a quick walk up here and discovered such wonderfully warm company!$h
Entries.Harvey: I couldn't believe this festival during my first year here. Eating out in the cold? But it all somehow works, doesn't it?$h
Entries.Jas: Aunt Marnie, can we eat now?
Entries.Marlon: I spent some time in the lava mines this morning. My body isn't properly adjusted to this chill.

Entries.Abigail: Are you bringing your A-game again this year?$h
Entries.Robin: I'll build as many coops as you like. Each one is just as enjoyable for me as the last.
Entries.Demetrius: The grass in the valley is very nutritious for chickens, certainly better than the corn they're fed on most other farms.
Entries.Maru: I'm trying to come up with egg-themed lesson ideas for Penny. It's tough when Jas already knows just about everything about them.
Entries.Sebastian: This festival must look really bizarre to someone with zero context for it.#$b#An entire day we're supposed to take, so we can talk about... eggs. I mean, really?#$e#What was it like, anyway, your first year here?
Entries.Linus: I'm helping myself to modest portions. Hopefully, there'll be some leftovers I can take home.
Entries.Caroline: You must have a lot of cash stockpiled. Is there anything we have for sale that you don't already own?
Entries.Alex: I wonder who was the first person to look at an egg come out of a chicken and think, 'Whoa, dude, that looks delicious.'$s#$e#Hey, I'm not complaining. It just must've been weird the first time that ever happened.$h
Entries.George: Half the town would make a fuss over it if I stayed in. I figured it's easier just to get this over with.
Entries.Evelyn: How many years have you been here now, dear?#$b#Well, I sure am glad you decided to stay. It's important for George and I to know Pelican Town's got a future.
Entries.Lewis: How's your spring so far, @? Everything going as planned?$h
Entries.Clint: I just went ahead and took one of everything this year. Nobody'll get mad, right?
Entries.Penny: Watching the kids enjoy this festival gives me just as much fun as I had when I was little.$h#$e#Life is anything but 'all downhill' after you grow up yourself.
Entries.Pam: I wonder if Gus'll teach me some of his recipes someday?
Entries.Emily: I use the same dyeing kit for clothing as I do with the eggs. Turns out, it works pretty well!#$e#I figured that one out years ago.
Entries.Haley: Okay, it's my goal today to try one new kind of food. I'm just trying to branch out a bit.#$e#What do you recommend?
Entries.Jodi: We're already almost halfway through spring, aren't we? Seems like the new year started just a couple of days ago.
Entries.Kent: I'm still not big on this festival much, myself, but it is nice to see Vincent in a good mood.
Entries.Marlon: Many years ago, I took on a whole horde of Pepper Rexes while looking for a dinosaur egg.#$e#I emerged victorious, of course, but those eggs are always a rare find.
Entries.Sam: I took some allergy medication this morning. Now I feel kind of loopy.#$e#It always hits me on the day of this festival, for some reason. Maybe it's just from spending so much time outside.
Entries.Leah: Nothing special in the fruit punch this year. That's totally fine.#$b#I'm a little older than I was when I first moved here.
Entries.Shane: If you want good birds who lay the best eggs, you've just gotta give 'em the life they deserve.#$e#This festival would never work with a bunch of factory-farmed eggs. Never in a million years.
Entries.Marnie: I think things turned out pretty well this year!$h
Entries.Elliott: This environment isn't particularly inspiring to me in the literary sense, but I am enjoying myself quite nicely.$h
Entries.Gus: We've got all the usual fixins here today. I improved my deviled egg recipe a bit, though, so that's something new. Give 'em a try!
Entries.Wizard: Hmm... And what about raw lizard egg sprinkled with blackened marrow?
Entries.Harvey: This year, I was looking forward to the egg festival like it's an old family tradition.#$b#I'm really lucky I wound up in this town.
Entries.Jas: I'll do the egg hunt, but I think I'll just look for the eggs I decorated.#$e#It's too hard to compete with grown ups.
Entries.Vincent: Me'n Dad already did an egg hunt in our house this morning.#$e#This one's more fun, though.
Entries.Willy: I thought I'd bring in a sample platter o' my homemade caviar, but it'd be a bit expensive to have enough for everyone.

Entries.Abigail: Here we go again.$u#$e#Guess I'll live through this one, too.
Entries.Robin: Some of my out-of-town friends can barely believe we still have traditions like this in the valley.#$b#For me, though, it's exactly why I love living here.
Entries.Demetrius: The timing of this festival is in almost perfect congruence with a swell in the ecosystem's activity.#$e#I'm sure that's no coincidence. Humans are connected to the natural world more than we realize.
Entries.Maru: *giggle* It's fun to be unapologetically girly every once in a while.$h
Entries.Sebastian: It's gotta be some kind of herd mentality that keeps me coming back here against my will.#$b#I guess there are... some individuals... who shouldn't have to suffer on their own.
Entries.Linus: A lot of death and decay goes into nourishing all of these flowers.#$b#Er, sorry... I don't mean to be gloomy. I simply mean that from different perspective, it's actually just as beautiful.#$e#Give it some thought.$h
Entries.Caroline: Has Pierre even sold anything today...?
Entries.Alex: Okay, I'm ready for some dancing. Bring it on!
Entries.George: I wonder how many more of these festivals I've got left in me...?#$e#Oh, don't worry. I don't plan on quitting any time soon.
Entries.Evelyn: I hope you like the flower arrangements, dear. I put in a little extra effort every year.
Entries.Clint: Emily's a pretty good dancer, you know.#$e#I hope the men she dances with appreciate that.
Entries.Penny: I know the dance'll be fine. It always is. But my nerves can never seem to settle down.
Entries.Pam: How's Penny doin'? That girl sure knows how to worry herself.#$e#I'm sure she'll be fine.
Entries.Emily: I remember your first year at the flower dance. That was a good year!
Entries.Haley: One of these years, I know I won't be the flower queen anymore. But for now, no one seems to have a problem with it.
Entries.Jodi: I wonder how many more years until Vincent's old enough for this?
Entries.Kent: Dancing... singing... all just for the heck of it.#$b#This is what happiness looks like.#$e#I'm grateful to see everyone happy like this. It's... what it's all about, right?
Entries.Marlon: Such a contrast to my usual environment. *sigh*#$b#Perhaps I should have put more effort into matters of love when I was younger.
Entries.Sam: Hey, I don't care who knows that I like flowers. Anyone who's comfortable in his masculinity has to be honest.
Entries.Leah: Moving water is really hard to paint. I'm trying to get the image of this river etched in my mind.
Entries.Shane: Nobody seems to mind if I sorta half-ass it through the dancing.$u#$b#Hope you're not offended, or anything...$u
Entries.Marnie: Everyone looks so lovely! I can't decide whether this festival makes me feel older or younger. Or maybe a bit of both.
Entries.Elliott: I'm feeling particularly inspired by this scene. I should dig up some of my old sonnets and see if they need any revision.
Entries.Gus: Looks like the weather turned out perfect again for a picnic.#$b#That's definitely a good thing, 'cause I most certainly do not have a backup plan if it rains.$h
Entries.Harvey: This dance is supposed to be for young people.#$b#I... guess that means I can still participate.$11
Entries.Jas: Granny Evelyn let me help out with some of the flowers this year!
Entries.Vincent: I wanna collect one of each color of the flowers here. You gotta be quick, though, when no one's watching.
Entries.Willy: Dorados should be lurking in these rivers pretty soon. They're one o' the rarer catches here in the valley.

Entries.Governor: That one year, the soup was delicious! Was that last year, or...?#$b#...no, perhaps it was a different year? Ah, I can't remember.
Entries.Abigail: It's quieter over here. Did you come over here for the same reason?
Entries.Robin: Oh, hi @! It wouldn't be a proper luau without a little dancing, would it?$h
Entries.Demetrius: Honey, what was that dance step you taught me at the saloon the other night?
Entries.Maru: Mmm, pulled pork and those slippery rice noodles. I think those are my favorite together.
Entries.Sebastian: If it suddenly rained right now, people would scramble and run away like the rain's made of poison.#$e#Is it bad if the thought of that sight makes me really happy?$h
Entries.Linus: I'm happy to share my roast with you if you'd like, @. Let no part of the animal go to waste, I say.$h
Entries.Pierre: If we ever get a storm on luau day, we could always host the Governor in my store.#$e#...What? I could make it work.
Entries.Caroline: Where's Abigail? Did she wander off again?
Entries.Alex: It's nice, you know? It really feels like Pelican Town is one big family.$h#$e#I should put in more effort to hang out with the people I don't normally see too much.
Entries.George: Evelyn, do you mind? Even if the sun does its worst on me, how does that matter in the grand scheme?
Entries.Evelyn: George, you forgot to bring your hat. We're going to need a little sunscreen on your head, too.
Entries.Lewis: Ah! Governor, do you remember? This is @, one of our premier agriculturalists here in the valley.$h#$b#Psst... Hey @, we're really counting on you this year, okay?
Entries.Clint: Let's see... what else haven't I tried yet?
Entries.Penny: Okay, here's a game. Watch the mayor and every time he smiles and says 'Absolutely!' to the governor, you get a point.#$e#It's adorable. I've just glanced over my shoulder a few times and I'm already at five points,
Entries.Pam: Aw shoot, I forgot to call in to the bus company for my day off!#$e#Oh well. Is anyone gonna notice?
Entries.Haley: Sipping a drink out of a coconut is the best. Have you ever tried it?
Entries.Jodi: Kent and I are sharing these little dumplings. They're beyond delicious.$h#$e#I wish Gus would share his recipes more often.
Entries.Kent: I'll steer clear of the soup. Who knows what could be in there?
Entries.Marlon: Do they make one-eyed sun shades?#$e#I can barely see a thing out here. The sun's way too bright.
Entries.Sam: I don't know if I have it in me anymore to be a prankster. It's been a number of years since I pulled anything.#$e#I've gotta set a good example for Vincent.
Entries.Leah: Hey, have you seen any good pieces of driftwood lying around?#$e#I always wonder how long it stays out at sea before it comes back home.
Entries.Shane: Hoo... I'm getting a little overheated here from all this spicy food. What is there to drink?
Entries.Marnie: *yawn* I'm tired. I think I'll sleep like a log tonight, especially after such a feast.$s
Entries.Elliott: There's a marvelous lobster bisque on the table closest to the ocean. Have you had some yet?$h
Entries.Gus: Based on what I've seen going into that soup, I'd say a little wine might be safe to add. Or something savory, like cheese or truffles.#$e#It'd have to be the best of the best quality, though.
Entries.Wizard: What? I'm not being antisocial. This is quite social for me, thank you.#$e#Compared to my usual lifestyle, this is...#$b#...look, I'm doing my best, okay?
Entries.Harvey: I trust everyone here enough to take decent care of themselves in this heat.#$b#But it's still my job to nag everyone, anyway.$h
Entries.Jas: Hi Mr. @. Wanna dance?^Hi Ms. @. Wanna dance?
Entries.Vincent: I've gotten better at dancing since last year! No, really!
Entries.Willy: It's just past the horizon, there. If you sail out that far, you can see the Fern Islands from that point.

Entries.Abigail: The air smells nice tonight, don't you think? A premonition of fall.
Entries.Robin: Hmm, I wonder if that candle-boat needs a little patching up this year.
Entries.Demetrius: The moonlight jellies' bioluminescent glow helps them survive in the midnight zone of the ocean.#$b#Very few places around the world see such a phenomenon, much less every single year on the same evening.
Entries.Maru: Up by the train tracks, the leaves have started changing color pretty noticeably. You should go see when you get a chance.
Entries.Sebastian: I'll admit, living life in the valley isn't so bad on nights like these.
Entries.Pierre: For me, tonight's about letting go and reflecting on what really matters.#$b#Maybe I left a few things undone at work today, but... it'll all be fine.#$e#Oh, shoot. Did I leave the stove on in the kitchen?$4
Entries.Caroline: Pierre, I'm sure everything's fine, dear.
Entries.Linus: Perhaps if I were a creature who lived in the ocean, my understanding of nature would be entirely different.#$e#Despite the depth of my connection to nature, I have to humble myself and realize it's still so limited on the cosmic scale.
Entries.Alex: Did you make any good memories this summer?
Entries.George: This is a good night. Maybe I'll be a bit extra cranky tomorrow from the loss of sleep, but it'll be worth it.#$b#Worth it for me, anyway. I can't say one way or the other for the people who cross paths with me.
Entries.Evelyn: Shhh, George. I think the jellies will be here any minute.
Entries.Lewis: Watching these creatures drift in and drift out each year... of course it reminds me of your grandfather.#$b#...How strange. To see this evening play out so many times, it's surreal to think we all do the same thing with our own lives.#$e#Even if we fade away, there's still the lingering promise that this beautiful cycle will repeat itself.
Entries.Clint: This evening always stirs up my senses. I can't quite describe it.#$e#It's not quite sadness, but it's more like... hope? In a regretful kind of way?#$b#Man, I don't know...$s
Entries.Emily: As long as I've been alive, I can't remember a single year when the jellies failed to show up.#$e#Clearly, when something's important to mother nature, she knows how to be consistent with it.
Entries.Penny: Jas and Vincent are going to be writing jellyfish poems for school tomorrow.#$b#Maybe I should try to write one, too.#$e#I got the idea from Elliott.
Entries.Pam: I miss standing next to Penny during this festival. I get it if she needs her space, though.
Entries.Haley: I think maybe I won't take any photos this year. I want to enjoy the moment rather than hide behind a camera.
Entries.Jodi: Every day, I can't help but spend so much time worrying about the littlest things.#$b#Oh, to be a jellyfish and just go with the flow...
Entries.Kent: It's nice. I actually feel at peace tonight.#$e#Got to enjoy it while it lasts.$h
Entries.Sam: I'd just like to part the ocean in half with a big wall of water on either side. I wonder how far I could walk?
Entries.Leah: The life cycle of these jellyfish... it all seems so pointless, and paradoxically, that's a part of why it's beautiful.
Entries.Shane: I'm surprised this festival doesn't get more tourists. Does the mayor have a law that swears us all to secrecy, or something?
Entries.Marnie: I actually feel a bit of a desire to sing something. The atmosphere just feels right.#$e#Maybe I'll just hum. I don't want to disturb anyone.
Entries.Elliott: I've prepared a poem for this evening. It's a bit long, but speak to me again if you'd like to hear it.#$e#The Midnight Ocean#$b#When lost in life as though I were asleep, / I fell into the midnight ocean deep, / The tossing waves attacking me to keep.#$b#"Prepost'rous, I can't die," thought I with pride, / For though it swept my body side to side, / "I only need a luminescent guide."#$b#Perhaps a cracking lightning bolt could blind, / Flash up a shoreline, etch into my mind / A simple haven, quite an easy find.#$b#Perhaps a royal galleon, blazing hope -- / The crew would spy me through a telescope, / And with some brilliant fanfare, offer rope.#$b#But nothing regal answered my proud cry: / Instead, some glowing jellyfish came nigh, / These eerie blooms no brighter than a sigh.#$b#And beckoned by this ghostly company, / I joined their flow, my strength returning free, / For drawn along to refuge, I did see#$b#The saving light strikes not in gaudy show / But rather glints in softest somber glow.#e#Have a good night.$h
Entries.Elliott_spouse: I've prepared a poem for this evening. It's a bit long, but speak to me again if you'd like to hear it.#$e#The Midnight Ocean#$b#When lost in life as though I were asleep, / I fell into the midnight ocean deep, / The tossing waves attacking me to keep.#$b#"Prepost'rous, I can't die," thought I with pride, / For though it swept my body side to side, / "I only need a luminescent guide."#$b#Perhaps a cracking lightning bolt could blind, / Flash up a shoreline, etch into my mind / A simple haven, quite an easy find.#$b#Perhaps a royal galleon, blazing hope -- / The crew would spy me through a telescope, / And with some brilliant fanfare, offer rope.#$b#But nothing regal answered my proud cry: / Instead, some glowing jellyfish came nigh, / These eerie blooms no brighter than a sigh.#$b#And beckoned by this ghostly company, / I joined their flow, my strength returning free, / For drawn along to refuge, I did see#$b#The saving light strikes not in gaudy show / But rather glints in softest somber glow.#e#I'll see you at home, darling.$h
Entries.Gus: Thankfully, business was a little slow, so I got all the mugs and dishes cleaned early.#$e#It's nice to have the better part of the evening off. That doesn't happen much.
Entries.Wizard: How did you find me back here? I thought I was well-hidden.#$b#Perhaps you are blessed with the gift of clairvoyance.#$b#Oh wait. No, you probably just remember me being here last year.
Entries.Harvey: I've been looking forward to this night for the past couple of weeks.#$e#What makes this evening special for you, @?
Entries.Jas: I wonder if this year's jellies are the same as last year's.#$b#'Cause if they are, the babies are probably all grown up now.
Entries.Vincent: I'm not tired! I never get tired!
Entries.Willy: As tempting as it is to go get my net and scoop one of these up, it's not my place to do such a thing.#$e#That would be disrespectful to the ocean.

Entries.Abigail: I got my fill of the games here over the past couple of years.#$b#Oh well. Maybe I'll grind for some more star tokens for another prize or two.
Entries.Robin: I'm here to see if I can inspire just one person to pick up some materials and craft something that they wouldn't have otherwise.#$e#How 'bout you, @? Got any potential DIY projects I can advise you on?$h
Entries.Demetrius: I always knew that Robin would do great things for this community if the locals hired her.#$e#Hey, thank you for your patronage.
Entries.Maru: I wish I could just take home one of these bottles of barbecue sauce. But I guess then there'd not be enough for everyone.
Entries.Sebastian: So much noise. Maybe I'll take my bike out for a ride later to unwind.
Entries.Pierre: Hi @. I was wondering, do you really need the star tokens for winning first place this year?#$e#I mean, don't let me deter you, I just...$4
Entries.Caroline: I really wish I could just retreat into my sunroom right now.$s#$e#But... I can't get inside our house with these grange displays in the way.$s
Entries.Linus: I already got a good meal from Gus at the other end of the fair.#$b#I came over here to pay my respects to these selfless creatures.
Entries.Alex: I think I'll stay away from the 'Strength' game this year. What other games do they even have here, anyway?
Entries.George: Heh... time for a little indulgence!$h
Entries.Evelyn: I don't eat meat, but I can't argue with that nice smokey smell.
Entries.Lewis: Hello there, @! I suppose you know the drill by now.#$b#I'd love to see what you've brought this year.$h
Entries.Clint: Unfortunately, I don't have any iridium bars for display. That stuff's too valuable not to use.
Entries.Emily: Maybe Haley would like it if I got her a balloon? You're never too old for balloons.#$e#Whoever's tired of balloons is tired of life.$h
Entries.Penny: Back when I won the wheel of chance ten times in a row, I guess it amounted to a 1 in 1024 chance.$s#$e#But that's assuming the orange and green sides both come up evenly.
Entries.Pam: I can never seem to get my fishing hobby off the ground, 'cept at festivals.#$e#Maybe if I was younger again...
Entries.Haley: The fortune teller? I dunno. I forgot my fortune from last year. I'm kind of over it.#$e#I still do it for fun, but I want to live for what I want, not just for what someone said might happen to me.
Entries.Jodi: Well, at least he's not the same clown as when Sam was still a boy.#$b#I think Sam's the reason why Mayor Lewis keeps hiring budget clowns.$s#$e#Um... don't ask.$s
Entries.Sam: I got almost 600 points in the slingshot tent this year! I don't even know how many star tokens that earned me!$h#$e#They just gave me a big ol' bag of tokens.$h
Entries.Leah: I thought about opening my own display at the fair.#$b#It could be fun, but then I wouldn't get a chance to enjoy the rest of the fair as much..
Entries.Shane: These cows are responsible for the giant cheese wheel Marnie's got on her display. And these are two of our best chickens.#$e#The pigs just needed a day out.
Entries.Marnie: Is there anything I can do to make my display more visually appealing?
Entries.Elliott: This barbecue is a symphony of flavor.$h#$b#I wonder if everyone else even knows it's here?
Entries.Gus: It takes some practice to manage five grills at once, but once you get a system down, it works out fine.
Entries.Wizard: ...#$e#...Hmph.#$e#I've been banned from the 'Strength' game for using my telekinetic powers on it.#$e#There was no rule against it. This is preposterous.
Entries.Harvey: The nutritional difference between pasture-raised animals and factory-raised animals is quite remarkable.#$e#Factory farming might even be one of the top reasons for rising obesity rates. Or so I've read.
Entries.Jas: The brown chicken is Ruby and the white chicken is Riley.#$b#That's what I named them, anyway.#$e#Sometimes they fight. But they're really best friends.
Entries.Vincent: See? Chickens and pigs and cows all smell bad, but everyone loves them!#$e#I don't even smell bad, but Mom says I have to start taking baths every single day when I get older.$s
Entries.Marlon: I'd like to see a demonstration of those swords' durability before I buy any from Clint.
Entries.Willy: I had just about the biggest catfish you've ever seen, early in the season.#$e#Too bad it didn't last until today.#$e#Well, a man's got to eat...$s

Entries.Abigail: What do you mean about the spiders not being real? They definitely move when I poke my head around the corner.$s
Entries.Robin: Hey @. Are there any crafting recipes you haven't tried yet?#$e#Winter's going to be a good time to do that. Or you could redecorate your home.
Entries.Demetrius: Maru just finished her dinner. I just saw her go into the maze.
Entries.Maru: I just got started. Go on ahead if you'd like.#$e#Weird... it's like my feet are made of lead. When did this happen?$s
Entries.Sebastian: I was already in the maze. It's pretty well done.
Entries.Caroline: Um, if you see Abby in the maze, can you tell her not to miss dinner? They've got some of her favorites here...
Entries.Alex: I made it to the end last year, but all I found was an empty box. Someone must've beaten me to it.#$e#Now if I could just remember where I went after this...$s
Entries.Lewis: I can't decide whether I love this festival or hate it.#$e#It's definitely impressive, but I can't ever seem to find answers for how that old man puts it together and cleans it up.
Entries.Clint: Nahh, these skeletons don't scare me. If Marlon says it's safe, it's safe.
Entries.Emily: I have a lot of fun carving pumpkins. They just don't last long, so Haley gets pictures of all my best ones.
Entries.Penny: I think there's... something that pulls me here, every year. *yawn* ...But why?$s
Entries.Pam: You wanna know somethin' scary? *hic* We all get old and wrinkly one day. Just look at me! Hah!$h#$e#You ready to take your turn one day? I used to be skinny an' pretty just like Penny!$h
Entries.Haley: I'm getting pictures of people as they come out of the maze. No way am I going in there again myself, though.
Entries.Jodi: *yawn* ...Is it bedtime yet? The older I get, the less I can stay out late like this.$s
Entries.Kent: I used to love stuff like this when I was a kid. These days, though, it seems like...#$b#...I dunno, just a waste of adrenaline, if that makes sense.
Entries.Sam: I think I finally figured it out.$h#$b#You're here at the same time as me, though, so... if you want the prize, it's all yours.#$b#I'll just head to the end if you've got no strong feelings about it.
Entries.Leah: Surreal horror art suddenly sounds appealing. Been a while since I made anything like that.#$e#When you live alone and you spend too much time with your mind steeped in that genre, though, it can mess with you a bit.#$b#Hmm, maybe not.$s
Entries.Marnie: Whew, done for the day. Time to relax a little. ...Relatively speaking.
Entries.Elliott: I read read some classic horror stories earlier today. Such fun!
Entries.Gus: You can't grow any crops outside soon, huh? Well, I'll be lookin' forward to the spring, then. Local produce can't be beat.
Entries.Harvey: I don't have quite enough energy for socializing, so I came here.#$e#I knew there weren't any jump scares in this part of the maze.#$e#Guess I'll rejoin the living in a few minutes. Heh.
Entries.Shane: So what's this about an underground frozen fortress? The adventurer guy was saying something about it.
Entries.Jas: Hehe, I love staying up late!$h
Entries.Vincent: Sam brought me into the maze, but...$s#$e#...Maybe next year.$s
Entries.Marlon: You've come a long way, @. Sights like these probably don't even faze you anymore, huh?

Entries.Abigail: Nope, I think it's safe to say that I'm morally incapable of creating normal looking snowmen.
Entries.Robin: I know I'm late getting this done again, but it has to be architecturally accurate!
Entries.Demetrius: I know it looks like the landscape is inert, but underneath the snow are seeds and sprouts that'll grow and bare themselves in spring.
Entries.Maru: I can be creative with making gadgets, but my creativity has to serve a function.#$e#So, this snowman is serving his function. He's being a very snowman-y snowman.
Entries.Sebastian: Looks like Abby's getting creative with the snowmen again.
Entries.Pierre: Ahh, I love getting outdoors in the winter.
Entries.Shane: Mmm, pizza...$u#$e#Sorry, just got a really wicked craving.
Entries.Caroline: A mug of hot tea is just perfect when you're outside on a day like this.
Entries.Linus: Yes, you know me. I like to keep my distance.#$e#Still, it's nice to watch everyone else in good spirits.
Entries.Alex: At least there are still a couple of gridball games left this season.
Entries.George: Cold? Sure, I'm cold. But I'm always cold, more or less.#$e#But, yeah, this is pretty cold.$s
Entries.Evelyn: Ah, it's so nice to see such joy in the air despite the cold.$h
Entries.Lewis: @! Glad you could make it.$h#$b#I sure have seen a lot of fish teeming under the ice this year. Be sure to look forward to it!
Entries.Clint: Oh, hey Emily. You can um, fix this one if you'd like. It's not very good.
Entries.Emily: Well, this snowman just needs a little love and care. Then he'll be just right.
Entries.Penny: $y 'Hmm... What kind of snowman should we make?_An astronaut_Hmm, sounds challenging. But we'll give it a try._A mighty king_Hey yeah! If we get a bunch of twigs, we could make a crown.$h_A Pepper Rex_That... wouldn't really be a snowman. Hmm... but the kids might like it.'
Entries.Pam: Hey kid, maybe you could teach me a thing or two about fishing.#$e#Seems like you got pretty good pretty fast.
Entries.Haley: I've been watching a lot of cheesy romantic comedies on TV. The ones in the winter are always best.
Entries.Jodi: I caught Vincent stomping on the frozen lake last year. He's not doing it again right now, is he?
Entries.Kent: I can fish. I used to fish all the time, but...#$b#...I'd rather not have everyone's eyes on me in a competition.
Entries.Sam: I hope we get a blizzard soon. Nothing compares to the big snow we got when I was Vincent's age.
Entries.Leah: What do you think? Is an art project more beautiful if it lasts a long time or if it disappears quickly?
Entries.Marnie: Mayor Lewis gets all the fish from Willy. Must be a bit strange for Willy to catch the same fish twice.
Entries.Elliott: I don't know how you find time for fishing with all of your farmwork on top of it all.
Entries.Gus: I sure could use a few of the fish from the competition and do a special at the saloon. It'd be great to pick over the best ones.
Entries.Harvey: It's a mystery to me how the people who live in perpetually frigid regions managed to survive for thousands of years.
Entries.Jas: I want to make our snowman really tall this year.

Entries.Abigail: My mom almost never drinks except for this day. She must get it all out of her system at once.
Entries.Robin: We're also coming up on the anniversary of your arrival in Pelican Town, aren't we? And look how far you've come!$h
Entries.Demetrius: Any ideas on who your secret gift-giver might be?
Entries.Maru: Mmm, finally. I've been looking forward to this all month.
Entries.Shane: Days like these always give me something nice to look forward to.
Entries.Sebastian: The food's good. I just don't have much to add to the conversation at our table.
Entries.Pierre: Caroline, honey, can you pass me a little more of that turkey?
Entries.Caroline: Hot cocoa, spiced cider... Is there any plain water? I don't want to get a nog hangover.$h#$e#Eh. It's probably fine.$h
Entries.Linus: I'm waiting to collect some leftovers. Such opulence shouldn't leave waste.
Entries.Alex: Whoa. At some point, I think I lost my hollow leg metabolism.$s#$b#I've only had four plates of food so far, but I feel like I might already be at my limit.$s#$e#Well, they were big plates.
Entries.George: How is it possible that another year's already gone by since our last Feast?
Entries.Evelyn: Oh, another year with the whole town together! It truly is special.$h
Entries.Lewis: Got plans to get things in order for the new year? It can wait!#$b#As your mayor, I insist on some local-government sponsored procrastination!$h
Entries.Clint: The food is always my favorite part of the festivals.#$e#I put on a few pounds this year. Oh well. Better to eat the stuff you like than to eat twigs and leaves all the time.
Entries.Emily: $y '@! What are you hoping to find under the spirit tree?_A homemade meal._Aww, that'd be special, wouldn't it? A little personal touch._A puppy._Ha, if only, right?$h_A new couch._Um... yeah. Maybe? I don't know how that'd fit in any of these boxes.$u'
Entries.Penny: I can't imagine the Winter Star without our town's traditions.#$e#It just wouldn't be the same without our whole town sitting down like one big family.$h
Entries.Pam: Maybe in the new year I'll take a nice road trip. I could hit up a few sites I ain't visited since I was little.#$e#Oh, y'know. I'd take the bus. No one would notice.#$e#Not if I play my cards right. Heh.$h
Entries.Haley: I think I've got a good idea of who my secret gift-giver is.
Entries.Jodi: I made an offer to Gus, to pitch in and help with some of the food, but he refused.#$e#This really is his pride and honor, isn't it?
Entries.Kent: Hey. Having a good time?#$e#Me? ...Yeah, actually. Thanks for asking.$h
Entries.Sam: It was a good year. I think I'm gonna miss this one.
Entries.Leah: I can't believe Gus doesn't talk more about the food he spent all week prepping.#$e#Maybe candy canes are just his go-to subject when he's exhausted from cooking and he breaks down.$u
Entries.Marnie: Happy Feasting, @! Glad you were able to make it.$h
Entries.Elliott: Oh, is Gus still talking? I must have tuned him out.
Entries.Harvey: I propose a toast! To a happily-ever-after for Pelican Town and all of us who live here!$h
Entries.Jas: I wonder if I'll get another princess doll this year?
Entries.Vincent: I wish today was every day.
Entries.Marlon: Happy Feasting. Gil sends his regards.
